58.description: Good food, nice atmosphere, and great for brunch but extremely and unapologetically slow service. If our food is going to take 45 minutes, an explanation would be appreciated. At least acknowledge the fact that the 3 tables that came after us who got their food before us.

56.description: They have very tasty food (candied bacon, hello!), with exceptionally friendly and attentive service in a lovely down to earth setting. This is my go-to brunch spot in Andersonville.

29.description: Literally my favorite Chicago brunch spot. This place will blow your mind. Everything is so freaking delicious. My favorite is the dandelion omelette though, the quiches come to a close second. I always recommend coming with friends, everyone ordering an entree and then ordering a crepe/french toast to share for the table. Parking is little difficult so I recommend coming at a non-peak time. It's also a 10-15 minute from the closest CTA station. Lot's a space inside, but sometimes it's still packed! Their bakery items are delicious as well :). You will not be disappointed!

42.description: The best pancakes you will ever have.

23.description: So good! Everything my friends and I tried was amazing. I had the blackberry bliss cakes which seems to be one of their more popular items. Did not disappoint. It was not too sweet making it more breakfast than dessert like it looks to be. Unfortunately they do not take reservations and I can only imagine the long waits that must accompany weekend brunches. My group of 15 were sat in a tight room during lunch amongst tiny tables pushed together. Go early or odd hours. A definite try while in Chicago.

47.description: I love M. Henry!  First off, it is adorable.  You walk in and it just feels like home.  Yes, it can be pretty crowded, but I believe that just speaks to how wonderful the food is.  And the wait is never very long.  I enjoy the fact that you can walk in here to enjoy breakfast/brunch/lunch, or if you want to just grab a coffee and a pastry at the coffee bar you can do that as well.  I have had really great service each time that I have gone and the food always comes out very quickly.I get the ice tea every time I go because it is delicious!  I have no idea what brand of ice tea they use, but the flavor is absolutely wonderful.  The jerk spiced chicken sandwich with the mango ketchup is an amazing choice if you are stopping by for lunch.  However if you are interested in breakfast I would strongly recommend the lemon raspberry brioche French toast.  The perfect mix of sweet and tart.If you are in the Andersonville area and looking for a spot to grab a bite, visit M. Henry, I promise it will not disappoint!

8.description: Went to the rock shop next door and was recommended to eat at m.henry...An amazing recommendation. We went around lunch time, as for perfect timing; this place is only open for breakfast/brunch. I had the best tasting Mexican breakfast I've ever consumed. Huevos borrachos (drunken eggs). It was carefully crafted for maximum deliciousness. My date got a chicken caprese sandwich. It was deluxe.We will be back

31.description: I've been here couple of times and M. Henry was one of my favorite brunch places but my last visit was total disappointing. Just not what it used to be. First of all, its famous French toast was too dry and cold seriously what happened? It's supposed to be fluffy and full of flavor but it was tasteless and dry that I had to ask for more syrup. Poor plating. Egg Benedict was mediocre at best. The pancake restaurant near my house is much better.

34.description: By far the best breakfast place I've ever been to!!!! Amazing!!!! The pancakes were fluffy and on point delicious! I had the berries and Creme pancakes with a side of potatoes. My husband got the dandelion omelette with a side salad. The kiddos got pancakes, eggs, and fruit cups from the kids menu. They gobbled everything up! Definitely a kid friendly place! The ambiance is a little loud but perfect for our family! It's a beautiful place with amazing service! Will definitely be back and recommend this place to everyone! It's definitely our families new breakfast spot! Also there's lots of street parking nearby for free!

16.description: I love their food! The French toast here are amazing. This place is second to bongo room for me for sweet brunch. Overall everything was great. One less star for average slow service.

13.description: Finally had the chance to visit this adorable restaurant with some friends this week. The restaurant looks fun and it's decorated very tastefully to resemble a bright/happy cafe. We had to wait for about 15-20 minutes before we got seated, which is not bad at all for brunch.I loved the food and presentation - I shared a Fried Egg sandwich and "Latina Omeletta" with my husband. Both were good, but I loved the Latina Omeletta. (It had fried plantains in it - which made the taste more unique). I wasn't too please with their coffee though! It tasted so bitter and two portions of cream couldn't save it. (I usually have 2 cups during brunch, however I really struggled to have half a cup this time!)Their prices are comparable to other brunch places and their cafe is adorable. Food is commendable so I would be back! :)

11.description: By far the best breakfast place I've ever been to!!!! Amazing!!!! The pancakes were fluffy and on point delicious! I had the berries and Creme pancakes with a side of potatoes. My husband got the dandelion omelette with a side salad. The kiddos got pancakes, eggs, and fruit cups from the kids menu. They gobbled everything up! Definitely a kid friendly place! The ambiance is a little loud but perfect for our family! It's a beautiful place with amazing service! Will definitely be back and recommend this place to everyone! It's definitely our families new breakfast spot! Also there's lots of street parking nearby for free!

39.description: I love their food! The French toast here are amazing. This place is second to bongo room for me for sweet brunch. Overall everything was great. One less star for average slow service.

37.description: we went on a Saturday around 11:30am, and the wait is for 20 minutes, which is not bad at all for a place as good as thiswe ordered a turkey sandwich, and it was literary LOADED with turkey (see pic), the flavour was ok, just very generous portionthe openface chicken sandwich is pretty good, a very balanced flavour, really liked the asian sesame slaw, not too sour or too creamy, very refreshing for the morningthe dandelion omelette is great too

0.description: Go to place for Brunch! Have been coming here for a couple of years and nothing will stop me from coming back. The wait is never too bad even on a busy weekend! I've tried the sweeter end of brunch items since I do not eat eggs, and they've never disappointed me. Their potatoes are also seasoned so deliciously, its hard to accept that they'll be gone in a few more bites :( See you soon M.Henry!

38.description: Just not what it used to be. Food served cold. Tasteless. Clueless waiters. Very unimpressed with this place. Maybe new owners would help?

51.description: Disclaimer: Not food related. Food is great.When we put in our names I said I was happy to put my daughter's car seat on the floor, but the hostess said we needed a high chair so had to wait extra for a table that accommodated one. I'm new to this and had no idea why a 3 month old would need a high chair since she can't sit up yet, but I figured she misspoke. When seated I was directed to put the car seat propped between the legs of a wooden high chair that had been flipped over and was all wobbly, with the high chair warning in full view "Never use this chair in the upside down position. Serious injury may occur etc etc."  I guess this is not uncommon in the restaurant industry, especially in the US which is not very kid friendly, but it is incredibly dangerous.

27.description: The popular restaurant m. Henry was a Michelin Bib Gourmand. It was also featured as the best breakfast in the USA on the food network. We had two flavorful brunches in the bright decor. The Latina omelette and the rustic quiche lorraine with mixed greens were delicious. The ingredients were extremely fresh. The size portions were fair.The restrooms were clean.

32.description: Simply the very best breakfast spots ever!  I had the roasted vegetable quiche and a side of turkey sausage. The quiche was so delicious, even the mixed green salad on the side was well dressed , green and tasty! The turkey sausage patties were house made not the typical frozen patties they serve at every other breakfast spot! Can't say enough about this place! Went on a Saturday morning around 10:30ish waited only 10 minutes for a table and the place was hopping! Service was superb! Will definitely be going back! Yummy!:)

54.description: There is a reason why people from all over the city come to Andersonville for M Henry. It offers the most consistent, fresh, and delicious brunch in the city hands down. There are plenty of good brunch places in the city, but I have never had a bad or even average meal here. Get there early for breakfast; once 9 am hits, your long wait for a table is assuredly so.

48.description: So delicious! Some of the best food ever, and the wait wasn't too long. If you can sit outside, because the back is super cute. The bread pudding is one of the best I've ever had. Highly recommend!

44.description: This place is worth 5 stars. Food is absolutely delicious and they are super fast about everything. You won't feel rushed, but their staff will have you seated and fed in no time! Went there for an early saturday breakfast and we were super pleased with the experience. Very cozy design inside as well. Awesome work!

24.description: Delicious pastries, cakes, turkey burger and excellent service!! Want to go back and try other items from menu!!

7.description: I wanted to update my review because I've been to m.henry a few times for brunch more recently and I had a very good experience.I like the open layout and the decor. The service is excellent. The food is very well prepared and attractive.My only disappointment was that there were no mimosas.

49.description: Great food, great service! My coffee was refilled throughout my breakfast. The food came out promptly. The appearance and food taste was exceptional. All the waiters and staff were delightful. The only downside-finding parking in the area!

40.description: This place deserves several more visits!! The cinnamon roll French toast was delicious! The vanilla yogurt cream was ridiculous and really set the did apart. The fresh, crisp pears were a nice delicate touch too. The omelettes were good but not fantastic; my daughter was under-whelmed. She had the basic omelette and I had the Latina. I'm going back because I love the space (very nice) and I have a feeling their lunch menu is da bomb!!

53.description: This place is a hidden gem! I have been in Chicago for almost a year and I actively look for good eataries around the city yet I've never heard or read any yelpers mention M Henry's! This place is such a cute little settlement in Andersonville! The place smells of delicious food as soon as you walk in, very appetizing! We ordered Latina omeletta with chicken sausage and mango-blueberry brioche french toast. Both the dishes were outstanding especially the omelet was delicious and very flavorful! I love when I don't have to add loads of salt and pepper or hot sauces to my food for added flavor! The potatoes were really yummy and so was the sausage.  French toast was really good as well but I've had better. Regardless, the food was on point. Service was really fast and the waiters were very attentive! Servings are huge, 2 of us shared both dishes and were full by the end of the meal. I am a very happy girl to have found an amazing breakfast place walking distance to my house! Cannot wait to return!!

30.description: I never thought that any restaurant could take Tweet's place in my heart, but my new favorite breakfast place is now m. henry.Everything was amazingly tasty, from the mug of steaming Metropolis coffee that they let me drink as I waited outside in the unseasonably warm and sunny December weather, to the half order of Blackberry Bliss Pancakes that was the perfect accompaniment to 'jorge's black bean cakes & huevos borrachos' for a killer combo of sweet and savory that made my stomach sing with delight.The wait was reasonable for a Saturday afternoon around 1pm, about 20 minutes - my only complaint was the 10-15 minute wait after being seated before we were able to place our order, as we were already ravenous and everything being consumed around us looked SO GOOD.I'll definitely be back to try the Sunday morning specials, and the treats in the dessert case that looked equally great. (sour cherry handpie? YES PLEASE!)

46.description: One of my favorite brunch places. It is popular so arrive early or there might be some wait. I have tried several dishes both savory (bean bean cakes, Latina omeletta and etc) and sweet (blackberry bliss and etc) are both delicious. The best part is the bread pudding.

1.description: If I'm in Chicago, I try to go to breakfast/brunch here if possible. Bonus points if it's on a weekday so that we don't have to wait in line. Protip: while they generally don't take reservations for brunch, they will do so if the group is large enough...which meant that one time I roped people I met at a wedding into joining us at brunch the next morning.The pancakes are my favorite restaurant pancakes of everywhere (take that, Bongo Room; take that, other cities). I've had bliss cakes and hot cakes (can someone please tell me what the difference is?) in rhubarb, blackberry, etc. The best strategy so that you don't get sick from sugar overload is to split an omelette and a stack of (bliss, hot) cakes with someone else. Make sure you ask for hot sauce for your omelette.

55.description: Going out to eat is never an easy task with a 9 month old. Our little one really set out to make that a known fact when within 30 seconds of getting a table she lunged for a glass of water, spilling it everywhere. Cannot thank the staff enough for swooping in and handling it like it happens all the time. Their patience and friendliness was amazing in an otherwise really embarrassing, messy moment. Then the thoughtfulness of being offered a tiny bowl of sliced fresh fruit for the little troublemaker! We ordered the bliss cakes, quiche, and candied bacon. All so very good. So happy we decided on trying m.henry's as our first breakfast spot since moving to the area.. Only regret was not getting some dessert to go. Great food, great staff!

9.description: Smells like heaven as soon as you walk in! Their menu is not the largest but there's plenty of options. All of the food we got tasted fantastic! The serving staff was very friendly. They were attentive and quick. Our server was very sweet with my little girl. The only thing I'd say to watch out for is the size of the group. The table/area wasn't the largest. We did each have two side plates but the table was 100% full. There wasn't too much extra elbow room or space on the table. This in no way took away from the experience but I figured it's worth mentioning. Wouldn't recommend for a large group.

26.description: Very good breakfast. They have an interesting menu. With a limited about of choices. Be sure to look for the specials board. We were not told about them and didn't spot the board until halfway through our meal, which was a little disappointing. But the food was great.

25.description: Aaaaaaah, brunch heaven! After you get in, that is... Waits can get hefty, but I've always found it worth it. My faves are the blackberry bliss cakes, which are seriously out of this world, and a killer egg sandwich. (Incidentally, that its name. Killer Fried Egg Sandwich.) It's BYOB, from what I seem to recall observing. I can't speak to their lunch. The inside is usually crowded but cute, with window frame hanging as whimsical separators between sections of tables.

12.description: I never thought that any restaurant could take Tweet's place in my heart, but my new favorite breakfast place is now m. henry.Everything was amazingly tasty, from the mug of steaming Metropolis coffee that they let me drink as I waited outside in the unseasonably warm and sunny December weather, to the half order of Blackberry Bliss Pancakes that was the perfect accompaniment to 'jorge's black bean cakes & huevos borrachos' for a killer combo of sweet and savory that made my stomach sing with delight.The wait was reasonable for a Saturday afternoon around 1pm, about 20 minutes - my only complaint was the 10-15 minute wait after being seated before we were able to place our order, as we were already ravenous and everything being consumed around us looked SO GOOD.I'll definitely be back to try the Sunday morning specials, and the treats in the dessert case that looked equally great. (sour cherry handpie? YES PLEASE!)

59.description: The food is consistently good and worth the wait. The pancakes with berries & mascarpone sauce are delicious!

21.description: Deserves the #1 brunch rating in the country by the Food Network.Excellent service.  Owners are hands on deck waiting on customers and have great attitudes.Food is outstanding.  Original dishes.  Enjoy!

17.description: I like small menus with colorful food that stimulate your appetite and m.henry has just that. We stopped in for breakfast on our way into the 'burbs. If you come early, I believe the pay to park meters don't start running until 9am on Saturdays. Yay for free parking!We walked in and there was a small line...I don't understand why there wasn't a hostess standing there. It was probably a 10 minute wait before someone showed up. I mean, the front dining area was completely empty and the main area in the back wasn't even full.We were seated near the back with the booths. The booth seat is highly uncomfortable for short people like me...legs danging and falling asleep. I really hoped the breakfast made up for it. I know they have specials here listed on the black board, but it really would've been nice if the waitress announced specials of the day rather than what would you like? I really really wanted pancakes so I went with the blackberry bliss hotcakes. My boyfriend got a cinnamon roll french toast. Within 5 miinutes of ordering, the server brings another table's order out by mistake. I was like, that's lighting fast service, only to wait another 10 mins or so before our food came.So the hotcakes were super fluffy layered w/warm blackberries & vanilla mascarpone cream, & topped w/a brown sugar & oat crust. You can totally eat this sans syrup with the delicious berry sauce that gives it the perfect hint of sweetness. Of course I got a side of candied applewood bacon as a savory item to go with it. It's a delicious sticky mess, but I wish it was a tad bit more crunchy. Nonetheless, still good. The house baked cinnamon roll dressed with warm fruit, vanilla neufchatel creme was also topped with a granola crust. It wasn't overly sweet and the mixture of textures was lovely.A very good breakfast option in the Andersonville/Edgewater area. A bit pricey (~$35 w/tips for 2), but the generous toppings of fresh fruits and homemade bakery items justifies quality. We went in at 8am and left by 9:05am, just 5 minutes after the meters took effect.

10.description: Great service and food. Service is quick and friendly. My favorite are the blackberry bliss cakes which are pancakes served in a blackberry sauce with vanilla mascarpone and oats sooo good. With a side of their house potatoes. Definitely recommend.

5.description: We took some friends to here on Sunday. We expect it would be really busy and it was. We arrived around 11am and got a table half hour later. This was so far the best brunch I have never had around Chicago. Pancakes were so fluffy and delicious, my boyfriend ordered the Jorge's beans and he was super happy whit it. My friends want to get back while they are in the city.

3.description: Whoaaaa - you will not go hungry here. So much food. Came with a party of 5 for brunch and everyone loved what they ordered. I had the blackberry bliss cakes with a side of apple & chicken sausage. It was delicious. Next time I will probably order Jorge's black bean cakes and huevos borrachos, because my friend ordered that dish and I couldn't take my eyes off it, before he completed devoured it.Service was excellent!

35.description: Great food!!! Too bad it is so busy and I don't always feel like waiting in line, but the food is really good.

19.description: The popular restaurant m. Henry was a Michelin Bib Gourmand. It was also featured as the best breakfast in the USA on the food network. We had two flavorful brunches in the bright decor. The Latina omelette and the rustic quiche lorraine with mixed greens were delicious. The ingredients were extremely fresh. The size portions were fair.The restrooms were clean.

28.description: I love this place, first time here... had the veggie quiche (quiche period first time ever) and it was great! The ambience was great too as well, made it much easier for the brunch/date to go on smoothly.

45.description: Was in town visiting a friend.  He had to go to work so I found a place to eat.  I found this place.  I walked in and it was packed.  Since I was a single they sat me at the counter.  Even though they were packed I was attended to right away. I ordered some eggs and bacon and the food was great.  If you are in town stop by and get a great meal.

33.description: Where do I start? As we entered the front we received blank stares. The three young ladies were engaged in a conversation. One hesitantly asked for our names. I must admit that Christen saved the day. Such a sweet lady with a radiant smile. She made sure we had great seats and we watched her bless the whole place with her supreme service. Caesar took our orders. He was nice and fast. Then came the food. Wow...it was so... good. The turkey breakfast sausage is like no other. This is a place I will visit over and over. I want to try everything on the menu. Yum.

43.description: All of their food is really good. My favorite is the jerk chicken sandwich. Be careful though because it has a pretty good kick.

2.description: We came in for Valentine's Day brunch, when it was snowing and freezing outside, and there were about fifteen other couples, but it was a pleasant experience given the circumstances. The host was lovely and eccentric, and we were welcome to order some coffee and some of their fresh baked pastries (which looked amazing). After about 20 minutes, we were also offered a sample of their sour cherry cupcake, which was delicious, and then were seated 10 minutes after.I ordered a cinnamon roll French toast, which was warm, smothered in fresh berries and fruit, and coated in a crunchy oat crust, something that I will dream about for years to come. I'm fairly sensitive to sweetness, but even with the cream hidden inside the roll, it was just the right amount of sugar. The boyfriend ordered a smoked salmon rotolone with mixed field greens, which was an absolutely delicious omelette stuffed with salmon and respectably sized slices of avocado. We also got a side of apple-chicken sausage and their house made sausage patties, which were really nice, but the patties were much more flavorful than the sausages.The decor was warm and inviting, the service was fairly quick once we got in, and even though there was strange house music in the background, this is our absolutely favorite brunch place. And we don't even live in Chicago. We will miss you, cinnamon roll french toast.

18.description: Greeted by a pastry case with hand pies and muffins that put cupcakes to shame, you are soon transported to a farm-like breakfast nook. Classic brick on one side with clever windowpanes hanging in a few spots to offer more window seats, the setting was appealing and the friendly service was quick.You could come back just for that, but why not thrill your palate as well? The Jorge's Drunken Eggs and the Classic Egg Sandwich are both deserving of your time. Go there now. And don't skip the fried plantains. You would be foolish.

41.description: Finally had the chance to visit this adorable restaurant with some friends this week. The restaurant looks fun and it's decorated very tastefully to resemble a bright/happy cafe. We had to wait for about 15-20 minutes before we got seated, which is not bad at all for brunch.I loved the food and presentation - I shared a Fried Egg sandwich and "Latina Omeletta" with my husband. Both were good, but I loved the Latina Omeletta. (It had fried plantains in it - which made the taste more unique). I wasn't too please with their coffee though! It tasted so bitter and two portions of cream couldn't save it. (I usually have 2 cups during brunch, however I really struggled to have half a cup this time!)Their prices are comparable to other brunch places and their cafe is adorable. Food is commendable so I would be back! :)

52.description: One of my favorite breakfast places. Their quiche is amazing... And one of their most popular is the berry bliss pancakes - they're the best I've ever had in Chicago. Highly recommend. It does get slammed and loud so be cognizant of that when you go especially weekends, but at least you know it's busy for a reason :) Give it a try! You'll love it!

50.description: We met friends here for brunch one day, and it did not disappoint one bit. I ate the vegan meal option, and it was delicious. Everyone else ate up their food quickly and wanted more! You might wait in line for a bit (well worth it), but you can get coffee while you wait (thankfully)!

4.description: Literally my favorite Chicago brunch spot. This place will blow your mind. Everything is so freaking delicious. My favorite is the dandelion omelette though, the quiches come to a close second. I always recommend coming with friends, everyone ordering an entree and then ordering a crepe/french toast to share for the table. Parking is little difficult so I recommend coming at a non-peak time. It's also a 10-15 minute from the closest CTA station. Lot's a space inside, but sometimes it's still packed! Their bakery items are delicious as well :). You will not be disappointed!

6.description: I couldn't have been happier with my decision to come here. I bookmarked awhile ago but just found the time to go and boy am I glad I did. It's no wonder M. Henry's House baked Brioche Cinnamon Roll French Toast layered with Seasonal Fruit, Vanilla Neufchâtel Crème & topped with Granola Crust was rated the #1 brunch plate in America according to Food Network. There were so many flavors and textures that really made this dish. The crunch of the granola was perfect. The Crème was the perfect balance of smooth and depth. The entire meal was not too sweet. And the roll itself was not too cinnamon-y. The cafe is super quaint and sweet. The service was unbelievably fast. I can't wait to get back. I'm literally still thinking about how much I enjoyed my meal and need it again. Like now!!! You can't go wrong with going for brunch. I HIGHLY recommend. Maybe I'll get to go back in the morning. Fingers crossed...

22.description: Went to the rock shop next door and was recommended to eat at m.henry...An amazing recommendation. We went around lunch time, as for perfect timing; this place is only open for breakfast/brunch. I had the best tasting Mexican breakfast I've ever consumed. Huevos borrachos (drunken eggs). It was carefully crafted for maximum deliciousness. My date got a chicken caprese sandwich. It was deluxe.We will be back

15.description: I was so excited to try this place for brunch after looking at all the delicious pictures. The restaurant itself is very cute, and we got seated right away on a Tuesday morning. I got their special french toast with mango and blueberry and the bf got the drunken eggs. The french toast came with sweet mangoes and a good amount of this sweet cream sauce. I cut my french toast up and dipped it in the sauce, making the bread super soft. I kind of wish I got the pancakes, because that's what they''re known for, but the mangoes sounded too tempting. The drunken eggs is a spanish breakfast with black bean pancakes and tortilla, chorizo and avocado on top. The back bean pancakes were unique and really good. Overall, a great option for brunch!

57.description: Delightful and unique atmosphere with creative use of beautiful hanging windows and doors to create open space that provides privacy without a sense of isolation. The food is fresh and delicious, and is also uniquely presented. Yep, be ready to post on Instagram! Moderate prices, too! Can't wait to go back!

20.description: I figured the best time to try this place was around 12-1 to minimize wait time.  I love this place and everything we ordered was delicious. However the salmon was cooked on too high of a flame and it had the charred taste of the grill to the point where we couldn't finish it. Otherwise, we had the peach french toast it was perfect. I had the fried egg sandwich which was great too. The berry bread pudding was wonderful and the fruit was fresh and cooked great. I had hoped for a thicker juice on the bread pudding like a syrup but none the less it was so good regardless. Can't wait to go back to try more and byob.

36.description: I don't know why anyone gives this place less than five stars.The portions are sizable, price is fair, and food is delicious. I would particularly recommend their sweet brunch, especially the pancakes.

14.description: we went on a Saturday around 11:30am, and the wait is for 20 minutes, which is not bad at all for a place as good as thiswe ordered a turkey sandwich, and it was literary LOADED with turkey (see pic), the flavour was ok, just very generous portionthe openface chicken sandwich is pretty good, a very balanced flavour, really liked the asian sesame slaw, not too sour or too creamy, very refreshing for the morningthe dandelion omelette is great too

12.description: The place was full and ordered drinks at the bar. The wine selections have three price points, which we were unaware of and erroneously assumed the first price was for a glass. BEWARE. The first price is for 1/2 a glass and the servings are small anyway. So not sure who would order 1/2 a glass of wine unless you wanted to do a flight I suppose. Thinking since it was European style in concept..it would be glass/Carafe/bottle instead of 1/2 glass of wine/not really a full glass/bottle....instead of $5-$6 a glass it was $10-$12 and that left you unsatisfied.The new wine portions at restaurants is really getting irritating.The full glass portion would have been worth it for $5 to $6.  No wonder craft beer is hot.Take a photo of the wine list and order a beer. The wine was really good but no one likes to feel taken advantage of/lying by omission and since the place is new, I would think the bartender would explain things about alcohol pricing since most customers are brand new? Felt shady yet presumptuous because of that maneuver. Otherwise, the cheese flights were really good. Small portions of baguette are served, so you can ask for more bread if you like bread. I think using the wine menu as well as the cheese menu to order your own take away selections is the best way to make the most of the place. Has a lot of potential to be great but needs better staff training.

3.description: I stumbled upon Pastoral while exploring Andersonville, and I was impressed with the selection of wine/cheese/specialty items that I haven't been able to find elsewhere. I was even excited to have noticed a Basque cheese (Ossau Iraty) as I have yet to find any on the North Side. I'll be returning soon to refill on the cheese and wine.

1.description: Great place, glad to have it in my neighborhood -- but they seriously need to improve their check-out concept.There are always several knowledgeable and helpful staffers behind the main counter, but there's (apparently) only one register. This often results in a semi-chaotic cluster of customers at the front of the shop asking questions, placing orders, and trying to make purchases. There is also a register all the way at the back of the shop, which is largely obscured by wine shelves; on several occasions, while trying to purchase something at the front counter, I've been redirected to the back register where -- in theory -- it will be quicker to check out. Unfortunately, the folks at the front counter can't really see how many people are lined up at the back register, and today I once again found myself in a line four-deep at the latter, which wasn't moving at all because the person at the front of the line wanted to ask the person on the register everything about everything. After ten minutes of that, I eventually just went back to the front register and waited another five minutes to pay for my purchase there; if the items hadn't been things I needed for tonight's dinner, I would have just left without them.Again, I like this place, and love their bread, cheese and wine selection. But their customer service would be vastly improved by at least one other register at the front counter, as well as better communication between the front and back registers so that they're not sending shoppers from one frustrating check-out gridlock to another.

2.description: What a fascinating little experience Pastoral is.  The 4 stars is earned through the quality of the product and the OUTSTANDING service at the cheese counter.  Per the other reviews the bartenders are indifferent at best and waiters quick to have anyone but them help you.You have to prepare yourself to be confused.  Do I order at the counter in the back? At the bar?  Is there table service?  After our visit I still am not sure.  We went in wanting to sit in the Appelation side which has beautiful leather half booths and small but comfy four seat tables.  After dancing around the bar and seating area we ended up just getting a cocktail and stuff to go.  We wanted to stay but we live a half mile out and none of the waiters or the bartenders seemed interested in us.The cheese counter attendants are the reason we bought anything more than the cocktails.  Literally all of the 6 staff members on this afternoon went above and beyond to demystify Pastoral's products and experience.  $200 on cheese, wine, mustards, pickles, pate and we left happy and really enjoyed every product at home.Long story short- get stuff to go it is worth it.  Want to stay? Recommendation to the bar and waiters...be more informative and welcoming.  Felt a wee bit judged for my beanie and thermal, I mean it's Andersonville, it's still girlstown, be welcoming if you want to be welcomed.

9.description: Went here for the first time on 11/12/2015. Great decor, atmosphere and service. The cheese case and retail section were amazing to browse. I had high hopes for the restaurant but the food was only okay. I ordered the roast beef which was cooked very unevenly medium (perfect) in the middle but a bit overdone and dry at the ends. The cheese turnover accompaniment was amazing though. My dining companion ordered the egg noodles. He commented that it was not good because the meat in the dish was very fatty and the pasta was inconsistent, as if someone added uncooked pasta to the water after the existing pasta had been cooking for a while. My share of the meal with glass of wine came to around $37. I could have had a much better meal up the street at Johnny Brown Bag for half the price. Sorry guys - I hope your chefs improve. Beautiful space but meals need improvement.

10.description: I'm confused, not quite sure if this is a deli, wine bar, retail, restaurant.We stopped by for a sandwich yesterday which was under whelming. The blonde bartender couldn't be less interested and  her service was pretty awful. The dinner menu didn't look to interesting.I think we are getting screwed on the wine poursMaybe I will purchase cheese or meat but that is only a maybe.

4.description: Lots of staff but none of them want to actually wait on customers.  Sat at the bar 15 minutes without even being acknowledged.  There were only 6 other people sitting there.  The bar back wiped the same glass for 8 1/2 minutes staring off into space.  I gave up and left.  I won't be backGreat looking place but the idea is to buy stuff and I can't do that when they don't want to sell anything.

6.description: Delicious cheese and charcuterie plates. Lovely selection of beer and wine. Try their own prosecco on tap. Service needs some work but they are new to the neighborhood so I'll cut them some slack.  Great date place!

15.description: Myself and a few friends wanted to have a drink after having dinner out at a Thai restaurant last night.  We thought we would stop by the new Pastoral Bar and Restaurant - Appellation, for a late night drink.  Kaitlin's big smile greeted us at the door and she walked us over to the bar and we sat at a corner seat with a great view of the entire restaurant and kitchen.  She asked us what we were in the mood for, and we said "red wine".  She was extremely knowledgeable and offered a few suggestions.  She poured us some samples and answered our questions without hesitations.  She was  lovely.  The bartender took over from there.  The place has a great wine selection, which was reasonably priced, and most importantly, was very enjoyable.  This new space has a great cool vib.  Our next trip back we will definitely try out the starters and the dinner menu.  This place is a great new addition to Andersonville.

0.description: Discovered the Loop location, and have been a fan since. To make clear, I am not a fan of cheese, but I do enjoy the wine/artisanal cheese pairings here. 3 Cheese platter options (two platters with 5 various cheeses and the third platter with 3 cheese variations), and a nice wine menu.Entre's:Lamb and brussel sprouts Dish: 5Chicken thighs/mashed potatoes: 5 (owner's favorite)Counter Culture Coffee: 4

5.description: A sumptuous experience without the pretense and at reasonable expense: delicious exotic, artisanal cheeses and charcuterie,  DEEP selection of wines for all palates, and very satisfying small plates.  I can't speak for the bigger courses - always too full from the side dishes and cheese flights.  Read a negative review by people upset that they didn't have high chairs for their kids.  How horrible of the owners not to cater their restaurant to the experience you and your little brood expect.  On second thought, take the smaller versions of yourselves to Hamburger Mary's down the street and spare the rest of us.The staff is rather well educated and can help you select a nice pairing of flavors to suit your tastes.  Excellent choice for a date night or a great evening out with friends.

13.description: Excellent addition to Andersonville. Their selection of cheese, beer, and wine is great. I can't wait for the holidays to have a chance to splurge.

11.description: I stopped by for a Sunday evening wine and snack and was blown away.  Very well done, very fine.  The classic cheese plate and its pairing were a wonderful way to end my weekend, and afterward I was able to purchase my favorite cheese from the plate at their accompanying store.

8.description: My wife and I love the other locations and we live around the corner from this new Clark spot so we were excited to give it a try on Saturday.  Unfortunately we had a really strange unwelcoming experience. When our group of three adults and 2 young kids walked in around 5pm we were greeted with a strange apprehension. The host and hostess spent a few minutes talking in the corner and pointing over at us and then they advised us that "the owners have not made an investment in booster chairs and therefore they could not seat us."  We hadn't even asked for booster chairs. We are not the type of parents who expect our kids or family to receive special treatment. We are highly sensitive to how they can impact the environment around them in public places, and we think they are very well behaved because of that. But this took us by surprise and changed our mood instantly from excited to embarrassed and disappointed. Two stars for a beautiful build out. Wish we could have enjoyed it.

14.description: I hope I can change this review to more stars in the future and that they are just working out the kinks of a new opening. I love the other locations and I was excited when they came to my neighborhood. In trying to place a catering order I was told I could pick up at 10:30am by one person and then I couldn't by another, I was bounced around and told to call back to finalize the order making me nervous about getting my order finalized. On another occasion they completely neglected to include something we ordered in a pick up order. The food is great once you get it but I sure hope they work out the kinks in their system because I won't return with this type of service !

7.description: Pastoral's cheese-and-wine shop and the wine bar share the same lovely space, but the experience of each is so different they might as well be in different stores altogether. In the cheese-and-wine area, the staff is friendly, welcoming and solicitous. At the wine bar, it's just the opposite: The servers there are indifferent at best. After we sat down at the wine bar, we waited a long while for the bartender to notice us -- even though there were maybe four other customers seated at the bar. He finally handed us a drink list while barely muttering "hi." No questions asked about the kinds of wine we might like, no information provided about the kinds of wine they offered. I might expect that disinterest at a dive bar selling well drinks, but not at a wine bar charging $10-$14 a glass. The wine I did have was fine but I would've liked to try something else. Unfortunately, I didn't trust that the bartender would know what wine to recommend or would be interested in doing so. The whole time he seemed more intent on what he was doing (mostly talking with the other bartender) than with what his customers were experiencing. Since then, there've been a couple of times when we walked by Pastoral thinking it might be nice to stop in for a glass of wine, but then we see the same bartender there and just keep on walking. Until Pastoral gets bartenders who know how to treat customers, or trains them better, I'll just stick to picking up some of its delicious cheese and wine to go.

28.description: It's very poorly organized and most of the stuff doesn't have prices. I love thrifting but this place just didn't impress me. Although they also sell stuff you wouldn't find elsewhere, like kids art projects and binders still containing someone's Shakespeare essay from 1995. So it's good if you're looking for oddities or just want to kill time.

1.description: Here is the most important thing I learned when I started visiting Green Element: they get new stuff in every day they are open.Fortunately it's only a few blocks from my place (and just steps off the Granville Red LIne CTA stop) so I drop by now and then to see what kinds of things I can find. I've pretty much outfitted my place with stuff from here. Today I purchased a large rectangular vase with colored pebbles which -- between the vase and the pebbles -- would easily have cost me more than $50-$60 at Bed, Bath and Beyond. $15.The place is huge and packed with stuff, but if you are into exploring you'll be walking around and suddenly see this one thing that would be great in your place, whether it be furniture (from a few dollars for a lamp to estate furniture pieces) knick-knacks or framed pics you can't believe someone threw away.I also got some end-of-summer name brand polo shirts in my size for a buck each. And it's all for charity, which is a plus.Rummaging through thrift stores is favorite pastime of mine, and this THE place in Edgewater to do so.

39.description: My husband and I totally LOVE this place!  It has everything you could possibly imagine.  The people are so friendly and helpful.  We go back every weekend.  They have toddler clothes and if you dig around you can find some really nice pieces.  Great assortment of books and movies too.  Check this place out, you won't regret it!

9.description: I stumbled across the cutest Lorde & Taylor wool coat here! Whenever I'm out this way I stop by and find something nice to give me my consignment shopping fix.  Great store!

29.description: Tried this place for the second time, about a month ago.  The young mansold me a pinata for $1.  When I told him it was for a Cinco de Mayo party at a shelter I volunteered at, he explained how I could also make my own (I needed more).  He also asked me to let him know other items we need and stated he would try to help.  The prices on the jewelry were better than last time I was there.  Thanks for a pleasant experience mainly due to that employee.

23.description: PLEASE READ (sorry so long!) I still have a bitter taste in my mouth. Please can we change the hours for this resale shop on Yelp? Does this place close at 7 or 8? Yelp says 8pm and the sign in front of the store says 8pm as well. I've been going to this resale shop since I started school at loyola in 2012 and I have had nothing but good things to say. But after today, I will never step foot in this store ever again.My sister and I love thrifting, vintage shopping, and looking for random things. We got to the store around 6:30pm and my sister went to the table/bin of photos and spent a good 30minutes digging through to find some vintage photos she really liked. I reminded her that they will not charge anything on a card under $10 which is understandable. When we went to pay at 7:15pm (mind you we were the only customers left in the store and we understood the store was closing), the older gentlemen told us our total was $2.20 for 10 small photos. We did not have cash so my sister dug through her coin purse and had $1.50. When she asked to see which photos she wanted to put back, he replied, "Sorry Its 7:15, I can't ring you out. We're closed. You can come back tomorrow and buy them." And then we awkwardly just walked out in shock. So my sister dug through the piles of photos (that no one probably wants)  all for nothing. I understand that they closed at 7 and we were there til 7:15, but he could not take the 20 seconds for my sister to put the ones she didn't want back? Where's the customer service? Very rude. Thanks for nothing. Will tell everyone that asks about this shop to never walk in. Just loss some customers. (We are pretty tolerable people when it comes to bad customer service, but this definitely ruined our saturday night)

5.description: This review is about Green Element's pickup service.  They were very thorough to make sure the furniture was in great condition.  Arranged everything via text, and then picked up 3 very large pieces IN THE RAIN.  I can't thank you enough!.

31.description: Green Element Resale is what a resale store should be: a resale store. I don't get all the fights about the pricing in the other reviews below, this place is super cheap for most items. Sometimes I'll grab a few items to make sure that I'm over the $10 credit card minimum, and they'll tell me that my handfulls of stuff still don't total over ten bucks. Well, alrighty then- I can go grab some more! I've found very good clothing here, including a number of blazers and a suit or two that- after a quick tailoring job elsewhere- are worth a few hundred apiece. One of my best finds was a leather bag that would've cost me around $250 new, for maybe $6 here? I love how huge the place is too, and Richard is always super friendly to me when I'm there.The one complaint is that there's no dressing room. There IS a space in the back with a mirror that's sort of private that I can usually try on dress shirts, but it's still open, so I can't exactly try on pants or dresses. But I think they have plans to fix this, if they haven't already. That'd be great!

25.description: I could have spent hours looking at all the stuff they have! I went looking for a last minute Halloween costume & also picked up a really nice skirt, and since I don't wear skirts very often I'm glad it was only $4.40! Staff was also courteous & friendly.

12.description: I'm writing a review on the furniture pick up service. Words cannot adequately describe how thankful I am this service is available. I was able to have same day furniture pick up, that's incredible living in the 60607. I called other places but they couldn't accommodate a same day, only 2 days to 2 weeks out and I was flying out in 2 days exactly. So after calling around & being duped by Craigslist con artists pretending to want to purchase my items; I found Green Elements. I called, was given the info for furniture pick up. I texted Brian my info and pics of my furniture. He came within the hour!!!! He moved everything in LESS THAN AN HOUR and I had a fair amount of items and a limited time to reserve the building's freight elevator. He's super friendly, strong, personable, and his partner was cool too. I'm so happy that my items will go to good use. Brian also gave me a tax letter as well.I can now have a stress free move & look forward to spending time with my friends and family before I leave Chicago. Brian and Green Elements are F'ing AMAZING!!! Thank you thank you thank you!

37.description: I desperately want to love this place because it's close to my house and is the perfect balance between antique and thrift. The place is a treasure trove of vintage oddities, neat furniture, and the absolute random, and if you have the time and determination, you can find some pretty sweet stuff.I don't agree that the place is over-priced, except for a lot of the furniture, which could definitely be more reasonable.In any case, I like the concept of this place. It's unique and fun.My complaints are few but significant enough. First off, most things don't have prices, so every time you want to consider buying anything you have to bother someone who has to go bother the owner to ask the price. And the owner is the least-friendly person in the place. He is not even remotely interested in being polite when you buy something big there, which I have. That said, I don't think he means to be a crank. He has a cool mission, and he's clearly a decent guy. It's just that I am too afraid of him to shop there.

21.description: An interesting hodge podge of items.They have every possibility of things you do not need but may want.Quite abit of furniture and lamps.  Priced expensively?  Not sure but not a steal.Forgot to look through clothes.Many books.  Helpful staff.Do not expect it to have a Goodwill/Village look to it.They do get 4 stars for all they have.You may find that one thing you have been looking for.

16.description: The owner has no regard for common decency.  If you couldn't already tell that from his flippant remarks when people give bad reviews (who does that??!), here's the text exchange he had with my wife.  He pissed me off to the point of signing up for Yelp just to publicize how unprofessional he is.  (background - we had some furniture and happened upon their business to come pick it up since we wanted to donate it.  A couple pieces had some nail polish stains, but they were not in that bad of condition and were nice to begin with.  They didn't need to do business with us if they didn't want to.  So when my wife asked for a receipt...)Brian: Sorry / it wasted more time than it was entirely worth and it cost more than we received in donation for how much labor we put in.  Brian: No receipt.  Brian: Cost of our labor and running a truck there.  Brian: I would not be able to have a store if every pickup request was like yours.Brian: Those were all items that a reasonable person would have set by the dumpster.Wife: Ok, sorry that I am not a reasonable person.  I thought all those items could be used by someone in need of furniture who maybe can't afford new things.  Salvation Army would probably have been better for that.  Thanks for your help.Brian: They were sold for less money than it took us to pick them up.Brian: So yes they were purchased by someone who needed themBrian: If you are that concerned about poor people you should have taken a cab and brought the items in yourself.Brian: Salvation Army would have been no more grateful then we were.Brian: And yet you still continue to waste my time trying to educate you about economics.Brian: I guess my whole point is try to show some decency the next time you call an organization to pick up donated items and then seek a tax credit for those same items.Brian: And yes we also get calls from people who say "Salvation Army turned down my furniture, would you guys come pick it up?"Wife: Ok, thank you for your time.So we wasted his time, but he has time to go on rants against people who give negative reviews on yelp or who he voluntarily did business with.

17.description: PLEASE READ (sorry so long!) I still have a bitter taste in my mouth. Please can we change the hours for this resale shop on Yelp? Does this place close at 7 or 8? Yelp says 8pm and the sign in front of the store says 8pm as well. I've been going to this resale shop since I started school at loyola in 2012 and I have had nothing but good things to say. But after today, I will never step foot in this store ever again.My sister and I love thrifting, vintage shopping, and looking for random things. We got to the store around 6:30pm and my sister went to the table/bin of photos and spent a good 30minutes digging through to find some vintage photos she really liked. I reminded her that they will not charge anything on a card under $10 which is understandable. When we went to pay at 7:15pm (mind you we were the only customers left in the store and we understood the store was closing), the older gentlemen told us our total was $2.20 for 10 small photos. We did not have cash so my sister dug through her coin purse and had $1.50. When she asked to see which photos she wanted to put back, he replied, "Sorry Its 7:15, I can't ring you out. We're closed. You can come back tomorrow and buy them." And then we awkwardly just walked out in shock. So my sister dug through the piles of photos (that no one probably wants)  all for nothing. I understand that they closed at 7 and we were there til 7:15, but he could not take the 20 seconds for my sister to put the ones she didn't want back? Where's the customer service? Very rude. Thanks for nothing. Will tell everyone that asks about this shop to never walk in. Just loss some customers. (We are pretty tolerable people when it comes to bad customer service, but this definitely ruined our saturday night)

10.description: This is an amazing place to shop, friendly staff, very affordable stuff, they only take in good quality items and resell them at a better price. They have always worked with me if I thought the price was a little higher than should be and have always walked out the door with the item I wanted. I would recommend this place to anyone who like a great deal. Take your time coming here as they have ALOT of stuff to look thru. I always find myself walking down the isles a couple of times taking it all in. i will def be back for more.

11.description: Everything is so musky and great. The owner was a lil crazy loud on the phone with a bad customer. I'm picking up some books for the train and postcards for my collection:) huge inventory of furniture in the back. A little strange that you have to ask for most prices..

26.description: I love this place! I love all those beautifully put-together, very choosy second-hand stores, too, but I don't want to pay that much money because second-hand is in now. I get it, but I really love a true thrift store. That's what Green Element is. I've so far only been on the lookout for household goods, but I'll be back to peruse the other aisles later. I got a great table (1950s with the chrome sides and legs), great condition, an extra leaf, only one chair, but all were in great condition---$75. I picked it up the next day, and the guy helped me tie it onto my car with care. The staff is volunteer and they are all super nice. To everyone. I've been there a handful of times now and each time reaffirms my appreciation for this true thrift store.

27.description: We loved this place! Favorite find us a little dresser that we turned into a coffee bar.

35.description: I like this place, i think the workers there are cool. The only problem I have is that its way crowded with stuff. Some stuff i came across were stained and not fit for anybody to purchase, but i know the owner Brian would have removed those things had he found them. also, some things are a little overpriced. but i like this place because all the money goes to a good cause, and the workers there sweat their asses off solely for this cause. they don't make much profit i'm sure. you all should volunteer there.

8.description: It is very easy to get lost in here, there are so many things to look at. I love coming here, when I want to clear my head or buy little things that i need.

0.description: I was here looking for some furniture on a whim a couple nights ago, and I thought it was great! I got a toaster oven for $5 (WHAT A DEAL), and we also picked up a mahogany dresser for $40 (WHAT A DEAL). There's some really excellent furniture here - they had a four-piece dresser set that looked brand new and so beautiful - and there's also some excellent deals, as I've proven. I'm going to come back and paw through the mirrors at some point - they have a huge selection of really large mirrors in all shapes and frames in the back, and I can't wait to get my hands on one of them!

38.description: I was so excited about this place opening in our hood. We have quite a few great antique markets but we really need a junk store. Make no mistake, this place is filled with crap. There are piles of things in disrepair all over the space...and that is absolutely fine. If you're like me and love going through piles of crap and finding something that you can fix up or put some love and time into, this is your store.  But the owner is charging ridiculous prices. I've given them three shots. Each time I've gone in with the intent of buying something and supporting a new business in my hood but the owner insists on calling broken pictures "vintage" and marking them at prices found across the street at the antique market. I can't imagine he can ever sell the furniture he has in the back...absurd prices.I'm not going to be bitchy and give one star because I really hope that he can hear what's being said and turn the business plan around.  I understand that you want to support a charity, but it is your charity of choice, not the customers...we aren't prepared to overpay because you have a charity in mind.I think Green Element can be a real addition to our area and a great counterpart to the antique markets...just, please, please stop confusing old and worn with 'vintage chic' and start thinking of it as a junk shop.

20.description: definitely recommend this place!! You can find great items for a good price. Great selection in books and movies. I was most happy with the staff. I can honestly say that this shop has some of the friendliest staff I've ever came across (which is definitely hard to find now a days).

19.description: Be nice to the employees and they will be kind in return and will be willing to negotiate prices. Give yourself time to explore.

33.description: I looove this place they have the cutest little kninck knacks for the best prices!

2.description: This review is about their pick up service, which was great! They were recommended by Brown Elephant, as people who might take a media cabinet. (Most thrift stores are not taking them anymore, or the big fat TVs that went in them.) I sent Brian the photos of the cabinet, and told him it had to go down three flights of stairs! The next day, the guys came and got it.They also moved a piece of my furniture in its place, as a favor to me! Don't forget to tip them.Someone will get a nice cabinet, suitable for storage, and I saved money on movers.

34.description: So we went here previously and thought it was terrible. Didn't think I'd visit again, but we had been at the ever-wonderful Edgewater Antique mall and had some time so hubby talked me into trying it again.It's still crammed with stuff but seemed slightly better organized than previously. I have a secret Santa  to shop for, and my goodness were they crammed with Christmas items.  Prices were great. Even scored a couple real antique ornaments for yard sale prices.Service was good too. We'll be back.But--as with so many of these places--bring your hand sanitizer! :)

32.description: A good friend of mine works at this place so I really want to write a good review but alas this place is overprriced period. Edited.... ebay used to make prices up??? if i wanted ebay at a thrift store id order on ebay!

18.description: An interesting hodge podge of items.They have every possibility of things you do not need but may want.Quite abit of furniture and lamps.  Priced expensively?  Not sure but not a steal.Forgot to look through clothes.Many books.  Helpful staff.Do not expect it to have a Goodwill/Village look to it.They do get 4 stars for all they have.You may find that one thing you have been looking for.

13.description: Looking for a disorganized junk store with surly, unhelpful staff and questionable business practices?  Then look no further; this is your place!I stumbled upon the store a few months back and got some shorts for the summer.  It was an okay experience, although I found the staff rather unfriendly.  A few weeks later I saw a mirror in the front window I liked, and I stopped in to check the price.  Much to my surprise, there was no price on it, nor on any mirror in the store.  The staff person who helped me seemed to make up prices as I looked at different mirrors through out the store, all of them incredibly high.Then a few weeks ago I stopped in just to browse and found a replacement bowl for my ice cream maker.  It was on a shelf by itself with a lid on it.  No price again.  As I didn't have any cash on me, i left it.  I went back today to see if it was still there.  It was, so I brought it to the front to buy.  The guy at the front desk (I believe the owner) literally ripped the bowl out of my hand and said he couldn't sell it to me.  He said it had gotten separated from the unit that's supposed to house it and he couldn't sell it like this.  It didn't matter that it had been sitting on its own for several weeks. And he made no attempt to see if I'd like to buy the entire unit.  He just said he wouldn't sell it to me.And now he'll never have to worry about selling me anything again.

4.description: Great, real, thrift shop.  They have something for everyone, every room and interest.  Clothing, furniture, furnishings, sporting goods, books, tools, audio/video, seasonal, and oddities.  The stock is continually refreshed so I rarely see the same thing twice.  I think the prices are perfect - like I'm getting a really good deal but not egregious.  The staff are really friendly and go out of their way to be helpful.

24.description: Went a few times when I first moved to the area, and loved it.  Went in today and there's apparently a new "sheriff in town" who believes that hiking up the price is a good idea for business. A scratched up Fiesta dish set for $95!?  There was a like new all white set in the window with double the pieces for $75.  Does that make any sense??  If they keep churning up the prices on mostly donated items then I don't see this business improving. By far, I've seen better thrift stores, neatly arranged and with employees that have decent customer service. Greed seems to be getting the best of this business, I don't plan to go back any time soon. Worth a pass.

6.description: I am very disappointed with my experience here earlier today. After doing some much needed grocery shopping, my boyfriend and I decided to stop in here to see if there was anything we liked. We had been in a few times before and had always had good experiences. We had wandered around the store for over 15 minutes with our big bags of groceries, and we had even seen two employees there who acknowledged us. When I walked over to the shoe aisle, I left my BLACK boyfriend waiting for me in the main aisle. As he walked over to talk to me an employee came by and nervously asked him if he was shopping???? Why else would we be in there? When he replied yes, the employee asked him to check his bag. Overhearing all of this, and carrying a bag of my own, we both walked over to the front desk to follow the store policy and check our bags. When we walked up we placed our bags on the counter, the employee looked confused and said to me, oh you don't need to check your bag, its just a purse. Mind you my bag was very obviously a cloth shopping bag full of the same groceries my boyfriend had in his bag AND I had an actual purse slung visually over my shoulder. Sensing there was some prejudice here I responded that this is my purse and this is my bag full of groceries, and since the policy is to check your bags I was bringing mine to be checked with my boyfriends, he still seemed confused, and I realized he didn't even think my boyfriend and I were together, so I told him so, and then I asked him to check our bags together. At the time I was holding an adorable little sailor lamp that I wanted to use in our apartment for my redecoration, I am building an entire room to commemorate my BLACK boyfriends 8 YEARS IN THE NAVY, and his numerous medals and achievements. It would have been perfect. He then asked if we wanted to get the lamp, we said yes but that we were still shopping. What? do you not remember asking us to come up to check our bags? Or were you just so ready for us to check out and get our biracial asses out the store? I said I wanted to buy it later and he said ok you can leave it here. He seemed nervous and awkward. The whole experience had thrown me off and felt slightly prejudice, why would my boyfriends bag of groceries not be ok, but my bag of groceries is ok?? Why? Because I look white? I tried to let it go, my boyfriend wanted me to let it go, so we walked back towards the rear to the look at the furniture. Upon passing NUMEROUS people with empty bags I became infuriated. There was an old white woman with a grey bob haircut and an EMPTY yellow shopping bag wandering around that no one had said anything to. Then there was ANOTHER WOMAN with an empty brown bag wandering around. Why had these people not been asked to check their bags? I wanted to leave, I went back up to the counter and I wanted my bags back. I explained that there seemed to be some prejudice since there was a white woman wandering with her bags unchecked. The man responded that he couldn't check everyone. Well sir, if you can come find my BLACK boyfriend to tell him to check his bag full of groceries, and you DONT want to be perceived as racist, MAYBE you should take the time to go look around at the entire store, you know, just so you don't make anyone feel singled out. Then he told me to go get the white woman! NO, YOU GO GET HER. You had enough time to find my boyfriend and get him, now you don't have enough time to tell the white woman to check her bag? Are you insinuating that Im lying??? I don't fucking work here, Im not the one policing the bags, or is it just the black men you police? And when I told him it felt like he had singled my boyfriend out, his response was that they were the least prejudiced people around, still not getting my bag for me. I told him it didn't seem that way. I continued to ask for my bag and he continued to ramble off stuttering excuses and reasons why he was not prejudiced, all while not getting the bag I asked for. I ignored him and continued to ask for my bag. As we went to leave he said "whatever," to our backs. Yes, a real professional way to handle a disgruntled customer. My advice is this, if you don't want someone to feel singled out, then take the time to make sure they don't, I don't know, maybe by asking EVERY SINGLE PERSON to leave their bags at the front. Your not Saks, if you have a store policy you want upheld, then have someone always at the front to make sure it is being upheld, because the two other employees we walked by with our big bags of groceries said NOTHING to us. I am all for following rules, my father is a sergeant and my boyfriend is a veteran, but I am not about to let someone be subconsciously racist and not get called out on it. My boyfriend deserves an apology. We don't need to steal, we followed your rules, you singled us out, we voiced our feelings and you took an extremely unprofessional way out. GOOD DAY.

22.description: I almost don't want to share this place with anyone. But I love supporting a great business! They have great vintage furniture for good/fair prices. Sometimes they need some fixing but they know that and price accordingly. I only seen a few expensive prices pieces or furniture and they are totally worth it because they are pieces of art. They currently have an Asian curio cabinet that is beautiful and worth the price listed for. They also have this cute vintage crib that I would snatch up in a heartbeat if I had a child lol. So hard to pass up that adorable piece since you never see furniture like that anymore. It's close to other antique shops, but this is defiantly the best-prices spot in the area.

15.description: I've stopped by several times since my last review.  Some advice for people unfamiliar with the store:1) Realize it's a used item store.  Think of the place as a huge garage sale and not a retail store.  Like other used item sales (thrift stores or not), there aren't price tags on the majority of things.  The older gentleman at the front really does make them up as he goes along.  If you don't like the price, offer something a little lower.  If you don't like the price he asks for, don't buy the item.  Simple haggling.  2) Bring cash.  I think they do take credit cards, but there's a limit.  Try paying in cash for small items as much as possible.  Stores lose a percentage of the sale to the credit card company.3) Go when you have time.  The place is very, very cluttered.  I have a general idea of where certain categories of things might be, but that's because I've been there many times and have dug through the different areas.  4) Don't go expecting clothes.  Instead, the more random the item, the better it seems.  For example, I've gotten a shoe shine brush, a metal card holder, board games, blocks of wood, plant pots, and a salad spinner.  5) They offer delivery for an extra charge.6) Be nice to the store's staff and be patient.  They're not in a rush, so you shouldn't be either.  Also, go well before closing.

7.description: After passing by this store for months, I decided to stop in.  I found a book I was looking for.  However, when I got up to the counter and produced my card, I was told I had to spend at least ten dollars in order for them to accept it.  I saw no sign anywhere stating that rule.  Despite the fact that I did find some more good items to purchase, I ended up spending more that I originally intended to spend.  Most items in the store don't have the price on them, which is off-putting, especially to those us on on a budget.  The guys behind the counter seemed to just make up prices on the spot.  It's too bad. . . I probably just going to keep passing by the store from now on.

36.description: Stopped in here today with some friends looking for a desk and left with something even better. CLOTHES! They had a pair of neon shorts for 2 bucks, the type you would find at forever 21 but better and with the 50% off all clothing, purses, and kitchen wear it was only a dollar! Whatttt? Not to mention this nice vintage running jacket for only 2 bucks!All in all $3.30 for a pair of shorts and a jacket, and my items were bagged in a reusable drawstring bag. Talk about awesome!First class service for sure.They have everything from vintage board games to chandeliers and everything else in between, just be prepared to dig.

30.description: This is a true resale "junking" store.  Well organized and chaotic at the same time; which suits it just fine.Excellent staff - super friendly and helpful.   All of the prices are very fair.  I bought a box of potting pot and utensils, gloves, a few black and white pictures and several books and the cost was about $16.00.  This also included two large, brass wall planter hangers.  Those along would have been at least $10.00 each in a big name or retail priced store.All of the glass and pottery were well wrapped and boxed for me. I am a big fan and plan to go back soon.

3.description: I LOVE GREEN ELEMENT. I can't say it enough times. I mostly shop here for their amazing books and furniture/area rug deals. They have great vintage clothing if that's what you're after, but their vintage furniture rivals the Broadway Antique Mart sometimes! They offer delivery and if something isn't marked, they let you make an offer. I got a high-pile thick like-new area rug that was originally at least $100 at Target for $15. Plus their sidewalk deals! If it's on the sidewalk they want it gone, so you can get some great furniture for cheap! Seriously, go here.

14.description: This is by far my favorite resale shop in Edgewater and Andersonville. I donate to them regularly and buy from them all the time. When I was planning my wedding, I was in here every week searching for items. They have been nothing but helpful and resourceful. They always helped me load things in and out. The pick up service on furniture is wonderful and they only take items they can resell. Meaning they don't just pick up everything, which I appreciate. Some of my furniture items they didn't think they could resell but they were super nice about it. I gave them a cash donation to set it out in the alley for me to which they obliged. I always enjoy the large selection of books. My only complaint is in the summer when there is no air conditioning. It can get stuffy in the building. Hope they can afford to cool the place soon.

58.description: Always excellent service and a fantastic product!  I stop here for holiday items and treats for work.  Never disappointed.

56.description: This bakery should be called the $wedi$h Bakery.  $4.14 for two sweet rolls--neither contained fruit, filling, frosting, or were Swedish specialties (e.g., containing cardamon).  Over $21 for a pound of biscotti. There is a large variety of breads, but no rolls, which seems odd. Their products  are tasty, but this bakery is trading on its well-established reputation and charges for it.

29.description: (NOTE: I translated this to Swedish for the Yelp 100 Challenge: Stockholm. For the English version of this review please scroll down to the original.)Kom hit för bästa traditionella europeiska bakverk i Chicago. Det är ofta trångt, särskilt runt jul. Svenskarna älskar att dricka en kopp kaffe och äta en bakelse på eftermiddagen, så mycket av priset här är för att: små läckra bakverk, kakor och krämer, som går bra med kaffe.Den svenska Bakery har också est Princess Torte jag har varje hade. Det är ett ljust grön ändå enkel tårta, rund, med en dubbel lager vit tårta och vispad grädde inuti, och en grön marsipan beläggning utanför (jag kan inte kalla det en glasyr eftersom du kan dra bort den som en hud).De erbjuder även kakor och bröd. Prova Limpa, det är smaskiga. Det finns också en lätt sötad kaffebröd kallas "Scorpa", som är smaksatt med kardemumma.Om det inte är alltför trångt att du kan ha din bakverk och kaffe här, medan du bestämmer hur många tusentals kalorier du ska ta med hem.

42.description: These guys are WONDERFUL! I worked with Lillan for about two months planing a surprise cake for my boyfriend. She was more than understanding (and SO patient) with me and my MANY emails and MANY questions. The cake was PERFECT! I ordered a TARDIS cake- so the details were important, and the decorators just nailed it! And of course the cake itself was SO tasty! I got a ton of compliments from friends for ordering half red velvet and half carrot cake. When you had both flavors on your plate at once the combo tasted amazing! I highly suggest both flavors with the cream cheese frosting! So good!I have never ordered a custom cake before so I was beyond nervous about it, but these guys made it so easy and stress-free! They do offer delivery which also made the whole situation/ birthday so much easier. I would for sure recommend these guys to family and friends!

23.description: LOVE! I'm not sure there is anything here that I don't like. This is a "real" bakery, not a little boutique type bakery. They have everything from amazing coffee cakes to sprinkle butter cookies by the pound to danish's to loaves of bread to custom bday cakes....everything is made fresh daily and the prices are reasonable! If you haven't been here I suggest you stop by this little gem bc you won't be disappointed.

47.description: I've lived in Chicago for 3 years and have used Swedish Bakery several times for birthday cakes and just to stop in for a treat. Their Triple Chocolate Ganache cake is the best cake in the city - a must have! Recently I had my first issue on an order I placed, but I was stunned at how fast the manager responded and helped out. I will definitely continue to use and recommend this place.

8.description: Swung by Swedish Bakery on Fat Tuesday 2/9 to pick up a Semla (Swedish specialty specifically eaten on Fat Tuesday). Was told by a lady behind the counter they were out. I asked her if it was possible they could make more since it was Fat Tuesday after all. She told me quite rudely that today was not a special day for Semlor but rather Paczki day. Didn't have the energy to inform her I lived my first 22 years in Sweden and never heard of Paczki day. Perhaps, I missed the part when the "Swedish Bakery" became the "Polish Bakery".

31.description: Service is great or very professional. Cakes are going from good to ok to it taste like any other bakery. I'm very sad that they are loosing taste. Recently bought a 6 inch red velvet with cream cheese filling, the cake was dry, and the filling tasted more like lard and powder sugar.... I really doubt they even used cream cheese at all. honestly box cake    Is better and cheaper.....

34.description: I recommend buying a semla and eating It in the storefront window, aside from whatever good things to take with you.

16.description: Ever since I saw British contestants on a PBS cooking contest attempt a "princess torte" I knew I would have to go over to the Swedish Bakery to try theirs.  It did not disappoint.  It was beautiful... and it was delicious.  Rich, creamy... a perfect birthday splurge.  I should also compliment the young man who served me, Erick, who was friendly, personable... and very attractive, I might add.:-)

13.description: I grew up going to this bakery. My friends worked here while we were in high school, back in the 90's. I hadn't been here in about 7 years and walking in again brought so many memories. It smells delicious, it was very busy, so many choices..... I bought a tart, a Napoleon, and some cookies.
