Those cookies are to die for!!!! Years ago I ordered my son his birthday cake from them and everyone raved on how great it was. I will always make a stop at the bakery whenever I'm in the area. Delicious treats at a very good price.

11.description: Never ever go here. The service is abysmal. The worst I've ever seen. They are disorganized and rude. And the cakes just aren't worth it. I have had just as good quality from Jewel with far less hassle. This was the last time I will buy anything from them. So much for trying to support local businesses.

39.description: Whenever I think of Swedish Bakery, I think of my childhood. Along with that comes the memories of the cake on my birthday and getting dessert with my grandparents. So because of this, I always loved and still love it a lot. In addition to this, the goods at this bakery are phenomenal. I can't even begin to explain how amazing this place is. My words do no justice. The cookies, coffee cake, truffles, everything is just beyond my expectations. The best part? Free samples of assorted coffee cakes! Let's put it this way....this is not the place to go if you're on a diet lol. I definitely recommend! Try the seven sisters cake!

37.description: Yummy

0.description: If you are within 30 minutes of the Swedish Bakery, divert and go directly to the Bakery, park in their private parking lot, proceed to the entrance and go in, grab a number and prepare for some mind blowing, scrumptious, artistically decorated desserts!The staff is super friendly and very patient while you hem and haw over which delights you want to bring home with you.This is my 3rd review for the Swedish Bakery and it just gets better and better. Stopped in right before Christmas (December 22) and loaded up with 2 stuffed boxes for the Holidays. Our treats stayed fresh in the fridge as they dwindled down to nothing.OMG, I can't wait to return but,  I kinda gained 10 lbs over the holidays. Totally worth it.

38.description: The Swedish Bakery is more than just a "Swedish" bakery; they have rather large assortment of cookies and pastries from many different parts of Europe. If you are looking for some particular type of European pastry in Chicago, this is probably the place to start. On my last visit, I tried both their version of the Swedish "semla" and the Polish equivalent, the "paczki". The semla was good, but unfortunately, it did not contain enough almond creme for my taste. It was also served in a strange paper cup. This is not the traditional way of serving a semla. Nonetheless, the semla would still be slightly above average compared to the ones you can find in Sweden.Where the Swedish Bakery really shines is with regards to the cookies. They sell a large number of traditional Swedish cookies by the pound. In many other places, these kinds of cookies are often quite dry and uninspiring. I am happy to report that this is not the case here! I tried about 7 different varieties, and all were very well made. The butter-to-sugar ratio was just right. As some other reviewers have noted, many of their products contain, or rather, consist of, marzipan. This may seem unappealing to many American consumers. But keep in mind that marzipan is to Europeans as peanut butter is to Americans. They put it on essentially everything! In addition, Scandinavian pastries are often less sweet than the American counterparts. As a result, you will not find many of the "large-size, extra cream, extra fudge" kind of treats that you might be used to. A final word of advice: the place is often quite crowded, so be prepared to wait about 10 to 15 minutes for service; particularly on weekends.

51.description: Dear friends got married last week and ordered their wedding cake from Swedish Bakery.  The happy couple loved the cake, and so did everyone else.  Not just the look of it, but the taste.  Sadly, the guests pretty much gobbled it all up and the hoped for leftovers didn't work out.

27.description: While Swedish Bakery is churning out some delicious baked goods, it's a little bit pricey compared to many other bakeries.  This is a bakery I would come back to for a small treat for myself or someone else, but probably not to cater an entire party.Everything we ate was so good!  I had to get the giant rainbow frosted cookie.  Even though it was just a sugar cookie, the cookie part and the frosting were so much better than I expected.  The Almond Tart was my favorite and would be perfect with a cup of tea.  The Rum Balls are also very good, dense little balls of chocolate which will totally satisfy in 2-3 bites.  Dominic P also picked out a cannoli, although I am not sure why a Swedish bakery makes cannoli...Our total for 2 Rum Balls,1 Rainbow Cookie, 1 Almond Tart, and 1 Cannoli was about $15.  Aside from the cookie, each treat was only a few bites and are not desserts meant to share.The service behind the counter was very attentive, and they didn't mind bouncing from counter to counter to help us.I would definitely come back here, but I would make sure to keep track of what I was spending.  During our visit, this could have easily spiraled out of control!

32.description: Horribly slow service. I realize it's Paczki day, but being use to going to webers and how efficient they are it's crazy for thee guys to take 25 minutes to serve 20 customers.

54.description: I love the Swedish Bakery so much. My boyfriend is Swedish and insisted we try it two years ago. It's an hour away from us...but so worth it!! The pastries and desserts are so, so, so yummy, and very reasonably priced. They even have shipping for some of their items! Which was very nice when I wanted to send some finals care packages. I have yet to try something that isn't delicious. And if you love almond/marzipan like I do, you'll find plenty of it here!

48.description: When I was younger, this was the place my parents ALWAYS got sweets from. We moved out of the area when I was five, so I thought maybe the deliciousness of Swedish Bakery was just a childhood dream, but I was wrong. I've recently gone back to this bakery a few times, and each time I have gotten wonderful baked goods. Additionally, I'm 100% sure the Swedish Bakery cake I bought for my boyfriend's birthday last August was what really helped me win over his mom. Thanks, Swedish Bakery! :)Consistent, authentic, and delicious - the Swedish Bakery is a must stop if you are in Andersonville.

44.description: Their butter cookies are wonderful.  And pricey at nearly $20 pound - fancy butter cookies are close to $22/pound.  But if you're trying to impress someone or bring a nice hostess gift - go for it.  I've had the petite pecan roll and it is also very good.  Their regular cake donuts are good, but nothing special.I recently had a mocha slice - chocolate cake with mocha mousse.  Oh my!  $4.50, but again worth it!

24.description: Great selection of tasty treats. Very welcoming and friendly people. Picked out a handful of butter cookies for the office and they were a hit!

7.description: The place was really warm and friendly, the service was on point, but the things that i bought weren't what i thought they would be. I bought 2 small cannoli Swedish, 2 biskvier and some chocolate dipped cookies. The cannoli were tasteless and the texture of the pastry was weird. I don't wanna talk about the biskvier because it made me regret i bought 2. I still havent tried the other stuff they offer but i will update the review once i try new ones.

49.description: They knocked it out of the park !! The cakes that they made for my wedding reception were incredible.  The manager was such a huge help in assisting me with choosing the right number of desserts for our reception.Every single person kept asking me where we had the cakes made. I told them I will never go anywhere else for desserts or cake for special occasions.... And I truly wish I lived closer. . As I would go there far more often. The input from the incredible staff there truly helped make my reception and especially my sweets table one that I will not forget.Hats off to all of the wonderful staff at swedish bakery. It could not have been any better !!!

40.description: Based on a recommendation from my fiancé's coworker, we scheduled a cake tasting on a Saturday morning. Going in early is definitely recommended because the place gets packed. We waited a little bit for Lilian. She came out and introduced herself and took us to a back room. Overall the experience was really good. We saved pictures of past cakes they made that we liked on their handy iPad, the cake flavors and fillings we chose were really good (their marble cake with salted caramel filling is amazing), and Lilian asked plenty of questions and gave us several options to make our wedding cake affordable. Although we haven't decided if they will be the bakery for us because we still have one more cake tasting, I know that we will be back because the cookies we purchased were delicious. If we do choose them, I'll write an updated review afterwards.

53.description: A total classic!  My grandma and grandfather are Swedish and we grew up going to the Swedish Bakery - Marzipan, Mazarines, Apple Boats, the Andersonville Coffee cake, and Limpa bread!!! It has changed hands over time, but still keeps baking our favorites and we have been very long time supporters.  Christmas time this place is so packed you have to wait for over 1 1/2 hours, but it is well worth it and the camaraderie with all the Swedes is fun!  For those of you lucky enough to go there in summer, enjoy the shorter lines and try the Mazarines.

30.description: I bought paczkis for Fat Tuesday. There was a long line when I arrived, but it moved quickly. There were samples of paczkis, which made me happy. I ordered 3 paczkis - fresh strawberry w/cream, blueberry and pineapple. All three were delicious! The fresh strawberry was my favorite because it wasn't too sweet. The woman who took my order was so nice and helpful. I want to come back and try their other baked treats!

46.description: As a disclaimer, I am very very sentimentally attached to this bakery, so this is, in fact, an incredibly biased review. The first non-Asian pastries and cakes I've had growing up are from this place and I still love them to death, so you can only imagine how pleasantly surprised I was to see that the yelp community shares my love for Swedish Bakery! I swung in here last week to pick up some goodies while en route to a good friend's house and the place was packed! Fortunately the staff is really efficient and helpful so I was in and out in no time. First off, you cannot go wrong with the raspberry napoleon. I also really like their carrot cake. I have never had any of their marzipan goods, but judging by everyone else's reviews, that seems to be THE thing here. I highly recommend checking this place out if you're in Andersonville. It definitely packs the full glory of an old world European bakery.

1.description: My hair salon is across the street, so once a month I treat myself here after my appointment. I am kinda obsessed with their cake balls. Cake balls became a "thing" on Yelp in 2007, so I am surprised that more bakeries do not carry them almost 10 years later. Swedish Bakery does a red velvet and a carrot cake version that are worth the splurge (calorie-wise, as they really aren't expensive). They have virtually every kind of bread, pastry, cookie and cake you could possibly want. And they are all delicious!

55.description: Yummy canolis and cookies. Red velvet cupcake ..not so yummy.

9.description: The cakes are amazing and so is the customer service. I always try to avoid rush hours because I don't want to wait in lines. Everybody talks about this "marzipan cake" and I decided to give it a go but it was so sweet. For now I will stay away from marzipan cake and enjoy other delicious bakeries.

26.description: Ridiculous, stupid delicious. I've had so many things there and it never disappoints. Tiny apple pies today, apple slices with gooey, flakey deliciousness. Cookies and cream truffles and frosted cookies mmmm!!!

25.description: Ever since I saw British contestants on a PBS cooking contest attempt a "princess torte" I knew I would have to go over to the Swedish Bakery to try theirs.  It did not disappoint.  It was beautiful... and it was delicious.  Rich, creamy... a perfect birthday splurge.  I should also compliment the young man who served me, Erick, who was friendly, personable... and very attractive, I might add.:-)

12.description: While Swedish Bakery is churning out some delicious baked goods, it's a little bit pricey compared to many other bakeries.  This is a bakery I would come back to for a small treat for myself or someone else, but probably not to cater an entire party.Everything we ate was so good!  I had to get the giant rainbow frosted cookie.  Even though it was just a sugar cookie, the cookie part and the frosting were so much better than I expected.  The Almond Tart was my favorite and would be perfect with a cup of tea.  The Rum Balls are also very good, dense little balls of chocolate which will totally satisfy in 2-3 bites.  Dominic P also picked out a cannoli, although I am not sure why a Swedish bakery makes cannoli...Our total for 2 Rum Balls,1 Rainbow Cookie, 1 Almond Tart, and 1 Cannoli was about $15.  Aside from the cookie, each treat was only a few bites and are not desserts meant to share.The service behind the counter was very attentive, and they didn't mind bouncing from counter to counter to help us.I would definitely come back here, but I would make sure to keep track of what I was spending.  During our visit, this could have easily spiraled out of control!

59.description: Swedish Bakery did our wedding cake. It was fantastic!  Lillian was very easy to work with and the cake was so amazingly delicious. Made the event more memorable!

21.description: They ripped me off. I ordered a treat off their menu, and they said it had to be special ordered (minimum of two days wait), and that even though I wanted only one or two, I had to order a minimum of four.  I accepted that. When I opened the box at home, I found that they'd gotten my order wrong. I called to have them replaced, but was told that they would not make them again until next year, and they would not fix the mistake, and no they would not give me my money back. In the end the manager said they would only give me half of my money back, but only in the form of store credit. (I will let you know if they actually follow through on that if I ever go back to this store) As if that weren't bad enough, the box of treats I was stuck with were two days old, and not as good as they should have been. (They weren't special order products either, they had been in the counter when I ordered them, days before.)$20 down the drain. Don't waste your money ordering from them.All that said, some of the products they sell are pretty good, if freshly made.

17.description: It might be sacrilegious, but one thing irks me about SB. We've made and paid for multiple advance orders. When returning to pick up your prepaid order, one must once again take a number and wait... and wait...  and continue to wait to have an employee simply hand you your order. It's the 21st century, people! When someone cares enough to think of the SB for their event/gathering and place an ADVANCE order, the SB should NOT make the same customer wait once again for their order. I'm voting with my feet and buying my pastries and desserts elsewhere until this policy changes.

10.description: "You get what you pay for" could never be more true than at Swedish Bakery. The staff (Hola, new girl Maria D.!), are so courteous and friendly, the selections are amazing, but if you're accustomed to the cheap, floury, greasy fried, sugar overkill of commercial doughnuts, you may be surprised and/or underwhelmed at the cake doughnuts. Also, if you want a twist on the old standard rye bread, you must try the Limpa Rye lLoaf. Sublime. WARNING!: NO DOUGHNUTS IN August!

5.description: It's nearly impossible to walk out without spending $25. They have the best of everything and I like trying their unique items. I always get a couple "frogs" for my mom, aka froggie. Their paczki's are amazing and they're actually too many flavors to decide... #oneofeach #paczkiday #fattuesday

3.description: This bakery is a staple in the Andersonville community. Came here to get some cookies before dinner. The smell walking through the doors is heavenly...and there were so many beautifully decorated treats to feast with the eyes. There weren't too many customers but it was night time so I think that is expected. We bought too many baked goods to take home including the picture attached. I am glad this place is far from my home or I would be morbidly obese.

35.description: The staff was very helpful and friendly in showing me around as a first timer. I got the cookies which were very good, as well as the small plain fudge cake

19.description: I recently stopped in to Swedish Bakery for the first time.  I bought a 1/4 box of mixed cookies and also ordered a Swedish Princess Cake for pick up a few days later.  The cookies were delightful, especially the two the lovely man behind the counter gave me to snack on while he filled up the box I ordered.  While the cookies were delicious, the most impressive thing about my experience was the service.  The gent behind the counter ( I think his name tag said Erik) was so pleasant, patient, knowledgeable, and helpful. It was such a nice experience! Then, on the day I was meant to pick up the cake, I spaced out, and someone called me to remind me, for which I was grateful. I'm sure I'll be enjoying many Swedish Bakery treats in the future.

28.description: Birthday cake was a complete disappointment. Special order of a marzipan cake with raspberry filling and chocolate cake. It was picked up March 21.The marzipan filling was dry and chewy, the cake was dry and was not chocolate, there was whip cream covering the outside of the cake, then it was covered in marzipan fondant. It was horrible. Not a tasty cake. It was difficult to cut as the marzipan fondant was dry and chewy. Tasted like hard paste with almond extract. Not authentic marzipan cake at all. We left a vm but have yet to hear back. The cake sits in the refrigerator as I am not dashing to eat it because the flavors and fillings are the worst! The pink flowers on the cake are hard and dry. This cake was not fresh at all.Unhappy!Owner wrote and only agreed to voucher $10.00 of items at the bakery, no refund- cake was over $25.00. TipAsk whats on a cake even if you special order it. There was whip cream under the chewy marzipan. I am allergic to whip cream. The cake basically was... Crap!It's prolly best just to order a cake that they are famous about. I am not sure what cake as I didn't order the cake. It was a surprise!A bad surprise. Since, no monetary refund was offered. I suggest asking what the polices before buying anything from this establishment. Also, ask for cake eating instructions, as that is what the owner stated. You have to eat certain cakes warm, even thou it has secret hidden whip cream.

45.description: *unleashes tsunami of drool* So yummy, excellent pastries! A bit too marzipan-y but I can put up with that. The cupcakes ROCK and the cake pops that are super large and uniquely decorated also ROCK! Recommend to the whole universe except my enemies :)

33.description: I recently stopped in to Swedish Bakery for the first time.  I bought a 1/4 box of mixed cookies and also ordered a Swedish Princess Cake for pick up a few days later.  The cookies were delightful, especially the two the lovely man behind the counter gave me to snack on while he filled up the box I ordered.  While the cookies were delicious, the most impressive thing about my experience was the service.  The gent behind the counter ( I think his name tag said Erik) was so pleasant, patient, knowledgeable, and helpful. It was such a nice experience! Then, on the day I was meant to pick up the cake, I spaced out, and someone called me to remind me, for which I was grateful. I'm sure I'll be enjoying many Swedish Bakery treats in the future.

43.description: What really stands out for me at Swedish Bakery are their freshly made breads and coffee cakes and danishes. Their limpa is my favorite, of course. They will slice and bag any bread for you, it's such a treat to take home.Their danish and coffee cakes are beautiful and a perfect gift, especially at the holidays. They have cardamom coffee cake people, with and without sanding sugar. They do have lots of sugar type cookies with sprinkles and great looking tarts and tortes with fruit and the like but a lot of their non-bread confections ALL have marzipan in them. COME ON. I actually do like marzipan, I do. But in intense moderation and while traveling abroad. I know this is Swedish, but .... I wanted to buy my landlord a nice box of freshly made chocolate truffles, not chocolate covered marzipan, god dangit. So really, I just want more confection variety in addition to the tons of marzipan. This place still rocks.

2.description: I waited an hour and 45 minutes for a prepaid pickup, would have been another hour if I hadn't found a discarded ticket from someone who gave up.  Line moved slowly, I calculated 1.7 minutes each number, and that includes people who baled.  There are way too few people working, and no "prepaid pickup" line.  I got waves out of the lot so had to keep pumping the meter.  Lots of unhappy people waiting for prepaid orders.  When I got to the front, I talked to the manager and asked why they didn't have an express line. "We tried that but it didn't work for us, people would jump into that line.". I asked "but why did you serve them".. She was curt: " you should be happy sometimes there's a 3 hour wait." Whatt?!  I don't care if it is an amazing coffee cake I won't be back. That is unacceptable.

18.description: Amazing bakery. Amazing service. Their cakes and Tortes are amazing - I highly recommend their hazelnut cake. It's outstanding. You guys do amazing work! Thanks for everything you do :) Also, get their cinnamon bread. It's the best for French toast in the city! I promise :)

41.description: I recently got my husbands birthday cake with a cricket bat and ball design from here, I got a prompt reply to my email enquiry. Lillian was extremely helpful in deciding my final cake ingredients and design. The cake itself was much appreciated by my husband and the guests!!! I will definitely look forward to more cakes from Swedish bakery!

52.description: My two dads just ordered their wedding cake from Swedish Bakery and I wanted everyone to know how wonderful they were to work with and how much help they provided through the whole process. As a puppy, I couldn't go in the store, but Dad said Karen was so helpful in making suggestions and also about listening to their wishes. With her assistance and guidance the wedding cake turned out to be absolutely beautiful (and delicious). I generally like steak, but Swedish Bakery has a carrot cake recipe that even a puppy can love. Sweet to taste, smooth texture and delicious icing. Can't go wrong with good icing. Thank you Swedish Bakery for helping make my dads' special day one they both and I will remember. Four paws up for you!

50.description: A few times a year, I go to swedish bakery for my marzipan fix- this is the best place to satisfy my craving. My favorite is the princess cake, but the marzipan cake slice and the swedish frog will suffice when I can't justify buying a whole cake. I've been to many occasions that have special ordered marzipan cakes from Swedish, and they are the best.   Most of my family are not marzipan lovers, so I have become very familiar with their buttercream and whipped cream cakes. You just cannot go wrong here, but I much prefer the regular (American?) buttercream to their European buttercream- it's such a great rendition of regular buttercream, it'll just spoil you from ever settling for less.  The white cake here is absolutely fantastic-- never dry like most are. I've had chocolate, lemon, and yellow- all great.   If you are a chocoholic, you've gotta try the ganache loaf-- two kinds- just chocolate or a raspberry ganache (which I prefer). They usually have it on the refrigerated shelves.   DO NOT WALK OUT OF THERE WITHOUT COOKIES!  They are all great; be sure to include some blondies!

4.description: Service has never fallen short of Amazing! My family have been customers of the Swedish Bakery for a really long time! I still remember being a kid and just going bananas for everything! Every family birthday party had a Swedish Bakery Cake to really top the night off. It wasn't official unless you had a Swedish Bakery Cake, seriously! Even the most special family occasions ended with a Swedish Bakery Cake! I'm not a big fan of dessert, seriously, when it comes to these desserts I'll never say no! Every bite reminds me of my childhood, the cakes tastes the same as it did when i was a kid! I recently turned 30 and you better believe I had a Swedish Bakery Cake, it was a surprise that had me in tears!! The quality they put into their baked goods is always on point, I have never once been disappointed by anything from this bakery! They consistently prove why they have been around for so long and you can't beat that! The service totally reflects the kind of care they put into their work, placing orders and picking up is always pleasant. The staff is always nice! One bite (of anything) and you will be hooked! You really get what you pay for and you'll definitely be back!! I definitely plan on continuing my families tradition with my friends and future family!

6.description: My experience with cakes there has been average, at best.  On two out of four or five tries over the years, the decorations have been sloppy.  When I questioned it one time, I literally got a shrug.  The requirement for payment-in-full when ordering really leaves the customer in a bind (a 50% deposit is fair, but more is a red flag for any business).  So, I now make the drive down to Bittersweet or Sweet Mandy B's for consistent, great quality.But the cookies and pastries in the cases are excellent, so it's always worth stopping in for some of those.

22.description: I've only tried a handful of the huge array of baked goods here, but my impression so far is that the Swedish pastries are the way to go: the last time I was here I had 2 Swedish almond tarts (a Marzariner tart and a Toska tart), and both were divine (although very expensive, nearly a dollar per bite), while my partner had a very lackluster (non-Swedish) donut.

15.description: Although I had a fantasy of a really charming swedish family running this business, the baked goods here and the service were amazing! Went here the other day for donuts and was absolutely delighted! The only thing that would make this place better would be if they served a great local coffee, like Metropolis. Huge fan of this place. Anytime I want to buy a cake or cookies or anything sweet, I'll stop in again.

57.description: Lillian was great to work with from the beginning when we went to do a cake tasting for our wedding. No pretense, no pressure, great cake and a nice presentation and way to peruse cake ideas (she had an iPad to glance through hundreds of cake ideas, having us click our interests along the way).We chose them, and we were so blown away! What we figured would be a fine choice for a small detail for the day turned out to be such a beautiful high point! We've used them for birthday cakes for years, and are so glad we continued with them for our wedding! Thanks!

20.description: I grew up going to this bakery. My friends worked here while we were in high school, back in the 90's. I hadn't been here in about 7 years and walking in again brought so many memories. It smells delicious, it was very busy, so many choices..... I bought a tart, a Napoleon, and some cookies. Those cookies are to die for!!!! Years ago I ordered my son his birthday cake from them and everyone raved on how great it was. I will always make a stop at the bakery whenever I'm in the area. Delicious treats at a very good price.

36.description: This bakery must not need to sell anything. I have attempted to go in to this location about 5 times over the past few months. Their hours are crazy!!! Its Saturday and they are closed today. They have bankers hours and are not in the business of selling to Customers. Obviously they don't need any money. Must be ancient rich owners.

14.description: Birthday cake was a complete disappointment. Special order of a marzipan cake with raspberry filling and chocolate cake. It was picked up March 21.The marzipan filling was dry and chewy, the cake was dry and was not chocolate, there was whip cream covering the outside of the cake, then it was covered in marzipan fondant. It was horrible. Not a tasty cake. It was difficult to cut as the marzipan fondant was dry and chewy. Tasted like hard paste with almond extract. Not authentic marzipan cake at all. We left a vm but have yet to hear back. The cake sits in the refrigerator as I am not dashing to eat it because the flavors and fillings are the worst! The pink flowers on the cake are hard and dry. This cake was not fresh at all.Unhappy!Owner wrote and only agreed to voucher $10.00 of items at the bakery, no refund- cake was over $25.00. TipAsk whats on a cake even if you special order it. There was whip cream under the chewy marzipan. I am allergic to whip cream. The cake basically was... Crap!It's prolly best just to order a cake that they are famous about. I am not sure what cake as I didn't order the cake. It was a surprise!A bad surprise. Since, no monetary refund was offered. I suggest asking what the polices before buying anything from this establishment. Also, ask for cake eating instructions, as that is what the owner stated. You have to eat certain cakes warm, even thou it has secret hidden whip cream.

28.description: How did I not know about this place!! We just had lunch delivered today and we barely spoke to each other. Lots of ummph and oh my gods ! Fresh , delicious and at such a good price!! Cannot wait to try the rest of the menu!

1.description: At times, I am late to the party, UNBELIEEEEVABLY late. My inattention to Piatto Pronto falls into the late to the party category. WHAT TOOK ME SO LONG?Good Grief!A friend and I were looking for some wondrous, flavorful, soup to be included in our delivery order. Not such an easy task. Except, Piatto Pronto has soups galore. This establishment offers 23 (TWENTY-THREE) different types of soups on the menu. I a listing a few here to spotlight the diversity: Lobster Bisque, Italian Wedding, Chicken Poblano Pepper, Vegetarian Lentil, Cream of Potato Soup with Bacon, Tomato Florentine, and White Chicken Chili Soup with Beans. At the time of our order these soups could be delivered in 16 or 32 oz. portions. We tried two and they were both fantastic! We also ordered a salad and dessert to round out the order. The salad had extremely fresh ingredients and also was served in a large portion.Our dessert was huge! Certainly enough for two. I was impressed. The salad was out of this world. The soups, marvelous. Piatto Pronto, where have you been all of my life?

39.description: It caught my eye as I biked past one day, then I checked reviews and confirmed that it was what it looked like, a legit Italian local sandwich place. They make everything fresh, so it takes some time. The sandwiches are huge, easily enough for two meals, and they are very reasonably priced, like the big sandwich places in Little Italy in New York. There are several interesting options, even for people who aren't that into deli meats. The meatball sub was very good. They do sandwiches, panini, and I think they had wraps, too. It also has a bunch of Italian cooking ingredients, imported and not, and they cram quite a bit into the small store. There's a little area outside where one can eat, when the weather allows.

9.description: One of my sandwiches had mold on the cheese! eek

29.description: Delicious sandwiches!  The Boss, Chicken Parm, and Amy's are my faves.  The bread, meats and cheeses are always fresh.  Great customer service too!

23.description: Delicious. Cheap. Friendly. Authentic.

5.description: Inviting sandwich place, friendly service, but I got food poisoning from this place. I may give it another try some day but for now I have to stay away.

31.description: LOVE LOVE LOVE this place! Everything I've had has been phenomenal and you can't beat the prices! Their enchilada soup is unbelievably good. You have to eat here more than once just because it's so hard to decide what to get! Their delivery is quick and always correct.

25.description: Coming here for the first time, I can see that this is a very different type of place to order food to go than what I am used to. I came in for a look and I was surprised to see the interior. Of course there was a line inside ordering what they want. As I wait for my order,  I can see that there are chips, drinks, and anything else you can buy that is indeed imported from Italy, since they were written in Italian, as well as there were people inside that were speaking to the guy taking the orders in Italian. But most importantly, once I got to eat my subs that I ordered, they were very delicious. They very much live up to the hype that is given to this ethnic deli. Somehow, just writing this review makes me craving to go back there, the food is very mouth-friendly. I definitely recommend this place to anyone who wants to try a new experience in restaurants.

12.description: Best sandwiches! What a great little sandwich shop.  I'll be telling all my friend about it.

37.description: Another reason to love this wonderful place? Fresh Turkeys!  We have had our Thanksgiving turkey from here for the past 6 years.  Mike gets them from Kaufmann Farms in Northern, IL and they are delicious.  Order now!

21.description: I love sandwiches and theirs is no exception. they're fresh and ingredients are very tasty.  I get one for my ravinia picnic every year.

16.description: Not sure why anyone would eat at subway, this place is great!  Sandwiches comes with tons of meat and are excellent.  Friendly staff also.

17.description: The sandwiches are fresh, great and can't wait to come back again.  Service great too!

10.description: Piatta Pronto is a gem, in the Andersonville community. The selection is fantastic, the price is right and the sandwiches are always tasty. But what sets them apart is their friendly service. I usually go up with my kids, and they always treat them special. I am glad Piatta Pronto calls my community its home!

11.description: Gave Piatto Pronto a second chance with a pickup order, and was satisfied this time on all counts: value, timing and quality were all above average. My friends who shared the sandwiches also gave them a thumbs up. Revised to 4 stars

26.description: The following is what the Piatto Pronto scene looks like.  You walk into an Italian grocery store and place your sandwich order at the front counter.  Carbonated drinks, teas, juice, coffee and beer are in the back refrigerator.  It took 5 minutes to get our order and grab seats outside on the benches in front, where other customers are munching on their food.  The sandwiches were so good that the 6" and 12" subs were gone within 15 minutes, split among two people.  All the ingredients tasted very fresh, and the highly recommended dolce di parma lived up to all the positive reviews. Very tasty prosciutto, and the combination of fresh mozzarella, sun dried tomatoes, pesto, etc. was a marriage made in heaven.  It is the discovery of places like these that really makes me love Yelp!

27.description: Wonderful, awesome, delicious! We had a team of 25 girls and placed our orders the night before. They were ready when we got there and all individually marked with the girls names. All of our orders were made to order perfectly. The girls loved all the food they ordered and were very pleased with the size of their subs/wraps/panini. Highly recommend!

35.description: Wanted something different for lunch today and an Italian sub sounded good, so after some yelping decided to head over for a meatball sub.I give the Meatball sub a solid B+.  Bread was very fresh and soft.  Marinara tasted of fresh tomatoes.  Actual meatballs were homemade and awesome.  Sandwich was quite large; could only finish about 3/4.  Sandwich topped with sliced mozzarella.Beware of F-BOMB Central, though.  I'm not sure if the owner has Tourette's or what, but every word out of his mouth was F-this and F-that and that F-in guy.  There were some regulars in the store ahead of me.  He obviously had camaraderie with them and felt he could speak his mind.  It didn't bother me, but I can see where other people might be offended.  Dude, tone it down a little.Will definitely be back to sample additional I-talian subs.

8.description: Great food and people. Can't want to got back. Prices are excellent and the chicken parm is by far the best in the city

0.description: We have ordered from their 2 times. Great service. First time we ordered the man said when he delivered "thank you so much for your business we truly appreciate it." So nice! Favorites we have tried Minestrone soup. So tasty full of flavor and veggies. Milano sandwich- yum!Tortellini tomato soup- tastes like a combination of tomato soups u might have had growing up. But so good. Wouldn't order again- lobster bisque and guacamole (probably not the best place to order this lol)

38.description: Great sandwiches. Nice cold deli combinations.

20.description: What a great little local Italian delicatessen. A wonderful selection of pasta is from Italy. There to  to go sandwiches are made fresh. Are a great way for lunch option. Mike is there to serve you. Please note closes early seven or 8 PM most days

19.description: Every lunch from here has been a great lunch. And you can browse and buy some chocolate while you wait for your sandwich.

33.description: I ordered through grubhub 2 large 32oz soups and 2 small 16oz soups. I received 3 small and one large, so I paid extra for one that I got in a small instead of a large. Also, there were no spoons in the bag. All of that soup and no spoons?? They soups were good though.

2.description: Horrible food. Too many better options in the area to waste my time or money here. Sandwiches were tasteless and the service was horrible. Staff has a bad attitude. I also got food poisoning from this place. Buyer beware.. avoid this crappy establishment  at all costs!

34.description: I ordered my food. The sandwich was excellent, it's the sandwich you crave when you go to a sub shop but it never is as amazing as you hoped it would be. Wonderful. I also ordered two soups, both soups were a little too salty. I was impressed with the delivery time and the food, I think Ill just skip the soup next time.

32.description: This place is the BOMB.  Oh my gosh.  First time eating there was today.  I ordered two sandwiches to-go: the Grainder and the Big Easy.  Both were PHENOMENAL! The chips they have are GMO free and gluten free and absolutely delicious!!!! I ordered 2 twelve inch sandwiches and a 5 oz bag of chips.  Total was like $18 for everything.  The sandwiches were incredible.  Flavorful, full of quality ingredients.  Everything tasted fresh and delicious.  Mmmmmm.I give everything I ate an A+ and the staff especially were friendly and pleasant.  I also love the selection of imported goods.  So many delicious drinks and snacks from Italia.  YUM!Definitely try this place if you are a sandwich lover. MMMMMMMM!

18.description: I have gone time and time again for the Dolce Di Parma and pickle chips. Best sandwich on the menu. I get their homemade pesto too which is great to have on hand.They have really good dips for my book club too. I have never had a bad experience food wise or with the staff. They are very nice. I will say though, one time, I was there and they were taking out the garbage in the back and I could smell it which was really unappetizing. I know they have to take it out but if I can smell it up front, probably means they need to take it out in a more timely manner.

13.description: Hands down the best delicatessen this side of the Ohio Valley.  The staff greats everyone the second you step foot inside. Ok full disclosure...No self respecting Joisey Gal would ever eat at Potbellys, et al. The quality and quantity of theirs "hoagies" are second to none. A 6" hoagie is enough for two people for $6, you can't get this style of goodness anywhere else. Fresh roasted meats, crisp vegetable toppings, incredible bread !  All prepared foods are homemade with a nice variety of meals and soups. Here's the best part for my fellow foodies....wait for it.....an array of imported Mediterranean products at domestic prices.

4.description: Whenever im in the area, i love getting sandwiches from Piatti Pronto. I usually get the Italian, but the roast beef is also delicious. At roughly $6.50 for a 12 inch plus sandwich, you cant go wrong.

24.description: Consistent high quality of ingredients and preparation. Friendly, helpful service. Wonderful selection of specialty foods. Taking home some of the wonderful cold cuts from the cooler is rivaled only by the best NY delis. Killer sandwiches!!

6.description: I work in the area and frequent this place for lunch and am never disappointed. My favorite sandwich is probably the Dolce di Parma, but I've had quite a number of their sandwiches and panini and they're all amazing. BIG sandwiches, too, no matter what size you order!The staff is super friendly and service is very quick. Definitely one of the best delis/sandwich shops around.

22.description: Best sandwiches ever!! We love the veggie and prosciutto sandwiches. So delicious, fresh ingredients. Mike, the owner, is so welcoming and the store has great specialty items.  Worth a visit, you will come back again and again.

15.description: This place is the BOMB.  Oh my gosh.  First time eating there was today.  I ordered two sandwiches to-go: the Grainder and the Big Easy.  Both were PHENOMENAL! The chips they have are GMO free and gluten free and absolutely delicious!!!! I ordered 2 twelve inch sandwiches and a 5 oz bag of chips.  Total was like $18 for everything.  The sandwiches were incredible.  Flavorful, full of quality ingredients.  Everything tasted fresh and delicious.  Mmmmmm.I give everything I ate an A+ and the staff especially were friendly and pleasant.  I also love the selection of imported goods.  So many delicious drinks and snacks from Italia.  YUM!Definitely try this place if you are a sandwich lover. MMMMMMMM!

7.description: Good bread, but there's no meat in these sandwiches. Service was slow and distracted. Too many better options in the neighborhood to waste any money here.

36.description: I ordered some soups, a sandwich and some drinks. It took over 2hrs. Tried calling them, But couldn't understand them and they were very rude and standoffish. Bad customer service, unfortunately never ordering from here again.

30.description: This place is OUTSTANDING!!! I can't say enough. It is the best food I have had delivered in Rogers Park hands down. Everything was good. If you are in RP or Andersonville you must grab some.

3.description: Great food, and great service. My wife and I visit this deli at least 3 times a month, on the way home from work.   Highly recommended. I am aware if the recent publicity..and have come to the following conclusion.I don,t care. :)  Mike can wear what ever he wants to.   If you don't like it..do not go.. Simple really.See you soon Mike !

14.description: Excellent sandwiches, Italian cheeses, olives, and more. A gem in Andersonville.

58.description: Wonderful food! This restaurant has a great atmosphere and service is very helpful. For Mexican in Chicago, this is the place to go.

56.description: Wow, what a great place!  And the fact that I'm saying that after eating there on New Year's Eve makes it even more true.  I admit that, historically, we have been disappointed with NYE dinners.  The restaurants are packed, they're serving an insanely priced prix fixe menu, the staff seems stressed out, and it usually doesn't end up being that great.  You know the drill.  This is probably why we avoided making plans this year and were searching Yelp for places at 4:30pm on New Year's Eve.I was in the mood for some delicious comfort food that wasn't too far, as the freezing temps were more than I wanted to brave for too long.  I suggested Mexican and Mas Alla Del Sol came up as being close by and having amazing looking food...and also a bar.  It looked like a great combination of casual and upscale.  Perfect!  I called them up and was happy to be able to get a reservation.  I was also happy that they were able to accommodate us when I called to move it back an hour.  The person who answered the phone was really friendly and helpful.The atmosphere is warm and cozy and I was happy that it was not completely insane for this holiday.  It was busy, but they were even taking walk ins.  In fact, after dining, it looked like a lot of the people there were regulars.  Many people seemed to be on a first name basis with the staff members.  That says a lot.  All of the servers were relaxed, friendly, and helpful despite the full restaurant.  We started with a blood orange margarita, a Romero cocktail, and the ceviche to share.  Round two of drinks consisted of the Margarita con Humo and the Mango Piquin Margarita.  I like that the drink menu consists of not just margaritas, but a variety of other cocktails as well.  The restaurant was serving their regular menu with a few specials, which was awesome.  For the main courses, we went with the tampiquena and camarones con verdolagas.  The dishes were all presented beautifully and everything was so delicious.  I ate probably way more than I should have but I have no regrets.  Now that we have found this place, I think we'll be going out for Mexican more often.  We couldn't have been more happy with our choice for dinner, it was the perfect place for us on this night and a great way to end 2014.

29.description: My wife and I just recently tried this place because we used to live by the sister restaurant Los Nopales in Lincoln Square. Los Nopales is no longer open, but this is a great alternative. A little bit more upscale in terms of atmosphere and menu, but delicious food and great service. I'm certainly going back to try more dishes.

42.description: We came here for Cinco de Mayo with reservations. It was quite busy so we had to wait for while to get seated anyway. We were then seated but away from the lively, colorful atmosphere downstairs to a drab ordinary area upstairs. It felt little like we were the bad children being put away cuz we can hear the lively music and sounds from the main floor but can't be apart of it. The restaurant was nice enough to send up the 9 person mariachi band to entertain the 3 tables upstairs (only 9 customers). This was actually pretty good band...I'm no expert though. I don't remember seeing this at Los Nopales.As we were seated upstairs and it was a busy night, it took a while to get our drinks and to order food. it took some time to get our food too. Service was quite hospitable and apologetic throughout dinner. A lot of us got the mango margarita - quite tasty.The food was pretty darn great (this is coming from someone who doesn't prefer Mexican usually unless it's authentic). I was a little torn about the menu and prices since I rarely want to pay a lot for Mexican food....I am one of those people that like tamales and tortas from the local places in Pilsen.  Anyways, i had the camarones chipotle (shrimp with chipotle sauce and rice) and it was soooooo tasty! I got to also try the costillas (baby back ribs smothered in some fusion bbq sauce) which was just fall of the bone tender. We were thinking to order dessert (I remember liking the guava cheesecake as their sister restaurant) but we opted against it as we felt that it may have taken a while to us upstairs :( In the end, the food was good and the service was hospitable. I am looking forward to coming back to try again someday.

23.description: First time there. Excellent carne asada, quality meat, very nice charcoal grill flavor, done perfectly(medium well). Everything tasted above  average.Service was very good, with the exception of it being a tad slow when it came to ordering the main course, it did improve afterwards.The salsa.....tasty but I prefer more flavor & heat. Margarita was very good, w/out being overly boozy or acidic from a cheap mix.Look forward to going back, curious on how they do a mole sauce.FWIW; 4 Stars from me is pretty damn good. I save 5 star ratings for fantastic & exceptional. Plus... I've had too many experiences of Yelpers 4 & 5 Star ratings in which I thought the food was average at best, or plain ol' bad.

47.description: Love this place! Great food, tequila selection, & tasty margaritas. Not to mention a beautiful interior. Does not look like much from the outside, but when you walk in, it's lovely! Within walking distance from my house, so we come here a lot! You will not be disappointed by anything here-- everything I've ordered here has been great.

8.description: This place reps Mexican food sooooooo well. Legit, so damn good!I ordered a Mexican Coke to wake me up. Sugar cane and caffeine, always hooks up the necessary jolt.I had the chilaquiles Yucatecos. Yucatan, represent! Habanero and roasted tomato salsa blessed my chilaquiles in the most extraordinary way. I ordered egg whites and black beans to finish off this epic dish. Whew, just the right amount of spice factor, creamy black beans made out with my palate, and avocado loved on my taste buds. I'm a fan. They do it up, do it right, get it done in the bestest of ways.

31.description: Gonna be a bit nitpicky here but I only do that with places I really want to like. One full star off for the salsa - they mix it with brown beans. I thought maybe they were trying to be different, but then my gf pointed out that beans are cheap and it probably stretches out the salsa. Maybe, but regardless, it doesn't work taste-wise. I'm of latin descent, we know these things, but hey, you be the judge. Of course, the salsa in a Mexican restaurant is arguably the first impression, so it's not something you want to mess with. Secondly, the prices are $2-5 bucks too high. $14 for enchiladas? They were good, but they weren't THAT good. I also ordered a michelada which did the trick but wasn't anything special (Taco Joint is my benchmark). The service however, was impeccable, and that's what brings one star back to the table, otherwise this would be a three star review. Would I go back? Maybe.

34.description: If you loved Los Nopales on Western (now closed), you will love this place! It's owned by the same family and the food is outstanding. We ordered guacamole, queso panela, pollo mole, and one of the skirt steak entrees. I have enough leftovers for 2 days! And the service is outstanding--it's so refreshing. The drinks (paloma and mojito) were outstanding too! Go here!

16.description: Wow, what a great place!  And the fact that I'm saying that after eating there on New Year's Eve makes it even more true.  I admit that, historically, we have been disappointed with NYE dinners.  The restaurants are packed, they're serving an insanely priced prix fixe menu, the staff seems stressed out, and it usually doesn't end up being that great.  You know the drill.  This is probably why we avoided making plans this year and were searching Yelp for places at 4:30pm on New Year's Eve.I was in the mood for some delicious comfort food that wasn't too far, as the freezing temps were more than I wanted to brave for too long.  I suggested Mexican and Mas Alla Del Sol came up as being close by and having amazing looking food...and also a bar.  It looked like a great combination of casual and upscale.  Perfect!  I called them up and was happy to be able to get a reservation.  I was also happy that they were able to accommodate us when I called to move it back an hour.  The person who answered the phone was really friendly and helpful.The atmosphere is warm and cozy and I was happy that it was not completely insane for this holiday.  It was busy, but they were even taking walk ins.  In fact, after dining, it looked like a lot of the people there were regulars.  Many people seemed to be on a first name basis with the staff members.  That says a lot.  All of the servers were relaxed, friendly, and helpful despite the full restaurant.  We started with a blood orange margarita, a Romero cocktail, and the ceviche to share.  Round two of drinks consisted of the Margarita con Humo and the Mango Piquin Margarita.  I like that the drink menu consists of not just margaritas, but a variety of other cocktails as well.  The restaurant was serving their regular menu with a few specials, which was awesome.  For the main courses, we went with the tampiquena and camarones con verdolagas.  The dishes were all presented beautifully and everything was so delicious.  I ate probably way more than I should have but I have no regrets.  Now that we have found this place, I think we'll be going out for Mexican more often.  We couldn't have been more happy with our choice for dinner, it was the perfect place for us on this night and a great way to end 2014.

13.description: Good service, good margaritas, nice true Mexican dishes well made from quality ingredients and some of the best enchiladas in Salsa Verde I've ever had.    On a side note, their rice and refried beans are not just for plate decoration like I've had at other places, but simply AMAZING!  :)Great neighborhood spot!

11.description: My favorite is the chicken enchiladas with verde sauce. They are topped with browned cheese and it's delicious. As an added bonus, the bartenders are really friendly and make a great margarita.

39.description: Just had an amazing brunch here! The chilaquiles were legit: the salsa verde was on point, nice and tangy.  I made it epic with a side of their chorizo and mixed it, it was hot, yo! Really friendly service, great experience overall.

37.description: This place reps Mexican food sooooooo well. Legit, so damn good!I ordered a Mexican Coke to wake me up. Sugar cane and caffeine, always hooks up the necessary jolt.I had the chilaquiles Yucatecos. Yucatan, represent! Habanero and roasted tomato salsa blessed my chilaquiles in the most extraordinary way. I ordered egg whites and black beans to finish off this epic dish. Whew, just the right amount of spice factor, creamy black beans made out with my palate, and avocado loved on my taste buds. I'm a fan. They do it up, do it right, get it done in the bestest of ways.

0.description: I walked in about 6 minutes before closing to order a burrito to go, I was worried about showing up so late, but one of the owners welcomed me with a friendly "¡Hola!" And we sat and talked while my food was prepared. I even met her baby granddaughter! It's so nice to have a family owned business where the family is friendly and takes pride in what they do! As far as the food is concerned, I was definitely impressed. The burrito was so huge and I'm always delighted when sour cream comes with it and isn't extra. The rice was delicious although the beans were pretty standard. The steak in the burrito was very well seasoned. I think the price is just a bit high but I'll definitely be back!

38.description: I don't even like Mexican restaurants!Saw the table next to us get some amazing looking shrimp dish so I ordered one of the 4 shrimp options and guessed wrong. But it was amazing...maybe I guessed right!I'll be back.

51.description: This is probably one of my not-so-great experiences at a restaurant.  After our meet & greet with the waiter, my friend & I ordered margaritas to start with.  I had the frozen mango margarita and he had the pomegranate margarita.  We didn't know what to start with so the waiter left to give us a few minutes and said "if you don't want appetizers, save room for desserts!"Our drinks arrived about 5 minutes later and were pretty disappointing.  Our frozen margaritas were more like watered down margaritas with crushed ice.  They were strong but lacking flavor.Our waiter didn't show up til probably 10 minutes or more after leaving our table.  I can understand if the restaurant was swamped but it really wasn't.  After he finally showed up we decided not to do appetizers anymore and he insisted we will probably have dessert then.I decided to order the carne asada for dinner & my friend order the Tampiquena (medium rare).  He wanted the scallops but was in the mood for steak.. so as a good friend.. I ordered the scallops.The food came out in a timely manner which was great because I was starving. As I eyed my scallops and stabbed my fork into them, it like as if I had just stuck my fork through jello.  I like cutting into my protein and feeling like I just sliced through thick butter but in this case... I didn't.  I sliced into another scallop and...again. Same result.   Yes,  they were very much undercooked/raw.   My friend's steak was seasoned well but cooked more medium to well then he asked for.I waved to the waiter to let him know about the scallops and he apologized and left.  When he came back.  The scallops shrunk down twice their size and were the same scallops that were served originally (they served the same scallops I cut into).I was very disappointed.  Getting served the same scallops (double seared).  Bad drinks. Not even some kind of free dessert or apology from the chef for the scallops.Now here is the funny thing.  The waiter asked us after removing our plates if we wanted dessert and my dinner companion asked to see the dessert menu.  Guess what the waiter brought back.  The check.I will never eat here again.  You can go to better places, pay less, and get better service.

27.description: Went here for brunch today and can say that it lived up to the 4.5 stars on yelp. Walked in at 12:30 and got seated with no wait.  Service was fantastic with staff very attentive. I had café de olla and the Omelette Ranchero off the brunch menu. I truly enjoyed the omelette packed with tons of flavor and a palette pleasing dose of goat cheese. The guajillo potatoes were okay, but then again they are an accompaniment and not the star of the show.   Would recommend for brunch.

32.description: very good steak fajitas, good waitstaff and friendly owner

54.description: Excellent service and the food was terrific.  Loved the guacamole; get it fully loaded and you'll have a fiesta in your mouth with every bite.  I ordered the Camarones  al  Chipotle which had very good depth of flavor.  Margaritas were very good as well - get the blood orange margarita when they're in season.The chef came out to greet us after our meal which is always a nice touch.  He was very friendly and appreciative of our business.  I've seen some reviews here about slow/bad service, but that was not my experience at all.  I guess some nights are just not as good as others.  I will definitely return as this has become one of my favorite Mexican restaurants in Edgewater.

48.description: This place is almost awesome. The service was fantastic, drinks (blood orange margaritas, yum!) were really great. Had to knock off a star for not being able to customize very much -- it's not that we're super picky (the enchiladas were great and the mole sauce is amaaazing), but when you can't make an order of guacamole without onions, that's kind of a bummer. I understand not wanting guests to change everything on the menu- that's super annoying. I also get making something like guacamole in larger quantities so it's quick and easy to serve, but taking an ingredient out is a pretty simple request. They weren't very busy when we were there either, so given the level of service, I was surprised they couldn't accommodate us. The prices are also a little high, but that's to be expected for the quality of everything else -- the rest of our meal was really great.

44.description: I love this place! The red snapper with garlic is honestly amazing!! Also the service is great, they know how to make good drinks and answer questions. Also the host is the cutest kid, obviously a family member, but so adorable! Make sure to get the drink in the clay mug!!

24.description: This was delicious! I always walk by here but somehow never noticed this place before.Service was great, and both the enchiladas and the mango margarita were awesome.

7.description: Yummmm. This just became our new go to Mexican spot in the neighborhood. Service was great! Drinks were strong and flavorful! We both ordered the chicken enchiladas. Hands down the best I've had in years. They were cheesy and gooey and the chicken was cooked to perfection. At the end of our visit the mariachi band came down from the upstairs area to play a few songs. It was a perfect way to end the evening.

49.description: This place blows me away every time.  Thing one--the drinks.  The Romano is delicious--weird (with a big jalapeno slice bobbing around in there!), but so so delicious, with a salt, lemon, and chile rim.  We also sometimes get a blood orange margarita which is also very good.  Thing two--the food.  This is the best Mexican food I've had in Chicago--innovative, flavorful, attractive.  Get something with the verdolagas!  They are outstanding!  My decision-making matrix here is pretty much based on how I can get more of the verdolagas.  Also notable are the mole enchiladas and all of the shrimp dishes.  Thing three--the service.  The waitstaff is lovely, and are down to chat with you about the menu, discuss the finer details of the drinks, if you want more info.  In short, this is one of my favorite restaurants in Chicago.  Yummmm.

40.description: Stopped by for a late lunch last weekend with my fiance. It was a Saturday afternoon, so it wasn't super busy. The dishes are fantastic - the mole is spot-on, and you get good bang for your buck. This is not simply a burrito and taco place - you get actual entrees, and they are delicious. Be prepared for most dishes to be from $10 and up, but it's well worth it. The only ding I would give it is that there were only two other tables besides us, yet service was a bit slow for the drinks. Other than that, not bad at all.

53.description: I live in the Edgewater neighborhood and a good sit down gourmet-ish Mexican restaurant is hard to find.  This place is within walking distance from the Thorndale red line stop and located just a few steps away on Broadway.  So, the location is good!  The staff here is attentive, friendly, and knowledgeable about the food.  Sebastian has waited on us several times and is always fun and wonderful.  My fiance and I have been to this place numerous times and every time we have had delicious food and great service.  If you like tequilas, there are several different types to try as well.  Anytime we have family or friends visiting, we take them here.  They love it...we love it!  My fiance only orders one thing on the menu for every visit....the carne mas alla del sol.  He dreams of it, it is so good.  It sold him on the first visit.  He has everyone try it also.  I am a vegetarian, and there are multiple choices for me as well.  They have this delicious fried cheese that you have to try and the veggies and beans are flavorful.  The salsa here is like none I have ever had.  It is spicy smooth salsa, but has a hearty creaminess flavor to it as well.  It is different than traditional salsas at other restaurants that are more chunky. This place is a hidden gem in the Edgewater neighborhood.  It has a cozy hominess feel once you get inside.  I am a local loyal customer and will keep going back.  I don't usually write reviews, but we love this place so much that we want this place to stick around forever!

30.description: Great food, super service.  Best Mexican food in the area!!

46.description: I went to this restaurant last night and was absolutely pleased.  I love their sister restaurant, Los Nopales, on Western so I thought I'd try this one too.  The waiters were very nice and offered me the daily margarita, which was delicious!  Then we ordered the cactus salad (I've never had cactus before but now I'm sold), guacamole, the scallops and for dessert the Mexican hot chocolate. From start to finish, the food was fresh and delicious.   They also don't do silly things like fill your plate with rice, rice and more rice, which is cheap and deludes consumers into thinking a restaurant is so generous with huge portions.  The portions were a good size, the fish and veggies were plentiful, I was totally full but not insulted with cheap carbs.  The place is very clean and clearly brand new.  It's also quite large and good for big groups.  Now, my two favorite Mexican restaurants are now this one and Los Nopales.  The prices were also quite reasonable.  I highly recommend them both.

1.description: My family came in for my mother's birthday. This was our first time so we were hoping it was going to play out well-AND.. it did. First the drinks were quite delicious they have cocktails or for non-alcoholic drinkers like my nephews-agua de horchata along with your typical variety of bar drinks. We ordered appetizers- pico de gallo-delicious! and guacamole - yummy (not too salty but just right). We ordered wine great selection we bought the malbec (Argentina). As for food I ordered the mar y tierra special- there were only 2 left and our server was prompt to notify us! DELICIOUS! My siblings ordered the tampiquena -per them it was cooked perfectly. My father ordered the salmon - no complaints there as well as my mother. Desserts were delicious! We ordered a mix of desserts- tequila cake, flan, chocolate cake, cappuccino, cappuccino with baileys, hot chocolate. As I am typing this review I am getting hungry again! GREAT SERVICE!!! On Sunday they had a man playing the guitar and singing any Spanish classic requests =)We will be returning!

55.description: This place is delicious! I never feel like there are many options in this area but decided to try this out after my girlfriend found them on Yelp. I was a bit hesitant after living in Pilsen for 4 years but I'm so happy I came. The place is super nice, the staff was so welcoming, and the food was everything I wished it would be. Great authentic Mexican food and their margaritas were so good.

9.description: Absolutely delicious. Margaritas are killer. We had the stuffed zucchini app, salmon, and veggie enchiladas. I had no idea Mexican fare could taste this good.  We are sold. Regulars for life.

26.description: What a hidden gem!  Authentic Mexican food, fresh margaritas (not the frozen, premixed kind).  The steak was quality and perfectly cooked. Ceviche was more of a cocktail style vs. lime/citrus style, but we were pleasantly surprised.  Go here is you want great food & service.

25.description: The best thing about this delightful restaurant is the service. Our waitress and bus boy were attentive, friendly, and helpful throughout the entire meal.While the salsa wasn't my favorite, we enjoyed the guacamole. We'd ordered the guava margaritas, but were accidentally served the house margaritas instead. The waitress apologized profusely and offered to replace them, but we were already enjoying what we had. Gives a reason to return to try the guava that sounded delicious. My friend ordered the Camarones Al Chipotle along with fried ice cream for dessert and enjoyed both very much. I had the enchiladas verdes, and my only complaint is that I could not order two cheese and one steak - they all had to be the same. I am not at all clear on why, but based on the recommendation of the waitress, I got the steak. The food was delivered hot and all was delicious. The bus boy was very kind and wrapped up what I could not finish of my entree. He even packed up our leftover chips & guacamole and threw in some salsa. Again, very friendly and capable staff. I will definitely be back!

12.description: I absolutely LOVE this place! The food is always delicious and well-priced, and the staff are very friendly. The cheese enchiladas with salsa verde are my favorite. I really also enjoy the guacamole, horchata, and veggie platter. Can't go wrong here! They are also good at accommodating large groups.

59.description: One of the best Mexican brunch place. I've ordered Enchiladas Verses. It's very good and this made this place one of the best in my opinion. The steak is perfectly cooked. The enchiladas are just about right. The salsa verde is also very good.I also asked them for chips because they don't normally serve chips for brunch. And I found out that their salsa is very different from other salsa I've tried, in a very good way. I asked the waitress and she said it's because they are roasted.I also ordered sopa de tortilla. It's good, but nothing special about it. It's on the pricier side than regular places in Pilsen.

21.description: Good service, good margaritas, nice true Mexican dishes well made from quality ingredients and some of the best enchiladas in Salsa Verde I've ever had.    On a side note, their rice and refried beans are not just for plate decoration like I've had at other places, but simply AMAZING!  :)Great neighborhood spot!

17.description: I will return as often as I can. The steak Tacos del ... the steak enchiladas in mole sauce ... the cheese and chorizo appetizer ... such flavors! The mole sauce was fantastic. And the flan for dessert, better than ice cream and I LOVE ice cream.

10.description: Wow. Just devoured the tastiest chilaquiles verde I've ever put in my mouth. Such a beautiful, rich salsa verde. Also great: the Bloody Mary. And the coconut flan. What a gem of a place. Service can be a little slow, but the goods are worth waiting for.

5.description: By far the best Mexican food I have ever eaten!! Highly highly recommend it. Everything is delicious

3.description: Excellent restaurant! Ate here for the first time tonight. I had the pork tenderloin and a pomegranate sour. My dining partner had the carne asada specialty. The meals were beautifully prepared and full of flavor. Very generous portions at an extremely reasonable price. It was very busy tonight but got our meal in a very timely manner. I highly recommend this restaurant. I will definitely be back!

35.description: Really good restaurant - the quality and authentic taste of the food, the ambiance, and the customer service were all very good. Prices are reasonable. The biggest problem is finding parking in the area! It took us about 15 minutes to find a space and then we had at least a five minute walk. Definitely worth a visit.

19.description: Went here for brunch today and can say that it lived up to the 4.5 stars on yelp. Walked in at 12:30 and got seated with no wait.  Service was fantastic with staff very attentive. I had café de olla and the Omelette Ranchero off the brunch menu. I truly enjoyed the omelette packed with tons of flavor and a palette pleasing dose of goat cheese. The guajillo potatoes were okay, but then again they are an accompaniment and not the star of the show.   Would recommend for brunch.

28.description: finally found a decent mexican restaurant not jus in chicago but right down the road! great food, variety of specials, and guava margarita is a must - could've used an xtra shot though. overall, worth the walk over. a bit pricey but hard to find decent mexican.

45.description: wow, and wow.  This place was amazing.  Was just using Yelp to find a restaurant to eat at near our subway line. And this place popped up with 4.5 stars.  And it was wonderful.  I had a wonderful regular margarita and then a blood orange margarita.  Then on top of that, the meals that we got -- scallops for my friend and tilapia for me. It was amazing.

33.description: Simply the best Mexican restaurant in the far north side of Chicago. If you want something different like the awesome ribs or stay with the traditional chicken enchiladas, this is the place for you. We come here often and the food and attention is always great. I just hope, one day, they include their seafood enchiladas especial as part of the standard menu because they are delicious.

43.description: Fantastic!  We have been to many many Mexican restaurants in Chicago and the surrounding area, and this is one of the best.  Top marks for both the essentials: 1) the food and 2) the service.  Menu goes well beyond the typical Mexican stand-by dishes - we tried queso de panela appetizer and had to order a second one for our table of four.  I had verdolagas salad for my main which was outstanding!  Never seen either one on a menu before.  Others at our table had enchiladas, tortilla soup, guacamole, and one of the beef dishes and everyone was impressed with the quality of food and preparation.  Darcy, our server, was prompt, efficient, friendly and knowledgeable.  Ambience was comfortable and welcoming.  The family has another restaurant, Nopales in Lincoln Square, which we will also try.  Thanks for a great evening!

2.description: This place is delicious! We recently moved into the neighborhood so it is a short walk away which is a plus. The food is great...I had enchiladas, my son had steak tacos, and his grandpa had a steak burrito. We all enjoyed our dishes with no complaints. They have a good looking drink menu that I'll have to take advantage of at some point.One of my favorite things about this place is the decor. I grew up in Pilsen and have been to many authentic Mexican restaurants ans far as food and decoration and this place fits in that category. All around good experience...give it a try! P.S There is also outdoor seating in the warmer weather.

18.description: One of the best Mexican brunch place. I've ordered Enchiladas Verses. It's very good and this made this place one of the best in my opinion. The steak is perfectly cooked. The enchiladas are just about right. The salsa verde is also very good.I also asked them for chips because they don't normally serve chips for brunch. And I found out that their salsa is very different from other salsa I've tried, in a very good way. I asked the waitress and she said it's because they are roasted.I also ordered sopa de tortilla. It's good, but nothing special about it. It's on the pricier side than regular places in Pilsen.

41.description: I've struggled with how to write this review for a few days. We came in as a group of five on cinco de mayo. My friend had made a reservation, so I figured we'd have no trouble. We get to the restaurant and there is a line out the door of people who have no idea what's going on. My friend tried to get in to the host stand to let them know we had arrived. From outside it looked like they were really busy. After several minutes she called us and said that no one had even acknowledged any of the people waiting at the front. She had to call the restaurant to ask someone to come to the front. Finally someone took our name down on a list and said it would be awhile before we could be seated. This seemed to be the case with several people who had made reservations. There didn't seem to be any system to it. The fact that reservations had been made didn't seem to matter. We eventually were seated but it wasn't in the main dining room. We were taken up a flight of stairs to an area where it looked like they had just thrown together a few tables because they were so busy. It was cold and dark up there. It took a long time to get drinks and to order dinner. It took close to an hour to get our food after ordering. We asked for more drinks when our food arrived, but we didn't receive them until we had finished eating. They were busy and didn't have the staff to handle the number of people dining that evening. I felt like we were forgotten about upstairs. The other two tables sent up with us did not look too happy with the situation either. Our waitress kept apologizing for everything, but by the time she asked if we wanted dessert, we all decided to pass because we didn't want to wait any longer. The food was tasty but it's not worth the prices they charge. I can get food that tastes just as good if not better for cheaper and closer to home.

52.description: Over priced. They don't let you get different types of enchiladas in your order - a policy that makes no sense. If you want guacamole you have to buy a $3.00 side, which is obnoxiously large for one person. Will not return.

50.description: Went here last weekend with our neighbors and we were all so happy to have a great place, with a nice bar, so close. The food was outstanding and great service. We ordered steak, lamb and fish and everyone was so pleased. All authentic and so tasty. The decor is perfect and it's much bigger than it looks. We can't wait to enjoy the sidewalk dining this summer. This is hands down my new fav place in Edgewater.

4.description: We came here for Cinco de Mayo with reservations. It was quite busy so we had to wait for while to get seated anyway. We were then seated but away from the lively, colorful atmosphere downstairs to a drab ordinary area upstairs. It felt little like we were the bad children being put away cuz we can hear the lively music and sounds from the main floor but can't be apart of it. The restaurant was nice enough to send up the 9 person mariachi band to entertain the 3 tables upstairs (only 9 customers). This was actually pretty good band...I'm no expert though. I don't remember seeing this at Los Nopales.As we were seated upstairs and it was a busy night, it took a while to get our drinks and to order food. it took some time to get our food too. Service was quite hospitable and apologetic throughout dinner. A lot of us got the mango margarita - quite tasty.The food was pretty darn great (this is coming from someone who doesn't prefer Mexican usually unless it's authentic). I was a little torn about the menu and prices since I rarely want to pay a lot for Mexican food....I am one of those people that like tamales and tortas from the local places in Pilsen.  Anyways, i had the camarones chipotle (shrimp with chipotle sauce and rice) and it was soooooo tasty! I got to also try the costillas (baby back ribs smothered in some fusion bbq sauce) which was just fall of the bone tender. We were thinking to order dessert (I remember liking the guava cheesecake as their sister restaurant) but we opted against it as we felt that it may have taken a while to us upstairs :( In the end, the food was good and the service was hospitable. I am looking forward to coming back to try again someday.

6.description: Really good restaurant - the quality and authentic taste of the food, the ambiance, and the customer service were all very good. Prices are reasonable. The biggest problem is finding parking in the area! It took us about 15 minutes to find a space and then we had at least a five minute walk. Definitely worth a visit.

22.description: I have been looking at the food online and it looked soooo good so a few friends and I went on a saturday night. One dish was a little bit too salty but still Excellent food and attentive service.  I will be back very soon and will check out the brunch for sure.
