For a quick meal get the chicken or beef fajita already made with vegetables, add guacamole and sour cream and pita bread -heat the fajita-add ingredients - instant dinner! Frankly I find the shopping experience better than at Mariano's - and certainly better than Whole Foods. Give it a try and imagine you took a trip overseas! The only time I am upset there is when I pass the Russian Vodka and realize my cancer episode has put it on the no no list :-(  -gives me new meaning to the song "Those were the days my friends!-   :-) Enjoy!

3.description: Chicago seems to have much Competition for food/groceryshopping.And, honestly, if you are like me you are looking for really goodquality at reasonable prices.Today I found a pretty great place by the name of Devon Market.Outside there were many pretty flowers on display for sale andmyself and 2 other women were kind of ooohing and ahhhing overthe pretty flowers..Hey, I'm a girl..I like flowers!So, I entered this Market/Store place and I high tailed it over to theproduce section to see if my favorite bing cherries were in stock,And, boy, was I happy when I found them however, I would so like to find the person/people who always has to put 2 pounds of cherriesin each bag!And even at $3.99 per pound my cherries would have equaled almost $8.00 so, no cherries for me today!Now that I'm home and thinking about it I should have takenlike a pound of those cherries out and put them in another bagbut there was a store employee watching over the produce likea hawk....And,okay, this store has a pretty big craft beer section but Ihad no use for that since I'm strictly a Miller Lite Girl!Okay, stop hating...And, Devon Market has a really great looking Meat Departmentand a nice Deli area with decent prices too!I noticed lots of ethnic foods as well.And, they even have a juice bar at the back of the store where ifyou check in on Yelp you can get a fresh squeezed 16 oz. juicefor $2.99!I, myself, did not get this Yelp Deal today because it honestlydidn't seem like such a deal.And, for the record, I always include signage shots with my reviews,however, today as I was attempting to do this that mean old Mr Sunkept shining in my eyes and I couldn't get a clear shot.Sometimes Mr. Sun really sucks!So, in closing Devon Market is a pretty great place to shop,And, their prices for the most part seemed more than fair!A store that's almost a block long with nice associates and a prettygreat selection of food..I like Devon Market, give them a chance, you may like them too..

35.description: The fresh meat prices have doubled in the past two months!  Veal breast used to be $1.59\pound, now it's $2.99\pound.  What a disappointment.  This was my go-to store for the past 12 years.

19.description: Fantastic selection of fresh fruit and vegetables at the best prices. Went there yesterday for ingredients for pasta dish and got couple different kinds of mushrooms, salad fixings and smoked bacon from deli. Also great place for fresh bread and usually warm. Great value at great prices.

28.description: good deals, sometimes gets too crowded. better than the big box stores.

45.description: I have been shopping here for over 5 years, and have mostly had positive experiences.  The guys in the meat and produce departments are great and you can't beat the prices in those departments.  However today I left there with not so great feelings.  First off, there was a guy stocking shelves who left his step ladder in the middle of the aisles at least twice as I went through the store. Then when I checked out I was overcharged on 3 items.  The customer service person adjusted 2,items but refused to do the other because the sign on shelf was not in front of the item, although the sign clearly stated that all the flavors were on sale.  Took refund on that.   Don't argue with me.  That's the best way to lose a customer.

33.description: Employees and manager of this store demonstrated very low customer service skills and 'who cares' behavior. We called and asked if we can stop by and bring caught by us fish to be cut and cleaned. We were transferred to meat/fish department representative who confined that it can be done at any time. In 15 min when we arrived to the store, their store manager refused to help stating that we should talk to him and not to anyone else. We stated that staff members must be trained to provide correct information. We were told that it was our fault because we spoke with the person who was not authorized to provide us with this type of information. Manager still did not get our point about the need to train their staff members not to answer questions they are not authorized to answer. We were offered no complimentary cards or reimbursements. Case was handled very unprofessional.

43.description: Like so many grocers in Chicago, it's all about what you're buying. They are consistently comparable to really cheap on produce and it's good quality. I shop here for produce and wine, though you'll find slightly cheaper wine at the major grocers. I don't know why I haven't found fresh guacamole nor salsa here in a while. That was another major reason to come here. I rarely ever buy juice or dairy here, outside of a sale. Customer service has gone from "why are you bothering me" to "okay, I'll help you and be fairly pleasant".

2.description: From reading past reviews, I try not to come here too often. I only come here if I run out of milk or something because I live within walking distance. When you first walk in, it smells like cleaning supplies and rotten meat. The produce doesn't look great. One time I went to pick up a container of sour cream and it didn't feel cold, dispite it being in the refrigerated section. So I grabbed a different one and that one didn't feel cold either. I don't know how long the sour cream was sitting out or where so I just didn't bother buying it. At least the employees all seem to be nice. Obviously the quality of the store isn't really their fault.

18.description: One of the best grocery stores in the city. Great prices and a curious Eastern European selection of beer and other liquor. They do veggie juices in the back of the produce area which is cool.

41.description: I'm blessed to live near Devon!  This market reminds me of Brooklyn with diversity of produce and Eastern European stuff.  Great prices and everything I need (that's not exotic).  ridiculously large loaves of luscious bread for nothing.

52.description: People are friendly and nice.  I am a vegetarian so I only buy produce here.  Some of the vegetables are great (wonderful kale, great price), but others are not so good.  Good apples, and their winter persimmons are good too.  But some fruit looks bad, and their mushrooms rarely hold for more than two days.  Overall, a good little market with a great parking lot.  Wonderful selection of candies, nutella, and wine.

50.description: Thrilled to find an alternative to the mega Domediocre in my new hood.Wide , fresh awesome selection of produce and meat.Bakery also impressive. I'm really curious about another reviewers comparison to Jewel and Dominick's with whom I have the 180 degree experience. Huh. takes all kinds.

4.description: Just okay. There are some good prices on stuff like canned foods and other non-perishables, but they don't have what I look for most in a grocery store: a wide selection of organic produce and vegan-friendly products. Nowadays, many mainstream grocery stores carry lots of such food, but Devon Market doesn't. They're definitely behind the times in that way. On the plus side, they're open until 10pm. Their alcohol selection also isn't very wide, but luckily, there is a liquor store a few doors down. Devon Market is my if-nothing-else-is-open-it's-better-than-a-convenience-store place.

6.description: Unorganized and confusing item placements everywhere. Most cashiers and staff are rude young adults (maybe students/summer employees) who don't know the words "hello" "goodbye" "thank you" and especially "excuse me" when needing to share space to stock or walking past you. There is an unacceptable standard of customer service. It's like a competition on who can get the most attention for being rude. Additionally, I had the wonderful opportunity to listen to a cashier (as she rang my items) explain to her coworker how she is banned from a previous job at Marshals for fighting another staff and boasting at how bad ass she is and can care less about rules. Nice *insert fake smile here*Lastly, it's nice to have a local juice bar but beware that if you want to pay for your green juice at check out and not in cash at the bar you may be followed or watched if you have additional shopping. Nothing about this store is impressive enough to return to even if it's practically next door.

22.description: Good, classic grocery store with affordable prices, personality, and handmade baked goods. The employees are nice, helpful, and hard-working, and I wish I lived close enough to make this my weekly spot.

15.description: Good, classic grocery store with affordable prices, personality, and handmade baked goods. The employees are nice, helpful, and hard-working, and I wish I lived close enough to make this my weekly spot.

57.description: Huge produce section, never have to go elsewhere for produce items. Prices are cheap for most produce and meats.Their ready made sushi is surprisingly delicious. Other items are a bit expensive, such as toiletries or the cereal. But they have a great wine selection and lots of ethnic foods.The checkouts are always quick. The aisles are cramped, and always busy. And i think they only hire cute girls for the checkouts. They are all russian or latina beauties. Lol, makes me put make-up on to get groceries, if I want to compete...lolznot kidding.

20.description: They have a lot of options for things that other stores don't carry, which is great but far too many times I've come in for fruit and it's all covered in mold. Most times I buy produce here it ends up going bad way too quickly. I'm glad more stores are coming into the neighborhood again because it was driving me nuts having produce go bad so quickly... They gotta up their quality. The selection is pretty good though, and friends of mine love getting their premixed chicken that just gets tossed on a grill or pan to cook. Overall, I go here for certain things or when I don't feel like going further over to Cermak...

36.description: Fair selection of international food.

14.description: They have good prices on produce meat and seafood.  And if you like eastern European specialty foods, they do have some interesting stuff.  I like their smoked Pork necks.  They have a lot of different types of smoked bacon too.

29.description: Fun place to go and have a drink and some great bar food. Cheese curds are great and all the burgers are worth trying. For dessert, the s'mores really are great at your table - just be prepared for the burner at your table. Of course, it is great that it is an SEC school except for the fact the owners are from Auburn. That's the only drawback I have found so far. ROLL TIDE!!

42.description: I stopped in one night for a drink on the way home from dinner with friends. Been going back ever since. The food is great and the drink selection  is large but it's the bartenders that make it a place to return to. On my second visit three weeks later , John , the manager brought me my favorite drink before I asked. He remembered my drink and my name. He sets the friendly tone for the whole place. He  makes you feel right at home. Meredith, is the other great bartender. She is so friendly and always makes an effort to chat even when it's busy. I've never been one to hang out in bars but they make you wanna do just that.

23.description: Mama like.I don't head to Andersonville often, but when I do I'm always surprised by how much I LIKE it here.  Loving Andersonville Brewing.  Swift service.  Pricing isn't offensive.  The apps are good.  I'm down.

47.description: I was very happy to hear that Hamburger Marys was taking over the Tomboy spot and making it into a sports oriented bar.  While there is much to chose from,  Andersonville lacked at that time a bar that had multiple TV's that were capable of playing multiple games.I have been there several times and have always enjoyed myself.  The staff has always been extremely hospitable and accommodating.  The crowd has always been enjoyable and very in to the games being shown.Just some pointers...it is a sports bar so there will be a large crowd for sporting events such as the Bears, Hawks, College Football, March Madness...I think you are getting my point.  Don't show up at 2:00 when the Bears started at Noon and 1. think you are going to get a seat and 2. think that you will be able to have a quiet afternoon.  Just cozy up to the nearest Grabowski you see, slam some beer and cheer on your favorite team.In my opinion it is a great addition to the neighborhood.

8.description: Mary's food without the hassle. Wound up on the trivia night, which was fun. Probably good beers, but I'm not a beer drinker, so don't trust me on those reviews. Food is wonderful bar food with some nice twists. Otherwise have a great time.

31.description: Checked out this place last night for trivia night and decide to have dinner while playing trivia. The trivia was great...the questions were challenging and fun and the pace was perfect. We couldn't say the same for the food. My husband and I both got the Guacamole BJ burger. We waited 40 minutes for our burgers to arrive, and when they did, we found them to be very uneventful. They were about as good as a typical burger you can get at a greasy spoon. The bun was the worst part though. It tasted like your run of the mill bun you can buy at the grocery store for a backyard barbecue. If you are going to offer a bunch of specialty burgers with unique ingredients, I think the bun should also be special in some way. Our waiter was very apologetic about the wait and brought us a free dessert which we appreciated. However, with all the great burgers in this city, I won't be choosing to go back there for one.

34.description: I really like coming to this place for a good beer, big burger, and some entertainment whether it's a tranny Bingo host, or a good football game on one of their 6 televisions.   Weekend afternoons tend to be a good time (save for a much anticipated football game), and they have $2 mimosas until 3pm.  The food is good, the service is usually good, and they have their own beer which is tasty and strong.  I prefer this more laid-back atmosphere than the dining room, and just can't get enough of their Guacamole B.J. Burger!

16.description: This review would reflect my third time in a "Mary's" facility, and as they say, Third Time is a Charm! My boyfriend and I went there on a Saturday night at midnight. Kitchen closes at 1 am so that really worked for our situation last night. The interior was nicely decorated sports bar- We loves their bottle cap table tops!We ordered a quesadilla and mini burgers! Quesadillas are such a simple appetizer but Mary's does it so right!! Also their brownie sundaes are super delicious! Our waitress Lori recommended putting caramel and graham crackers in it, do it!! Or customize it your own way!Service was phenomenal thanks to our waitress LORI. She was absolutely a delight: helpful, fun, and nice! It is refreshing to interact with someone who loves their job! You can tell through her service and attentiveness!  Next time you are at "Mary's" ask for LORI! You wont regret it! Loved her!

13.description: I went in with a friend to watch the Sunday Superbowl, the place was packed and cozy. Butt to butt here. With such a small space, it felt like I walked into a tiny coffee shop, not a bar. Also full of people who've never seen a minority before I'm guessing? lol. Everybody literally stared wide-eyed at me and my friend. That's how small the place is, and how weird the people there were. With no seats left and the weird vibe, we left immediately.

11.description: Mama like.I don't head to Andersonville often, but when I do I'm always surprised by how much I LIKE it here.  Loving Andersonville Brewing.  Swift service.  Pricing isn't offensive.  The apps are good.  I'm down.

39.description: This place blows, take your business elsewhere.

37.description: This is a cozy sports with a very warm and friendly environment.  Solid food and beer selection.   Angela the bartender is the best.

0.description: was there thursday night and i have to say im a fan. the beer was great, i had the 4 beer flight and i liked all of their beers. the atmosphere was chill. MY kind of place! the bartender (James I think was his name) was very nice and attentive, the waitresses were also very friendly, which is what i like in a brewery. cant wait to be back and try some more of the beers they have.

38.description: I enjoy coming to Mary's Rec Room. I usually go for Tuesday Trivias which is pretty great. $2 PBR's and compliments well with their $6 cheese curds. I like coming here for casual drinks with friends. We usually like to split their $16 cocktail pitchers. It's strong enough to give you a nice buzz just in case you want to head upstairs to Mary's Attic to dance. Their servers are great. I've never had a bad experience with their service. At one point we knew this one server by name but I don't think she works there anymore. She was great though. I recommend going to their Trivia night, the host is hilarious.

51.description: For a sports bar, I guess this is OK.  This was not one of my favorite places to hang out.  I came here after having dinner with some friends.  It seemed very loud, and it was very crowded, but that is what you have to expect for any bar on a Saturday night in Chicago.  The drinks were good, the bartenders very friendly.  I definitely enjoy Mary's Attic a little bit better, but if you like Sports bars and beer, then this is worth checking out.

27.description: Had to give Mary's a try, since I live close and had never been to a 'gay bar' before. Funny thing is Mary's doesn't feel any different from your typical sports bar, there just happens to be awesome 80s and 90s music videos playing instead of the game and gay couples instead of jocks populating the tables. I've been there twice now and our servers were both friendly, helpful, and quick. For drinks I have gotten Mary's punch which is everything I would want in a punch; fruity and filled with barely detectable vodka. Perfect. But then I also got a hot toddy which was disgusting. A friend of mine got a cucumber mojito which was tasty and refreshing!Our food has been hit or miss also. Everyone raves about their burgers but I wasn't thrilled with their menu selection or the burger I ended up with. Huge, greasy, and boring flavors. I've had much better burgers in the city. Their sweet potato fries are awesome though, super crispy without that cornstarchy taste.I'd love to come back to Mary's for more punch and a visit to the Attic

32.description: Great fun place. Trivia night on Tuesdays is always something to look forward to each week. Friendly atmosphere. Food is from Hamburger Mary's (next door) and has the same hours of food service. Drinks are fairly priced. Beer drafts are plenty but other drinks are limited. Otherwise, a great place.

48.description: I have to admit, I love this place. Maybe it's because its location and atmosphere bring my eclectic group of friends ranging in age from 23 to 43 together under one roof but there is more to it than that. Friday and Saturday nights the Rec Room can get crowded but the place is great for watching the game, with reasonably priced beer and some unique in-house brew selections. They also have some decent specials on mixed drinks here and there. Oh and all the perks of Mary's food! I love the Mary's Taco Wrap and the Mac 'n' Cheese bites. Salads are also fresh and hearty and the burgers... if you are a fan of Mary's that should hook you on the Rec Room's food as well! The wait staff is usually prompt and fun, even when busy they try their best to get to you as much as possible and keep good tabs on your drink levels. I have gotten the occasional hyperactive server, unfortunately to the point of annoyance a time or two during the week for dinner. Nice as could be but loud outbursts of crazy song and dance when there isn't more than 7 people in the bar can be annoying and distracting. And the strange "we're friends" buddy buddy chit chat can sometimes be a bit much, perhaps a few too many pixi-stix before work? People here are usually very friendly too, we've had people nice enough to move tables when our party suddenly grew beyond our expected number and during games there can be high fives all around and lots of friendly banter. Overall, great place for a yummy dinner or to catch a game and a bite to eat with friends!

44.description: I went to Mary's Rec Room a few weekends ago for some pre-birthday drinking.  Here's how it went:Things I don't remember:-our awesome bartender's name-she was the best!-other ingredients in the fantastic elderflower liquor cocktail she made me.Things I do remember:-aforementioned bartender had awesome (purple?) hair and had a great sense of humor while taking care of our lively group.-reasonably priced drinks and good beer specials.-the cucumber mojito was phenomenal.-a welcoming, laid back vibe with clean bathrooms.  In summation, this is a great extension of Hamburger Mary's next door and I'll definitely be back!

24.description: Ok seriously, loved, loved, loved this place so much.  Let's talk about the staff for a minute.  So, so friendly and happy and gay!!  And they fix a KILLER Mary's fruit punch!!  I would recommend the large!!  Also had a hamburger that was to die for in fact, I am craving one now.  This is one of my new favorite places!!

7.description: Stopped by Saturday afternoon for some beer flights. Casual, dimly lit, neighborhood bar. Our server seemed distracted and beer was just okay. Was in good company so that helped! Perhaps an off day at the establishment. There are lots of TVs with various sports games on.

49.description: The Rec Room has the same food as Mary's, but is a more chill place to have drinks. Super friendly staff and great drinks. The Berry Punch special on Friday is wonderful.A great addition to the neighborhood!

40.description: I love this place.  It's a casual place to go meet friends or casual dates for drinks.  I like the servers.  I like the food/drinks.  The environment is that of a sports bar with TVs and such, and if you like that, you will like this.

53.description: I'm surprised that this is only the second review of what seems like a pretty excellent establishment. I don't usually hang out in Andersonville, and I've never been to any of the other Mary's establishments, but this place was A+. I came here with some co-workers after our holiday party and we had an excellent time. The Mary's microbrews were great and decent'y priced, and the beer cocktails were an interesting addition to the drink menu. The bar had a nice relaxed vibe, and the staff was attentive and laid back. There seems to be a lot of potential to enjoy the hell out of this place on a game day and there's a pool table, which is always good. Definitely looking forward to coming back.

30.description: This review would reflect my third time in a "Mary's" facility, and as they say, Third Time is a Charm! My boyfriend and I went there on a Saturday night at midnight. Kitchen closes at 1 am so that really worked for our situation last night. The interior was nicely decorated sports bar- We loves their bottle cap table tops!We ordered a quesadilla and mini burgers! Quesadillas are such a simple appetizer but Mary's does it so right!! Also their brownie sundaes are super delicious! Our waitress Lori recommended putting caramel and graham crackers in it, do it!! Or customize it your own way!Service was phenomenal thanks to our waitress LORI. She was absolutely a delight: helpful, fun, and nice! It is refreshing to interact with someone who loves their job! You can tell through her service and attentiveness!  Next time you are at "Mary's" ask for LORI! You wont regret it! Loved her!

46.description: The Rec Room is more than a great place to grab a drink and eat a bite, either alone or with pals. Heck, even show up with a little Viking early in the evening and they're cool with it. I love the staff for that.If you're looking for a place to watch a game, grab a seat. If you're looking for a place to have a drink, grab a seat. Either way, they serve the same home brew and food as next door, just with a more sports bar feel, all without the frat house attitude.

1.description: Visited this place on Halloween. First thing to note, service was just awful. We were there for about an hour and our server only came to us twice, and didn't even check in with us when running to other tables. It wasn't too busy either. For the first time in my life I encouraged my group to leave some cash on the table to bail since the server wasn't interested in bringing our check.The first thing we were told was they were out of ginger beer and this was after a friend tried to order one of the drinks with ginger beer in it and no suggestion was made as a replacement. The server made us feel unwelcome the entire visit, not even giving us a "I'll be right back" or even spot checking to make sure we still had drinks left.On top of the poor service, the beer was just awful and made me sick. It was completely flat and had absolutely no flavor values except gross.And as a PS I was once a server at a sports bar so I'm familiar with the industry and bad days, but with how poor the beer was I will not be back unless I am checking out Hamburger Mary's.

9.description: They have some good in house beers my favorite of which is the marry hoppins, pale ale. They do seasonal brews and some rotations but they stick to four beers total that they brew themselves. They also have in house cocktails and the standard bar variety of everything else. They do serve food here and I havent tried their whole menu but their loaded ta-tas are amazing. It's basically nachos made with tater tots instead of tortilla chips.

26.description: Can someone tell me why this place has 4 stars?! I've been here a few times, the food is awful, the bartenders are total inattentive snobs, and the house beers are mediocre at best. It is a disappointment every time! Gave it one more chance tonight, ended up leaving without spending a dime since the bartender basically chose to completely ignore us, and they weren't busy at all.

25.description: Went here last night for a ladies night. Mixed drinks were tasty and nice size. The special was $2 off pints, with lots of options. LOVED the flights of their beer - all were interesting and tasty. Server was a little slow, but friendly and attentive. I'll be back for some more beers!

12.description: Yesterday was our second visit to Andersonville Brewing.  It will be our last.  Totally not impressed.  When you walk in the door, you are immediately met with a very stale, dirty bar smell.  Ick.No beer flights available yesterday.  They were out of one of the beers and when we asked if they could substitute a beer, we were told no and that "they" (whoever that is) don't like to substitute.  Okay.  Nothing like being at a place that brews their own beer and you can't sample.My boyfriend ordered the Hippity Hoppity IPA.  He loves IPAs and said it was the worst IPA he had ever had.  He thought there was a mistake because the IPA was super smoky tasting.  I tried it.  Definitely did not have the hoppy IPA characteristics.  I ordered the spicy bloody mary.  That was supposed to be a house speciality.  Worst bloody mary I have ever had.  Totally bland.  I thought our server was very nice and I felt bad that he was put in a position of having to tell the customers "no."  He was the only saving grace about our visit.  The rest--eh...won't be back.

21.description: First of all, the time on Yelp here says you open at 5am- fix that since you open at 5pm. Second- I called today asking for Andersonville Brewing and the lady says yes we are open now. My friends and I get to the door at 2pm and you are closed. I call again and find out that It's closed and Hamburger Mary's is open now- which I like but reAlly? My friends and I wanted to try the Brewing company. Fix your advertising and your customer service so customers don't have to question if you are open. Thank you Maryann

17.description: I am a proud M2F trans Latina and feel good here, despite competition.I like the sports on TV and the cute bartender.Soy una trans-latina orgullosa y siento bien aquí, a pesar de la competencia. Me gustan los deportes en la televisión y el barman lindo.

10.description: Sadly, I have to update my previously glowing review downward.  It's just not what it was.  The former Rec Room has been on a downward slide since changing to the new name.  The portion sizes of the food kept shrinking, and beers kept being out or unavailable.  The last straw for me was when I had a rancid glass of Gangster Ale.  I've enjoyed this beer many, many times, and I know what it should taste like.  The server said the brewer was trying to increase the size of their batches and was having trouble getting things right.  I understand not wanting to dump a batch of beer, but serving bad booze is just inexcusable.  If I hear they turn things around I'd try it again, but as it is I'll go elsewhere to watch games and eat some food.

5.description: I was excited to see this is affiliated with Hamburger Mary's. I came with a few people to get drinks and watch a football game. Our server was very personable and attentive. We ordered the Mary Tyler S'Mores and were really surprised when a tray with a mini fire and all the fixin's came out and we could roast our own marshmallows! Very cool experience.

3.description: Stopped in to try a few of their beers. The Frank Lloyd Rye was fine, but the Rye of Tiger was foul. I've never been served a craft beer before that was undrinkable, but this was undrinkable. They really need to work on quality control for their beer. The bartender was really nice though.

35.description: Interesting crowd, pretty busy on a Friday night, and they pour a strong cocktail!  I had a Basil/Cucumber martini that was the perfect refreshment on a hot July night in Chicago!  I would definitely return to try more of their cocktails, or one of their beers they brew in house.

19.description: Andersonville Brewing Company's bartenders really know their beer, and the service was fast and competent. I was surprised at how few people were present at the brewery, but it might have just been that most were in the Mary's portion of the establishment. I tried the Mary Hoppins APA, which was full flavored, a good balance of crisp yet musky. They have outdoor (sidewalk tables) seating both in front of the brewing company and on the Hamburger Mary's side. I will definitely go there again.

28.description: I like Mary's-- I forgive the mediocre food and inconsistent service because its fun and cheap. Made the mistake of coming to the rec room after dinner the other night when the game was on. It's such a pet peeve when bartenders stand watching the tv while you're waiting to order. And when he finally dragged himself away from tv he had an attitude with us like we were bothering him. Ugh, I'd rather have a Mimosa with a drag queen on the other side.

45.description: My favorite bartender in the whole world works at the Rec Room.  If you're ever waited on by John K., he makes the most delectable Old Fashioneds you'll ever imbibe, and he's the sweetest fellow in the world.  Ask him about otters -- You won't be disappointed.  (And you'll learn something!)Beyond that, it can get loud on game nights.  It's pretty much a sexy sports bar.  I'm fine with that, but I can see being surprised if you show up in the middle of a playoffs season not expecting it.  Also, Sunday nights are karaoke nights at the Attic upstairs.  Take that as you will.

33.description: My friends and I came here on Saturday for watch the footballs games and pretty much spent the entire day eating, drinking, screaming at the TVs and playing pool.  The game started around 3:30pm, so we were happy to discover there were plenty of tables to choose from.  Our server, who rocked the entire night, was helpful in putting two tables together for our group of 7 and made sure we always had drinks and food throughout the course of our stay here. We tried so many different things, since we were here for about 7 hours (insane, I know).Here's a list of everything we had:- Fried Pickle Spears - awesome, definitely get these!- Beer n' Cheese dip - also awesome, but order some extra pretzels or fries because there is so much dip!- Potato skins - I didn't eat these, but our friends loved them-Mary Burger - this is what I had and it was awesome, huge and juicy.  I got it with tatter tots, which were crispy on the outside and soft on the inside-Turkey Burger - my friend got this and loved it-Hawaiian Burger - a few of my friends got this and loved it.  The pineapple looked really good.- Breakfast Burger - someone else got this and literally ate the whole thing (as if that's possible with how huge these things are).  The egg was cooked perfectly and it was spilling over with cheese-All American Stuffed Burger - my fiance got this and was head over heels for it.  It's stuffed with cheese and bacon.  Pretty much a heart attack on a plate-Vanilla Milk Shake w/ Honey - someone ordered this and raved about it, it was huge and creamy.Beer!  They have a great selection of beer here.  I was all about their wheats in the bottle.  I wasn't a huge fan of their drafts, some of them seemed a little flat to me but perhaps it was just me.  Everyone was getting the draft, so its possible I was being picky.  I also had a bloody mary, which was really good, for those interested in something a little stronger than beer.The pool table is fun, but in a weird spot to play.  I felt bad disrupting the staff since its situated where they come out from the kitchen and near the wait station.  They never seemed annoyed, but I still felt bad.The staff was just super nice throughout the whole time here.  Our server was on top of everything and funny to hang out with.They also have a million high definition TVs, so if you want to see the game - this is a great place to watch.  And for anyone who gets sick of watching TV (like my lady friends and I were), we went for a walk in the hood and left the boys to their football.

43.description: Mary's is a great fun and crazy Enviroment and I love that.  If you are looking to chill out, the rec room is for you.  It has a sports vibe but you will not feel out of place is you are not watching the game.  You can also get the same food and drinks that Mary's serves next door.

2.description: This is more of a warning on the poutine...IT WAS DISGUSTING....never had it and sounds like you cant go wrong with fries, melted cheese curds and gravy BUT after eating some i had to vomit....the gravy tasted like it came from a can..over salty and metal taste to it....and the cheese curds all melted was just like eating a giant congealed blob of cheese that didn't break very easy...would have been better off just ordering fries and cheese curds separatelyOther than that i love Hamburger Mary's and the rec room...just no poutine for me anymore

18.description: Fun, friendly, awesome beers, stellar food. Just a great place to go for lunch or dinner.

41.description: Another solid five stars for this place. I'm a regular here every Sunday night with my Andersonville homegirls. I'm either chowing down a burger, or munching a salad at the bar, flanked by the usual suspects.Burgers: I can't get away from Buffy the Hamburger Slayer, it is too good. If I'm feeling lighter, a Cheeseburger Salad - Caesar salad with a couple of Blue Boy mini cheeseburgers. They brew their own beers - including a couple Gluten Free beers, and also pour a mean vodka tonic. The bartenders - John and Meredith, and the manager - Other Erika are FABULOUS! Friendly, hysterical, sassy, and hot. Super hot!And doesn't everyone end up here on their birthday sprawled on the pool table at 3 AM laughing hysterically? If you don't you should!

52.description: I don't know exactly why, but I'm really drawn to the Mary's places. They all have the same relaxed and welcoming atmosphere, I guess. I really liked the Rec Room. Their own beers are really good, and you can get a tasters flight for pretty cheap. The food menu is the same as Hamburger Mary's, but the tables are smaller and if you really want a full, sit-down meal just go next door. The cocktail menu is very interesting, my friend ordered and liked the Butter-beer, which was beer with butterscotch schnapps in it. It wasn't my thing but there are a lot of choices. I enjoyed the very strong and delicious Arnold Palmer. yum.

50.description: It's open later than In Fine Spirits?  I can't conjure much else positive about this bar.I only award the second star because they attempt (which is the operative term) to brew their own beer in-house.  However, I sampled two ales (the Mary Hoppins Pale Ale and the Peach Wheat), and I can honestly say that I've personally brewed mistakes better than each.They do have a pool table, and their ambience could be worse, but I haven't identified any sound reason to return.

4.description: I changed my mind. This place is actually pretty fun. I've been back a couple times and their apps are generally good. They have nice drink specials and a good atmosphere. It's a fun place to watch a game. The Ginger Rogers is a great cocktail. The Mac and cheese bites are tops. Give this place a try!

6.description: I found their beer just barely tolerable. I hate to say it, but I was not a fan.The few redeeming aspects of my evening out where the following:the bartender, she was attentive but not overly attentivethe location, it is centrally located between myself and my friend i went there withthe vodka martini

22.description: The server was rude and had something against my boyfriend right from the start. First we couldn't have our drinks from the Midsommarfest on the patio but the next couple was allowed to. Then the server had asked to hold our credit card bc people were dining and dashing so without a doubt we gave it to him but then realized people that came after us didn't get asked for their card. I work in the industry and I know how it is but seriously one of the worst experience I've ever had. Only reason they even get a star is bc of their beer samples. The poutine was not good.

15.description: I'm awarding this place 3 stars because of 3 reasons: great staff, yummy fries and $3 mimosas. Other than that, nothing special. I was extremely disappointed with their chicken & waffles.

20.description: I am a proud M2F trans Latina and feel good here, despite competition.I like the sports on TV and the cute bartender.Soy una trans-latina orgullosa y siento bien aquí, a pesar de la competencia. Me gustan los deportes en la televisión y el barman lindo.

36.description: typical bar food, good drinks, diverse crowd, and fun staff... for the most part.

14.description: Good place, nice, clean, friendly service, beer not the best, but good!, the most recomendable their blonde lager or some like that, fair prices, tolerable noise. Good place to watch sports lot of TVs. And the food It's good! The burguers awesome!

1.description: If you think you don't like tofu, try the spicy tofu from Phoenix Bean.  The non-GMO tofu is freshly made right here in Edgewater.  The spicy tofu is bathed in a delicious, assertively spiced Asian chili sauce.  It's my fave!  There are other varieties including a mellower creamy ginger sauce.  The soy noodles are an awesome alternative to pasta, especially paired  with a homemade peanut sauce.  Check out your local farmers market for the Phoenix Bean stand.   The spicy tofu is especially addictive. Long after the close of the last farmers market you can still find it at Urban Orchard in Andersonville and Harvest Time in Ravenswood.   Support a local company and enjoy Phoenix Bean products.

9.description: You've probably seen their tofu around town, especially in Asian markets.  But did you know you can buy right from the factory?  And for cheaper?  Well now you do!  Don't be discouraged by the imposing façade:  Go in the glass door to the left and approach the nice person in the office.They have several kinds of tofu:  Extra firm, firm, soft, fried, pouches, spicy, yellow...  Most of them don't need to have the water squeezed out of them before cooking, either.  They also have bean sprouts and soy milk for sale.Street parking is metered, but there is a lot next door that may or may not be for customers.  Not a lot of signage there.They are open 9:00AM to 3:00PM Monday through Saturday, or by appointment.

23.description: They produce fresh tofu that you can find at local ethnic (mostly Asian, but a few Latino) markets.  There really isn't any comparison between freshly prepared bean curd, and the crap most restaurants use.  I've been told that most restaurants use firm tofu simply because it is easier to prepare, but the fresh soft tofu from Phoenix always finds its way into my shopping cart.

12.description: Phoenix Bean's tofu stir fries are good for the soul. They have about 5 prepackaged ones, but the spicy stir fry with cilantro and chili oil is my favorite. I'll second the reviewer below who said it's addictive... Every time I've gotten a carton, I'll finish it within an hour of bringing it home!

21.description: Love their tofu!  It's local and fresh and soooooo good!  I met some of their friendly folks at the Andersonville Farmer's Market.  I'm a solid customer for life.

16.description: Fanastic products....! Soybean noodles are to die for. . I wish they had a retail store.

17.description: We've been eating Phoenix Bean's tofu for many years but this year we discovered their Phoenix Spicy Tofu Stir Fry at the Glenwood Sunday Market. It's great. You can eat this stuff right out of the tub, marinated as it is in corn oil, salt, garlic chili sauce, soy sauce, black bean sauce and plenty of cilantro. Just about to finish off what we bought the other day . . . will have to get some more. Did I mention it was spicy?

10.description: I've tried a lot of their products at the Andersonville farmers market and I am excited to learn that I can purchase their products directly from their store in edgewater!  I will definitely be doing so! I've tried the yellow tofu and the fried puffed tofu.  Both are delicious! You don't have to do any prep work either, you can just eat it right out of the pack.The staff at the farmers markets is soooo friendly too!  You can get a huge pack of tofu for 2.50!!!SUPER CHEAP!

5.description: I attended a tasting yesterday where the owner talked about the process of making tofu and her product line.  As a vegetarian, I greatly appreciated the chance to taste the different varieties and be able to ask questions about how best to store the pressed tofu.  I particularly liked the smoked five spice tofu and the prepared dishes with shittake mushrooms,  the latter of which the owner said will be for sale at some farmer's markets.  Best of all, many of the products are for sale at their factory, which is a short bus ride for me.  :-)  I've had mixed experiences buying their products at area stores, so hopefully buying directly from the factory will solve this problem.

11.description: Stopped in here on a Saturday and loved it!  The woman working here was very friendly and her son happened to drop by and he told us that his mom had been working here for over 20 years and that he's grown up eating Phoenix tofu!  Will definitely be back to buy more of their tofu!  Was lucky enough to be at vegan mania that same day and sampled all their varieties and sauces too!

22.description: Phoenix Bean has the freshest ToFu in the market. Among the rest of the other ToFu companies, Phoenix Bean has more variety in their product line. The baked five spiced ToFu is great and I love the white extra firm. Always fresh and always satisfied. If you go to their plant on Broadway, you can pick up any product, if you're lucky when you head there, you may get the tofu made that morning. Every Wednesday evening in the Andersen-ville Farmers Market, you stop by for some FREE samples.

0.description: I visited the Argyle Street Night Market last Thursday after work, and I was pleasantly surprised by the level of activity.  It seemed like a cross between an ethnic street fair and a local farmers' market, and it was nice that folks walked their dogs and bicycles through this stretch of Argyle.  There was even a small stage with a young lady singing and playing guitar (she even covered Pink Floyd - cool!).  However the find of this night market is the Phoenix Bean Products tofu booth.  OMG is this lifelong meat eating guy rambling about tofu?  Indeed I am, as I am sort of embracing my Chinese-American roots to see what tofu is all about.  Phoenix's primary location is just around the corner on North Broadway, but they have been actively participating and selling their products at several outdoor markets around Chicago.  The tofu is locally made and freshly made, so Phoenix has a solid reputation.  The owner and her friendly staff chatted up the versatility of the tofu, as they served a tasty variety of prepared tofu selections to sample.  I was not a tofu fan growing up in my traditional Chinese-American household, but I must say that these tofu bites were mighty tasty.  You can tell that some passersby looked quizzically at the various tofu samples (the same look I had when I was a kid), but there were also a lot of tofu fans that stopped by enthusiastically to eat and to purchase.  The Argyle Street Night Market is taking place on Thursday evenings for the summer, so if you are in the area check out the Phoenix tent.  If you do not see Phoenix here or at one of the local markets or Asian food stores, visit them at their establishment for some quality tofu.

20.description: Me + health food such as tofu?? Yeah Right!!! but not if it's deep fried. Love their tofu products! I bought some of their fried tofu squares for my pad see ew and they tasted great! Absolutely delicious-- non stale oil taste from the fried squares. The fried squares aren't too dense but very airy.. I much prefer that over the much denser versions found elsewhere. Some of the best tofu I've had.. My health freak of a mother would be so proud. Bravo asians in the Midwest, Bravo. I didn't think you could make edible asian food products in this part of the country but you just proved me wrong this month. Round of applause.

19.description: Phoenix Bean has the freshest ToFu in the market. Among the rest of the other ToFu companies, Phoenix Bean has more variety in their product line. The baked five spiced ToFu is great and I love the white extra firm. Always fresh and always satisfied. If you go to their plant on Broadway, you can pick up any product, if you're lucky when you head there, you may get the tofu made that morning. Every Wednesday evening in the Andersen-ville Farmers Market, you stop by for some FREE samples.

2.description: I love there products!  There tofu is far superior to any other brands.  I love the five spiced smoked tofu, it's so good!  I've also had there fried, baked a and plain tofu, all super good!  If you ever see them at the farmers market (we buy it at Logan square) definitely try them.  I highly suggest, I know they sell at small grocery stores such as plenty in Chicago but I really wish they were at whole foods too as it would be easier.  Nonetheless there products are great and they are vegan and gluten free (wish it said that on the packing).  I highly suggest

18.description: Do not bother going anywhere else!!! This company is wonderful...period. The service is spectacular: friendly and genuinely interested. The quality of all of their products is phenomenal and the pricing is perfect. I highly recommend the extra-firm pre-pressed tofu and the Five Spice Baked Tofu. I refuse to give my business to anyone else.

13.description: I just ate an entire carton of Phoenix Spicy Tofu Stir Fry for breakfast. Regrets? Only that I don't know where I can find more today. I picked this up at the Independence Park Farmers' Market and I cannot wait weeks until the next market day rolls around.

4.description: The first time I stopped by the Phoenix Bean booth at the Glenwood Sunday Market, I was told that I'd become addicted to the spicy tofu. And I am. I'm hopelessly addicted, so much so that a box of it comes home with me every week. It's delicious with just about any vegetable you can stir-fry, but I'm not ashamed to admit that I've eaten it straight out of the box, cold. In fact, I just had some now over some cold soba noodles.Even if you don't think you're a fan of tofu, give it a try. You might become addicted, too.

6.description: Love the local tofu.  Upton's and Teese get all the locavore props, but these folk should get love too.  And buying here is cheaper than a supermarket.  I got 4 things of tofu for $5.  Dig it.

15.description: Great product but frankly I was a bit taken aback when I saw it being sold at the Andersonville Farmers Market for 3 times what I could get it an an Asian grocery on Broadway.

7.description: Dofu Fah and Dou Jurng is awesome. Thought this stuff was a lost art. But now its resurrected in in Edgewater! Halleujah!!

8.description: I have never been a fan of tofu, but I am incorporating it into my new dietary lifestyle. I was excited to learn that Veganmania 2012 was only a 10 minute drive to my home so of course I went. I almost passed by this place, but since there was such a nice crowd I decided to stop. I a glad that I did!! A young lady at the table was very nice, friendly & helpful. I am totally love with the spicy tofu!!!! I purchased two containers immediately. The mango was quite tasty as well. It was great with my homemade stiffly, plus she gave me a nice sauce on the side for each container. Love it!They didnt have any flyers, but she said the address was on the label. I did a search & saw good reciews on here and I agree with the positive ones. I visited the website, but it's nothing impressive. The plus is that I can purchase this spicy deliciousness straight from the warehouse. To get me to eat tofu from a container it must be great! I like to support local business & they have my support. In fact, since they close early I better go by there today while I have time :)

3.description: Stop it right now. We have someone making fresh soy products and I had no idea! I wandered by their stand at Green City Market Wednesday and just about had an anxiety attack I was so excited. I sampled several varieties of their marinated tofu, as well as their tofu 'noodles' and fried tofu. All delicious...the real hit for me though was the marinated tofu in spicy sauce. We grilled a bunch of vegetables and tossed it all together and it was phenomenal. Can't wait to pick some up on the regular.I'm always wary of tofu because it can be so over-processed and packed w/GMO soybeans so this is an amazing find!! Local, non-gmo soybeans w/o additives or preservatives is a dream come true.

14.description: Love their tofu!  It's local and fresh and soooooo good!  I met some of their friendly folks at the Andersonville Farmer's Market.  I'm a solid customer for life.

3.description: This place is fabulous. I recently bought a groupon for a jewelry making class and boy was I impressed. I live in Logan so I had never heard of it since it's quite a trek. Really glad I checked it out and would definitely take another class.

1.description: BLUE BUDDHA BOUTIQUE IS ROCKIN'!My mom and I went on a mother-daughter date here to take the chainmaille class where we made a Wiggle Bracelet.Rebecca (the store owner) was the one who taught our class- how cool? She is the sweetest girl ever, by the way. You will love taking classes with her! There were only three of us in the class that evening which was cool because we got more hands-on learning time. We were able to choose between copper, brass, or titanium rings. Rebecca taught us the steps of the pattern for the bracelet, and how to use the tools as well. Once you get the hang of opening and closing the rings, it really sort of becomes meditative. You sort of get a chance to quiet your mind as you work and then all of a sudden you end up with a master piece! So zen. Rebecca was super helpful, though, and offered assistance all the way through when it was required.She gave us a laminated copy of the directions on how to make the bracelet which was super helpful! The class lasted maybe 2 hours, and all three of us successfully made beautiful bracelets.Then my obsession started!I went back days later to check out their store (they have one online as well). I walked out with tools, Tool Magic, a whole lot of rings, and a few blueprints for a couple bracelets that I liked. Omni was very helpful, too, not to mention very polite to my mother which I really respect.This place has their stuff together and they know what they are talking about! I encourage all of you to take a course or two and see how you like it! This is a great date night idea, or even great for some alone time if you want to get out and try something new by yourself.

2.description: I admit, I'm not huge into chainmaille (yes, I know, go ahead and hate me now)... I lack the patience and the style in general just isn't "me." But, I took a ring making class here that was about wire wrapping, and I loved it. Aimee was our teacher, and she was sweet, knowledgeable & patient. For the price of the class, we got to make 2 rings, and this included all the supllies to do so, as well as ring sizers & a wooden mandrel for you to take home so you can create more at your leisure. I'll definitely look into the jewelry classes here in the future, I really enjoyed the class & I'm loving my new rings.

9.description: Took a beginner class for my birthday, it was fun, and I got an amazing piece of jewelry out of it. The instructors were smart and knowledgeable and really want to help.  I will definitely be taking another class and will be ordering some DIY kits from their website.

10.description: I am so excited that they opened a storefront with classrooms! I've been a long time customer online and am so happy that I'll be able to drop in an buy rings when I'm in their hood. The customer service is top notch. As to classes, Rebeca is an amazing teacher. She is so patient, knowledgable and clear. The other teachers are great as well and willing to make sure you are confident with what you've learned before you walk out the door with your beautiful new piece of jewelry.

4.description: B3 is the best! Great staff, great products and they're always willing to go the extra mile for their customers. Aimee handles customer care and she is so freakin' awesome! She is wicked friendly and is always available to help me out. Rebeca, Aimee, Dan, Omni and the rest at B3...thank you. You've given me the tools I need to create some pretty awesome stuff. I don't know what I'd do without you.

6.description: I love B3! This was a place I visited for a general crafting event (knowing 0 about chainmaile) and now I have a new hobby/form of relaxation. Still not sure how it happened. Everyone here is super friendly and knowledgeable, and the amount of stock is impressive. I've done a few little "make and take" events, and just did my first beginner class (Rebeca is a great teacher). This is definitely the beginning of a beautiful relationship. :D

12.description: There are many options out now for us to purchase jumprings and take chainmaille classes, but honestly, why bother with the amateurs? I learned that the quality of my jumprings is crucial to my success as a chainmailler and BBB's KNOWLEDGE and expertise is A+. EXPERTS!!!!!!!!!

5.description: I have mixed feelings, and hence the 3 stars.Five stars for the website, tutorials, introductory classes, and contents of the store (jewelry, jump rings, samples, etc).  Thanks to BBB, I've learned to like chainmaille jewelry a lot and would like to do it as a hobby, because I like working with my hands.Five stars to the friendly and helpful artisans, like Dan, Omni, and Rebeca (the store owner).  Their jewelry is beautiful and they're really knowledgeable.Fewer stars, because I get different vibes based on who's working and who's teaching.  Sometimes the space feels welcoming to newbies.  Other times, it feels like the people working that day would prefer that no one came in and that potential customers are an inconvenience.  I get that working retail can be annoying, because potential customers come in, poke at stuff people have spent hours carefully crafting, ask random questions, and then leave without buying anything.  I'm getting really turned off by the vibe in the store on some days though.  I'll likely just start buying what I need online.  I'm glad I was turned on to chainmaille though.

11.description: I've been buying from B3 for a few years now.  I've lost track.  But they've never lost track of my orders!  Top notch service and products all in the same place. I love B3!

8.description: I LOVE Blue Buddha Boutique.  For numerous reasons.  One is Aimee.  She was so helpful.  I needed certain color rings for an order I had.  I called and talked to Aimee.  She looked through the store and warehouse until she found the color in the sizes I needed.  Thank you Aimee for that.  Another is the quality of their rings.  I buy 99% of my rings from them.  Last, but certainly not least, is their commitment to customer satisfaction.  About a week ago I ordered a bunch of tutorials (the best available in my mind).  In my rush to get them I forgot to enter a promo code for 15% off.  I was disappointed but realized it was my fault.  Today I received an email stating that a refund had been issued for the discount, plus the extra tax.  I did not call and request it.  They found it and took it upon themselves to issue it.  I live an hour away from their store.  I look forward to visiting them soon to thank them in person.Sincerely, Kathy K

0.description: I love this store and will be so sad to see it go. The staff here was so helpful in getting me started with chainmaille. I love the craft and will miss this shop dearly.

7.description: love love love B3!  Quality rings, best tutorials, just all around awesome.  Hope to make the pilgrimage someday to BBB in person.

12.description: Here we go...1) The sambusas - these were pretty bad. They only have Lentil, Potato&Carrot, and Spinach. There were no meat ones on the menu. They were all very bland and the dough was very tough. Skip these.2) The salad was just okay - nothing to write home about. Skip it.3) We had the E4 and E5.From E4 - Tibs Sampler09/13 Combo Zil Zil Tibs/Doro Zips  (marinated steak and chicken) these were terrible. It was like fajita fillings but without any seasoning. Definitely skip this.30 Yesmir  Wat (spicy lentils) - the best of the whole group!33 Gomen (Collard Greens) was bad. really bad. skip it.34 Quosta (spinach) - it was good if you are into that sort of thing. my vote is to skip it.35 Tikel Gomen (cabbage & carrots) - it was good but not the best we have hadFrom E5 - The Traditional Platter06 Tibs (grilled steak) was terrible. It was like fajita fillings but without any seasoning. Definitely skip this. 12 Doro Wat (spicy chicken leg) was good, I would recommend it if you are here but I have had better.17 Yebig Alicha (mild lamb) was pretty good, not the best30 Yemisir Wat (spicy lentil)  - the best of the whole group! We should have had two portions of this since it came in both E4 and E5 but we definitely only had one portion. Skimping out on us!31 Kik Alicha (yellow split peas) was okay but not the best I've had33 Gomen (Collard Greens) was bad. really bad. skip it.37 Dinch Alicha (potato & carrots) was okay, a little too bland - we have had better. Skip it.So overall, my recommendation is #1 - Yemisir Wat followed by Doro Wat. I would also want to try Kay Wat although we didn't have it so I can't say yay or nay. No need to get a sampler platter here given that it's super hit or miss.4) Desserts - these were terrible. Absolutely terrible. Do yourself a favor and skip them. Even though the Groupon doesn't say anything about exclusions, our server would not let us order the chocolate Diamond. I offered to pay the extra dollar (the price difference between the chocolate diamond and the next most expensive dessert) and she wouldn't have it. She wanted us to order three desserts.The House Special was terrible. Just fried chips with crappy vanilla ice cream and some hershey's chocolate drizzled over it.The Destaye was in the sambusa dough and it was SO TOUGH you could barely eat it. Not to mention the filling was terrible.5) Ambiance - this is a big place with a couple unique pieces of furniture. They also had a guy singing, he said he's there every other Sunday night.6) Service - slow. Confusing. She didn't tell us what each of the dishes were when she brought them out.My advice: if you go here, do not get the Groupon. This place should not be selling Groupons that highlight all of their shortcomings (sambusas and desserts). The only things you need to get from here are a couple specific entrees (not sampler platters). If you do that, you'll have a great time!*I read other reviews that said the spicy dishes are really, really spicy. I didn't find that to be true at all. They were definitely well spiced, but not anywhere near too spicy! So don't be afraid. In fact, the only good dishes were the spicy ones, the rest were very bland, so I would focus your attention on the spicy part of the menu if I were you...

7.description: Ethiopian diamond is a great place to eat when you're hungry for a lot of food.  Thr staff is very friendly and their prices are reasonable. I try to get here at least once a month.

19.description: This is the best Ethiopian restaurant we've ever been to! And we've been to different ones in LA and TX. We'll definitely be back!!!

1.description: Excellent food. Excellent service. It was my birthday treat.  My wife picked the spot.  Our 5 & 9 year old boys wiped the plate clean.  I was so proud We ordered sampler E5 - meats and veggies.  Did not care for the beef, but everything else was just perfect We did not try any of the desserts. We'll be dinning there again, soon.

2.description: Excellent Ethiopian cuisine - fresh and flavorful food and a great service experience. House made INJERA is a medium brown indicating use of real teff flower with a nice spongy but firm texture. Injera like this is hard to find. DORO WAT (chicken in egg in bere bere pepper sauce) has a nice dark spicy yet buttery finish. The KITFO (raw beef tar tar) is also a special find combined with homemade white cheese. All of the VEGETARIAN ENTREES - yellow lentils,  red lentils, chopped greens, boiled potatoes and carrots were all cooked to perfection not too soft or hard with rich flavors. This 100+ dining rooms has a warm and welcoming feel with traditional Ethiopian decor. Staff was friendly, and attentive

9.description: Great food and service. I had the goat and it was delicious. The pricing was great and you can eat one meal for 2 people. The portions are massive

6.description: The food is fine though the quality has changed over the years. For many years my family made an annual pilgramage here to pick up food for my son's birthday.  The portions were huge, the accuracy of the order perfect and the taste of the food was exceptional.  This evening, after treking from 6900 south for a meal I ordered for pick up, to arrive home and find that my order was not fulfilled as ordered was a tremendous disappointment.  I would assume more responsibility for this mis hap except I asked if the order was complete and was told it was.  To the restaurants credit, they agreed to refund my credit card for the item they ommitted but I am hungry (not enough for the people we ordered for so I had to forfeit my portion).  I won't give Ethiopian Diamond another chance.

18.description: I'm not a connoisseur when it comes to Ethiopian food, but this place was SO GOOD.  I appreciated that they have variety plates for those of us not familiar enough with the cuisine to choose specific dishes. I will definitely keep trying new things here, and work on getting to know the dishes. I tried the meat plate for one. It came with four different meat dishes (beef, chicken, and lamb), two sides (kik alicha and quosta), and a choice of two sambusas (little pastries with yum filling). It was about $20, which is pretty pricey for me but it fed two people with a small plate of leftovers for the next day. Not bad! Every, single thing on the plate was amazingly delicious. I have thought about it almost daily since trying it last week. It's THAT good. I tried delivery, so I can't comment on the atmosphere. My only complaints are that it's a tad expensive and that the boundary for delivery is a block and a half north of me. :( I'll just keep convincing my friends to order while I'm visiting, or go check out the restaurant.

10.description: It was my first time ever trying Ethiopian food and I didn't know what to expect. However, I was blown away by the depth of flavor and richness in everything I tried there. Felt like it's a lot similar to Pakistani food except the bread which was a novel experience. All in all, great taste, great food, great service. Will definitely go there again. Only downfall is that it's quite expensive, you get very little for what you pay for. P.s. it's a great date idea, you get to sit and eat with your hands sharing one plate, very intimate and something we don't get to do anywhere else ;)!

13.description: Ethiopian Diamond catered my mom's 60th and not only was the food delivered on time and hot, it was DELICIOUS! We under-ordered expecting 50 people we ordered food for 40 and still had leftovers for a week. Everyone loved it. Excellent service.

16.description: I first discovered Ethiopian cuisine when Mama Desta's opened their doors in the 1970s.  A dozen competitors have since ensued, and all used better fresher vegetables, fish and meat and for a long time I thought Ethio Diamond was the best of them.  It may still be the best in Chicago, but in cities like Minneapolis where there's a larger concentration of Ethiopian immigrants, the restaurants are better too, and Ethio diamond is actually not quite as good as our better Ethiopian restaurant downtown in Milwaukee.  The ambiance is great, the service is typical Ethiopian (not rushed, very unobtrusive).  This sort of cuisine is best with a group of four to share a maximum variety, it's a good choice if there are vegetarians or those who are watching cholesterol intake in your party.  For a couple of decades, I've been coming back.

17.description: Delicious food, great service. Since the renovations the atmosphere is especially fantastic.  Be sure to get the tea! It has a delicious blend of black tea, cinnamon, cloves, and cardamom. The service sizes for the food are excellent and they provide such a blend of options!

15.description: This was my first time eating at an Ethiopian restaurant. It was okay. Food was okay. Sambusso's were really good. Lentils were tasty. Beef could have used more flavor. Chicken was okay. Tilapia was nicely prepared.The coffee was sooooooo good though!When I read live music, I didn't picture a guy at a keyboard near the entrance, but hey. I wasn't wow'd by this place. So it's a toss up as to if i'd come back. I wouldn't go out of my way to revisit. If anything I'd come for the coffee!:)

0.description: Cute place and some of the warmest, best service I've ever had.Went here on a groupon, and completely enjoyed the experience.It felt more authentic, in comparison to other Ethiopian restaurants I've ever been to.I only didn't like the bones in my chicken, but that's probably because we were dumb when we ordered.  A must if you're in the Edgewater area!

5.description: FANTASTIC! I've been twice and had the vegetarian sampler (for 1 the first time, then my husband and I split the platter for 2 the second time). The food is phenomenal - incredible what interesting things they can do with vegetables and lentils. If you're new to Ethiopian food, I recommend getting a sampler so you can taste lots of things. It seems like all dishes are served on this giant traditional crepe-like stuff. Then you tear off some crepe and eat the different dishes with your hands. I've had great service both times. This place is legit and delicious.

11.description: Good food but don't order delivery!   I ordered from this place twice in same week.  BOTH TIMES they got it wrong.   Manager apologized first time and said he'd include missing items on next order.  I ordered again today and they forgot again.  With delivery, each order was over  $25. Too much money for  mistakes.  I will not be ordering from them again.

8.description: Now, I'm no Ethiopian food expert, but I love this place!  I've been here numerous times and everything I've had here has been delicious.  My favorite dishes are the tibs wat, the kitfo, and the greens (I don't remember what it's called).  The lentil dish and the potatoes are also really good.  I also really enjoy the Ethiopian hot tea and honey wine. The staff here is always really nice.  Best of all, it's also pretty cheap for a sit down restaurant.  I typically end up spending about $25 and leave completely stuffed. This place is definitely my go to for Ethiopian food.

3.description: The wuss and i have been coming here together for years starting in maybe 2002. This is one if those places I like and frequent often, but never review. Now is the time to remedy that oversight.The food is all delicious. We usually get beef angar wat, stewed potatoes/carrots, lentils and chick peas. I don't know what the dishes are called. When you order an entree, the restaurant picks a side for you. The sides are as good as the entree. This time we ordered gluten free injera because the mother in law was with us. To be clear, she is not one of those cretins who falsely and without any basis in reality believes that gluten is unhealthy.  She is actually allergic to it.  If she were one of those "healthy" cretins, we would not take her to a restaurant in the first place, let alone ask for gluten free anything.  I was expecting the gluten free injera to be terrible, but I was pleasantly surprised. The wife and I noticed that the gluten free injera is more filling.

14.description: This place has gluten free injera upon request and still likely one of my top choices for Ethiopian food in town!

4.description: Traveled all the way from downtown to try out some good ol' Ethiopian food. The trip was worth it for sure.We ordered the Tour of Ethiopia- the 2nd one with more meat. Go for this if you're a newbie like me who isn't sure what to order off the menu. You get a taste of a lot of items.First off the goat is AMAZING. So juicy, succulent and flavorful. The chicken was well marinated as well. The samosas were alright, nothing out of the world.I just wish the portions of the entrees were a bit more. I did get to peep into other people's plates (yeah I'm RUDE, don't worry I'll peep into yours as well if I get the chance), and did notice that ours was a lot smaller. Wonder why.. Serving in the kitchen is done a bit random, disproportionately. But overall, it was a great experience. The server was super friendly too. Go for it

58.description: This place is terrific... I had an interview in the area so I decided to stop somewhere have lunch and ensure that I wouldn't be late. I was going to stop at the Starbucks but they were a bit crowded even though it's my normal go to place i passed. luckily just a block further was this little what I thought was a pastry shop once I entered I noticed they had a ridiculous selection of food and soy ice cream ... needless to say I enjoyed the soy ice cream it was Oreos and coffee yet I didn't spoil my appetite because I had it after I had their delicious Panini.. The staff was also extremely helpful and pleasant seeing that it was my first time they were patient. Thankfully I got the job so I'm sure I'll be seeing them for lunch quite often.

56.description: would not recommend this place the workers are racist or something, it just walked in and before I can order a drink I was told I had to buy something to get the internet code, which I felt was very rude, I requested to talk to manager and they were refusing to take my complaint, would definitely look into another establishment that treat people fair and not embarrass them in front of other customers for reasons unknown.

29.description: I love this place I go here all the time and always Bring my out if town guests. They've got great ice cream, sandwiches and sweets! My visit waS most unpleasant the other night when a police officer sporting a large assault rifle entered the shop, walked around a bit, and then hung out for a while. When I go for ice cream in my leisure time I intentionally choose fun-free environments and to have such a large weapon and huge police force presence will definitely make me think again before coming back to Zanzibar.

42.description: I disdain liars. I overheard the heavy-set blond woman tell someone all the cookies and pies were home made when she should have said they were bought frozen and baked there. I also dislike the way they treat their guests if they feel you've stayed long enough. I find the place itself to be cute and the offerings tasty but over priced, yet most people don't know about the ice cream place in the Pink Hotel, which at least has history. Spend your $5 at subway.

23.description: love this place! when I first visited I mentioned that we had just moved down the street, and they included a complimentary slice of cake with a note that said "welcome to the neighborhood" with our to-go order! one of the many reasons why I love chicago! I've been back several times already :)

47.description: This is one of my go-to ice cream spots in the summertime. Although I have not actually dined-in here, the atmosphere feels so welcoming and cozy that it definitely is on my list of places to chill out and sip tea. I've had scoops of ice cream here all last summer and they have all been delicious. Whether in a waffle cone or in a bowl, Zanzibar's ice cream is on-point. I will most definitely be back again once summer arrives. This is my little neighborhood ice cream shop

8.description: I'd come here any day, over Starbucks. They have internet connection, ice cream, food, and it's very peaceful. I love the peanut butter & jelly sandwiches. The internet signal is a lot better than Starbucks also.

31.description: The food is good. The ice cream is better. My only complaint is the sides they serve with the sandwiches. Sometimes the portions are completely inconsistent. You either get a tablespoon of potato salad or a ton of chips.  The staff is very friendly.

34.description: I live about 30 seconds away from this place, which is very dangerous for me, because I LOVE IT. Walls covered with work from local artists, friendly staff, delicious sandwiches, great coffee drinks, and an ice cream setup that is much more deluxe than you'd guess from the outside. They also offer watermelon slices as a side in the summer, which is not only tastier and healthier than the standard bag of chips, but kind of makes you feel like your mom sent you to day camp with a lovingly-packed bag lunch. My one and only complaint is that I don't really like the way they do the eggs for the breakfast sandwiches, but that's probably a good thing or I'd be in there twice a day.

16.description: I noticed this place a little while ago when my love and I were out for a walk. He told me that they're "pretty good, but they're a little on the expensive side".  So when I was out for a walk on my own, I decided to give this place a try. Upon entering, I was greeted by one of the staff members, who eventually helped me out in ordering a great meal. The place itself was pretty cozy.  They do offer free wifi, which means this place would be an excellent place for studying, reading a good book, or getting some work done if you don't feel like doing it at home. It was also very clean.I was pleasantly surprised by the food. Usually when I order food from a coffee shop, it's on the decent side, but its nothing spectacular. The food is very delicious! I honestly couldn't believe how yummy it was when I took my first bite out of my sandwich. And the strawberry cheesecake I had was heavenly!!My boyfriend was right, they are on the pricy side, but you do get what you pay for (in my opinion). The food and coffee are delicious so it was well worth it. I'm looking forward to trying another sandwich here in the near future.

13.description: They have the BEST icecream in the world. Always so fresh and always such a variety in flavors. I've also been there for lunch and their paninis are fantastic. They use top quality ingredients and it does not go unnoticed. I love Zanzibar!

11.description: After supporting (sadly) Starbucks down the block for years, I've switched (happily) to Zanzibar, and I'm so glad I did.  The food and coffee are great, and the service is invariably excellent.  Plus, I'm supporting a local business, and not a giant corporation.  Lastly, when I order something at Zanzibar, I get a smile and a thank you.  At Starbucks, I get a "Anything else?" as they try to increase the sale.Hooray for Zanzibar !

39.description: The almond croissants are the greatest thing ever. Really. They will change your life. Good coffee and fun assortment of baked goods and rotating cakes and pies. The ice cream almost appears to be gourmet or specialty but it's not. Kind of tasteless and disappointing. I work real close so I go a lot. One disturbing  thing is I have seen is they put out chocolate covered strawberries sometimes, like on Friday, and then when I went back Monday they were still there looking old ish. Guy in front of me bought two and as the barista packed them up there was mold on them and he didn't notice or say anything. Ugh. Disgusted. Also they get fancy cupcakes in sometimes and they look bad and wilted after two days of sitting there, but people still get them. Maybe it's just going there so often and seeing the treats age over the week is turning me off. They have almost no gluten free options for lunch unless you want salad. Just lots of sandwiches. Staff is nice enough I guess. This place is huge and good for small groups. Wouldn't be easy to bring a big group.

37.description: I noticed this place a little while ago when my love and I were out for a walk. He told me that they're "pretty good, but they're a little on the expensive side".  So when I was out for a walk on my own, I decided to give this place a try. Upon entering, I was greeted by one of the staff members, who eventually helped me out in ordering a great meal. The place itself was pretty cozy.  They do offer free wifi, which means this place would be an excellent place for studying, reading a good book, or getting some work done if you don't feel like doing it at home.
