It was also very clean.I was pleasantly surprised by the food. Usually when I order food from a coffee shop, it's on the decent side, but its nothing spectacular. The food is very delicious! I honestly couldn't believe how yummy it was when I took my first bite out of my sandwich. And the strawberry cheesecake I had was heavenly!!My boyfriend was right, they are on the pricy side, but you do get what you pay for (in my opinion). The food and coffee are delicious so it was well worth it. I'm looking forward to trying another sandwich here in the near future.

0.description: This is one of our favorite neighborhood restaurants. The wife introduced me to this place a hundred years ago and I have been coming here with her ever since. The coffee (Uncommon Ground) and other caffeinated drinks are good. This is the kind of place where people hang around for hours with their Macs or reading. We have been here for ice cream, other desserts, breakfast and lunch.  Breakfast is unremarkable, but good enough.  I have had breakfast sandwiches here that are okay. Importantly, the breakfast sandwiches are not burnt, which is increasingly unusual.  The ice cream is good and there is a pretty good selection.  We have tried a number of the flavors. No complaints.Today we went for lunch.  I ordered the Edgewater Melt with tuna.  It came out hot and was quite good.  My wife ordered the the Hollywood, which is a ham and havarti sandwich.  She called it awesome.  We have had other sandwiches here, including grilled cheese and some veggie. All that we have tried have been good.

38.description: A cute neighborhood coffeeshop. I like their icecream but it seems to be a bit overpriced. I would recommend their paninis! My husband loves their roast beef panini and i've tried all their vegetarian ones and they taste good.This place is a go to for me on gloomy cold winter afternoons, they offer free wi-fi and decent coffe. But i have to add that they turn off their panini grills about half an hour before shutting down and turn off the wi-fi 15 minutes before shutting down. So you definitely don't want to get here before that!

51.description: Awesome cake and pastries, Good breakfast items and not too busy. One of my favorite spots to do work.

27.description: Having lived here for more than a year now, this place is my spot. I will often grab a coffee and almond croissant on my way to work and stop in for soup or chili on the weekends. It's so delicious and that staff is great. I just picked up my Thanksgiving dessert this morning: pumpkin spice bars and a quart of the snap-o-lantern ice cream (drooling).

32.description: The ice cream is great.  It's 4 bucks for a cone but it is a HUGE cone, so you get what you pay for.  It's a great neighborhood location, lots of people were studying or working.  I've only tried one warm sandwich, and it was good, but a bit pricey.  The staff are sweet, not rude or standoffish.  Definitely an excellent and one-of-a-kind place to have in the neighborhood though the prices are a bit on the higher side.

54.description: I'd definitely deem it as one of my favorite coffee shops. The breakfast panini's are served until 12 p.m. and are incredible. Try the Western Egg Panini (scrambled eggs, roasted red peppers, red onions, cheddar cheese, chipotle mayo on grilled italian bread). I also get a cup of Hazelnut Coffee on the side too. Good spot to grab some breakfast and a good read before starting work.  The booths are spacious so it's an ideal study spot too. The friendly staff doesn't mind how long you stay there. Enjoy it :)

48.description: Seems to be going downhill as of late.

44.description: I'm a fan if Zanzibar. They have unique flavors and very helpful staff. They have a large sitting area and are friendly to customers. I'm a big fan of their strawberry cheesecake ice cream. I also get their milkshakes but usually ask they they make it out of milk or soy mill instead of half and half. It's too rich for me if half and half is used. Still, a great place to go in Edgewater during the summer.

24.description: There chicken salad sandwiches are to die for. The food here is all around excellent! When i first got my sandwich, i thought it would be to big for me to eat. When i took my first bite, i knew i would be able to eat all of it, even if i stuffed myself silly! The downside is they only let you use their Internet for 2 hours, they don't have much seating with outlets, and their cappuccinos were only ok. Overall, this place is a solid 4 stars, but not 5.

7.description: This place has a little bit of everything. They serve Uncommon Ground coffee, sandwiches, salads, cake, pie and macarons. What really excited me is the Chocolate ice cream from Wisconsin. I tried several flavors but decided on a mixed pint(sooo glad that's an option) of chocolate and bourbon pecan pie. My friends this is some delicious ice cream! The prices are about what I would expect -pint $7.59, coffee 12 oz $1.89, sandwiches/salads starting at around $7(if memory serves me correctly). There is booth seating and they also have bathrooms which to me is important to mention in case one is looking for a place to sit awhile and sip java. The staff was pretty nice too.  I'll be returning for some more of that bourbon pecan ice cream.

49.description: Vegan ice cream. Sometimes have vegan pastries if they're not sold out. Free Wi-Fi (though apparently now timed?). Sandwiches aren't great. When we were there, someone was on the other side of the booth on her cell and we could hear everything (we weren't trying to eavesdrop I promise).

40.description: Great little neighborhood coffee shop! Did not have anything but a cup of coffee but my friend who is a regular let me try the scone and it was great. Coffee wasn't bad either. Great change up from the other option right down the block (Starbucks). I will definitely be back. As I can see now Zanzibar is more than a coffee shop and I would like to try their other options. Friendly staff as well!

53.description: Zanzibar is decent, clean, and has an outdoors area with a good location for people watching the folks going from the train to the beach and back.  The food is average and reminds me of a Panera.

30.description: I Love this place! probably spend to much money, but I digress. The staff is super friendly and its a great place for coffee, I would also def recommend the pesto grilled cheese. OMG. so good.

46.description: The food here is good and service is ok. Prices are extremely high for a deli style restaurant.

1.description: The good-the food.  The Broadway Beef is my favorite.  The roast beef is fresh, I love the horseradish sauce, and the bread is fresh.  Plus, I don' t know what brand of chips they use but they're great.  The Lakewood uses fresh turkey, love the havarti, but I wish it had a good sauce like the Broadway does.  Their grilled cheese is yummy.  And great milkshakes.Now, the bad-the service.  Wed. night (Dec.30) I was in there with a friend.  The guy behind the counter (25 if he's a day), was busy talking to a cop who was sitting at the window drinking coffee.  He saw us enter and resumed speaking to the cop.  My friend and I stood there looking at the menu.  And stood there...and stood there.  Now, we're both in our early 50's and I know we don't register in this guy's radar for anything but we are customers.  The girl who was busy making food kept glancing at us and glancing at him, gave us a weak smile and kept looking over at the guy but she was busy making other people's food.  He finally ambled over to us.  No hello, no what would you like, just stood there looking at us like we were the biggest nuisance to him.  The only response we got was the total of our meal.  And then, I watched him bring everyone's meal out to the booths where they were sitting but our meal was brought to the counter and he just yelled "Your sandwiches."  I assume he has, perhaps, father issues but don't take them out on the customers. I might suggest a re-training for him or perhaps another line of work where he doesn't have to interact with humans.

55.description: Great atmosphere and delicious food and coffee. I love local spots and this is one I will frequent often. Staff is friendly and offer great recommendations. I feel prices are fair for the food you enjoy. I do wish you could tip on card- so bring cash when coming here!

9.description: This is a Great Place for Breakfast, brunch and what not.They could make really spicy ...They really care and they have different options. You could be new, but they really take care and very nice. They can make a Special Sandwich really good for 5 dollar 25 cents approximately....this is best you can get ..I go there on weekends. i was there on September 27 2015 , again on 10/3 and 10/4/2015. They can add special flavors too. They also have Ice creams which are Sugar free- amazing.. Melissa is super quiet, nice, workaholic...sincere, honest and good. Niko Capello goes out of the way to come and give on your table-he does not need...he travels extra mile. Ken did a great job on the first day without knowing me... Mahir did really well on Saturday. Other manager to mention is Donna..she looks tough but a very nice girl. She means business only:) No joking around:)

26.description: I'm so thankful that Zanzi is my neighborhood coffee spot. The workers are so friendly, the food is so yummy and the coffee has all the right stuff.

25.description: I went to Zanzibar to grab coffee, lunch and read for a bit.  It was the perfect spot to do so. Ordered, from a semi small but decent menu, and then found a cozy booth. I did have to move a cup and some garbage before sitting down.There isn't a lot of seating and the booths seemed to be in high demand. I didn't have to wait long for my sandwich and side salad, which was brought to me. The sandwhich was wonderful. It was served with chips and a pickle. I ordered the side salad as well. It was fresh and crisp. The service (despite it being right around the holidays) was what you would expect from a smallish sandwich/bake/ice cream shop. Since I'd been glaring at the ice cream for a while I got a scoop and stayed a little longer. It was well worth the calorie indulgence. I highly recommend having coffee with ice cream. So yummy.

12.description: Very cute little spot. Went one morning for a quick to go breakfast and chai and was very impressed. Service was quick and prices were descent. Definitely coming back because the chai is as good as Starbucks **street parking is not easy during the rush which the only down side.

59.description: Nice local coffee shop with paninis, baked goods, and ice cream.  Multiple vegetarian options.  Good coffee-better than spending your money at Starbucks down the street.  Pros: Lending library of books..Booths to sit in.Spacious.Friendly staff.Tasty food and drink.Vegan options.Cons:Slightly pricey, but it's what you'd expect to spend for anything comparable.

21.description: My favorite place to go in Edgewater for sandwiches. I have never experienced a rude employee and they have never messed up my order. The place is always clean ! It's also a great place to study (free wifi). Zanzibar definitely sets the bar for other small businesses.

17.description: Sandwiches are crap. I've been told they're "cutting costs". I wish it wasn't blatantly at the expense of their sandwiches. I've tried several different kinds since I noticed the downturn in hopes I'm just imagining things, and I can safely say the quality here is poor. Not worth anywhere near what they're charging. Still a nice space for a coffee and a chat.

10.description: A really chill vibe with great tasting food and extra friendly staff. I had the pleasure of being serviced by an Asian male employee (don't know the name). Made my experience better. I love their cheesecake.

5.description: I went to Zanzibar to grab coffee, lunch and read for a bit.  It was the perfect spot to do so. Ordered, from a semi small but decent menu, and then found a cozy booth. I did have to move a cup and some garbage before sitting down.There isn't a lot of seating and the booths seemed to be in high demand. I didn't have to wait long for my sandwich and side salad, which was brought to me. The sandwhich was wonderful. It was served with chips and a pickle. I ordered the side salad as well. It was fresh and crisp. The service (despite it being right around the holidays) was what you would expect from a smallish sandwich/bake/ice cream shop. Since I'd been glaring at the ice cream for a while I got a scoop and stayed a little longer. It was well worth the calorie indulgence. I highly recommend having coffee with ice cream. So yummy.

3.description: Sad assortment of pastry for 7:30 am, but they make good coffee and the menu looks good.

35.description: Zanzibar took awhile to grow on me, but now that I frequent this place more often, it is one of my favorite establishments on Bryn Mawr.  For starters, the sandwiches are good.  Like really, really good.  And I love their potato salad as a side.  The salads and breakfast sandwiches are tasty too.  They also have an array of decadent treats, ranging from ice cream, cakes, tarts, breakfast pastries and other assorted goods.  Their competitor a few blocks down does have a good amount of baked goods, but this place is the overall better spot for an after-dinner treat.   They brew Uncommon Grounds, which is a fine cup of regular coffee, but I am not too keen on the cafe drinks.  My initial disappointment with Zanzibar came from trying a few drinks off the cafe menu and they don't do this as well as other coffee establishments in the area.  But the food is so good and the selection is great that I have learned to overlook this.  Overall, I really do like Zanzibar and think it makes a nice cozy spot to grab a casual lunch, dessert or even to study.

19.description: Zanzibar cafe is a nice place with friendly employees. I go to this place mostly to study. They are open until 9 pm. I like their almond sweet stuffs with tea. Once I tried bread with scrambled egg,spinach and feta cheese in breakfast menu. I think it's name was Grecian. Taste was not bad.

28.description: Similar to Elizabeth W's review, Zanzi wasn't an absolute favorite of mine right away, in large part because of very average coffee and hot drinks.  So it's not what I go there for anymore.  I go for the fantastic sandwiches, paninis, and salads!!  The toasty Western breakfast sandwich with its fluffy eggs, crisp red onion and bell peppers, chipotle sauce, and cheddar cheese on grilled white (sourdough??) bread is what's inspiring me to create a Yelp list of breakfast sandwich places.  My bf showed me this place - and the Western - and it's been a standby ever since.  Also check out the tuna salad.  On a salad that has cherry vinaigrette dressing.  Amazinggggg.Very friendly, accommodating, and cool staff.  Haven't tried the sweets or ice cream but I don't need to, I love your savory food more than enough!

45.description: This place feels nice -- spacious, clean, well decorated, lots of spacious seating... etc. Prices are ridiculously  high.  A small Americano, veggie panini (totally underwhelming sandwich, by the way), and a tart ran me $17! Ouch. The sandwich was way under filled and not made with proper panini-style bread --though it was toasty, the multi-grain bun of sorts that was used didn't show any signs of being pressed in a panini grill. Wifi sloooooooow!

33.description: Please don't get any espresso drinks here as they don't know how to make them. Coffee grinds are not tamped enough leading to a watered down drink. Nor do they know the difference between a cappuccino and latte. Boo!

43.description: A cute little shoppe with ANAZING dessert creations. Their sabdwiches are named after the streets in the area. A superb place for getting lunch to picnic along the lakefront!

2.description: I've been here a few times because I live in the neighborhood and every time I visit the staff does something that is not conducive to a pleasant customer experience.  On my 1st attempt to work here an employee started mopping around my feet and splashing water everywhere in the middle of the day.  Another employee decided to kill time my staring at me while I worked which creeped me out after 30 mins so I moved to another table.  On my 2nd attempt to work here the owners had a loud spat across from me. They were loud enough to drown out the music playing through my noise isolating headphones. :(PROS:Large tables/booths that are very comfortable Decent bathrooms that are close to the seating areaGood coffeeA good selection of savory and sweet items on the menuFree Wi-Fi  CONS:Wi-Fi is spotty even with a handful of customersNot enough power outlets and none that I could find by the booths at allSandwiches are a bit pricey for the amount of toppings and only chips on the sideIt's loud - the speakers are loud and the staff likes to talk over the speakers at times.  Staff members like to people watch inside the shop when they are idle which sucks if you're the object of their attention and an introvert like myself I probably won't be back to work here because it's just too loud.  Even with noise canceling earbuds in I can hear the clanging of dishes and pans in the food prep area.

18.description: There chicken salad sandwiches are to die for. The food here is all around excellent! When i first got my sandwich, i thought it would be to big for me to eat. When i took my first bite, i knew i would be able to eat all of it, even if i stuffed myself silly! The downside is they only let you use their Internet for 2 hours, they don't have much seating with outlets, and their cappuccinos were only ok. Overall, this place is a solid 4 stars, but not 5.

41.description: I think it's an average neighborhood coffee shop. Interior is mediocre. The hard booths are not...that great. I don't think this place is really conducive to "studying" but perhaps just meeting up with friends for an hour or so. The price point is quite good and the panini was good too, but not spectacular. I would probably frequent this place if I lived nearby, but otherwise I don't foresee schlepping myself to Bryn Mawr to come here.

52.description: Terric food, great location, nice atmosphere! Great space and nice place to have a conversation or catch up on school or work studies!

50.description: They have a great set of staff The cafe itself could be so much better in terms of prices as well as its seating arrangementAnd one would think the Wifi should be faster now with timed passwords.. But its not !

4.description: I realized my last review was from 2010! This is my neighborhood spot. Great sandwiches, pastry and desserts, not to mention their amazing ice-cream from Wisconsin. I go there weekly to work and meet people. Most of the staff (although young) has been there for years, what for me, means the place is well-managed.

6.description: I'm sure it's fine, but they refuse to serve breakfast sandwiches after noon.  On a Sunday.  When half the population wants breakfast.  Because microwaving fake eggs is just too much to ask if it's 12:45 p.m.  had to scramble - no pun intended - to find something in the area that wasnt Starbucks or Dunkin' Donuts, and luckily, found my way into Lovely Two, which was a great find (and they serve breakfast sandwiches all day).

22.description: This place has a little bit of everything. They serve Uncommon Ground coffee, sandwiches, salads, cake, pie and macarons. What really excited me is the Chocolate ice cream from Wisconsin. I tried several flavors but decided on a mixed pint(sooo glad that's an option) of chocolate and bourbon pecan pie. My friends this is some delicious ice cream! The prices are about what I would expect -pint $7.59, coffee 12 oz $1.89, sandwiches/salads starting at around $7(if memory serves me correctly). There is booth seating and they also have bathrooms which to me is important to mention in case one is looking for a place to sit awhile and sip java. The staff was pretty nice too.  I'll be returning for some more of that bourbon pecan ice cream.

15.description: Good coffee, enjoyed the atmosphere, lots of nice sitting space, staff seemed friendly. Problem - spotty internet. Needed to get some serious work done and was booted repeatedly every 10 minutes or so. Very frustrating. That's a top priority for me in a coffee shop, so will limit in how often I visit.

57.description: I went in here to just get a scoop of ice cream and sit for a while.  This is cute cafe. I didn't get a chance to try out their food but their prices seem a tad high and I can probably get something better for the same down the street.   But the ambiance is nice and the staff were friendly towards me.

20.description: An absolute Edgewater treasure!  Great coffee, wonderful food!  Yummy ice cream, cakes and pies and a very friendly staff.  Comfortable inside and out.  And!  She doesn't know it, but the owner Helen is my new girl friend....:)  I highly recommend this place!

36.description: Fun, varied sandwich menu and good coffee. Ice cream is good and the cakes look very nice, though i havent tried them yet. Wifi cuts off at 2 hours, so not a "hang around all afternoon" kind of place.

14.description: Great for getting an ice cream treat. Sandwiches and soups OK. Feels really pricey for what you get. They host birthday parties. Good place for local families with little kids.

28.description: Nothing negative to say. A few friends and I went out originally looking to go to Leonardo's Ristorante, located next door to Antica's. Upon seeing it was closed due to the owners being on vacation, we ducked into the Pizzeria next door. We were immediately welcomed warmly by everyone. We took a seat and realized we were the only patrons there, but it was near closing time. The place is beautiful, brick and low light. We ordered wine and food, and everything came out fast and absolutely delicious. I had shrimp penne, others had pizza and the filet and nobody had any complaints. The staff was very animated, talking in loud Italian and laughing and drinking wine themselves. We wanted to head out as not to keep the staff past closing, but they heard we were celebrating a birthday and brought us tiramisu with a candle and sang happy birthday in Italian. Our waitress was so fun, she said her English wasn't great, and the next minute she was singing a Kansas song that came over the speakers. So glad we ended up here, would recommend to anyone.

1.description: I just ordered again from here and the service and food was way below average. Last time I ordered a pizza and they forgot some of the ingredients. This time I ordered the lasagna and it was not what it described on the menu. This is cafeteria quality at best or by can Chef Boyardee. I paid $5 to have it delivered by Door Dash. No napkins, nothing. I just called the restaurant and the manager yelled over the noise and told me"if you don't like it don't order from here." He then hung up the phone on me.There food may be better at the restaurant but I live in the neighborhood and will never order here again based on the their rudeness and poor quality of food. Btw-I got a large slice of lasagna with no cheese that cost me $25. I wouldn't even give them 1 star but you have to select one. Not a happy camper on a cold night looking for some authentic, Italian food.

39.description: No longer BYOB.  Dock 1 star for that plus the fact that our waitress was very rude about it when we showed up with wine - sorry we didn't get the memo!  She was also  giving me skeptical looks about my request for no cheese on anything, mild dairy intolerance over here.... thanks. I'm chalking that one up to an off night, because we come here a decent amount. Otherwise, this is still a great place for Italian. I'm partial to the pizza and appetizers.  Haven't experimented with much the entrees but I'm sure they are yummy as well.  Seating wise, it can be crowded on the weekends, so make a reservation if you are coming during prime hours.  There isn't really a good waiting area if you are a walk-in.

9.description: Delicious authentic Italian pizza! The crust was perfect. The toppings were fresh and flavorful.  We also tried the asparagus salad which was so good! I am so glad we found this place and will definitely be going back!

29.description: As of  a few months ago, this place is no longer BYOB. Makes no difference to me but actually makes it easier for my friends who like to all drink different things with their meal. I continue to be impressed by Mario and his staff as they always ensure an outstanding dining experience.

23.description: I have always been a fan of this restaurant. The whole menu is delicious, from their pastas to their pizzas, and so on. I just recently dined here last weekend, after not visiting for close to two years. The food did not disappoint yet again. I did, however, become a little irritated about one thing. Since the place is BYOB, and always has been, they decided to start charging a corkage fee (the server said they started it about a year ago). This is not stated on their website, which is frustrating. We had a table of six on Saturday night, so had a couple bottles of wine with us. They then stated that they charge per bottle as well, not just a one time fee for corkage. It is $15 per normal sized bottle, and $20 per larger bottle. I understand restaurants needing to do this since they are BYOB, but let's not get carried away now. So our table ended up just opening up one of the bottles for dinner and took the other one back home. You are a great restaurant, Antica, but please fix your new rules with your BYOB (that are not stated on your website either).Thank you.

5.description: First of all . . . a $15 corkage fee?! I actually asked the waiter if he was kidding on that one. He wasn't. That part is WAY out of line when you're toting a $7.99 bottle of wine. So, we saved our wine and got vodka drinks there instead, for what we would have paid for a corkage fee - and all was right again. It's almost like they're trying to phase out the BYOB aspect of this restaurant, and that's a shame.That said, we came here on a reco of friends (M&L!) who know their pizza. And the pizza was spot on. We got the ham, artichoke, mushroom - and it was delicious. The bread was great too, made in the same brick over as the pizza. Absolutely loved it - the pizza was juicy, cheesy and piping hot. Really great - it rivals Apart for my favorite pizza in the neighborhood. Prices were great too, we got out of there for under $50 for two. Waiter was friendly and attentive. The decor . . . whatever, it's a real nothing there - but you aren't eating the decor. You should come here and eat their pizza, it's worth visiting again for that.

31.description: Wow, give me the Isola Bella pizza as a gift if you ever want to woo me - because that 'za was some of the most delicious I've ever had. The butternut squash played off the olives and tomatoes in a wonderful way; sweetness mixing with the acidity of the tomatoes and salt of the olives. I drool at the thought.We waltzed in at 7 p.m. on Friday night (5 of us) and were promptly seated and welcomed by our friendly server. It's a little loud inside, due to the open nature of the restaurant, but it's cozy and dimly lit, so what's a little noise? We did have to wave our waiter down for wine he forgot and then to get the bill, but I'm not letting that knock my experience too much - I'll definitely be back!

25.description: Antica Pizzeria is one of the best pizza places I've been to in the city! It's an authentic Italian style pizza on an artisan crust. The crust is crispy on the bottom, soft on the top and very light.The atmosphere is very warm and cozy. This place would be perfect for a date, a romantic evening or a small party with friends.  It's in the north part of Andersonville so you'll find a good mix of people and ages.I went with the pizza because it's a pizzeria.  I got the margarita pizza and it was simply amazing.  The mozzarella cheese was in the perfect amount making it a perfect addition to the overall flavor.  They have some Italian beers in the bottle if you're interested in something crisp and light.I would recommend trying it if your in the area or even if your not. It's a good pizza that won't leave you feeling weighed down.

12.description: I really enjoyed my overall experience from the service to the food. I was greeted  promptly and seated for my reservation and the waitress could not have been nicer or more authentic; real Italian that knows her food and wine.  So don't be afraid to ask for recommendations. The pizza was excellent thin-woodfired-goodness. The salads were fresh and delicious. And the pastas are really well done and flavorful.  It's nice to experience such a well run family run establishment. I will definitely be back.

37.description: F this place. Haven't been in for a while but always liked it because the pizza was excellent, they were BYOB and they were usually not too crowded. The staff was always pleasant, the owner slung pizza in the back, always visited the tables to check on patron's meals. After having not been in over a year we came in tonight and brought some beer. We learned that they now had wine (fairly expensive) and beer (crap and Italian). We also couldn't get a straight answer about the fees to bring our own, other than an exorbitant $15 corkage fee for wine. Turns out there was a $3 per beer fee. We ordered, we ate, it was all very quick because that's how you go to restaurants when you have a 2-year-old. He was well-behaved, he wasn't screaming or yelling, he wasn't walking around, he wasn't throwing stuff. I'm not one of those halfwits who thinks their child doesn't misbehave, or who thinks every scream and yell should be recorded for posterity because it's so precious. But my son was not misbehaving. Towards the end of the meal, as we waited for a rather long time for them to take our check and give us change our son started to get antsy. He yelled a few times, so my wife took him out of his chair and he walked towards the front door where he stood waving goodbye to people, or rather persons because the place was pretty empty. In fact he waved goodbye to two people who left. At this time the owner was standing at the hostess station, leaning on it, looking not amused because a child was standing there really doing nothing. He frankly looked pretty annoyed. He was wincing like he was getting a rectal exam actually. My son let out a few more yells and that's when the owner decided that he needed to tell us that we need to keep our child quiet, because people were trying to enjoy their meal. He had made a few noises, I didn't see anyone complain and I think I would have known because there were only two other occupied tables and one of them also had a young child at their table. So my wife picked our son up and told the owner that we were just trying to pay our check, and the owner kept hounding us about keeping our son quiet. Again, I'm not some halfwit who can't recognize when my child is misbehaving. I'm not the kind of idiot who would bring a toddler to Alinea, or any kind of fancy, quiet restaurant. But this place has many high chairs, and often has many kids in the restaurant when we have been in the past. I'm not sure if business is bad and the owner just feels like being a smug dick to everyone, but that's what we experienced tonight and it was unfortunate, because I would tell anyone I knew about how great their brick-oven pizza was, how it wasn't anywhere near as crowded as some of the other brick-oven places in Chicago, how they were BYOB and it was a very casual, friendly environment. So in closing a big F you to the prick owner of this place, who is shown in the foreground of at least one of the photos on the Yelp review. Don't go here if you have kids who make a few noises during dinner because you'll incur the wrath of an asshole who seems mad that his restaurant isn't very full, or that people don't want to spend way too much money on his wine and bad beer.

21.description: This is one of those reviews that I'm afraid to write. I'm fiercely protective of what is really our favorite neighborhood restaurant, but they deserve the business. So, here I am.We've lived in Andersonville for years, and this is one of the places we go to again and again and again. In fact, it's probably one of the places we've been to the most in Chicago, and that's saying a lot; we like to try new eats, and we don't often go back to the same place twice.However, several times a year--and when we have company in town--we often find ourselves making our way down to Antica.Why do we love it so much? Oh, let me count the ways.First, the service is OUTSTANDING. I mean, really, they fawn over you. The waitstaff is professional and kind and efficient. My mom dropped something out of her purse while we were dining there today, and our waiter came over to pick it up before she even had a chance to bend over.Also, Mario, the owner, is always there. He will great you with a smile and a buttery Italian accent as soon as you walk in the door, and he'll make sure you've had a good time.The vibe of the restaurant is cozy and homey and oh-so-welcoming. It really feels like a family-owned neighborhood restaurant.But the food, of course, is the real star. The pizza, which is fired in their large pizza oven, is my favorite in the city. The crust is thin and floppy, the edges are blistered, and the toppings are fresh.They also have the best Italian salads and pastas I've had in the city. Every time I go, I find myself saying, "This is just like the Italian food I grew up with!"They regularly change specials, have a large menu, have delicious homemade desserts, and are reasonably priced. Truthfully, I can't think of a bad thing to say about this place. Just go--you'll have a good time and a great meal. And you, too, will be back!

16.description: FYI: They were taking reservations in Oct 2013. Not sure of that is still the case.On our first visit in July 2013, enjoyed 2 of the best Neopolitan pizzas I've had in Chicago- the Margherita and a special summer/fall pizza with sweet potatoes and fennel sausage. Everything was perfect- from food, service, timing, and ambiance, up to and including payment and boxing my (extensive) left-over pizza. The prices are very reasonable and the pizzas were just the right size for a single meal or sharing. On the second visit with a group of 5 in October 2013, we brought our own bottle, not realizing the policy had changed. We did not realize they took reservations when we decided to come in on a Friday with no reservation. Manager seemed irritated but he accommodated us. The food was even better than we remembered- Pere e Gorgonzola, Pappardelle con Costicine di Manzo, and two other pizzas. I don't remember exactly which pizzas, but I do know they were still the best I've had in Chicago. Our server was great and the manager (Mario) was very friendly, with the exception of his initial annoyance at our being there without a reservation. Next time, and I hope it is soon, I'll be sure to make a reservation.

17.description: My favorite Neapolitan style pizza in Chicago.  Other places, including Coalfire and Spacca, are a bit overrated.   I get a food high every time I eat here.

10.description: Antica Pizzeria is one of the best pizza places I've been to in the city! It's an authentic Italian style pizza on an artisan crust. The crust is crispy on the bottom, soft on the top and very light.The atmosphere is very warm and cozy. This place would be perfect for a date, a romantic evening or a small party with friends.  It's in the north part of Andersonville so you'll find a good mix of people and ages.I went with the pizza because it's a pizzeria.  I got the margarita pizza and it was simply amazing.  The mozzarella cheese was in the perfect amount making it a perfect addition to the overall flavor.  They have some Italian beers in the bottle if you're interested in something crisp and light.I would recommend trying it if your in the area or even if your not. It's a good pizza that won't leave you feeling weighed down.

11.description: OMG! Loved the pizza at Antica Pizzeria. Had been trying to make my way here, and when Pork Shoppe opened the other night and we couldn't wait 1/2 hour, then we just walked on over. The pistachio, arugula and speck pizza was beyond delicious. The thin crust was blistered, crispy and chewy -- all at the same time -- I'm longing for one right now. I ordered a bowl of zucchini soup, which was good, especially with the roasted crouton on top.And the waiter, while busy with our table of five and other customers, was helpful. We had to hurry to get to a play at Raven, and really forgot to mention that up front -- our bad:-)

26.description: While looking for a place on my phone using Yelp app in Andersonville, I found this Pizza place to be best rated. As I sit on the table super high price on corkage fee was very surprising. 15$ for corkage fee is little too over priced in my opinion. Second very surprising fact of this night was the fact waitress trying so hard to talk to a point that I could tell she was not Italian, which is not a big deal, in fact nice that she tries for working at an Italian restaurant but this made it impossible for me to communicate with her. I got Spinach salad, which was to be honest interesting for the fact that it had some crispy walnuts. Pizza I ordered was Pepperoni and Red pepper Pizza. It was around 14" good for one person or along with a salad can fill two person comfortably. Though, there were around 4-5 slices of pepperoni on the pizza in total so their pizza did not make me happy either. Overall my experience with this place was not good. It's very discouraging to check new restaurants in my neighborhood with their rating nowadays since, I have no idea how, some restaurants get higher rating but provide more expensive, money oriented and customer satisfaction is not as important, as I had this impression.

27.description: This place is great! Went here last night with a friend for the first time. We started off with the bruschetta appetizer, and it was amazing. I loved how it was actually real chunks of tomato, instead of the random, perfectly formed cubes of tomato like at some other places. The pizza was also amazing; crispy crust with a soft middle was perfect!It's a quaint little place where everyone is friendly, the waitress was awesome, and you can tell they really care about their business and know their way around Italian food. I'll definitely be back!

35.description: Very poor service and used to be a BYOB and major attitude if you didn't know and happen to bring in a bottle. The staff will get to you eventually, if they aren't busy talking. There are much better places to go in Andersonville.I wouldn't recommend it unless you are walking, no transportation, and are already a few glasses in.

8.description: We enjoyed the experience at this restaurant (located north side -quite side of Andersonville).We had grilled calamari, Fattoressa piza ( the Sicilian special) and the pasta Penn con crema di pistachio!Food: Excellent Service : Excellent Ambience : GreatPrice: Fair We recommend to others and will go back there again soon.

0.description: yum yum yummy food with the most charming service... if you're not in the neighborhood it is totally worth traveling to... the food is very fresh and prepared daily... the ambience is casual and dimly lit good for a date or a relaxing meal with friends the tables can easily be pushed together to accommodate larger parties

38.description: Their pizza really is authentic Napoli style pizza. It's thin and taste fresh out of the oven! The toppings offer a wide variety of flavors, from meaty and salty to cheesy and savory. The sauce tastes great and fresh as well. There is nothing I can complain about except for the fact that the amount of toppings and freshness kinda leaves the crust too soft to pick up a slice without everything sliding off of it or it falling apart. This seems to be a natural part of the Napoli style, as it happened when I had some at Eately. The best thing to do is eat it with a knife and fork. It's that good!I will be back and might try the pasta, but the pizza is so darn good it's hard to pass up. The food isn't the only thing about this place that makes it so wonderful to visit. The people make you feel like family with their warm, welcoming spirit and service. I highly recommend this place especially if you are not the deep dish kinda pizza guy or gal.

20.description: Went there for dinner on Saturday night.  It wasn't full, and we were given a table by the kitchen.  All was well... pretty good starter, and then a steak with spinach.  Both tasted good.  But halfway through my entree there was a huge wave of cleaning fluid smell -- they had started to clean the kitchen at 10 pm on a Saturday night.  It was pretty nauseating, and put me right off my food.  The bus boy came by, and I asked him to wrap what I hadn't had a chance to eat.  I told our waiter what had happened, and he apologized and said that the kitchen "did what they wanted!"  He asked if I'd like to speak to the manager (owner?).  When he came over he was immediately aggressive.  I told him what happened, and he started yelling at me that I should have asked to be moved when the cleaning fluids started to mess with my senses, that this was my own fault, and that he bore no responsibility!  What a thoroughly unpleasant person.  That guy needs to do a refresher course at charm school.  Definitely my first and last time at Antica.

19.description: Their pizza really is authentic Napoli style pizza. It's thin and taste fresh out of the oven! The toppings offer a wide variety of flavors, from meaty and salty to cheesy and savory. The sauce tastes great and fresh as well. There is nothing I can complain about except for the fact that the amount of toppings and freshness kinda leaves the crust too soft to pick up a slice without everything sliding off of it or it falling apart. This seems to be a natural part of the Napoli style, as it happened when I had some at Eately. The best thing to do is eat it with a knife and fork. It's that good!I will be back and might try the pasta, but the pizza is so darn good it's hard to pass up. The food isn't the only thing about this place that makes it so wonderful to visit. The people make you feel like family with their warm, welcoming spirit and service. I highly recommend this place especially if you are not the deep dish kinda pizza guy or gal.

33.description: Ordered to pick up margherita, sausage and mushroom, and ham. Coming from ny with high pizza standards, this was delicious! Classic style Italian pizza.

2.description: To the owner: not sure if you've actually read some of the other reviews but there at least 2 that have commented on your anti-sound policy coming out of children. To refresh your memory, here are some quotes: "My son let out a few more yells and that's when the owner decided that he needed to tell us that we need to keep our child quiet, because people were trying to enjoy their meal...I'm not sure if business is bad and the owner just feels like being a smug dick to everyone, but that's what we experienced tonight and it was unfortunate." "Sometimes a business has to have a little people manners and its not always about the food."

34.description: Here is the basics:Loved: the staff (they are fantastic), BYOB, atmosphere, fresh fresh calamari, pizza (we tried two different ones and went with the staff recommendations)The negative was the tart for dessert. It just wasn't that good.  We will be back, I'd like to try the pasta and a different dessert.

32.description: I have been here twice. First time I had pizza. It was fabulous. Crust is crisp but soggy in the middle. Yum. Second time I had bolognese. It was good but a little acidic for bolognese. My boyfriend gets the Amatriciana. It's good. Downside-no longer BYOB. It would be cool, but the wine list is lacking. Corkage fee is $15. Ummm. How about not.

18.description: While looking for a place on my phone using Yelp app in Andersonville, I found this Pizza place to be best rated. As I sit on the table super high price on corkage fee was very surprising. 15$ for corkage fee is little too over priced in my opinion. Second very surprising fact of this night was the fact waitress trying so hard to talk to a point that I could tell she was not Italian, which is not a big deal, in fact nice that she tries for working at an Italian restaurant but this made it impossible for me to communicate with her. I got Spinach salad, which was to be honest interesting for the fact that it had some crispy walnuts. Pizza I ordered was Pepperoni and Red pepper Pizza. It was around 14" good for one person or along with a salad can fill two person comfortably. Though, there were around 4-5 slices of pepperoni on the pizza in total so their pizza did not make me happy either. Overall my experience with this place was not good. It's very discouraging to check new restaurants in my neighborhood with their rating nowadays since, I have no idea how, some restaurants get higher rating but provide more expensive, money oriented and customer satisfaction is not as important, as I had this impression.

13.description: Wow, give me the Isola Bella pizza as a gift if you ever want to woo me - because that 'za was some of the most delicious I've ever had. The butternut squash played off the olives and tomatoes in a wonderful way; sweetness mixing with the acidity of the tomatoes and salt of the olives. I drool at the thought.We waltzed in at 7 p.m. on Friday night (5 of us) and were promptly seated and welcomed by our friendly server. It's a little loud inside, due to the open nature of the restaurant, but it's cozy and dimly lit, so what's a little noise? We did have to wave our waiter down for wine he forgot and then to get the bill, but I'm not letting that knock my experience too much - I'll definitely be back!

4.description: Whoa. This is seriously good pizza.We ordered the Pistachio and the Parma.  First off, this dough is incredibly tasty. Now, you would not think about arugula and pistachios on a white pizza, but PLEASE try this.The Parma pizza is a meaty, yet delicate meal. The beet salad was beautiful, the lemon vinegrete was perfect for it. We had it delivered from Grub Hub,  it was still hot! Thank you for restoring my faith in pizza.

24.description: The quality is still there, but the prices have gone up significantly and the quantity has gone down substantially.

6.description: The feel is so Italian and very warmth .. When you get in .. The owner working as a host, waiter, etc will personally sit you down .. And will give you the details of the specials and other relevant info and answer your queries !!!  I had the best calamari that night .. And all the other food we ordered were very good .. And I was so impressed of the service .... We went back today .. But Tuesday they are closed ... But then I'mLooking forward to go back to this restaurant !!!

22.description: Wow.  Surly greeting when we byob and argument with owner over what website we looked at that still indicated byob.  He blamed Google which is not his official site.  What a putz.  Shitty attitude continued with server who informed us corking fee is $20 per bottle.  Long wait for wood oven pizza with moist flimsy crust.  Will not be going back.

15.description: It's our second kitchen...with a Sicilian chef. Incredible food! Flavors. Authentic. Treated like family. Warmest place in Chicago. Mario food home and keeps close to his roots. XOXO

7.description: Are you short on time and money and can't get over to Italy for a good pizza? No worries! Stop by Antica Pizzeria. I've been to this establishment twice now, and can say both times I felt like I was back in Italy enjoying a really special pizza. On my latest trip, my group split the Panna (green peas, heavy cream, sausage), the Fattoressa (ham, eggs, green peas, mushrooms), and the agnolotti pasticciati. As much as I wanted something basic like a bolognese, I'm glad my sister urged us to order less-traditional fare. Each of those choices was delicious and unique, especially the Panna. Prices are reasonable, $15 corkage fee. I'll be back!

36.description: Okay...definitely one of the best italian restaurants in Chicago...didn't get to the pizza but we had an amazing barley soup and beet salad followed by roast rack of lamb...just incredible. Clean clear flavors. Amazing staff and owners. Can't wait to become one of their regulars.

30.description: I really enjoyed my overall experience from the service to the food. I was greeted  promptly and seated for my reservation and the waitress could not have been nicer or more authentic; real Italian that knows her food and wine.  So don't be afraid to ask for recommendations. The pizza was excellent thin-woodfired-goodness. The salads were fresh and delicious. And the pastas are really well done and flavorful.  It's nice to experience such a well run family run establishment. I will definitely be back.

3.description: This is one of those reviews that I'm afraid to write. I'm fiercely protective of what is really our favorite neighborhood restaurant, but they deserve the business. So, here I am.We've lived in Andersonville for years, and this is one of the places we go to again and again and again. In fact, it's probably one of the places we've been to the most in Chicago, and that's saying a lot; we like to try new eats, and we don't often go back to the same place twice.However, several times a year--and when we have company in town--we often find ourselves making our way down to Antica.Why do we love it so much? Oh, let me count the ways.First, the service is OUTSTANDING. I mean, really, they fawn over you. The waitstaff is professional and kind and efficient. My mom dropped something out of her purse while we were dining there today, and our waiter came over to pick it up before she even had a chance to bend over.Also, Mario, the owner, is always there. He will great you with a smile and a buttery Italian accent as soon as you walk in the door, and he'll make sure you've had a good time.The vibe of the restaurant is cozy and homey and oh-so-welcoming. It really feels like a family-owned neighborhood restaurant.But the food, of course, is the real star. The pizza, which is fired in their large pizza oven, is my favorite in the city. The crust is thin and floppy, the edges are blistered, and the toppings are fresh.They also have the best Italian salads and pastas I've had in the city. Every time I go, I find myself saying, "This is just like the Italian food I grew up with!"They regularly change specials, have a large menu, have delicious homemade desserts, and are reasonably priced. Truthfully, I can't think of a bad thing to say about this place. Just go--you'll have a good time and a great meal. And you, too, will be back!

14.description: This is NOT a kid friendly restaurant. My husband and I came here today with our 13 month old and 4 year old because, per Yelp, this place fit the criteria for close by, good pizza, casual and kid friendly. I guess I should have known when they didn't have a kids menu. Everything was going fine till my 13 month old started fussing a bit because he was hungry. I had nothing to give him (No, they don't even provide bread or anything.) but after a bit was unable to distract him. The maître D starts coming over and I thought at first he was going to offer help (the other "kid friendly" places I've been to either helped or ignored a fussy baby) but then he instead tells us that some customers (as though we weren't) had complained and would we please please do something about the baby.I took him outside to wait till our food arrived, since that felt like my only option under the circumstances.  When my husband came to get us, my 4 year old started yelling. At that point, we decided to get everything to go.When we got home we discovered they hadn't even cut our pizzas they were in such a hurry to get us out.The food was good but there are plenty of other good pizza places in Chicago that won't treat you like a second class citizen for having children. We will NOT be returning.

58.description: Delicious ice cream in an adorable store with excellent customer service in the heart of Andersonville.  In addition to unique and classic ice cream flavors, they also offer dairy-free soy, vegan, and even Italian Ice flavors. They also have a ton of specialty sundaes, shakes, and even a case full of cupcakes and pastries in the back.I almost cried when I found out that they have Gluten Free sugar & wafer cones! They are kept in a separate box and away from the other cones so it's safe. My favorite flavor by far has been the Horchata ice cream - delicious! Note: their ice cream is on the soft side so eat up quick!Plenty of seating if you want to enjoy your sweets at George's, but they also have packed pints and half gallons for you to indulge at home.  Every single time I've been here the staff is super friendly and attentive, no matter how crazy busy it is. Love this place!

56.description: Overpriced is an understatement. Almost $5 for a single. Most of the staff was nice but the person working the register was clearly having a bad night and taking it out in customers. Save your money and indulge your sweet tooth elsewhere.

29.description: Swung by here with a Popular Pays comp for two cones. Nothing like homemade ice cream, and the atmosphere and neighborhood are great. I'll be back when the weather settles into toasty summer temperatures and I'm craving more cold treats.

42.description: I have lost track how often I come here!  I do know that its George's Ice Cream that helps me make sure I hit the gym.I love neighborhood gems and George's is one of the gems in Andersonville.  For me the go to a massive helping of Kitty Kitty Bang Bang (cheese cake, raspberry swirls and chocolate chips) on a waffle cone.  Its pure happiness.I have also had the Raspberry Rhapsody (I think its called that) and Snap Dragon.    Still have not be disappointed.  When in Andersonville its a crime not to stop here.

23.description: It was love at first scoop.  My cousin introduced me to the wonder that is George's.  I ordered one scoop of Cherry Amaretto on a sugar cone.  The girl behind the counter gave me the biggest scoop that the little cone could handle.  I had to hurry up and eat the excess before it hit the floor.  Tough job, but I was up for it!  It was then that I decided Cherry Amaretto is my new favorite ice cream.  Well, at least until my next trip to George's.I will definitely be back to see what flavor I will fall in love with next!

47.description: I come here all the time and it is always delicious. The line is sometimes long but it's because the service and ice cream are always on point!

8.description: Flavored twinkles, peanut butter s'mores and amazing ice cream flavors?WHAT IN THE WORLD?! I didn't even know what to do with myself. They have peanut butter, oreo, and chocolate twinkles. DEAD. They also have s'mores with and without peanut butter - with though, duh. They have cake balls (heh) and they even had blue ones :P Some interesting ice cream flavors, crazy sundaes and to top it all off - Dark Matter coffee. This place is a solid winner all around. Something for everybody. And all of it for me! YUMMMM!

31.description: A classic ice cream shop with dairy free options! Yay! A sugar cone with a single scoop of espresso Oreo soy ice cream, please :)

34.description: Absolutely love Georgie's! It's old school charm really makes you feel like you're a child again. And the Nutella shake is amazing. I always have it made with regular vanilla ice cream and it's so addictive it's not even funny. We've also had their brownies and they're yummy too. I love the ice cream with brownies-I think its called the Zanzibar? So so good!

16.description: As Ice Cream shops go, this one is one of the more solid.  As many have noted, the price for a scoop or two of ice cream is pretty high.  I'm not sure why perhaps we're paying for the extra rent since the place is pretty large inside for an ice cream shoppe.  The decor I found a little dark, particularly since it was a bright and sunny day.  But enough with that.  Down to the real business.The ice cream was delicious.  I had the strawberry cheesecake and it was amazing.  There are more options than you can hope to reasonably eat and not become morbidly obese, so there's something for everyone.   They also have a large selection of other sweets and baked goods.  Next on my list is one of the amazing looking milk shakes. The staff was great and super helpful.  Despite it being a little crowded they were patient with everyone and made sure you got to sample whatever it is you were interested in.

13.description: When it comes to ice cream, my sweet tooth prefers artisanal. I blame it on living close to a Jeni's during my formative years. Now nothing says dessert like an obscurely complex scoop featuring a trifecta of locally sourced ingredients. Since it was close to midnight on Friday, I'd managed to get my fix at George's. For the kid at heart, there's Cotton Candy, Birthday Cake, and Zanzibar Chocolate. For the rest of us, it's the Exhausted Parent: coffee ice cream with bourbon. My junior scoop ended up as a triple. Thanks guy-behind-the-counter! Perhaps he took one look at my weary face and sensed that I needed a reprieve. My ice cream was really creamy, nicely spiked but with a muted coffee flavor. I tip my hat to George's as a neighborhood haunt. Great place for locals to stop by later in the evening, hang out and indulge on a variety of sweet options. As for me, not really worth the drive up from River North.

11.description: It was love at first scoop.  My cousin introduced me to the wonder that is George's.  I ordered one scoop of Cherry Amaretto on a sugar cone.  The girl behind the counter gave me the biggest scoop that the little cone could handle.  I had to hurry up and eat the excess before it hit the floor.  Tough job, but I was up for it!  It was then that I decided Cherry Amaretto is my new favorite ice cream.  Well, at least until my next trip to George's.I will definitely be back to see what flavor I will fall in love with next!

39.description: George's has fun flavors, lots of options, and very generous sized scoops.  I could barely finish my 2 scoop ice cream cone and I have a bottomless pit when it comes to sweets. Plan on that!  It's also nice that they have a lot of spacious seating, which I found unexpected for an ice cream place.

37.description: I honestly can't comment on too much from George's because I've only been here once, but that one visit was really, really nice.  I'm not sure how much they actually make in house, but the inside is like an adult's version of a candy store.  They've got a bunch of ice creams, chocolate covered treats, warm pies and cobblers, and cakes to go around and they've just managed to bring them all to the next level. Specifically I had a scoop of ginger-honey ice cream here and it was awesome.  There were chunks of sugared ginger (maybe crystallized ginger?) in the ice cream and both the ginger and honey flavors were prominent and right in your face.  The ice cream base was smooth and creamy, and even despite it being winter, I finished that whole cup in probably 5 minutes.  It was simply sublime.Other than that, they had a bunch of other flavors I'd want to try like horchata, black raspberry, and fat Elvis (banana/chocolate/peanut butter), so you can just imagine how awesome this place would be in the summer!The next time I visit Chicago I will have to stop by again.  Their flavors are great.  The staff is friendly.  And who can resist pretzel waffle cones or pistachio cookies?!

0.description: I love this place.  I love it so much I feel bad for most of the restaurants in the area because I can't really think of many instances where I've stayed after dinner for dessert at the same location-- I usually just walk over to George's.No matter what you're craving, if it's sweet, George's will probably have you covered.  Their ice cream selection is fantastic, and as you've seen in other reviews, is from one of the best ice cream places in the world-- especially if you're a Badger and sometimes get nostalgic for Madison.The staff is super friendly and let's you try out as many flavors as you feel you need to before making a decision.  There's always plenty of seating which accommodates groups or individuals.  There's also wifi so if it's somewhere you want to stop in during the day to do work, it's really a great alternative to other places in the area which don't offer wifi.Totally a favorite in the city.

38.description: Absolutely loved George's! Such a cute little place, decor is cute, place is clean, staff was nice... We had a 3scoop sundae.. I'm not much of an ice cream person, but I've gotta say, I'd definitely come back for some! Next time I'll try some of the baked goods or maybe the chocolate dipped Twinkie!

51.description: This place is always great.  Many times the ice cream isn't frozen solid enough - sometimes, we can't make it to the door before it's running down your hand.

27.description: I've been to this place twice, both times to redeem a popular pays. The place is pretty big, which is good for ice cream parlors. The staff was friendly both times.The first time, my friend and I got 3 favors in their own cups - mint chocolate, some kind of brownie flavor, and one other that I cannot remember. This time, my friend and I got our own cones - mine had Yippee Skipee in it, and his has key lime pie. The key lime pie had crust/graham bits in it. Super limey but not artificial flavory! Mine had peanut butter and such in it. All of the flavors that I have had have been AMAZING. I love this place. Can't get enough. I recently moved down the street, so I'll be going often :)

32.description: Flavored twinkles, peanut butter s'mores and amazing ice cream flavors?WHAT IN THE WORLD?! I didn't even know what to do with myself. They have peanut butter, oreo, and chocolate twinkles. DEAD. They also have s'mores with and without peanut butter - with though, duh. They have cake balls (heh) and they even had blue ones :P Some interesting ice cream flavors, crazy sundaes and to top it all off - Dark Matter coffee. This place is a solid winner all around. Something for everybody. And all of it for me! YUMMMM!

54.description: This place is wonderful! It's decently priced and has a wide variety of flavors to choose from. You can get your ice cream in so many different ways - sundaes, milkshakes, in a cone, cup, or whatever.I got an Oreo Milkshake and it was awesome, and my friend got their Grasshopper ice cream and said it was amazing! Definitely going back to this little gem.They also have a great little sweets bar filled with cookies, cakes, etc. their cookies are pretty good, but there are better out there. If you do get a cookie just take it home and heat it up a little bit.The staff is very friendly and can give you recommendations on anything. There is usually a good amount of people working so if there's a line it won't last long.

48.description: Ice Cream and Sweets, Yup they have both of those. The ice cream flavors are of the super sweet, super manufactured, super nuts variety... I spotted marshmallows, caramels, brownie swirls, cheesecake bites, more brownies.. you get the point. I can only imagine they are all tasty. This isn't Jeni's with hibiscus or lavender. Points for dairy-free, Soy options.. I have too many friends who can't do 'Ice Cream'.I chose the green tea ice cream, it was actually very light and creamy with a slight green tea flavor, super good, not too rich. You can get the flavors in a cone, a sundae, a milkshake or choose from one of their pre-imagined concoctions.. which from what i saw look like a sweets overload.. never a bad thing. I did not make it the pastry case on the end as the store was very busy and I wanted to get to my ice cream.All in all, a tasty experience, in great location with a very friendly staff. Just beware there are a ton of flavors, and lots of options which might be hard to choose what you really want with a line out the door.

44.description: Love the quality and variety. Portions are generous. The staff can appear flustered when there's a crowd but dont let it dissuade you from stopping in!

24.description: Delicious flavors and cool artwork. There's also a great selection of cake and candies. There's a really pretty and relaxing patio in the back that you can enjoy during the summer, and it butts up against Alleycat Comics, so you can have coffee or ice cream and then stop in Alleycat to get something to read. The reason it didn't get 5 stars is because the lines are always really long, and they don't have a coffee grinder even though they sell some of the best coffee.

7.description: I've been to this place twice, both times to redeem a popular pays. The place is pretty big, which is good for ice cream parlors. The staff was friendly both times.The first time, my friend and I got 3 favors in their own cups - mint chocolate, some kind of brownie flavor, and one other that I cannot remember. This time, my friend and I got our own cones - mine had Yippee Skipee in it, and his has key lime pie. The key lime pie had crust/graham bits in it. Super limey but not artificial flavory! Mine had peanut butter and such in it. All of the flavors that I have had have been AMAZING. I love this place. Can't get enough. I recently moved down the street, so I'll be going often :)

49.description: This is a mixed review.On the surface George's is pretty incredible. Their ice cream tastes so good. They have so many flavors! Their sundaes are so childishly sinful and delicious. BUT ..... but, every single time, without fail, both my boyfriend and I feel unbelievably sick after eating their ice cream. Like, TMI sick. Get it? Immediate punishment. This is no good!I went here with 2 of my aunts once and they immediately commented on the old milk smell in the parlor and it is so true. There is a SMELL for sure in here. It's stale milk and refrigerator smell. It's so bad that you can smell it OUTSIDE the parlor, leaking through the door. It's nauseating. Am I getting sick because their ice cream is old, bad, spoiled, not stored at the proper temperature? I don't know. I will say many times the ice cream has been basically dripping melting the second they put it on a cone. Maybe they aren't keep their cooler/fridges at the right temp.An even bigger complaint than getting continually sick from their ice cream and a sign that something huge is wrong with their refrigerators is the taste of their refrigerated treats/baked goods.  One day I wanted some chocolate, not ice cream, and I remember George's has some such items along with cake and what not. I purchased a small baggie of foam candy, I think it's called Devil's food candy in some parts. It's caramelized foamy sugar in chunks, covered in chocolate. The sugar is delicious and dissolves in your mouth, or so it is supposed to. I got these bad boys home and took one bite and could not eat anymore. The taste of old fridge had so intensely permeated these treats that I could not eat another bite and threw them away. How old are these candies? When were they made? If they are fresh, when is the last time you cleaned out your fridge units?!??!?! With a taste like that I am absolutely 100% certain that absolutely all of their candies, cakes, chocolates also taste like fridge. And because this parlor continually smells stale I have to confidently assume their baked goods and treats ALWAYS taste like old, stale fridge. The taste was so god awful inedible, old and terrible. Yikes. I was so close to going back to return these disgusting treats but I just let it go because I didn't feel like losing it in public and yelling at hipsters about chocolate. I've been here many times and I am sure I'll cave again because for the 15 minutes before I get sick, their ice cream is good. I should really try to take my own advice though and avoid and visit Forever Yogurt across the street instead.

40.description: Drove by with my kids on an ice cream crave and they were closed even though it clearly says they're open. I thought maybe the location changed so I called while I was Infront and someone answered and said they're location hasn't changed but they were closed... OH AND that they'd b open after New Years. Maybe. Boo to you. Took our business across the street.

53.description: I like this place a lot and come here often! Sometimes the line is super long but their house chocolate ice cream (Zanzibar) in a pretzel cone is worth it.

30.description: Super cute store with delicious ice cream! I got the ginger honey on a waffle cone all indulgently after eating sushi at Ora.  What a freakin perfect meal! They have a bunch of other desserts as well in addition to coffee.  Some unique things like pretzel cones, which, I can only imagine, is great.

46.description: A girlfriend treated me to a scoop after we finished a long day of thrifting the vintage shops of Andersonville for baby shower decor, and it was the perfect sweet end to a lady date afternoon.I can only speak for the key lime, which is out of this world! Perfectly fitting for a summer day where some citrusy zing is a welcome note to offset the sugar-coated thirstiness precipitated by snacking on sweets, the key lime certainly delivers.The employees at George's were sweet and patient, offering samples and happy to offer advice on their favorites to boot.  And ice cream-induced thirst can easily and freely be quenched from a water cooler in the front of the store. All in all, a pleasurable experience, and one I'd be only too happy to repeat when in the area.

1.description: This is a fine place for ice cream. If you're in the area and are in the mood for the something sweet, this place is worth considering. However, I felt that there wasn't anything that really made it stand out. The flavors were good and priced reasonably, so it's good for the money. Also, there is ample seating area if you are coming with friends. It's good, but not great.

55.description: Just had a great ice cream cone at George's sweet shop on Clark. I had their peanut butter pretzel caramel in a waffle cone. It was a sweet, gooey treat.  The ambience is very relaxed, with leather couch seating.  It is a large, comfortable space.  You can try any flavor before buying. I will definitely be back

9.description: The scoop on George's is they serve Chocolate Shoppe Ice Cream, which is based in Madison. Not too many places serve it. And it is damn good. I've gotten nothing else here, so consider this review one of ice cream, service and atmosphere.My favorite ice creams here are any of the vanilla based ones with tons of goodies mixed in. No point in telling you what they are because the flavors rotate often but Yippee Skippee and Zoreo are musts if in stock. Zoreo seriously changed my mind about chocolate ice cream. (Ok, maybe not, but it's the only chocolate based ice cream I've ever loved.) they also have really cool sundaes.The staff at George's is always friendly aka let you sample all the ice cream you want without giving you grief. I always enjoy sitting down there too or on their kind of hidden back patio. It's a fun atmosphere. Best of all, George's is one of few dessert places staying open past 11. In Chicago you can count those places on one hand. That makes them pretty much the best.

26.description: This place is fantastic! Tried the Zanzibar ice cream, red velvet cake bite, and triple chocolate cake bite. The ice cream was like cold molten brownies and the cake bites were so dense with ingredients they had some weight to them... It drowned my taste buds! Not to mention the people working there look like they are having a great time. Very kind and talkative. Music was a nice touch as well!

25.description: When it comes to ice cream, my sweet tooth prefers artisanal. I blame it on living close to a Jeni's during my formative years. Now nothing says dessert like an obscurely complex scoop featuring a trifecta of locally sourced ingredients. Since it was close to midnight on Friday, I'd managed to get my fix at George's. For the kid at heart, there's Cotton Candy, Birthday Cake, and Zanzibar Chocolate. For the rest of us, it's the Exhausted Parent: coffee ice cream with bourbon. My junior scoop ended up as a triple. Thanks guy-behind-the-counter! Perhaps he took one look at my weary face and sensed that I needed a reprieve. My ice cream was really creamy, nicely spiked but with a muted coffee flavor. I tip my hat to George's as a neighborhood haunt. Great place for locals to stop by later in the evening, hang out and indulge on a variety of sweet options. As for me, not really worth the drive up from River North.

12.description: Super cute place. Plenty of flavors, and there are even board games to play with.

59.description: This is great ice cream!It makes me happy!Go Georgie Porgies!!!!

21.description: Great ice cream. I don't love that there isn't a board with the ice cream flavors on the wall. If several people are in line you can't see the ice cream flavors until you get up to the counter but oh well. It's ice cream and it was good. They also run good deals through out the week.

17.description: I love having this spot so close to the restaurants. It is nice to skip the high priced deserts from wherever you are eating and stop in here on the way home. They have a great selection and fair prices. It can be busy at times during the summer but they do a pretty good job moving the line. It is normally the fault of a few dopes that need to try every flavor before making up their mind. The staff is normally very friendly but they do sometimes hire hipsters that are too cool for their own good.

10.description: I honestly can't comment on too much from George's because I've only been here once, but that one visit was really, really nice.  I'm not sure how much they actually make in house, but the inside is like an adult's version of a candy store.  They've got a bunch of ice creams, chocolate covered treats, warm pies and cobblers, and cakes to go around and they've just managed to bring them all to the next level. Specifically I had a scoop of ginger-honey ice cream here and it was awesome.  There were chunks of sugared ginger (maybe crystallized ginger?) in the ice cream and both the ginger and honey flavors were prominent and right in your face.  The ice cream base was smooth and creamy, and even despite it being winter, I finished that whole cup in probably 5 minutes.  It was simply sublime.Other than that, they had a bunch of other flavors I'd want to try like horchata, black raspberry, and fat Elvis (banana/chocolate/peanut butter), so you can just imagine how awesome this place would be in the summer!The next time I visit Chicago I will have to stop by again.  Their flavors are great.  The staff is friendly.  And who can resist pretzel waffle cones or pistachio cookies?!

5.description: My whole next paycheck will likely go to this place.We stopped in for some ice cream. Loads of options though, we opted for just cones, but next time, it's a sundae for sure!Junior cone was plenty to fill us up after dinner, and the flavor options were almost endless (tank goodness for sample spoons and patient staff!). The beau got the best mint chocolate chip he's ever had (with oreo bits instead of chocolate chips...yum!) and I got "blue moon" which is described as the flavor of fruit loops milk (true!).Super polite staff, lots of tables, free wifi, no complaints here!

3.description: Key word: PRICEY! (Bobtail and Windy City Sweets offer bigger portions for same price) Worth a 20min drive? NOPEI was a fan at first but after exploring many other ice cream shops in the city, this is no longer my top three. The ice cream brand they sell is called "Chocolate Shoppe Ice Cream" which is made in Madison, WI. Their are three shops in/near Chicago that are actually named "Chocolate Shoppe Ice Cream" that sell this brand (Skokie, Forest Park, and one on the outskirts of Chicago). Besides that, George's is the only one I know that is not named "Chocolate Shoppe" that sells it. I love their service because they are super patient. My friend basically sampled half their ice creams  and they weren't even bothered by it. They just kept asking if he wanted to try something else. They were super inviting. They also reply to every comment you make in the most polite way possible. Almost as if the owner tells them they should always be the last one to respond. Pretty cool. Their service alone won me over. Another huge plus is that they are not underemployed. The line moves fast even though it looks long. I got 2 scoops of "Heaps of love" with Oreo, Nuts, and M&M toppings. It was good but, their scoops are SMALL. Something to note is that they keep rotating their ice cream flavors. So what they sell today may not be their tomorrow. I just wish it wasn't as PRICEY. It has a very chill ambiance and I have to mention the restrooms because it smells like cake. I don't know how they do that, but the smell of cake is so strong you can't smell anything else. I know I'm weird for pointing that out but usually any restrooms in the city are disgusting and smell like pee. So this stood out to me.

35.description: George's is pretty cool because they have good coffee, WiFi, and decadent snacks - so I can come here and work on my computer for an hour or 2 in comfort, and no one rushes you out (since it's usually not packed). I often end up here because the Starbucks a block away is always packed. I would recommend George's Red Velvet Cake, Carrot Cake, Smores Tart, a Vanilla Latte or any of their ice cream. I would warn against the fruit tarts, which are pretty hit or miss.Located in the heart of Andersonville, it's a cool location with good people watching, or a hot date (I've heard about those)....The only cons about the place are the somewhat pricey pricing on a lot of their items, and the big hit on my growing waist, which I need to see a therapist about....Other than that - indulge, hang out, enjoy, love, and celebrate at George's ;-)

19.description: They have a rotating selection of 2 soy flavors and a no sugar added option as well. Love the dairy free ice cream options. As someone who is allergic to milk, this place makes me feel like the average and is a great place to gather with friends in Andersonville. The team here is so pleasant and make getting ice cream even better. Good job!

28.description: They have been in the neighborhood for 50 years so if that alone isn't a testament to their success, just a glance at the menu will have you sold. This place is magical. It smells amazing when you walk in. You cannot go wrong with any flavor because they are all delicious. Their sundaes are all super fun. Sweet counter will have your mouth watering. They have colored changing spoons. Love this place. Such a great spot!!

45.description: Came in here for an impromptu dessert after a dinner outing with friends. It is definitely a nice location and the fact that it's open late really is a plus. This is my reasoning for only giving it 3 stars. I noticed that they had ice cream cookie sandwiches. I had been craving one of those suckers for a long time.
