23.description: My wife and I have been eating here from time to time for a hundred years.  That's a small exaggeration, but she has been going there since the 1990s and introduced me to Kopi.  When we have out of town guests, we often take them to Kopi for breakfast on weekends.  In addition to good food, there is a useful travel books section and a gift shop.  I have found a few good gifts for people there over the years.  Service is always good although there seems to be some kind of moral objection to spoons for tasks such as stirring coffee. My wife always orders the challa French toast and always loves it.  Most recently, I ordered the salty Madame salmon sandwich.  This was basically an egg and salmon sandwich.  It was good, but not very salty and left a lot of salmon stuck in my teeth.  As we often do, we ordered the salmon patties, which, of course, are not meat.  They  are always delicious.  I usually don't drink alcohol here, but since it was a federal holiday had the house Bloody Mary.  It was good.My wife says the coffee is the best she can get without going to an overpriced fancy coffee shop. You don't have to get a fancy coffee for it to taste good.

5.description: This is a great venue for multiple different reasons. First, the coffee is utterly delicious. If you are on the run, don't let the setup of the venue throw you off. Approach the cash register. You can order there and get coffee to go, even if it doesn't feel right. It is right. And delicious. And well worth your money. But if you have the time, please sit down and try the food. My breakfast pizza was incredible. Their vegetarian (technically pescatarian) menu is extremely creative and delicious. Also, it is a great location to come with a friend or friends and catch up. Very intimate and cozy. Overall, this is a fantastic place to eat, visit and drink. Just know that its greatness takes time. So don't come if you are in a rush!

31.description: This place is awesome!  The store in the back has really neat stuff to buy, and the food is different and delicious!  The drinks are the best.  They have Gilligan'r lemonade (lemonade with coconut) and hot cherry cider!  I wasn't feeling well once when I went and they had hot Emergen-C on the menu.  It's the best in the summer when you can sit outside.

25.description: Been coming here for decades and the coffee is always good and strong.The decor is cool and world-ish.The back area has slowly become an over loaded pile of crap...ok I don't mean crap like junk I mean crap like I can't figure out what's there because there's a mountain of it and moving too quickly might trigger an avalanche. The food is good but over-priced - always has been and always will be.Staff has always been easy, friendly and awesome.One last thing- it's awesome that they got a liquor license and have some nice selections present.

12.description: looked forward to returning as soon as I made it back to chicago. management/owners were perfectly attentive, yet hands off last time I visited. i'm here once a month. walked in, found a seat in the chill space. the woman who greeted me to take my order could not have been more rude. not sure what she's going through, although the manager on duty wasn't too much more empathetic to her crisis, nor my having been treated so poorly. really wanted this to be my new favorite place in the world. it's ok to acknowledge you're having a bad day. it's also ok to apologize & start all over. plenty of people in the cafe around the corner. unfortunate.

37.description: I've eaten here a few times and every time I've been happy with the food and the welcoming atmosphere. The staff is friendly and efficient. I visited Kopi's gift shop with my husband, son and daughter-in-law yesterday (Monday) evening to find a last minute, unique gift for my mother. I asked if they had any hand mirrors. The woman behind the counter checked in a cabinet and found two lovely hand mirrors. She carried the two mirrors behind the counter with pretext of cleaning them. As I watched, I saw her remove a price sticker that showed $18, and attempt to surreptitiously replace it with a new price tag that had $24 on it. I didn't say anything, but I felt slightly insulted. I told her I wanted to look around a bit more, but that I would take the mirror. As I was looking at other items, I saw her approach the owner(?) and whisper something to him. It was odd, but I ignored it. I returned to the counter and paid for the mirror. I would have understood if she told me she had to mark up the price for any reason; however, changing a price tag in such a secretive manner, without saying anything to me, was offensive. You didn't get away with anything, sweetheart. Thing is, I would have happily paid the $24, even if you'd been open about it. I'll still visit for the food, and maybe even for the gift store. But last night left a bad taste in my mouth.

21.description: It's a cute store. Unfortunately the iced coffee was really weak, the Thai iced coffee isn't Thai iced coffee (it was just weak coffee with some milk in it), and the cake was really oily. The server and staff were super nice, though. I could hang out there but I'd probably just get tea or something.

16.description: Kopi, what a wonderful find during a Sunday afternoon stroll! The atmosphere is inviting and casual, service friendly and food delicious  great for vegans, vegetarians and carnivores alike. Delicious sangria and a cute shop in the back. I will definitely be back..

17.description: Absolutely love this adorable, kitch-y and warm little coffee & tea place! I got their house blend tea and it was so good! I'm also obsessed with the shop in the very back as well as the whole shelf of Lonely Planet travel guides and adorable and unique journals and notebooks for sale! They have a great selection of vegan items and baked goods as well which are not to be missed!

10.description: This is my favorite cafe in Chicago. The food is consistently creative and satisfying, the coffee is remarkable in all of it's glorious configurations, the groovy boutique in the back is like a little world traveling road trip, the folks that work there are sweet and attentive. love love love it.

11.description: Cute cafe! I went i to get the green smoothie and i couldn't help but go towards the back of the cafe to browse in their gift shop, its really cute. Cant wait to go back there again! Thumbs up!

26.description: This is a great place with good coffee and good food. The servers are nice, but slow, so don't go if you're in a hurry. My only reason for giving it less than five stars is because there is no mobile phone connectivity there and no wifi access, so if you want to go there to do some work and need Internet access, you're out of luck. I must say I find it curious that there is not mobile reception and there is no wifi access. I hope that they are not blocking phone access, for if they did that, they could be fined by the FCC, and they could be held liable in the event of an emergency and a patron cannot be reached.

27.description: Tons of cool beverage options like a match a martini or yerba mate. Wasn't into the floor seating by the window because I'm a very long legged lady. Kind servers that will let you relax. Cute kitschy shop in the back, full of hipstery books and travel books.

35.description: This rating is for the Staff plus Ambiance plus Food...mostly for the food. Staff and Ambiance get a 4.5. Food gets a 2.5, here's why:Organic Fried Tofu- I should know better than to get something Asian at a coffee shop. Texture was dry like microwaved tofu. The peanut sauce was okay, but nothing special. Nachos: huge portion. Share this as dinner with 1 person if you're not ordering anything else and 2 or 3 people if you're ordering other items. Good flavor on the beans. Chips are too dense and a bit on the burnt side. Salsa is good, needed more to cover up the burnt chip flavor. Jalapeños are spicy,  good for cold weather days. $10 bucks...yikes on the price for what would typically be an appetizer item. I drove 35 min to try this place, so I won't be back. If I were within walking distance, is give it one more shot.

8.description: Love this place when it's not too busy.  The portion with the cushions is always a nice place to go, sit, drink some coffee, and read.  It has a lot of character, a pretty good food selection (though nothing has every struck me as amazing) and great coffee.It's a four because these days sometimes a person just needs to have wifi and not having wifi at a coffee shop is a bit odd.  At least make it very clear to customers before they sit down that there is no wifi if you're not going to have it.

0.description: Kopi Travelers Cafe is a cute little spot on Clark that is the perfect mix of coffee shop and cafe. There is a little area in the front where you can sit on the ground (ample cushions and pillows to sit on) where you can sip your drink and have your snacks at low tables. The section in the middle has standard tables that you can grab a bite to eat at, and the very back section has some cute local and non-local goods for purchase (think eclectic jewelry, soaps, etc).I've never had a full meal here, but instead typically pop in for some tea (their russian tea with sour cherries is very tasty), hot chocolate, or wine, along with a dessert or snack. Of the snacks I've tried, their multigrain bread and butter is REALLY good, so much flavor in the crust and loaded with grains and seeds.Definitely a cute spot to relax over drinks with some friends or on your own with a book - will continue to pop in whenever I get a chance.

38.description: I love Kopi Cafe!  I brought my students there and they were very accommodating in terms of seating and checks.  They were also very friendly as well.  I love the pole with the international dollars, one of my students from Kazakhstan left a bill on there and it makes me happy when I go back and see it.  The food is pretty delicious too, I love the carrot cake and their panini's!

20.description: Very comfortable atmosphere and presumably ethical food makes up for portions on the smaller side. The green juice with cherry cider is very tasty as are the lox and eggs.

19.description: This rating is for the Staff plus Ambiance plus Food...mostly for the food. Staff and Ambiance get a 4.5. Food gets a 2.5, here's why:Organic Fried Tofu- I should know better than to get something Asian at a coffee shop. Texture was dry like microwaved tofu. The peanut sauce was okay, but nothing special. Nachos: huge portion. Share this as dinner with 1 person if you're not ordering anything else and 2 or 3 people if you're ordering other items. Good flavor on the beans. Chips are too dense and a bit on the burnt side. Salsa is good, needed more to cover up the burnt chip flavor. Jalapeños are spicy,  good for cold weather days. $10 bucks...yikes on the price for what would typically be an appetizer item. I drove 35 min to try this place, so I won't be back. If I were within walking distance, is give it one more shot.

33.description: I was greeted by two very nice staff members when I walked in to order food, and decided to shop in the back section for a candle while I waited.  The older lady working behind the counter was chatting it up with some chic about her flight coming up and carrying on and on about who knows what, but obviously she was busy and not able to step away from her convo to help me out.  The thing that really pissed me off, is that when I went pay the lady, she looked at me like I was I was crazy, and did not even have the decency to quit talking to this Jessica chic while I was paying. Then she did not thank me when I paid for a $34 candle, I had to say something to her. I hope that she is not a manager or owner, because she does not know the first steps of customer service. Then, not to mention when I got home and opened up my food, the sandwich I ordered looked like a kid threw it together in 1 minute with grapes that were all shriveled and gross for $10.  Listen to all the other Yelp reviews, and go somewhere else!!

2.description: Kopi Travelers Cafe is the definition of small coffee shop and cafe. Upon entering there is a nook with four tables that are close to the ground. There are many different colored pillows so that you can sit comfortably on the ground while eating your food or drinking a beverage. There is a small gift section in the back that is filled with accessories, books, and other knick knacks. The drink menu is extensive. They have both non-alcoholic and alcoholic beverages. I had the Oregan Chai which was spiced nicely with Cinnamon and others. My friend had the Peppermint Latte which tasted like a melted down Peppermint Patty! It wasn't too sweet, but it had a more authentic mint taste than other lattes. The menu offers all day breakfast, soups, sandwiches, appetizers, and salads. Kopi offers a many deserts and pastries. I had the Challa French toast. Absolutely delightful! I asked the waitress to leave the maple syrup and the triple berry capote on the side so I could taste the bread on its own. My friend ordered the fluffy eggs with salmon and dill sour cream on multi grain bread. The sour cream pulled the dish together when spread on the bread and eaten with the eggs. A unique thing about Kopi is that there is one waitress that brings drinks and food to customers at tables. One does not go up and pick their food up from the counter like other cafes. The waitress also brings water and buses the table. Yet there is no expectation to tip him or her. I would recommend Kopi to those who would like a warm, laid back, and intimate place to drink coffee and casually dine.

34.description: Great coffee, good music, and amazing selection of vegetarian food. The prices are very reasonable for the quality food you get. The store in the back is a nice touch and carries fun, unique items. Lunch for 2 people with coffee is easily $30 or less.

32.description: I was referred to the store by another bookstore. I was looking for some books on travel, but was in awe of all the amazing, unique gifts, jewelry, clothes and books. Loved it!!

18.description: Been coming here for decades and the coffee is always good and strong.The decor is cool and world-ish.The back area has slowly become an over loaded pile of crap...ok I don't mean crap like junk I mean crap like I can't figure out what's there because there's a mountain of it and moving too quickly might trigger an avalanche. The food is good but over-priced - always has been and always will be.Staff has always been easy, friendly and awesome.One last thing- it's awesome that they got a liquor license and have some nice selections present.

13.description: A charming place to go for good food solo or with friends. The staff was friendly and accommodating, the downgrade is because they haven't realized that tacos come best in threes, and they make their drinks heavy on the sweet side. They lack WiFi so it's best for reading or writing if you're planning to work.

4.description: My wife and I have been eating here from time to time for a hundred years.  That's a small exaggeration, but she has been going there since the 1990s and introduced me to Kopi.  When we have out of town guests, we often take them to Kopi for breakfast on weekends.  In addition to good food, there is a useful travel books section and a gift shop.  I have found a few good gifts for people there over the years.  Service is always good although there seems to be some kind of moral objection to spoons for tasks such as stirring coffee. My wife always orders the challa French toast and always loves it.  Most recently, I ordered the salty Madame salmon sandwich.  This was basically an egg and salmon sandwich.  It was good, but not very salty and left a lot of salmon stuck in my teeth.  As we often do, we ordered the salmon patties, which, of course, are not meat.  They  are always delicious.  I usually don't drink alcohol here, but since it was a federal holiday had the house Bloody Mary.  It was good.My wife says the coffee is the best she can get without going to an overpriced fancy coffee shop. You don't have to get a fancy coffee for it to taste good.

24.description: The ambiance was the best part: an atmosphere that is varied enough to appeal to all tastes. There is outdoor sidewalk-adjacent seating, as well as big windows in the front with pillows in front where patrons can sit on the floor if they would like. Inside there are tables and a general store/artsy market area. Restrooms were exceptionally clean. Staff was very helpful and knowledgeable. Unfortunately there was no wi-fi, but that is probably a positive attribute because it keeps tables open for those whose priority is eating, drinking, and socializing. Reasonable selection of craft beers too.

6.description: Very comfortable atmosphere and presumably ethical food makes up for portions on the smaller side. The green juice with cherry cider is very tasty as are the lox and eggs.

22.description: Spacious yet cozy cafe made for a great stop on our trip through Andersonville.  Nice tea selection and we also enjoyed a chocolate thing.  Great spot to unwind.

15.description: Fool me once, shame on you.Fool me twice, shame on me.Fool me three times . . . I've been to Kopi several times over the past year (2013-2014) without updating my review. Until now. When the friend arrived, she and the waiter exchanged a friendly hug and familiar greetings. Clearly, she'd been going to Kopi even more than I had, over the years.Despite that friendly greeting, once we ordered and received the food, the waiter disappeared. Not in a Halloween-type way, like vanished into a puff of smoke. No, he hung around the bar area, he chatted with another employee, he went into the back for some mysterious purpose. That was $10.00 worth of breakfast.My friend ordered a bagel and asked for extra cream cheese. She did get her bagel, and she did get the cream cheese. The waiter gave her two packets, charging her $.75 for each. She didn't know about the charge until we looked at the check.I was still hungry at the end of breakfast. I saw a treat in the counter, a peanut butter/chocolate muffin. That was $5.50. I scarfed it down on the walk to the car, because I was still so hungry. You get a small amount of mediocre food for high prices.No more second chances, Kopi. It took a year of bad experiences, but now, after this final visit, I'm done. From now on, it's M. Henry or Taste of Heaven. I get better more and better food, and better service, for less money.

7.description: This is our favorite place to go for breakfast, lunch, And dinner! Laid back ambiance with always friendly staff. I've yet to find a dish that I didn't like here. The coffee is flavorful and prepared well. Service is fast. Cost is reasonable. And I always end up finding something adorable in the shop at the back of the store. Love Kopi Cafe

36.description: This place is super comfortable not to mention the nice staff. The menu is perfect for everyone no matter what your in the mood for. The Mexican latte is to die for!

30.description: I just stopped in for a small Mexican hot chocolate with whipped cream to go, on one of the last cold days this winter, and was really impressed by Kopi. My order was taken and prepared by chatty, friendly adults. The hot cocoa was tasty.Overall, a solid to-go experience!

3.description: Minus a point for the waitstaff. There's leaving us alone to enjoy our food...and then again there's making sure we get what we ordered WHEN we ordered it in the order we ordered it.Minus a point for tripping over other diners when Kopi's busy. No, not kidding here. Tripping over one another. Though thankfully all the other diners have been phenomenally good-humored about that! I mean, shuffling coats and bags about to make sure that we all have a place to sit. Lovely.However, plus a point because I do love the steamed eggs! I'm fussy about eggs. And the steaming process leaves the eggs both fluffy and tender. No, really. (Did I mention I"m fussy about eggs?) And because the coffee's good. (If you can get the waiter's attention. Try tripping him!)And plus a purely personal point because it reminds me of the pre-hipster grubby Haight-Ashbury where I grew up. i'll be back.

14.description: Delish vegetable with roasted pepper, avocado, goat cheese with pesto sandwich and jasmine tea. I do see it has many ranges of stuffs like tea, coffee and alcoholic drinks to choose!

58.description: Well, it is the BEST espresso in Andersonville.  But that's not saying much.  Usually I get a VERY nice pour.  Most of the baristas are well trained. But then there's is the sometimes, when I get a sloppy coffee and some diffidence in the process.A little more customer service; a little more consistency and they can have 5 stars instead of 4.

56.description: Afternoon of December 14th, 2013.First and last time to visit this Coffee place. Ordered a Nutella Hot Chocolate it was cool to touch and warm to taste. Nothing to write home about being from a small town in Ohio. Decided while I was waiting, I would get a pound of coffee. They assisted me with picking out a blend that was mildly roasted. Then they offered to grind it up for me. Which, I thought was a nice gesture. They handed the ground bag of coffee over to me, then offered to put it in a larger shopping bag. Since I was still finishing my lukewarm supposedly hot chocolate I agreed. Smart move for the barista, bad business move, the reason she put it in the bag, I noticed after I arrived home was because she punctured the bag. I now have it in a zip lock bag to keep it fresh. There are plenty of other coffee houses that have treated me better. I do not need to waste my time with someone being inconsiderate. I am too old for this at 50 y/o I have done my time with poor customer service.

29.description: Super Awesome Place!  Love it here!  Earlier today we were driving by and noticed this coffee place.  I didn't want coffee yet was curious as it looked really cool from the outside.  So after passing it by and going for a few blocks we turned around and came back.  So happy we did.First, the atmosphere is modern contemporary and sleek.  So nice.  The menu board offers fantastic foodie selections, and the baked goods look crazy great.  I ordered and throughly enjoyed the fig and cardamom oatmeal and was impressed that they make it per order so the simple syrup can be eliminated.The staff is beyond friendly, helpful, and accommodating.  A Plus for hiring this great team.I won't be in Chicago much longer yet would love to come back before I leave town.You will be so happy if you go here.:+)

42.description: Really cute space invites you to stay longer but WEBeams limited WiFi pushes you away. Such a contradiction. Unfortunately won't be a regular here.

23.description: I was about to give The Coffee Studio 3 stars, but after seeing that Yelp suggested that 3 stars is equivalent to "A-OK" I just couldn't. It wouldn't be fair to the world.I love trying new cafes, and I've heard a few good things about The Coffee Studio so I thought I'd check it out. When I got there, I was pretty impressed with the atmosphere and thought it would be a nice place to sit and study for a while. I order my coffee, got some food, had myself a seat and hopped on my computer... Oh wait, I forgot a step... I also had to get a wifi code with my purchase which allowed me 1 hour of internet... I'm sorry, but this just isn't reasonable considering the price I pay for coffee and food at The Coffee Studio. I understand the logic that the internet should only be for paying customers, but I can find plenty of other cafes that don't suggest that I get the F out after an hour. I won't be returning

47.description: I've got to be honest, this was one of the most uncomfortable coffee shops I've walked into and I've read some other reviews here where people share my feelings. The baristas seemed unhappy to help and had no conversation whatsoever. I'm not suggesting that baristas are required to talk to you but even getting acknowledged here seemed like I was disturbing the people behind the counter. On top of it, their wifi is limited to 1 hour for a purchase so this is not a place I would recommend coming to sit and study for a while if you need the Internet. Just a general awkward sense the entire time I was here. The coffee was good, but everywhere has good coffee.

8.description: I wasn't impressed with my visit to the Coffee Studio and the only thing going for them is the décor and cute ambiance.  I stopped by for my second cup of coffee for the day and ordered an iced dolce coffee with soy.  The iced dolce coffee was described as their cold brewed coffee with a little of their house made sweetener.  Service also wasn't anything to brag about, the cashier wasn't very friendly and he messed up the order.  I ordered mine with soy milk but I don't think the guy was listening and when I got my drink it was black coffee.  The drink itself wasn't anything special, it barely had any flavor or sweetener and basically tasted as bad as the crappy cold brew I attempted to make at home before.  I should have stuck to a latte and probably would have had a better experience so it was partially on me for going rogue.

31.description: I really love the coffee, but I strongly dislike the vibe! They don't carry almond milk, which is fine, but it would be a nice option for the lactose intolerant and the Monsanto soy-averse. Also, you only get an hour of WiFi with a purchase, which is ridiculous when there are plenty of places in the area with free WiFi indefinitely. And it's just such a waste of time and paper to constantly get up to get another code. I have never felt like I could stay here all day, which I know plenty of people do-- but why would you? Good, overpriced food. Great espresso drinks, nice enough staff. I just wish it were a bit cozier.

34.description: Found this spot one cold snowy day a couple years ago. Loved the caramelatte they serve. Have only gone back a few times since as my commute to work leads me in a different direction, but I try to get over there when I can. I understand that pouring/brewing the perfect coffee is an art form, but it kind of stinks to have to stand around to wait for a latte to be poured with a cute little design on it. The baristas that I have encountered are not friendly at all, a smile goes a long way! Obviously, this has not been a deterrent for me, but just a heads up for people who are more impatient than me. You definitely get what you pay for here- in terms of quality.

16.description: My favorite coffee shop. Details: It's gorgeous inside. Fast wifi with purchase. Super friendly service. All of the baristas are so nice here. Seriously. Not one has been mean to me even when I think it's a good idea to go out into the world freshly rolled out of bed and looking that way too. Their black iced tea. I don't drink coffee so I always drink other things at a coffee shop and this tea. This tea. I'm not really sure what it is about it but it is so delicious. I crave it like some people crave coffee. And their flatbreads. So. Good. Get one.

13.description: Here's my checklist for how I determine how much I like a coffee shop:1. Great coffee 2. Super nice baristas3. Brick wall (I know, randomly specific)4. Plugs for your chargers5. Tables wide enough for your computer6. Convenient location7. Has wine/beer and eats for later in the evening8. Airy and spacious9. WIFI10. Cute boys (kidding...kind of)The Coffee Studio has it all!! It's a really wonderful coffee shop tucked away in Andersonville that is a great place to grab a quick coffee or to hang out and get some work done. Can't recommend it enough.

11.description: Friendly staff and great coffee!  There is a lot of seating, but people tend to camp out with their laptops.  You may have to share a table with someone.

39.description: I enjoy this coffee house very much.  I come in from the suburbs, and order the looseleaf green tea along with, usually, a small snack..  It is a pleasant environment, and I am able to concentrate on my studying without disturbing noise.  The music is low-key, and not disruptive at all.I have generally been able to get a table, even during the busiest hours.  In the rare instances that I couldn't, I sat at the counter, and a table soon became available.I have found the staff to be professional at all times -- I have never encountered any rudeness.

37.description: I'm always up for a cup of great red eye coffee, anytime of the day.  I was waiting for my hubby to finish up his service call nearby and found this place while yelping on the bus.  Got off at Mryn Bawr and Clark and walked diagonally across the street, there you were!  I finally was about to get my afternoon coffee fix.  I saw red eye coffee on the menu.  Great!  Even though it was a bit pricy (medium size for $3.85 as of 02/03/2015), it was more than a decent cup of bold black coffee.  I know it's a close call, but I still prefer the red eye from Baker&Nosh in Uptown.If you're planning on staying and using the wifi, be sure to ask for a free wifi code upon ordering.  You will receive a 60-minute free wifi.  Overall, it's great neighborhood coffee shop.  I was able to surf the web and had a quality cup of red eye.  The service was slower because there was one Barista on duty.  I didn't mind since I wasn't in a hurry.

0.description: I come here every week with my son beige school. It's much different now, or at least the morning crew is different. We have a great experience and the staff are very patient and let my 6 yr old place his order. The patience an stage smiles are appreciated. Thank you!

38.description: Very cozy coffee shop to chill with friends or study.  I like the fact that the areas are kind of separate. So you can chat and mingle with your friends at the tables or coffee bar.  Or you can choose to set up your own mobile office AKA laptop and wifi :)

51.description: Super amazing customer service! This is my second time visiting the Coffee Studio, and I've been pleased both times, but this visit made it a 5 star. I went in with an unusual request for a small amount of powdered espresso for a baking project and was in a bit of a time crunch. The manager at first seemed stressed but upon noticing I was in a hurry, asked what she could do for me. I asked for the espresso and even though they didn't have a price ready for the small amount I needed, she made it work! They were wonderfully accommodating and definitely went above and beyond for the customer. I'll totally be back.

27.description: Love the vibe here. Very laid back with hip contemporary aesthetic. A great place to sit down and relax or just to work on your laptop. Music isn't too loud and the baristas were really nice. Found a new favorite place to go.

32.description: Wonderful coffee shop in Andersonville. I'm here almost every weekend. The staff is so friendly and they have a great selection of drinks. I typically stick to just black coffee and the occasional latte, but they have a lot of interesting types of drinks on their menu. They also have some yummy looking treats that I've never had enough time to sample (vegan options too!)They have a lot of seating, but it's typically pretty crowded. They also have free wi-fi.

54.description: Got an Americano and a Monkey Bar. The monkey bar is an interesting glazed croissant creation. Internet's a little unreliable, and you only get an hour per purchase. Friendly place, but not necessarily worth the hike out.

48.description: I mean, of all the coffee shops I have discovered since moving here (probably 7-8), this is my favorite! Wonderful cappuccino, awesome staff, the layout was very well-done and tasteful, and the homemade donut topped it all off! There were lots of other free lancers there and a general conducive area for reading, writing or working. GET THE SOUR CREAM DONUT!!

44.description: Great coffee, yummy vegetarian nomnoms, very nice ambiance. the only letdown was the limited wifi. they were willing to give me another code for an extra hour but it's not convenient for long hours of working.

24.description: This is an Indie type of coffee shop. You sense that from the very moment you enter. Baristas, brick walls, stylish interior design are all indie type! and great espresso coffees! Seats are very comfortable and it's very conveniently located. It seems like they don't play music though!

7.description: I'm always up for a cup of great red eye coffee, anytime of the day.  I was waiting for my hubby to finish up his service call nearby and found this place while yelping on the bus.  Got off at Mryn Bawr and Clark and walked diagonally across the street, there you were!  I finally was about to get my afternoon coffee fix.  I saw red eye coffee on the menu.  Great!  Even though it was a bit pricy (medium size for $3.85 as of 02/03/2015), it was more than a decent cup of bold black coffee.  I know it's a close call, but I still prefer the red eye from Baker&Nosh in Uptown.If you're planning on staying and using the wifi, be sure to ask for a free wifi code upon ordering.  You will receive a 60-minute free wifi.  Overall, it's great neighborhood coffee shop.  I was able to surf the web and had a quality cup of red eye.  The service was slower because there was one Barista on duty.  I didn't mind since I wasn't in a hurry.

49.description: I don't understand why this cafe is so popular. The price for a regular cup of coffee is way too expensive, particularly compared to cafes similar to this one. And, they usually leave at least a fifth of the cup empty without even asking if you need room. Are the baristas told not to fill up the cup without even asking the customer first?I've asked the barista to fill it up all the way several times and was met with a bad attitude. If I'm paying for something, specifically a cup of regular coffee that costs close to four dollars, I don't think it's a lot to ask for a full serving without my request reluctantly being fulfilled.The general feeling of the place is annoying, and I would recommend going elsewhere. I don't like giving bad reviews, but I've tried several times with this place, hoping they would change for the better, but they haven't.

40.description: This place is hip and cool. Bring your lap top in and plop down for a business meeting, a friendly chat with a friend or for some quiet time to read or get things done.  Definitely the beginnings of a franchise-able coffee spot for any neighborhood not just Andersonville / Edgewater.

53.description: I absolutely love this little coffee spot in Andersonville. It's a place that gives you a real feel for the neighborhood and the people around. Limited seating so be sure to scour around for a good spot. Everything I have ever had here has been absolutely delicious. A great place to stop by on a cold day or when you need to study.

30.description: Here's my checklist for how I determine how much I like a coffee shop:1. Great coffee 2. Super nice baristas3. Brick wall (I know, randomly specific)4. Plugs for your chargers5. Tables wide enough for your computer6. Convenient location7. Has wine/beer and eats for later in the evening8. Airy and spacious9. WIFI10. Cute boys (kidding...kind of)The Coffee Studio has it all!! It's a really wonderful coffee shop tucked away in Andersonville that is a great place to grab a quick coffee or to hang out and get some work done. Can't recommend it enough.

46.description: Easily the best latte I've had in the city. Far and away. Been here a handful of times and my soy latte is always done beautifully. Not a real fast pace, but I appreciate them doing it right, rather than the Starbucks method of just serving hot milk. Here, the milk is steamed to a silky texture and a latte can easily be great without any sugar - no bitterness, no burnt taste.I'm rating it 5 stars due to the quality of the drink. However, I can't disagree with other reviews that the staff is unfriendly. It's just not something that bothers me too much, since I interact with them for 30 seconds and then get to enjoy my drink. No complaints about the atmosphere - seems like your average coffee shop. And they serve booze!

1.description: I really enjoy The Coffee Studio. Good coffee and always a fantastic playlist in the background. The wifi is hourly, but you can also access xfinity wifi from many parts of the coffee shop. They also seem to be pretty liberal about giving out the wifi slips. Why not 5 stars? First, there's a terrible draft from the door. It gets cold. Second, I would say the vast majority of the staff is lovely and professional, but one makes really pretentious, loud comments ("you know, like women who wear yoga pants and watch sitcom television shows"). Some people might find that charming, but it ruins the warm vibe that everyone else creates.

55.description: I hesitated between giving this place 1 or 2 stars, but I decided on 2 because the coffee was good. I wish I could say the same about the service. I was sitting in one of the 3 chairs in the small sitting area and moved my chair a bit in order to give my friend more space (she had sat on the ottoman across from me and space was a bit tight), a few moments later one of the baristas (a short girl) came by and told me to push the chair forward and added "it must sit directly on the carpet". Nothing to add, this speaks for itself.

9.description: I was in the area and needed to get some work done so I made a pit stop to the Coffee Studio. I almost took my coffee to go since the place was PACKED on a Saturday morning. My first impression was that it has such a cozy environment and the seats are really comfy! I also appreciate that I'm not freezing my butt off like at most other coffee shops. The price of the drinks are a tad steep....$4 for a teeny cappuccino I could down in 5 seconds. However, both the coffee and the tea are on point.

26.description: Good coffee, good service, nice ambiance but very limited food choices. Wi-fi crowd...

25.description: I really liked this place! Plenty of outlets, free wi-fi (1 hour from the store, an extra hour if you watch a brief ad). Their coffee was delicious, very open space and a cool crowd.

12.description: This place is super cute! There are banquettes, two-top tables, outdoor seating, a community table, and comfy chairs as far as seating options go. You can buy coffee and tea products, coffee beans, doughnuts, sandwiches, lattes, etc. The baristas greet you with a smile and a warm welcome. They're quick and efficient.I've been once before to redeem a popular pays for a free cold brew. It was really good. Strong flavor, like all good cold brews are. Pretty straight forward. This time, I got a 12oz (you can get that or 16oz) iced sugar free vanilla skim latte - judge my order. Do it. Please. ;) I chatted with the male barista while he made my drink. Super nice guy. I love when baristas are friendly and will chat with you. The drink tasted pretty good! Not too sweet. I'm giving this place 5 stars because of the ambience and the service. Service is a lot to me because I'm a server and a total people person. I love good experiences, and this place gave that. Thank you!

59.description: Another coffee shop with decent, over-priced coffee. Cute atmosphere. Seems to stay pretty busy and is in a decent neighborhood. Service was a little slow. The chai was good, but it was ordered extra hot and came out mildly warm. The nutella hot chocolate was pretty yummy and again, ordered extra hot and was only mildly warm... I would say they don't seem to care if they make anything how you order it. Had a cookie too; it was simple but nothing to get worked up over. I recommend getting your drink to go and walking across the street to Roost to browse the super cute antiques!

21.description: Places like these make me happy to be on earth. And the fact that the Coffee Studio is located on a street with a great brunch place, a great yarn shop, and a great barbecue restaurant make me wish I lived in Chicago. The Coffee Studio is a gorgeous space with a beautiful interior (modernist, exposed brick, all the style accoutrements of modern day hipster living) and an expansive menu of coffee drinks, breakfast items, and so forth. They use Intelligentsia beans, and while those are a bit overroasted for my taste (not that this is the Coffee Studio's fault), the coffee they brew is very nice. This is a great place to hang out, have a cup of coffee, and peruse the latest issue of ArtForum magazine.

17.description: Let's make one thing clear - I am a faithful patron of overpriced hipster coffee shops around Chicago and beyond. The Coffee Studio is not unique in its quality or pretentiousness. Yes, they make great espresso. Yes, their vegan fare and artisan ice-cream sandwiches are drool-inducing. But here's my gripe: you can be committed to serving quality coffee without being an asshole. The baristas themselves are okay. But come on, $4.50 for a teeny cappuccino the size of a shot glass? And that's the only size you serve? Because it's "traditional?" REALLY? That has to be AT LEAST a $3 profit margin. I may as well bend over and present my behind for a good kick. Also, no almond milk, which is lame for such a trendy place. Definitely fell short of expectations.

10.description: Wonderful coffee shop in Andersonville. I'm here almost every weekend. The staff is so friendly and they have a great selection of drinks. I typically stick to just black coffee and the occasional latte, but they have a lot of interesting types of drinks on their menu. They also have some yummy looking treats that I've never had enough time to sample (vegan options too!)They have a lot of seating, but it's typically pretty crowded. They also have free wi-fi.

5.description: I absolutely love this atmosphere, whether you want to get work done or catch up with a friend. This place is very clean the staff is amazing & attentive.

3.description: This place was awesome! Great environment and drinks. It's a place I would like to visit again. The employees were really nice and helpful in helping me and my friend decide what drinks would be our best. They have plenty of table space if you'll like to work. It is a bit quieter than Starbucks so me and my friend were talking low to not disturb others. I wouldn't encourage small groups to come if they want to meet or have a conversation. At least that was my experience.

35.description: Tried to go in at 7:50 pm on thursday evening since it says it opens until 9pm. The door was locked and the staff said they are closed. They need more accurate hours posted on the page. I won't bother coming in after 5pm. The coffee is not extraordinary anyway.

19.description: Ok, so the tea is pretty good and they have a decent selection and the decor is nice and the baristas are very friendly but I don't think I'll be coming back here. The reason why is that when you purchase something and ask for the wifi info you get a little slip with a complicated password that lets you use the wifi for an hour. Not the kind of vibe I want at a little neighborhood coffee shop.

28.description: My favorite coffee shop. Details: It's gorgeous inside. Fast wifi with purchase. Super friendly service. All of the baristas are so nice here. Seriously. Not one has been mean to me even when I think it's a good idea to go out into the world freshly rolled out of bed and looking that way too. Their black iced tea. I don't drink coffee so I always drink other things at a coffee shop and this tea. This tea. I'm not really sure what it is about it but it is so delicious. I crave it like some people crave coffee. And their flatbreads. So. Good. Get one.

45.description: It's an average fancy coffee place, pretty full of itself and full of hipsters, but the coffee is good, strong, and the milk is well frothed. They don't do tasty flavorings like, say, Ipsento, but for a good, basic coffee it works. It seemed more like a place to sit with friends than to wit and work. They also sell lots of overpriced coffee accoutrements.

33.description: Fantastic coffee served by baristas that know what they're doing. You won't be ever be served a bad coffee drink here. The modern design, wood aesthetics, and chill music make for a nice atmosphere.

43.description: I had a business meeting here once. I ordered an iced americano. It's a notch above Starbucks in quality and price.The ambiance is nice -- attracting a more 'indie' crowd of bicycle messengers, artists, and telecommuting workers. I would recommend this coffee shop to those interested in exploring beyond the Starbucks horizon.

2.description: This is my spot people.  The Coffee Studio is awesome with cozy places to sit, little art exhibits on the walls, a good little retail selection, vibrant energy and good coffee.  They sell Intelligencia.  They also offer a small assortment of beer and wine if you'd like to have a beer as you study or hang out.  Their pastry assortment is soso...Doughnuts are dry so you're better off going to DD.  They do have an almond croissant that rocks my world.  One of the best things is that they get the froth right on cappuccinos and lattes.  So many places screw that up.  They must put the staff through rigorous froth class.  I do wish they would stay open a bit later at least some of the week.  They are only open till 9pm.

18.description: I love the atmosphere here, along with the coffee! Solid food selections, and the pastries are always delicious. I'd be there every morning if it wasn't so far from me, but in the meantime I will cherish my impromptu visits here!

41.description: Discovered the Coffee Studio while antique shopping in the area. This will be my go-to spot in Andersonville moving forward. The Coffee Studio has delicious pastries, Intelligentsia coffee, and an upscale ambiance with an eye toward design. The staff here looks like the hipster trendy type but are friendly an unpretentious.

52.description: Just had a great coffee au lait at The Coffee Studio. Daughter and I went for breakfast on a wedding errand and crafting weekend. We each had a spinach and cheese croissant and our coffees. The barista asked if it would be alright if we waited to have our croissants toasted, as the oven had pizzas in it, with the heat cranked up and it would scorch the croissants.  I really appreciated her asking, the croissant was delicious!

50.description: This place and everyone in it will judge you! Starting with the two baristas, who stare at you and make you feel like you are doing something wrong just by walking in the door. They are not friendly at all. Then people who go here don't want to be disturbed and want to take up the biggest tables for their laptops. They will stare at you awkwardly over the top of their screens when you try and have a quiet conversation. If I wanted to pay money to be judged by people there are a million other places I would rather go to for that. The only reason for two stars is because the main reason to come here is for the coffee and the coffee/drinks are great.

4.description: 5 stars for for a cute, comfy environment with brick walls, comfy chairs and cute decor.4 stars for overpriced iced tea on a menu board with too-small font.3 stars for only getting an hour on the code-protected, moderate-speed wifi.

6.description: I was about to give The Coffee Studio 3 stars, but after seeing that Yelp suggested that 3 stars is equivalent to "A-OK" I just couldn't. It wouldn't be fair to the world.I love trying new cafes, and I've heard a few good things about The Coffee Studio so I thought I'd check it out. When I got there, I was pretty impressed with the atmosphere and thought it would be a nice place to sit and study for a while. I order my coffee, got some food, had myself a seat and hopped on my computer... Oh wait, I forgot a step... I also had to get a wifi code with my purchase which allowed me 1 hour of internet... I'm sorry, but this just isn't reasonable considering the price I pay for coffee and food at The Coffee Studio. I understand the logic that the internet should only be for paying customers, but I can find plenty of other cafes that don't suggest that I get the F out after an hour. I won't be returning

22.description: This place looks cool but it is nothing special for the following reasons:- the one hour of free wifi is ridiculous and didn't even work on my laptop- the prices are just terrible - more than $8 for a cup of tea and a chocolate croissant?- although the tea selection is decent it is very sad that they treat it as an ugly stepchild and have sad paper sleeves for the leaves. It's essentially just tea bags at that point. It would be so, so easy to improve your tea game! I do realize this is called the Coffee Studio, but if you're going to have tea on the menu, it's not hard to try.- the chocolate croissant I had was very poor and had the equivalent of only about 4 chocolate chips in it. Don't be fooled by the pretty egg wash.

15.description: Coffee is so delicious and an awesome atmosphere to get work done in. Very happy with my experience here. Definitely go!

57.description: I walked in and thought "wait, am I in wicker park?" Then a stroller bumped into me and I realized I was in fact in Andersonville. This is not just your average coffee shop. They truly care about crafting delicious, quality drinks. Not only that, they stock some of the best pastries a coffee shop can offer. And they have doughnut vault doughnuts. OK, count me in!The atmosphere is nice and mellow, but does tend to attract a large group of table hoarders that turn their table into their home office. It's not "I brought my iMac to the coffee shop" bad, but it is a bit annoying that they tend to hog much of the seating there.Despite that, the coffee studio is by far my favorite place to sit, chat and grab a coffee. Plus it's in Andersonville! How can you beat that?

20.description: Ok, so the tea is pretty good and they have a decent selection and the decor is nice and the baristas are very friendly but I don't think I'll be coming back here. The reason why is that when you purchase something and ask for the wifi info you get a little slip with a complicated password that lets you use the wifi for an hour. Not the kind of vibe I want at a little neighborhood coffee shop.

36.description: The space is nice and is laptop friendly (lots of outlets and single tables) The coffee is not good though,way to acidic.

14.description: Places like these make me happy to be on earth. And the fact that the Coffee Studio is located on a street with a great brunch place, a great yarn shop, and a great barbecue restaurant make me wish I lived in Chicago. The Coffee Studio is a gorgeous space with a beautiful interior (modernist, exposed brick, all the style accoutrements of modern day hipster living) and an expansive menu of coffee drinks, breakfast items, and so forth. They use Intelligentsia beans, and while those are a bit overroasted for my taste (not that this is the Coffee Studio's fault), the coffee they brew is very nice. This is a great place to hang out, have a cup of coffee, and peruse the latest issue of ArtForum magazine.

3.description: First off, I absolutely LOVE that this place is dog friendly. That alone keeps me coming back time after time. Though it's not the cheapest in town, the prices are definitely reasonable, none of the crazy markups you can sometimes see at these smaller places. The staff is great, and again, DOG FRIENDLY. They give my little bug a treat every time he comes in to help mommy buy wine. I love it.

1.description: Nice neighborhood liquor store with better than average beer selection, acceptable wine choices (better than at Whole Whitepeople Foods) only slightly more expensive than big box liquor stores.  Fair selection of grocery items, non-alcoholic beverages, friendly service, it's in a good location for the BYOB restaurants nearby.

2.description: What a life saver! There was a misunderstanding on who was to purchase wine one night. I wasnt off till 830 from the west side. Luckily this great life saver was stocked and ready. Found a nice merlot under my budget from Washington, my home state. Thanks for saving the night guys!

9.description: Wow, Im rating a liquor store.PROS: I just realized on a bicycle I can do a round trip home and back in 10 min.  Great beer selection because they have Half Acre!  They also have a slew of other great beers and snacks.CONS: Prices are a little high.  I dont like to pay more than $11 for a 6 pack.... even a great 6 pack, but I will if need be.  Stupid pricks loiter in this area. A steady flow of gang banger idiots come down from the train.Check out the selection and be happy.  Avoid the idiots that made them install a flashing blue light on the corner.

10.description: Great Liquor Store.  Just can't stand the garbage that hangs out in front.

4.description: This place looks like kind of a hole from the outside, but the inside has a REALLY great beer selection.AND a nice selection of TASTY TREATS.But seriously. They have some really great beers in here. If you are a beer snob like we are, you will probably like it in here. It's a great little neighborhood shop.There can be some shifty people hanging outside it, though... several guys got in a fight out front, and one of their fists actually whiffed my face. An inch to the right and I would have had a black eye.ANYWAY.The beer selection is still good.

6.description: Don't let the lackluster curb appeal and the kids outside looking like fools with their pants on the ground keep you from walking in the door. Tommy is super friendly, the rest of the crew is helpful and remembers return customers and the  liquor selection is awesome. I'd rate this higher than 5 stars but Yelp won't let me!Great wine selection, significantly better than Dominick's and worth the extra block of walking (if you're heading south on Broadway). Awesome beer selection, too. And my favorite? A growing selection of wheat and gluten free beers... this gluten free girl is VERY happy with that. Especially because they are stocking Green's gluten-free, sulfite-free Tripel Blonde ale from Belgium - YUM!I mentioned Tommy earlier and he's worth a mention again and not just because he is awesome. He's totally receptive to suggested wines and beers and he can get them in the store within days of your request. My first experience was in searching for a Gruner-Veltliner. Within 3 days of my request, he had pulled in Grooner - a fab white from Austria. Stop by, say hi to Tommy and pick up a bottle (or 3) the next time you're in the area.

12.description: Cleanest liquor shop in Edgewater.  Very convenient. Sometimes I would get off the train at Thorndale just to stop by here so I didn't get mauled by the pimps and thugs on Granville.

5.description: WOOOHOOOO!Castle's has come through quite a few times, whether before or after a shift at work. There have been occasions where I'll hop off the train and have the taste for a root beer and some pretzels. Where to? No, not Dominicks or Jewel, but Castle. Just last week, I got a call from a group of friends hoping to hang out at my place and we thought a couple of 12 packs would do us just right. If you are thinking I made my way to Castle, you are quite the context clue detective. lolThe guys behind the counter are quite effective at handling the random rushes on Friday/Saturday nights and do so with a courteous touch. As Meghan B. noted, if there is Chicago baseball on television, you can bet it will be on the TV behind the counter.The selection isn't going to make your head spin, but there are about ten to twelve beers and a fair section of wines and spirits.The fifth star could be attained if they institute a Frequent Buyer club, or something.Go ahead and pop in and check it out

11.description: haha  I'm posting this mostly because I find it delightful that this place is on here.Come for beer, as the wine selection, while sizeable, isn't too appealing.  Beer selection is better, albeit a little more expensive, than Dominick's around the corner.It's really fun to come in while a Cubs game is on their little TV behind the counter.  I love the guys that work here.  Somehow it's always just a pleasure to go in there.  I always leave with a smile on my face.

8.description: Solid neighborhood liquor store. Decent selection of beer, wine, and liquor, as well as snack foods and basic necessities. Cheap? Nah. Expensive? Nah. Very middle of the road. And they close at 11. That's kind of lame. That often drives me to Dominick's around the corner... well, that and cheaper prices. Sorry, independent retailer. But when I can, I shop here. They're clean, friendly, and if you can pass the wannabe gangstas hanging out in front/by the Thorndale stop on any given night, it's a perfectly acceptable neighborhood liquor store.

0.description: I got rid of my fat looser husband and to celebrate my new man and i bought a nicely priced bottle of Hennessey and cranberry. They have it all to make you forget about the lamest jerk in your life. Only con they close early. Cheers!!!

7.description: Great location, friendly staff.They lose one star because of the mass of ignorant dudes always hanging out in front (not the store's fault, but still very unpleasant) and another because the prices are a bit ridiculous.Overall they're great in a pinch.

3.description: Very nice first experience.  Great atmosphere, clean and very friendly.  And the Wasabi wrap was delicious.  Yummy and more health-oriented than most places in the neighborhood.

1.description: I stopped in with a friend because a another friend had recommended I check it out, mainly because I am a health nut. So, I stopped in Sunday and it's the first time I have ever walked into a coffee house and felt like I was also in a supplement store, I then turned to the staff and asked "what's the concept here?". The person replied that the owner's take was to create a healthy/fitness minded cafe so, I thought to myself .. "that's cool" and I was a bit excited.So, I was pretty disappointed to find, if the concept was suppose to be truly a healthy alternative to the other multiple coffee houses in the area, why not offer organic milk options and why even offer soy, since it's one of the the unhealthiest things both men and women can consume to due to its effect on Estrogen levels; there are much better options is Almond or Coconut milk and your competitors down the street are offering it.The decor was nice and the staff friendly but, if this place is truly trying to differentiate itself from the all the other coffee houses with a health/fitness spin then that message needs to be pretty clearly communicated and the products served need to back up that concept with organics and choices; do that and I will gladly walk past the other coffee houses to come to yours.

2.description: Stopped by shortly after their grand opening. The staff was incredible friends and knowledgeable. I thought the food was delicious and very well executed. The Metropolis coffee they brew was a great accompaniment to my salad. Great spot to get work done away from home. They also sell protein and supplements! This place has it all!

0.description: A friendly neighborhood spot with a diverse pantry of goodies. If you lift, you can get your protein powder fix! Also, there is delicious local Metropolis coffee and even salads/wraps. Congrats to my good friend for making his dream come true.

28.description: I go to Kitchen Sink often because my girlfriend lives around the corner. I only go there for the convenience (which is definitely as good of a reason as most to go to a coffee shop). However, with Chicago Grind open now across the street, Kitchen Sink might be in trouble.I could write so much more, but the number one most consistent problem with this cafe is the staff. They are not friendly. The most friendly person who works there is lukewarm, at best.My context is, I work in food service and understand how truly exhausting, draining, frustrating, thankless etc it can be. But Kitchen Sink has the opportunity to be a really special place, because of it's size, uniqueness and location. It is not a chain. It is one of a kind, and the staff doesn't treat it like so. There are times when I could swear I am at a Dunkin Donuts with the service and sour faces I get.

1.description: I felt "Kitchen Sink" is a misnomer.  When I think of this term, images of the "salad bowl with leftover Italian dressing," "stainless steel pot that she used the night before for pierogi," and "tea cups with a couple of herbal tea bags inside she forgot to discard" surface.  Well, this "Kitchen Sink" is a coffeeshop, less than one (1) block east of the CTA Berwyn Red Line station.  Rosa J. was waiting to meet up her hubby who was nearby.  However, the cold wind raged and the temperature dropped.  She needed a hiding place and believed food could nourish her body. Yelp suggested me this place and surely didn't lead me wrong.  They serve Metropolis Coffee.  See, you can't find that in the kitchen sink, can you?  Hubby came after me ordered a cortado.  He knew that the colder the day, the stronger the coffee he needed.  I went with a green tea latte instead, along with a blueberry lemon scone.  "Kitchen Sink" isn't particularly hipster, but you can identify the city-feel by looking at the general clientele and overall ambiance.  It's not an absolutely quiet spot, yet it's serene enough if you need to engage conversations with your partner or to stay in the zone to minimize the external disturbance.  I guess I will never forget the name of this place since it's time for me to proceed to the kitchen sink and load these naughty dishes into the dish washer.

39.description: Came in for an Iced Coffee and a Scone to fuel up for my day exploring my new home. I was greeted by friendly staff and got my order super fast. This place is pretty close to my apt, so I will be making frequent trips!

9.description: I walked up to Kitchen Sink at 5:40pm and hesitated. The hours posted on the door showed they closed at 6:30pm. But I had a workshop at 6:30, so I would definitely be out of there in plenty of time. See, I'm up in this neighborhood every month for this same reason, and I usually go to Chicago Grind. But the last few times my favorite sandwich had been dry, they replaced the excellent spicy slaw with sweet slop, and the staff was rude. So, I'd been wanting to try something new. So I walked in. I was immediately greeted with the notice that they had no bread, but could still make wraps. OK, no problem. I ordered the Peggy and a iced green-mint tea. I asked the woman behind the counter if they had Wi-Fi and she grimaced a "yes." I explained I just wanted to open up a document on my laptop while I ate, to prep for my workshop. "I know you guys close at 6:30, and I promise I'll be out of here by 6:15," I said. "Um, so I guess you want a Wi-Fi password?" she asked menacingly. "That would be great," I said. She handed me my tea and told me the wrap would be ready shortly. Uh, ok..? I sat down and she immediately began sweeping up all around my table. The friendly guy behind the counter brought me my wrap. It was nicely grilled and assembled, but the turkey texture was spongy, like what you get from grocery store packages. The BBQ sauce was way too sweet, making the whole thing taste like some sort of bizarre take on horseradish candy. The woman never said another word to me as she cleaned aggressively around me, so I ate what I could and left as soon as possible. Upside? The tea was delicious. But not worth it; I guess I'll go back to Chicago Grind next month.

29.description: They have almond milk! Great coffee and tea and friendly staff and delicious wraps. Some vegan options. Wish they had gluten free muffins and bread etc. For wifi you get an old school code at the register, good for 2 hours.

23.description: My new favorite coffee shop. What you need to know:-2 hour wifi with purchase and it's fast-friendly staff-food food. As in, sandwiches and soups -best iced chai ever. Ever.Also, the architecture of the building is beautiful. I always forget to look up and am always pleasantly surprised when I remember there's a huge skylight in the ceiling.

5.description: Review strictly based off of food and coffee; not service since I waited outside with my dog while friends went inside to get my breakfast burrito and coffee. Seemed as if the burrito wasn't as hot as expected, but that's my only complaint. It was delicious. Can't wait to try the waffle burrito.

31.description: Cute little neighborhood coffee shop vibe. I love to walk over and get a coffee and the PRF. The people who work there are always sweet and pretty quick.

25.description: It was OKAY-- guess it was what I ordered.. Just a simple grilled cheese and soup to ward off the chill of the day.  The soup was tasty but wasn't great.  The grilled cheese was parboiled - cheese wasn't melted when it came off the grill--you could still see the slices.. When I asked for it to be warmed up again - they put it in the microwave till it was melted to the point of inedibility.  Needless to say I won't be revisiting.

12.description: I really wanted to like this place, but every time I go in I feel like I'm intruding. I get that the cool hipster thing to do is to be apathetic towards your guests, or act irritated that someone has walked in to the establishment to buy something....but it's actually not that cool and it'd be nice to walk into a welcoming atmosphere. Their drinks are standard. Kind of pricey. The only reason they're getting more than 1 star is because their breakfast sandwiches are pretty tasty.

37.description: I had a caramel latte and egg/avocado/cheese wrap and was unimpressed by both. Not only were they bland, but they were way too expensive for what they were. My husband ordered the Mayor (no coffee) and we were the only people in line. It took the 2 people on staff over 15 minutes to make the sandwich. Between the overpriced, average food and coffee, and slow staff, I will not be returning to the Kitchen Sink, or recommending it.

21.description: Great place- convenient and close to the train. The staff is very friendly and the food and drinks are made well.My only very specific problems are that the straws they use are very flimsy and the way they wrap sandwiches when you ask to-go is very hard to unwrap and deal with while commuting!

16.description: Had the iced chai and it was disgusting. Felt like coughing every time I took a sip because it was overloaded with spices. The staff is extremely unfriendly and gave me a quick glance without even greeting me when I walked in. Seriously, if you're looking for a warm welcoming environment to study or relax in, avoid Kitchen Sink at all costs. You're better off going to Dunkin Donuts instead. But if you're looking for a pretentious hipstery coffee shop atmosphere, this is the place for you!

17.description: Jeff the owner, should not be in this line of business.  You walk in, no hello, smiles and certainly not a "thank you" in sight.He acts like you should be grateful that someone even waited on you.  He is the most unfriendly business owner that I know.  I haven't been in there for a very long time and have no intention of going back.He knows nothing about customer service and has such a poor disposition!Chicago Grind is a great coffee shop and their coffee is 10 times better!!!If they ever get a new owner I may reconsider coming back, but as long Ashe is there. NEVER!!!

10.description: Of all the coffee places near me in Chicago, this one reminds me the most of my favorite place in college... except the hours. It's small and so it closes earlier than I'd hope. The place strikes a nice balance between being quite and having members of the community meet and talk. Two hours for WIFI with the purchase of a drink is pretty generous for a coffee shop this size. I see complaints here about that. I'm not sure these people know what they're talking about, but they can always go to Starbucks if they need 6 hours of WIFI for free.

11.description: This is a nice coffee shop to have on the block, but its general apathy makes it a hard place to frequent. The lackadaisical atmosphere isn't enough to deter patrons when it is so conveniently beneath an el stop, but I sure hope the people who run this place learn the value of a simple smile, because "welcoming" is never a word I'd use to describe the joint.

26.description: I had avoided going to the Kitchen Sink for a while, because it was out of the way and I heard that it was small. But when Kopi failed to produce wi-fi and the sterile environment of Ch'ava finally got to me, I decided to venture out into the world.I feel so at home!Pros:Lovely, friendly baristas. I'm not sure of her name, but the one with the razor sharp pink nails (Yeah, you heard me) is a especially delightful.Cozy, warm atmosphereChill, indie decor that doesn't try too hardRage face signsVice magazine in the bookshelfGender neutral bathroomDecent Nutella Mocha latteDecent sammiesAMAZING soup- I had the chickpea curry. Is this homemade? It tastes homemade.And as friends and I noticed separately, sexy queer ladies flouncing about the placeDJ Shadow/ Wax Tailor/ Triphop playlist that isn't so loud you can't hear yourself thinkNeutral:They serve MetropolisTheir food menu is obviously very well thought outApparently they do live events- awesome!Cons:You have to pay for a wi-fi code every 2 hours... and the wi-fi is terrible.  It's been 5 minutes and I'm still waiting for Google Drive to pop up. Perhaps the owners should consider nixing the paid for wi-fi in favor of free? Since it isn't useable, that is.(This is a deal breaker for me : ( . Please, please fix the wi-fi so I can come back. You have everything else going for you, Kitchen Sink!)

27.description: Latte was good, but not great. I think the milk was a little sour. Bacon/Egg/Cheese/Avocado on everything bagel was also good enough to statisfy my hunger, but nothing to write home about.Quick place. Won't disappoint you, but also won't knock your socks off. You can probably find a better option, but if you're in the area and in a rush, go for it.

35.description: Some of the best breakfast wraps.  Try the egg and ham and mushroom and onion and mustard Winston burrito with avocado and apricot or fig jam added to it.   Sooooo good.

8.description: I had the Mayor sandwich, which came grilled and.had some sort of cheese that was soo nutty that at first I thought there was peanut butter in it. It's a sweet and savory kinda deal, not too bad. My friend got the Greek salad, which was standard. Regarding ambience, they have cool art on the walls, which was also affordable if you want to make out yours... the music playing was 80s hits, so if you'll be reading a book or magazine, better be ready to concentrate or else "sweet dreams are made of these" will make hard to get past the first page.

0.description: Ambiance: very, very relaxing and quiet. Easily one of Chicago's top places to study or simply do anything that requires a strenuous amount of focusing. Big on promoting local events in Andersonville/Edgewater. Service: excellent! Enormously friendly staff who can advise you on what to sip on. Terrifically fast with the perfect equilibrium of quality is always a bonus, too!Food: never eaten here but they have a meal dedicated to the sweet Ms. Ollie who owns the dive bar Ollie's just kitty-corner to the coffee shop (side note: visit Ollie's after having coffee).Dranks: cannot emphasize how delicious and strong the coffee is here. Just go try it. Strongly recommend the Nutella Mocha!

38.description: I stopped by kitchen sink to grab some coffee and lunch. I had an iced Americano and a sandwich with the cold chili soup. The soup was full of fresh flavors and herbs.  I imagine the other soups would follow suit. The sandwhich seemed a bit dry to me but was still pretty tasty. Overall kitchen sink was a nice place to stop by.

20.description: I gave this coffee shop three stars for a couple of reasons, but let's start with the good.I keep coming back because they have some of the best sandwiches in town. Seriously, amazing. Beyond coffee shop good.Their espresso is ok, it has a bit of an odd flavor to it, but not bad.Here are my two gripes:1. Wifi has a 2 hour limit. I understand why people do this, but it's still off putting. I feel like most people who are there for over two hours end up buying something else anyway.2. The staff. There has been one guy I've  gotten along with so far. Everyone else looks at me like I knocked over the sugar on purpose  (metaphorically, I didn't  knock over any sugar). I've  never seen so much service with so few smiles. I watched one woman serve customer after customer without cracking a smile once.Honestly, I know it's  not the most important thing in a coffee joint, but it's  got a neighborhood coffee vibe, so I was expecting vibrant employees who really liked being there. Instead, I  end up feeling like an inconvenience and an means to their paycheck. If you grab a sandwich and coffee to go, maybe you won't  mind. Personally, I found it off-putting.It's near my house and like I said, AMAZING sandwiches, but otherwise I wouldn't continue to go.

19.description: My new favorite coffee shop. What you need to know:-2 hour wifi with purchase and it's fast-friendly staff-food food. As in, sandwiches and soups -best iced chai ever. Ever.Also, the architecture of the building is beautiful. I always forget to look up and am always pleasantly surprised when I remember there's a huge skylight in the ceiling.

33.description: Stumbled upon this place a couple of weekends ago, thanks to Yelp reviews for my neighborhood. This place is kind of hidden, just off of Broadway. I like it. Parking was easy and it wasn't super busy. I ordered an espresso drink that was supposed to taste like Nutella, but I was seriously disappointed. It had an OK flavor and I willingly drank the whole thing, but it definitely did not taste like Nutella. Maybe a hint of hazelnut? Meh, not really. I ordered my drink to "dine in" since I was with a friend who wanted to grab some food too, but my coffee came in a to-go cup, while his was served in a ceramic mug. Maybe they misheard me. It's not a big deal, but it was a little strange. My friend ordered a wrap of some kind (I can't remember), which he said was standard but nothing special. His drink was made with rosewater and amaretto. It smelled devine, but the flavor was also lacking in his beverage as well. Prices are pretty standard for local coffee joints in the city, but the drinks weren't that great. Maybe it was an off day. I would give them another shot, but they don't compare to Ipsento!

2.description: Very close to the CTA station berwyn which makes it a convenient choice. The drinks were reasonably priced, I got a hot ginger lemonade that was interesting but the taste was sort of sickening after a while. So I wouldn't recommend that but maybe their coffees are betterIt's a pretty good environment to work in, when j was there all the tables were filled with people working on stuff. You get two hours of free wifi with your purchase, just ask for the code.

34.description: Meeeeehhhhhhhh.Here's the skinny:Bitter coffee.Free wifi but you have to get a password from the barista and it expires after a fairly short period of time.Kinda dirty.I don't like.

32.description: First time here, Siri found it for me  i was looking for a quick breakfast joint. This place was awesome. Quiet chill spot (at least at 10am on a Tuesday), friendly customer service.I ordered the trooper breakfast burrito. Perfect balance of sweet and salty. It's egg, cheddar, sausage AND waffle with a side of syrup. It was a great size. I dipped the waffle and sausage side, since I don't topically eat eggs and cheddar with syrup. They serve Metropolis coffee, not my favorite but still ok (just a coffee preference).I would def come again to try their great assortment of breakfast burritos.It's so chill...I don't wanna go

18.description: Definitely your hole-in-the-wall coffee shop. If I didn't already read up on this place on yelp, I probably wouldn't have thought to come in when I walked by. I ordered the Larry and my boyfriend ordered the Peggy. We ordered to-go so I didn't get a feel of the atmosphere there. There were a few people studying and two people working, and it's a small place, so I can't imagine what this place is like when it's crowded. Apart from that, my sandwich was good. Nothing to rave about but I enjoyed it. My boyfriend felt the same. I'll probably try this place again and get one of their specialty drinks.

13.description: They must've changed their chai from my last review. They use a spicy Devi brand that I haven't seen elsewhere. It's pretty sweet and spicy. Their sandwiches are good, sometimes it varies by who's making them. They used to serve muffins from Lovely and Southport Grocery before that, but now they make their own. I was a little skeptical about the changes, but they're really good. You can call in your order ahead of time for pick-up, if you're familiar enough with the menu. Service is friendly, but kind of conservative, all-business friendly.

4.description: After passing this cafe almost daily to catch my morning train, today I decided to stop in and see what the Kitchen Sink was all about. I was immediately greeted by a friendly young man who was cleaning the trash area (big ups for cleanliness!) I ordered a quick cafe au lait with almond milk. The flavor rivaled that of cups I've had down in the French Quarter. The decor looks completely different than what the front window lets in on. A giant (and slightly steampunk) sunroof lets in plenty of natural light to shine on all the great art pieces covering the walls. Will definitely be returning many mornings in the future to check out some of those gorgeous muffins, and of course another great cuppa.

24.description: I love stopping in Kitchen Sink before a long commute on the Red Line, but I feel like their pastry game has really fallen off in the past year or so. When they first opened, they were serving Lovely muffins and croissants, which went great with their delicious and well-served coffee and espresso. But at some point, they started either making their own or getting them from a different supplier, and the quality is highly variable. Today I got the last muffin, and it was at least two days old. I actually had to throw it out, not because it was stale (I would've eaten it anyway!) but because it was drenched in oil or butter (soaked quickly through the paper bag it was given to me in) and had very little flavor. I find the service is always pretty good here, so 4 stars, and the coffee and tea are fine, and the location can't be beat. But guys! Better food options please! It's such a drag!

6.description: This place is a rare find. I got so much work done for graduate school while sitting here, highly caffeinated while feeling so comfortable. Food is great, coffee even better. Not a ton of seating but it seems to work. There is a piece of art (?) in the back with beautiful stained glass. Kitchen Sink is unique and in a good way :)

22.description: Had the iced chai and it was disgusting. Felt like coughing every time I took a sip because it was overloaded with spices. The staff is extremely unfriendly and gave me a quick glance without even greeting me when I walked in.
