Seriously, if you're looking for a warm welcoming environment to study or relax in, avoid Kitchen Sink at all costs. You're better off going to Dunkin Donuts instead. But if you're looking for a pretentious hipstery coffee shop atmosphere, this is the place for you!

15.description: I gave this coffee shop three stars for a couple of reasons, but let's start with the good.I keep coming back because they have some of the best sandwiches in town. Seriously, amazing. Beyond coffee shop good.Their espresso is ok, it has a bit of an odd flavor to it, but not bad.Here are my two gripes:1. Wifi has a 2 hour limit. I understand why people do this, but it's still off putting. I feel like most people who are there for over two hours end up buying something else anyway.2. The staff. There has been one guy I've  gotten along with so far. Everyone else looks at me like I knocked over the sugar on purpose  (metaphorically, I didn't  knock over any sugar). I've  never seen so much service with so few smiles. I watched one woman serve customer after customer without cracking a smile once.Honestly, I know it's  not the most important thing in a coffee joint, but it's  got a neighborhood coffee vibe, so I was expecting vibrant employees who really liked being there. Instead, I  end up feeling like an inconvenience and an means to their paycheck. If you grab a sandwich and coffee to go, maybe you won't  mind. Personally, I found it off-putting.It's near my house and like I said, AMAZING sandwiches, but otherwise I wouldn't continue to go.

7.description: It was a nice cafe but not nice enough to get me to transfer my loyalty from my current favorite cafe. The egg sandwich I got was tiny and unsatisfying. The wifi password expires after two hours which I found to be annoying. Some areas of the cafe, the music was too loud to get work done. Pro: the muffin I tried was delicious. May stop there for sweets in the future but probably won't plan on staying a long time to get work done.

36.description: The Bacon egg and cheese breakfast sandwich with avocado on an everything bagel. Can't go wrong

30.description: The Kitchen Sink was across the street!Staying with my friends close by - I visited the Kitchen Sink.     I was hurting for some breakfast and coffee after a night full of New Years Eve shenanigans.   This place delivered.Ordered a Bacon, Egg, and Cheese on an Onion Bagel with a large cup of coffee.    The food was excellent.    The coffee was excellent.   What more can one ask? I would recommend :-)

3.description: Three stars for the Wi-Fi (two hours per purchase) and the friendly service -- that is, when the apparent owner is not there. I've seen this guy referenced in some other reviews and I'll just assume it's the same guy who gives people guff for having the temerity to order a food item off his menu. Try and order a bagel sandwich anytime he's there solo and you get a "gonna be like 15-20 mins" dismissal. Keep in mind these sandwiches involve microwaved eggs and a slice of avocado -- I mean, who could handle all that work on their own?!Other breakfast items are pretty OK - like the burritos when feeling lazy. They serve NY Bagel and Bialy so that's a huge plus. Drip coffee tastes watery and I now regularly avoid ordering it. In warmer months the iced coffee doesn't taste balanced -- if they're doing a homemade concentrate they need to test out their water ratio more..

14.description: Meeeeehhhhhhhh.Here's the skinny:Bitter coffee.Free wifi but you have to get a password from the barista and it expires after a fairly short period of time.Kinda dirty.I don't like.

29.description: I haven't been into comics since I was a young child but with the success of recent movies and the need to read stuff on public transportation led me to Alleycat.  This throwback has a modern look to it with comics you've heard of and unheard.  Strategically placed between Starbucks and an alley, this hidden gem is a great Chicago experience.

42.description: Let me preface this by saying I know thismuch about comic books. (Imagine me holding a very small stretch of air between thumb and forefinger). That said the fates (ie the nerds/geeks/men who wear glasses who are currently populating my life) have been beating me over the head with comic books of late. I've been to more comic book stores in the past few months than in my whole life and this one is my favorite. Now I can't speak to the selection (they have these books with drawings and words in bubbles) but I can speak to how nice the staff seems to be, how clean and organized the store seems to be and the AWESOMENESS of its location. I kind of wish there was a door to a secret apartment in which I could live in this alley.  I could wear black leather pants and stiletto boots and...a mask? And I'd look really cool every time I stalked down the alley to my hidden home. And maybe I could like...fight crime or something? I guess. In my spare time? Or just read the comic book my cousin bought me today (it's my first one ever and I kind of get the appeal now).Probably the latter. And then if this one hooks me I might even be back for more...

23.description: I don't know what the one reviewer was talking about. They actually have a section of LGBT graphic novels, prominently labelled LGBT, with some good stuff in there. And I don't feel treated poorly for being a woman at all. The staff is very nice and friendly.The location is absolutely adorable. It really does feel like a secret passage to a clubhouse of awesome.They seem to have gotten better at ordering, because there's plenty of comics on the shelves now. Not just DC/Marvel, but a healthy selection of more indy comics. And like any comic shop, they're happy to order anything in Previews if you find something off the beaten path.I'd recommend checking this store out. It has a lot of heart, and felt more like home to me than some of the larger stores.

47.description: Do you read comic books? Would you like to meet artists? Would you enjoy a movie in Andersonville on a Saturday night? This place has everything. Go for the comics. Stay for the cute nerds. They have a great selection of new releases and the graphic novel choices are superb. Can't find it? It's down the alley next to Starbucks.

8.description: An awesome little comic shop, literally, hidden down the alley (as the name implies). I wish they had some more figurines but they did have some other cool swag (like a Doctor Who Tardis scarf).The staff was really friendly and knew their stuff.

31.description: As I walked through the little passage to get to AlleyCats I thought how cool to be off in the cut like they are. When you get pass the darkness you come into this little courtyard and then to this little gem of a comic book store waiting for you. I felt like Alice in Wonderland. The layout was nice and love they had all the back issues of WW I was looking for. The staff was very cool. We had cool convo about Katy Keene. My only gripe was they didnt take Amex oh well not every place does. I think I will definitely check them out again I really liked them.

34.description: GREAT store. Friendly, affordable and knowledgeable staff.  Too bad there is not an e-mail contact. I have six to seven ten gallon tubs filled with comic books (mostly X-Men), I would like to sell AS IS for $100. I did not keep my comics in covers. I have been a collector sine sixteen. Please contact me, if interested. Thanks.

16.description: Go. Take the kids. Get them addicted young. DO IT. 1. Place is awesome; location kick ass2. Staff is friendly. 3. They keep their pulls right behind the counter and know your name. 4. Awesome events 5. Great selection; don't see something you want? ASK! 6. So classy & funI wish this place continued success!

13.description: This has become our favorite comic book joint in Chicago. The proximity started it, but the kindness, accessibility, helpfulness, and super cool hidden passage location clinched it for us. Me and my 7 year old dig it!

11.description: Tucked into a little alley, this discrete little store offers a lot in its minimal space. Well-organized back issues, good current offerings, and nice selection of board games and statues make for a good selection. Personable staff know their stuff.

39.description: Totally hidden between two building you would not expect such a cool comic book store in the back with a huge library of comic books. We came by for their magic show on the weekend and it was entertaining.

37.description: Great selection in an excellent location.  The employees are always knowledgeable about when new issues are coming out :) I'll be back!

0.description: There are so many cool places in Andersonville and this one is hidden. Literally... you will pass it up. It's almost like that scene from Harry Potter going down a secret alley to a magical universe.... of Comics! Friendly staff and a memorable experience due to the unique location.

38.description: Been here only twice. Today was my first day as a actual customer. It seems like a nice little comic shop. There were a group of regulars who were talking and having a good time with the staff. I was greeted when I came in which is always nice to hear. I came here to look for certain issues I've been trying to track down. Sadly they didn't have them but I did find some other comics and was happy. Totally coming back.

51.description: A comic book store in A-ville... Hell yeah!!I was casually walking down the street with a few people when my senses started tingling. I jumped back expecting to hit a wall, but only found more sidewalk instead. "Holy, hole in the wall, Pants!!"They had me from the entrance, I'm a sucker for mysterious passage ways. It's down a sidewalk corridor on berwyn and clark, between Starbucks and Potbelly's. This story could write itself, the small business pinched between two corporate giants (dun dun dunnn). Immediately upon entering this square building of deadly paper cuts, I saw the Walking Dead. I leaped over the counter shouting "I guess you can call this a COUNTER-attack!!"**  This small garage turned modern store front complete with pull down glass garage door is super clean and they have made good use of their space. They stock a combination of new and old comics, plus a few odds and ends (t-shirts, toys, and figures). The prices are pretty standard compared to everywhere else. They were super busy when I stopped in so I didn't get a chance to chat with the staff but they did seem very helpful. Nice to have place so nearby. **May not of actually happened.

27.description: Homophobic? Maybe...Culturally insensitive?  No doubt.Despite asking three different employees on separate occasions for gay comics, I was told the demand did not exist. This store is located in Andersonville...Then the comment was made that gay comics were erotic/adult in nature and that AlleyCat Comics is a family store.My comments have been deleted from their Facebook page and I was blocked after being accused of "childish bickering" and being a bully.Today they told a fellow comic book queer that the whole thing had been a "misunderstanding".This dismissiveness reeks of intolerance.I urge all fans of comics and fairness to spend their $ elsewhere.

32.description: I came in on a cold February day and was immediately impressed with the selection and layout.  The employees were SUPER friendly and willing to chat with me about my nerdy questions.  Even the nice customers chimed in.  A nice little visit to a nice little store.

54.description: Just discovered that this place had opened up on my street.  Totally makes up for the fact that Walgreen's is going to be moving into the old Thybony store location a few blocks north.  I think that AlleyCat and Transistor could form a formidable alliance.I have to admit that I don't know much about comics.  But what I do know is that AlleyCat deserves to succeed.  The location, behind an alley, is ridiculously awesome.  They seem well-stocked and have a lot of back issues available.  The guy at the desk was really nice and helpful when my boyfriend asked him some questions.  Definitely plan to return if/when I develop a serious interest in graphic novels and of course for gifts for friends who already have!

48.description: It's great to see a store in Andersonville!  And right by my 2 nd favorite place (Starbucks..lol) (my 1st favorite are comic stores in general)  But it's a great store, great location and Nick and staff are just always full of energy and knowledge.  Even if your not into comics that much, you should still stop in there and check it out!  Ya never know..it may change your mind

44.description: Mama K told me we were going to a comic book store. She said it was like a book store but not like a regular book store. We walked and walked down a long alley to a door and we went inside the store. I saw superheros! Spiderman! Batman! Pow pow pow! Captain America! Wolverine! We looked at comic books. Hey hey hiyah! I liked the action figures. They had tiny ones and big ones and ones with arms that you can change. I saw a cowboy. Pow pow pow! For my special treat I picked out an Amazing Spiderman comic book. I told the owner it was my very first comic book and he gave it to me on the house. I said thank you because I use my manners. Zombie zombie pow hiyah! Thank you!Please don't tell Mama K I was typing on her computer because I'm not supposed to touch it. I wanted to tell you how cool the comic book store is and that you should go look at Spiderman or your favorite superhero. Mama K said if I am good we'll go back again on another day. She also told me that sometimes they show movies there so we might go watch one. I have a superhero name. Pow pow pow!

24.description: Go. Take the kids. Get them addicted young. DO IT. 1. Place is awesome; location kick ass2. Staff is friendly. 3. They keep their pulls right behind the counter and know your name. 4. Awesome events 5. Great selection; don't see something you want? ASK! 6. So classy & funI wish this place continued success!

7.description: Alley Cat is by far my favorite place in Andersonville! If you're looking for a hidden gem, this is quite literally the epitome of the phrase. The entrance in the gangway between starbucks and potbelly. It feels like you're going down diagon alley! The staff is ridiculously friendly and if you go often enough they learn your name like a little mom and pop shop. I have a pull list here for my weekly comic needs and what's nice is that they'll throw some things in there if they think you'll like it. Of course absolutely no obligation to buy it. Even if you're not a serious comic collector, the decor in here alone is pretty amazing. They have game nights, movie nights, and all sorts of fun events to bond with your fellow geek. Gotta love these guys!

49.description: Very aesthetically pleasing comic shop, you walk a narrow alley way to what used to be a garage which they rehabbed very nicely! inside the bright, clean interior there is a great selection of comics, books, t's. the staff is very friendly, helpful and enthusiastic. this shop is great addition to a-ville! :)

40.description: I absolutely love this place. Now, while I've read my share of comics in my life, I am by no means qualified to comment on how well curated the selection is, because I quite simply don't know enough. They certainly appear to have a delightfully wide selection of new comics, trade paperbacks, small-press curios, action figures, and other awesome hoo-hahs that you would want to exchange your money for and take home with you. The space is also beautifully set up: airy, light, welcoming. I would like, though, to make a special shout out to two things: the wonderful staff and the awesome stuff for kids. I have never had a bad customer service experience here; the staff has been welcoming, friendly, and helpful without being pushy or too cool for school (which isn't to say they don't appear decisively cool). Towards the back of the store they have an amazing selection of stuff age-appropriate for the younger set, which is super-cool and not cloying. My kids have delighted in Bone, Amulet, Little Lulu, Melvin Monster, and a horde of other comics they've found on the back shelves. And they've always been treated with respect and like valued customers/readers when they've interacted with the staff. AlleyCat Comics is a gem.

53.description: What a perfectly nestled nook of a space!  It is down a sidewalk corridor on berwyn and clark, between starbucks and potbelly's.  The comics are neatly displayed, drawing you in with the gloss, color and artistry.  I'm not a comic afficianado, but I saw a Star Wars series I may have to check out. They play movies on saturday night and there is an open air patio that gives thems a little more breathing room and a lot of charm.  Well done!

30.description: Amazing shop.  The cleanest and most organized comic shop I've ever been to.  The custom comic cabinets makes searching for back issues so much easier.  I'm giddy over this place.

46.description: Cool location, its really in an alley! Excluded and hard to find.Awesome selection of current comics. Good graphic novels, cool people and i think a family operation cuz i always see pops and his daughter!!!

1.description: First things first, I'd like to say is that to me, presentation is the first thing that makes the ambience of the place shine. The architecture of AlleyCats is outstanding. I want to say it's kind of a huge garage that's been flipped to a hip store. The place is real unique, super clean, with nice exposed brick walls, and modern shelves that display the comics. So to sum it up, shop is dope, fresh, fly and all that! lol   Shops got a real good selection of comics. They have games and actions figures too. The staff is awesome and friendly. Their real good people. This spot is definitely my home away home.

55.description: Tired of those grim and dirty local comic stores, with ceilings caving in run by the comic book guy from the Simpsons?  Girls?  Tired of creepy fanboys learing at you as you peruse for you local manga selction or Geoff Johns epic yarn?  Well, look no further!  Alley Cat is the jam, and even has cloth towels in the bathroom!  It's so awesome, it smells like a new car, and is run by some of the nicest guys in the city of Chicago.  Not only that, it's nestled between a Potbellys and a Starbucks, so literally, you can hangout out, all day, and talk about movies, books, comics ... whatever!

9.description: Alleycat, once you find it actually down a narrow alley, is a fantastic little gem. They have something for everyone with graphic novels, comics, cards and tabletop gaming. If you're looking for something in particular, they'd be more than happy to order it for you or hold a copy of the newest edition of your favorite comic.Whether you're stopping in just to pick up some comics or looking to hang out, Alleycat is a great place for it!

26.description: This is a wonderful shop, plain and simple. The employees are quite knowledgeable of their product and always seem friendly and willing to help. The selection is solid, especially for a neighborhood comic shop. Anytime I wanted something they don't stock they have always ordered it for me with no issue.Currently they have a Magic the Gathering community that is growing player by player. It's a friendly and warm atmosphere that caters to new, casual, and competitive players alike. They always have players willing to help new folks learn the game.Beyond that, they have events all the time including movie night on Saturdays and Karaoke towards the end of each month. These things aren't necessary but it's been an great way to connect with the staff that otherwise would not have been possible.I would recommend this shop to anyone.

25.description: I don't know anything about comics/graphic novels, but happened to be looking for a specific Astro City thing.  Selene and Bryan were super friendly, approachable and helpful.  The store is in such a cool location and is organized and bright. I'm such a fan of the store that I'll have to learn more about comics just to go there!

12.description: A HIDDEN GEM!This place is truly down an alley!   If you're searching for this place, it's located RIGHT NEXT to Starbucks.  It's the alley way between Starbucks and the business next door.This place wasn't huge but it was fun, inviting, and the two workers (maybe the owners) were SUPER nice and helpful.  The place itself isn't huge but they have a little bit of everything.   My boyfriend bought this Spiderman bank but was curious about a Venom one that was just like it.   They knew their inventory and told us it was sold out.  He then had a questions about a comic and the gentlemen was knowledgeable and walked us to where the series was.  They were out of what we wanted but knew it was coming in soon and offered the service of holding it for him when it arrive in store, what a great service!  By the time we went back to the front to buy the Spiderman bank, the lady had researched for the Venom bank without us asking and provided us information about that specific product.  She went out of her way to make sure we were highly informed and I truly appreciate the customer service they both provided us.   Even though we have a couple comic places near us, we'll be coming to AlleyCat Comics as our home comic store for now on.Thanks for the great service AlleyCat Comics!

21.description: It kind of sucks that such a mediocre comic shop has such a cool name and location. After the anticipation that builds from walking down the alley inside is a major let down. I'm not sure they had even your standard titles, but maybe that is the point? If it is, I don't get it.

17.description: Full on YES. For Alley Cat. Great people, very helpful and easy going. I take my kids and there's something for everyone. The owners kid is often there on weekends so kids are welcome. Go, just to sneak down the alley

10.description: Another place that, when I visit, I get this overwhelming sense that everything will be OK if I could just stay in their store forever. (Nothing crazy or delusional about that, nope).Alley Cat is so special, walk down tiny whimsical brick gangway to comic paradise. I'm not a big super hero person and my boyfriend isn't either but we have found comics to enjoy here. Half the fun is browsing their extremely huge selection of comics, admiring the art and picking up a new title to take home. If you are, or know someone who is, a huge comic freak they have some really great, although kind pricey, hardbound full color books that would make great gifts for a true collector. Many toys and games and paraphernalia line their shelves. They have a nice selection of comics and books for younger kids and an anime section of manga. They have boxes of what seem to be older publications of classic titles and plenty of nerdy card games like Magic the Gathering. I think they actually host Magic games here throughout the week and movie nights.The staff are all very friendly and never pressure you to buy anything, its a very welcoming environment to stop at and have a look around. A nice asset to the neighborhood and a favorite weekend stop for the bf and I.

5.description: What a great little store!  They are so friendly here, and you can find anything that you need.  I've been several times now.  My favorite part is how it doesn't feel like a lot of other comic shops -- it's very clean, clutter-free, and organized.

3.description: First off, points for having the comic shop be in an actual alleyway. And for said alleyway to be as neat as it can be. That being said, OH MY GOD! A little slice of comic book heaven. Great selection, friendly staff, and they have sales in most older comics. It's a great place to stop by and check out.

35.description: The people here are very helpful:-if they don't know something (even that's rare) they say, "I don't know, lemme look it up" and look it up and fill me in.-they always ask if they can help me find something if I can't seem to find what I need.-they will order anything you want and hold anything for you.The people here are sickly kind:-always cheerful-they seems like they like working there-they chat me up about about superhero/comic nerdomThere are ridiculously adorable children there:-sitting on counters-sitting on floors-walking around-talking to you-talking to themselvesLike like like.  Go here and get your fill of comics and picture books and stories and art.  Stay for the nice people.HOWEVER!  My only critique is that I wish they handled my comics a little more lightly and carefully.  I get that not everyone is a collector and wants pristine, NM contitions of their weekly issues but when I go up to pay, they batter the pretty little delicate spines of my issues.  Even so, this is still not enough to keep me away from this place.

19.description: I get that Andersonville is tiny and everyone gets excited about a new place opening up, but seriously?  Besides having an extremely cool location this place has nothing going for it.  And it's getting two strikes from me on big issues.First off, the selection is super duper tiny.  Went in on a Friday morning when they first opened and there were so many holes of things sold out.  I would say 'good for you' but instead I say 'shame on you for not ordering enough of what you customers want'.  Additionally, being in Andersonville, I didn't think I would feel like I would stick out like a sore thumb.  There's a weird thing that happens when a girl walks into a comic book stores - not all but some - and it's where all the boys stare like they're thinking I walked in the wrong place.  And then offers no hello, no help, and when I decide to check out after perusing their tiny selection, not a word. And when my wife compliments you on your space, you answer.  Don't just keep your eyes low and ring my credit card through.  Not. One. Word.  This is rude and I already wanted to tell the dude to forget it but my card had been processed.  Secondly, it's been brought to my attention that they refuse to carry gay and lesbian books because they're "family friendly".  To start, look at what neighborhood you're in.  And also, you have comic books that have porn in them.  Saga for instance is on the second to last shelf where any child could pick it up.  If you're SO worried about being family friendly, you would either ban that too or put it up higher.  I'm not sure if this is a business that doesn't want conflict.  Or if they're just altogether not gay friendly.  Perhaps this is why my wife and I got the cold shoulder when we entered even though we were spending money - and not on fluff either - I'm a Walking Dead girl!  I would advise my friends and other comic lovers to not enter this store though because they're using some crap business practices.  Go to Chicago Comics where you're not shunned just for being a girl or even being gay - this place is wack!

28.description: I get that Andersonville is tiny and everyone gets excited about a new place opening up, but seriously?  Besides having an extremely cool location this place has nothing going for it.  And it's getting two strikes from me on big issues.First off, the selection is super duper tiny.  Went in on a Friday morning when they first opened and there were so many holes of things sold out.  I would say 'good for you' but instead I say 'shame on you for not ordering enough of what you customers want'.  Additionally, being in Andersonville, I didn't think I would feel like I would stick out like a sore thumb.  There's a weird thing that happens when a girl walks into a comic book stores - not all but some - and it's where all the boys stare like they're thinking I walked in the wrong place.  And then offers no hello, no help, and when I decide to check out after perusing their tiny selection, not a word. And when my wife compliments you on your space, you answer.  Don't just keep your eyes low and ring my credit card through.  Not. One. Word.  This is rude and I already wanted to tell the dude to forget it but my card had been processed.  Secondly, it's been brought to my attention that they refuse to carry gay and lesbian books because they're "family friendly".  To start, look at what neighborhood you're in.  And also, you have comic books that have porn in them.  Saga for instance is on the second to last shelf where any child could pick it up.  If you're SO worried about being family friendly, you would either ban that too or put it up higher.  I'm not sure if this is a business that doesn't want conflict.  Or if they're just altogether not gay friendly.  Perhaps this is why my wife and I got the cold shoulder when we entered even though we were spending money - and not on fluff either - I'm a Walking Dead girl!  I would advise my friends and other comic lovers to not enter this store though because they're using some crap business practices.  Go to Chicago Comics where you're not shunned just for being a girl or even being gay - this place is wack!

45.description: Fantastic store. Great looking location and the staff there are very, very friendly and knowledgeable. Great selection too.

33.description: This place is great. A really good selection of weeklies and trades and if they don't have something they're happy to order it for you. Everyone is incredibly nice, Nick and Luke behind the counter are great and they really like working there and helping people find what they're looking for. It's well light, open, and family friendly. There's even usually a kid or two looking around and talking to whoever is around. They have movie nights and karaoke nights and are doing a great job of building a community in the area. If you're going to buy comic books, give this place a shot and see what you think.

43.description: Kids say cool!

2.description: "AlleyCat Comics is a gem; from the alley entrance you know this place is something special and the shop and staff make that assumption true. They have an excellent stock of new, indie, and past issue comics, as well as, a small but well curated selection of collectables."

18.description: Nothing but love for Alley Cat and all the great folks that work there. Friendly, knowledgeable, and needs, this is my favorite business to give my time as well as my money in all of Chicago.

41.description: This place is really cool and tucked into a hidden corner of Andersonville.  I can't say that I am a major comic book fan, and the first time I went in there was to just check out the new neighborhood store.  But they really do have something for everyone.  They are super friendly and willing to help you find what you are looking for.  It is more expensive than buying the comics online like off of amazing but I think it is great to support a local friendly business.One the wall to the right they have a big display of more special comics and it is great to look at just as a piece of wall art because of all the color and pattern that is going on.  I am a huge fan of the Parker books (that was my first comic purchase).  I will definitely be going back for more.I would recommend this place to anyone for a fun stop in Andersonville.

52.description: I've been going into comic book stores for decades.  Over the last few years, though, visits have become infrequent. I find myself departing the store feeling melancholy over the industry, and having purchased nothing. Not so with my first visit to Alley Cat.  I think it's the quality of the light in the space, and the way the shelves are arranged - browsing books here is pleasurable.  Enjoyed chatting with the knowledgable and genuinely friendly staff.  I bought probably more comics in my first visit to to this shop than I have in the last year since moving to Chicago.  Perhaps it's lack of clutter plus an interesting selection just put me in a better mood.I really want this place to succeed!  Make the effort to find AlleyCat. Then bring your comics into George's and read 'em over a chocolate malted.

50.description: Great modern comic book store.  Probably one if not the most aesthetically pleasing comic book stores in Chicago; converted from an old garage, accessible though a proper Chicago gangway.  At Alley Cat you'll find a very well organized selection of current releases, back issues, trades and toys.  Clean and well lit, with a solid competitive and versatile subscription service.  Not to mention a friendly and accommodating staff.I should also mention that they have a kid specific area stocked with the Archie, Disney, DC & Marvel children's titles and more.  Additionally it is behind an ice cream store.

4.description: AlleyCat is hands down, the best comic shop in Chicago. From a knowledgeable and funny staff to an insane selection, I drive out of my way all of the time to visit these cats.

6.description: Comic book stores don't get much cleaner and well-organized than this.  They aren't as large as a lot of other comic book stores in Chicago.  They don't have a lot of the "toys" you'll see jammed into nooks and crannies in other places.  I'm not into comic books as much as the people I was with, so I'll let others review the place in depth.

22.description: I am new to the world of comic books, even though I shouldn't be new. I have a MA degree in Popular Culture studies, and while I concentrated on film and TV, many friends worked with comics and comic book history and culture. Here's the thing: because I didn't grow up with it, it has always been difficult to go to a store and be taken seriously, as: 1. I'm a woman. 2. I admit to being a comic novice. 3. Again, I'm a woman. 4. I'm not a huge fan of superhero-based content. AlleyCat has changed all that, and now that I'm 30, I have finally found a place where I am comfortable and feel welcomed and not ostracized. I had gone in a few times with my husband (a huge comic book fan) and was, as usual, completely overwhelmed and way out of my element. I finally went in by myself, in the hopes of being able to find something that I would enjoy that wasn't just something my husband or friends told me I had to try. I wanted to find what works for me. Nick not only helped me find material, but asked what sorts of TV and film I watch to better assess things that would be good starts for me to read. He never pushed something on me, and I don't even think he was sure I'd buy anything, but he did spend about 20 minutes with me and actually listened. As in, he didn't flinch when I said I was a newbie and felt overwhelmed and didn't know what the hell I was doing. Instead, he listened carefully to my list of favorite shows and films and carefully selected items for me. The experience was so positive for me that not only did I walk out with about $50 worth of books (because they looked perfect), but that someone finally cared about what I was interested in and invested time on a busy night to help me out. My husband is a loyal customer, but they found a loyal customer in me as well. I can't wait to go back in this week and discuss how I felt about the selections I went home with (Saga, Chew, Gotham Central, Black Science, and Scalped) to better learn where my tastes lie.Bottom line: these people are wonderful and beyond helpful. If you have ever been afraid of walking into comic book store, this is the one to break you from that fear.

15.description: This is my Neighborhood Comicbook Shop. I'm here once a week spending all my hard-earned money on comics (don't judge me). The customer service is tops. Don't know what you're looking for? They'll happily recommend something that you'll end up loving. Remember a book you saw a few months ago and it was blue and about a superhero? They'll find it or die trying. Want to put a few books aside to pick up later? I'm almost 100% sure they'll do that. In short, they're extremely nice, and extremely knowledgeable, and would even probably help you deliver your child if the timing was right.Another thing I like about this store is that all are welcome. For all the time I've spent there I've never once seen a customer make it in the shop without being warmly greeted. No one is ignored; no one is slighted, and let's face it, you can't say that about a lot of comic shops. You're not going to get dissed for liking Bat Mite, or laughed at for digging Greg Land's art, or any other comic-related offense. Alley Cat just doesn't have that vibe.The vibe it DOES have, is clean, tidy, and warm. You won't be tripping over boxes of random crap, or accidentally knocking books off the shelves because they've been there for months and have started to warp. You won't smell that musty moldering old-book smell present in some shops (sorry, places who still sport the carpet you had when your store opened 25 years-ago, but you know it's true), And you won't run out of things to peruse until long after your parking meter has expired (be careful, this has happened to me a few times already) because the place is packed with great stuff.Not only do they carry all the titles from your Marvels and DC's (and all their imprints), but they treat independent /alternative/smaller-press comics with the equal reverence. They've got a huge selection of trades and graphic novels as well as a great selection of various games (Magic gatherings also happen here weekly, so, you can do that), statues, figures, shirts, magazine, AND a great kid's section! Can you even believe it? So much stuff...it's pretty amazing.Lastly, the neighborhood. It's a walking neighborhood as well as a parking, shopping, and driving-away neighborhood. Starbucks, Potbellies, lot's of eateries and ice creameries, and shops are within footsteps of AlleyCat (which is hidden at the end of a small. but completely safe alley between Starbucks and Potbellies). The only downside is that in the summer on Wednesdays - that's "comic book day" for those that don't know - there's a stupid old farmer's market half a block away (just kidding, it's excellent).  that makes parking a bit harder to find. Not nearly impossible, just a bit harrowing if you're running out of gas. Still, worth it though. Finally, you should really support your local comic shop. If you haven't been comic shopping since you were a kid (like in the 90's, like Youngblood, am I right?), or you fell out of it because you thought you'd set aside childish things for a job and a car and kids, well, you should go back NOW. Things have changed. This is the titanium age of comics (I think I just made that up). The art.is literally better now than it's ever been. The stories are amazing and encompass every imaginable genre and subject (including zombies). Amazing artists and writers are being employed by comic companies (or starting their own) in incredible numbers, and it makes the comic experience so much more fulfilling. You should re-check it out. It's awesome.

20.description: This place is awesome!!!   The staff are so nice - soooooo nice.  Chatty, funny, cool - to me, my 10 yo son, my mom, my husband.  Cannot recommend highly enough.  Go now!  Buy their stuff!   :-)

36.description: ADORBS little spot - follow the secret tunnel (not too secret - make sure they stay in business!) down off of the main Andersonville retail stretch to this little spot. All killer, no filler, the perfect proportion of current superhero floppies to legacy trade paperbacks and a respectable amount of indies. Bonus points to them for not pandering with a name like "Diagon Alley Comics" or something like that, because it feels like a hidden magical spot right out of Hairy Potters.

14.description: The staff is very helpful and friendly. Amazing customer service. I seen a ton of interesting comics, and although I'm not a comics person, I do enjoy certain shows (like Doctor Who and BTVS) that the store caters too. And there's comics and games you can ffind on those hip, campy, tongue-in cheek shows too ;pDefinitely give this place a try!

58.description: You can tell the ingredients are quality but I just can't give this place 4 stars. The prices are outrageous. $5 for one taco?  The pizza was good, but very greasy that the cheese just slid right off. The cookies also weren't any different than ones I could buy at the mariano's for much less. Also, I get the idea that their cleanliness standards aren't that great. We came in and two tables next to us were just leaving. The pizza plates on each table sat there the whole time we are with no signs of them attempting to clean up. The owner made no attempt to clean it and I watched as he played online games on his computer. Also, they filled up their water tank in the main dining area with an old plastic bucket. The guy filling it had his fingers grasped around the edge of the bucket. That gave me the heebie jeebies. I'm all about closing my eyes when I go into a divey type place, but not for a place that has high quality ingredients and exorbitant prices.

56.description: Great food...great staff..best tacos in Chicago! The menu is crazy..everything is amazing.

29.description: tasty pizza, would come back to try some tacos

42.description: The pork shoulder tacos were absolutely phenomenal!  The guy working, I believe his name is Mikey, was super helpful and nice, really made my first experience here great! I'll be back for more for sure!

23.description: I just moved a block away from Cookies and Carnitas. This is dangerous. I'm a vegetarian. You may be wondering, why would a vegetarian go to a place that focuses on carnitas? I answer thus: -Cookies. Delicious cookies. Big cookies, but not "this-is-contributing-to-the-obesity-epidemic" big. Soft, but not creepily soft like Chips Ahoy preservative-pumped soft. Sweet cookies, but but not "please-put-some-actual-flour-and-butter-in-this-cookie" sweet. Ya get it? These are some good cookies. They make different flavors, and it looked like they had a PB&J cookie today, but I will probably stick with the triple chocolate chunk. -Pizza. As a red-blooded Midwestern American, it's vital that I get my daily recommended serving of pizza. I ordered the standard cheese pizza, and not only was it ready in a jiffy, but it was also a great classic New York style pie; thin, foldable crust, a slim layer of mild tomato sauce, and a sheet of browned cheese. I'm more of a deep dish gal, but this pizza did it for me. -Beverages. For its pseudo-divey atmosphere (intentional or not), there were some pretty great drink choices. I will refer to them as "craft soft drinks"; it's BYOB, so no craft beer here, but if "craft soft drinks" were a thing, that's what these would be. -Location: like I said, this place is close to where I live. It's right by the Broadway bus stop and pretty close to the El, so you have no excuses. I'd take away 1/2 a star for the price - 5 bucks for one taco? - but I will try one of these tacos first and then decide whether it's too steep. They do have a veggie taco, plus some vegetarian sides, so I will check it out!

47.description: There aren't enough descriptive adjectives available in my heat-addled brain to portray the deliciousness that is Cookies &  Carnitas. Plus, what a great concept! I love this place.

8.description: I had the opportunity to quickly stop in for a rather large "Triple-Chocolate" and a "Cowboy" cookie recently, and all I can say is "YUM!".The small restaurant boasts a fair amount of outdoor seating, a variety of entree options, including a Portobello vegetarian taco, and many different types of cookies to choose from.Stop by sometime, (bring cash!), if you get the chance - I'm glad I did!

31.description: Yum!!!  Totally addicting flavors and very reasonably priced for such high quality ingredients  (think seasonable, local, sustainable and organic).Inviting, casual vibe with very friendly people.  The chef owners are so passionate about high quality, flavorful food and it shows in every bite.  They're even at the Green City Market in Lincoln Park (vendors are held to extremely high standards for using only local, sustainable, organically grown/raised foods and ingredients.)The carnitas are amazing - so far I've had the pork shoulder, chorizo and crispy chicken skin tacos and all 3 were fabulous.  Check out the daily specials too.  Great mix of flavors and textures from the corn tortilla, carefully cooked and seasoned meat, crunchy cabbage, to the perfect amount of mexican crema and lusciously smoky salsa on top.  The pork taco has a bit of pineapple pico on top too.   I can't wait to try the other tacos -brisket, mushroom, etc. And love the small bottles of Coke! And the cookies, wow!  The only possible way to top the cookies is to get them as an ice cream sandwich which is HUGE and thankfully can be cut in half to share or taken home and put in the freezer for snacking later.  The cowboy and triple chocolate and my favorites - choc full of stuff too (coconut, chocolate, nuts, etc.) Since it's cold out now, I can't wait to try their chili!

34.description: Cookies and Carnitas was truly outstanding. I had been intrigued by the name for a while and finally got over there to see what it was all about. Exciting unique tacos to choose from (lamb tongue, crispy chicken skin..) as well as the classics done with the highest quality and culinary focus. The atmosphere is laid back and a bit edgy. Highly recommend this place.

16.description: Stopped in for a cookie and the suggestion of fellow Yelp crew. Oatmeal raisin cranberry.....LEGIT! One of the best cookies I have had in a while.I have aeen and walked by place and have to admit never really got their concept. I walked in for my cookie and found they had full menu of sanwiches, salad and pizza. Ill be back to check in amd try some very appealing looking offerings.

13.description: Went here for lunch today and really like the place. Super friendly with a cool menu. They're a 15 minute drive from where I live, and well worth the drive. If they were closer to my house I'd be here once a week.I had the pork shoulder sandwich, my son had a burger, and my wife had two tacos. Food is very flavorful with generous portions at a very reasonable price. We took some cookies to go, which I've not tried yet.

11.description: Such a good place!! My boyfriend and I got the loaded chili, to which we both agreed was the best chili we have ever had in our lives. Super hearty and delicious. Then afterward we shared a kitchen floor cookie which was super moist and delicious!! Cookies and Carnitas is definitely a place to try and is a place that I'm going to revisit.

39.description: This review is based on the green city market stand. I come to the market pretty much every Saturday just to get my favorite chorizo and egg taco here. I'm the biggest fan and think I have told all of Chicago about it. Lol. The breakfast taco is the most amazing, and unique, that I have  ever had. All fresh, market ingredients. Made right in front of you, what more can you ask for. Oh and the staff is super friendly and helpful. I recently met the owner Brad. He is so friendly and fun. Seems like a great person to work for. Now if only i could get him to offer the tacos during the winter when they move into the nature museum. Lol can't wait till Saturday.

37.description: This place is fantastic. All of their sandwiches are divine, as are the cookies. Get the kitchen floor. SO GOOD.  Also, their burgers are delightful if you're not into the tacos. The folks that run the place are super friendly too. Don't forget your cash!

0.description: The tacos are bomb and huge.  Big enough that 2 of them is enough for this 6'2" 230lbs dude.  Here's the big secret: THEIR PIZZA IS AMAZING. Better than the tacos. Go spinach, sausage, and roasted garlic. You won't be disappointed.

38.description: I LOVE their cookies and can't wait to get back soon to try their tacos and sandwiches!

51.description: The "quality" is good........ the authenticity is completely lacking.  And, they are charging WAY TOO MUCH FOR TACOS.  The lighting is depressing fluorescent... and none of those pictures posted in Yelp are "true to life" without photo-retouching.  (The lighting was adjusted with photoshop for sure)  With the price that they are charging, they should be providing table service.  There are many places that you can get better "real" tacos WITH table service at a fair price.

27.description: Great local taco spot. I had them cater a dinner this weekend. Everything tasted great, and the portions were ample. The brisket tacos and pork shoulder tacos are both good. The salsa has a spicy kick with a subtle sweetness. The cookies are good too, relatively dense with a slight crisp on the outside and yet a nice softness in the center. Also, Mikey was very helpful in taking care of my order, and he is clearly passionate about his business.

32.description: I ate a few bites of the grilled cheese and I could honestly feel my arteries clogging, lol. Had to throw it out. Maybe that's some peoples idea of delicious but it's way too much for me! I got the ice cream cookie sandwich delivered, and it was literally frozen solid. Had to microwave it for a while, which melted most of the ice cream, but it taste pretty good!

54.description: my husband and i love this place. The staff is super helpful. My first time here our gal at the register offered up some advice on what to order. Needless, to say the items we received were da bomb. Pork belly tacos, beef brisket tacos, and the burger were our to go choices. Everything was so yummy. We have been back twice and they are always helpful, and efficient. The cookies look huge, and delicious. i have yet to try. All in all, A+ for C&C

48.description: This place is great! I am obsessed with the pork belly tacos and the dark green salad.

44.description: THIS PLACE IS AMAZING!!! We just ate here with a large group- and they were beyond accommodating. Their pork belly is the most incredible I've ever had. We got a blue salad, a pork belly taco and a pork shoulder taco- they were all great. But! The pork belly will definitely be in my dreams. I can't wait to come back and have more. PS- everyone who works there is super friendly.

24.description: Went here for lunch today and really like the place. Super friendly with a cool menu. They're a 15 minute drive from where I live, and well worth the drive. If they were closer to my house I'd be here once a week.I had the pork shoulder sandwich, my son had a burger, and my wife had two tacos. Food is very flavorful with generous portions at a very reasonable price. We took some cookies to go, which I've not tried yet.

7.description: We were here for the first time on NYE. We ordered the grilled cheese with applewood bacon and it blew my mind away!! I wasn't expecting much at first but as soon as I took the first bite, my thoughts were wow this is the cheesiest gooey goodness grilled cheese I've ever had in my entire life. We absolutely loved it so much that we couldn't stop talking about it the following day (today) and were seriously considering taking a trip from oak park il all the way back to cookies and carnitas. Kudos to the guy in the front (I didn't catch his name) he explained what's the specialty about the place is. My only regret was choosing not to pig out totally missing out on the cookies but I will definitely be back to explore and sample more foods from the menu l. Overall wonderful experience and best of all, totally awesome food!

49.description: I had the opportunity to quickly stop in for a rather large "Triple-Chocolate" and a "Cowboy" cookie recently, and all I can say is "YUM!".The small restaurant boasts a fair amount of outdoor seating, a variety of entree options, including a Portobello vegetarian taco, and many different types of cookies to choose from.Stop by sometime, (bring cash!), if you get the chance - I'm glad I did!

40.description: Delicious and unique! Crispy portobello tacos were amazing! Highly recommend! The cookies are like homemade, chewy and yummy! Cool art on the walls too.

53.description: This is my first visit.  Really disappointing.  Cookies were average like from a grocery store.  It also got weird - I ordered two cookies, paid for them, they gave one to someone else.  Not a big deal.  Until... This guy (an owner I'm told) with anger issues in a bandanna tells me "What you want me to do, chase them down?"  He keeps on arguing with me.  I sense he might lose his temper.  His attitude pretty much killed the buzz and ruined it for me.  Even if the food was stellar, which it was definitely not.  About $18 bucks for two tacos and two cookies with tax and tip. His attitude was really bad; that's what I will remember about this place.

30.description: Loaded Chili is the best chili I've ever had. Great and quick service. Awesome soundtrack. BYOB. I can't wait to get back here and try everything else on the menu!

46.description: Best tacos, I have had, good quality meat, decent cookies and they have a really good coffee.

1.description: I've had to reduce my rating on this gem.The service lately has just not been on par. The majority of my orders have had errors to the point where I have to remind them not to forget things and only then is the order complete. If you call ahead the 15-20 minute wait they state is more like a 45 minute wait.The restaurant needs a manager so that the owner's can focus on cooking and training their kitchen staff who appear young and inexperienced. This is easy to critique someone on when you don't have the costs of overhead looming over you. With that, I understand business well to know it's tough to hire people in the service industry and turn a profit: restaurants are losing businesses. That is why I've kept them at four-stars, I see them struggling and try to remain human in my analysis. That being said, accountability are important and easy fixes would be to state accurate wait times, develop a process for validating orders, and train kitchen staff to be more attentive and perhaps urgent.With small improvements I think this spot can be as glorious as it has been but without those I cannot give it the accolades I previously had.

55.description: Order the aged steak sandwich and my partner had the cheesy beef. Fantastic! Will definitely order again. And the cookies are amazing!

9.description: This place is amazing! The tacos are giant and so delicious. The crispy portobello is my personal favorite, with a side of beans. Their cookies are heaven. Cowboy cookie is a must!

26.description: Had a delicious order of their loaded chili! Their tacos are super huge and worth the little extra price. You will leave here happy, and with a cookie to bring home. And it's BYOB!

25.description: This place is awesome. Service is great, cookies are moist and soft, and sandwiches and tacos are delicious. We will definitely be back.  I want to try the pizzas!

12.description: Met up w/ a good friend to catch up and grab a meal; Great  atmosphere to just sit & eat. We both had two tacos, drink & their famous cookies;  generous portions and great price. One of the two owners was working that evening; he was very informing and nice.

59.description: I ordered the aged steak sandwich and asked for 3 cookie recommendations tonight.  The steak was cut incorrectly, and the only way that I could chew it was to take it out of the sandwich and re-slice it.  It was not served as described, no olive tapenade, no tomato relish and no Italian roll, rather after a long wait, it came with some sort of cabbage slaw and served on a bun.  It was not good.  I asked for recommendations for 3 cookies.  It was suggested that I order the chocolate chip and the oatmeal dried fruit and the cowboy.  Clearly they are made from the same basic recipe with minor changes.  The cowboy was burned, it smelled burned, and when I turned it over, the entire bottom of the cookie was black--it never should have been offered for sale, and at $2.75 a cookie, that was really annoying.  The chocolate chip and oatmeal were not that different; there was the oatmeal texture, the few pieces of dried fruit and chocolate chips did not have any flavor.  This was very disappointing; don't waste your money or calories here.

21.description: Great service! The carnitas pork shoulder sandwich is topped with a honey coleslaw that's not too rich. The hot sauce is just right for my taste. Pork shoulder is tender and has an adequate smoky flavor without being over the top. The French fries are hardy and have the skins on them. You don't see that too often. Portion is large and filling. Service was great and the staff is friendly.

17.description: YUMMY! This place is great. The 2 owners are so friendly and generous. I love their pizza the most. It's as close to NY style pizza that i have found in Chicago. Their cookies are so good too. i don't eat meat but my friends have loved the pork carnitas every time we are there. They are huge and they always have to take a doggie bag.These guys are great cooks! Go there now!!!!

10.description: This place is fire! Crazy fresh ingredients awesome tacos and pizza. Staff is funny and friendly. If you like good music, great food, and decent prices you need to try this place.

5.description: I have been to Cookies and Carnitas several times now.  I've had only their cookies, cookie ice cream sandwiches, and tacos.  All are scrumptious.  I am giving them an overall 4 stars for the spot-on food.  On our last visit, it was clear that they were way busier than the one person at the front of the house could handle.  This person was supposed to be taking orders, getting sides, getting drinks, getting cookies, and making sure guests were comfortable.  He was so distracted.  Examples: our side of pickled vegetables was taken to two other tables because he had forgotten who ordered it.  I had to ask for drinks and remind him three times of the type of cookie I ordered.  This type of thing was happening all over the dining room.The food more than makes up for this.  Also, the servers (and the person at the front!) were so friendly and so helpful that I feel bad even bringing this stuff up.  But it needed to be said.  Cookies and Carnitas is a great place, and everyone should try their food.

3.description: After moving here and missing my local pizzeria, we gave this one a try on Sunday. The service was fast and friendly. We ordered to go over the phone and went and picked it up in fifteen minutes. The employee encouraged us to return and let us know it was BYOB. We ordered a medium cheese pizza and an ice cream sandwich to split. The medium was perfect for two people with a piece or two leftover. The tomato sauce was delicious, albeit a touch salty. However I still enjoyed it. The ice cream sandwich was HUGE and delicious m. Like I said, we split it and it still felt like J was squeezing down the last few bites. Overall I thoroughly enjoyed their pizza and ice cream sandwiches. We'll get it the next time a pizza craving strikes!

35.description: My wife and I shared 2 pork shoulder tacos and a pork shoulder sandwich.  They were excellent.  The tacos were huge.  We also had 2 cookies chocolate chip and oatmeal raisin and cherry.  The service was fantastic also.

19.description: Sorry Cookies & Carnitas - I am not impressed.  I had heard a lot of good things from friends, but I tried your pork belly taco, I tried your espresso-chocolate-nut cookie, I tried your skirt steak carnitas, and nothing was all that amazing or groundbreaking.  First and foremost I'm actually going to comment on the cookie.  As a baker myself, I'm definitely more particular than others when it comes to this sort of thing, but I can tell you for sure that it was way too eggy and far too dry.  The dryness is honestly because it was overbaked and probably was sitting out in the cold all day, but the eggy-ness is almost inexcusable.  Cookies should not be cakey.  Period.  If I wanted a dry cake, I'd just go to the supermarket.  Other than that, there weren't enough nuts, there wasn't any coffee flavor whatsoever, and the chocolate was also questionable throughout the cookie.  In short, this was nothing but an utter disappointment.  1/5 at best.As for the savory part of the meal - the carnita and the taco - nothing really blew me away.  The steak and pork belly were screaming for some seasoning, as was the slaw on both of them.  There was no acid, no salt, no anything.  Yes there was some honey, but the sriracha poured over it ended up taking over my taste buds completely.  It's such a shame too because both the meats were cooked correctly and were a good portion size, but without flavor basics, the dishes were just ruined.  Honestly if it weren't for the amazingly sweet and hilarious wait staff, this review would've likely been 2/5 stars just because of the food.  I wouldn't eat here again I don't think, but I would be friends with the people that work there. So there's that... I guess?

28.description: Cookies and Carnitas gives you that local restaurant vibe. Everyone who walks in the door is a friend who has been coming in for years. The staff is awesome, the food is awesome (those fries though.... they can't be beat), and the cookies.... the perfect satisfaction for my sweet tooth.Yeah, the cash thing is a bummer, but the food is worth it (and there's a Chase just a couple store fronts down - just so you know).Thanks guys for the awesome first time experience!

45.description: I'm a regular visitor at Cookies and Carnitas the pork shoulder taco is by far the best and the pizza is AMAZING!! I also love the kitchen floor cookie and the ice cream sandwich is big enough to share. Don't be discouraged by the cost it's well worth it. Not your average taco!

33.description: We recently moved in around the corner and we're so glad this place is in our neighborhood. The owner and staff are the absolute nicest. They clearly use quality ingredients and put care into everything they make. The cookies are gigantic and to die for. Last time we went I had the loaded chili (house brisket chili topped with avocado, cheese, fried tortillas, a sunny-side egg, and possibly some other stuff I can't remember.) I could literally eat this every darn day and be happy (although I think they only serve their chili in the cooler months.) Boyfriend had a chorizo taco and a brisket fat cap taco, the latter of which was on the specials board. The tacos here are huge, by the way, and both were delicious. Do I wish this place took cards and prices were slightly lower so I could come more often? Sure. But I get that the cash-only policy is best for their small business and I know they use and produce really good stuff, so I support them (and I think you should, too!)

43.description: Loved their options! Although not a traditional Mexican restaurant, their tacos and other dishes were a hit! The ambiance was great and they even had cookies for us to try before we left. I will definitely try their ice cream sandwiches the next time I come back. Staff is friendly too! TIP: They only accept cash!

2.description: Good food. Reasonably priced. We had the Amish chicken, pork shoulder, and pork belly tacos. Our favorite was pork shoulder--but all were good.The chocolate chip cookies were good too!

18.description: Great service! The carnitas pork shoulder sandwich is topped with a honey coleslaw that's not too rich. The hot sauce is just right for my taste. Pork shoulder is tender and has an adequate smoky flavor without being over the top. The French fries are hardy and have the skins on them. You don't see that too often. Portion is large and filling. Service was great and the staff is friendly.

41.description: This place is a unique find in Edgewater. We walked by on our way home from dinner and drinks, but it looked so good we had to stop in. We tried the kitchen floor cookie and the pork shoulder taco as recommended by the owner. The cookie satisfied our late night sweet cravings. The pork shoulder was tender and juicy with a perfectly complimentary sweet and tangy coleslaw. The owner is friendly and down to earth.

52.description: It's all right. I won't be back. I went with my sis. She had the pork shoulder sandwich and I had the pork belly. We both grabbed the same cookie, the triple choc. First off, we get there and we're greeted with that wholesome moldy smell I affectionately refer to as "Ardmore" that every business that has been run there can't seem to escape. If you've been around the neighborhood long enough, you'll know what I mean. My sis finds out she needs to make a cash run because they don't take cards. We head out, solve the problem, then go back in. The guy behind the counter welcomes us back. He had to have known that we were new customers, but he didn't bother to fill us in on the type of restaurant we'd gone into. If you're a laidback, self-service kind of place, I can dig it, it's just a little heads up would be nice. We sat waiting for service, and when we looked over to see if he was going to wait on us, he was chowing down on a huge piece of lettuce. Laughing a bit, we went up to the counter to place our order, because sure enough, you order at the counter. He was a little weird. I tipped because I tip, but he wasn't my kind of employee. He wasn't mean, or disrespectful, he was just weird. Anyhoo, we make our order, mine about $18. It's steep. We head back to the table. The service after this point was better. The food came and the portions made me feel a little better about the price. The pork belly was plentiful, but it was definitely missing something. The fries (the cashier assumed we wanted them, so we both wound up with them though there were other options for sides) were BANGIN'! They were thick-cut, skin on, and perfectly crisp on the outside with the right amount of fluff on the inside. They were the real MVP!!The sandwich was just chock full of meat. It needed something. More slaw, some bbq sauce, something. It was a bit bland and I was a little disappointed. I took about half of it home and it warms up very well. Definitely better the next day. I tried a little of my sis' pork shoulder and felt the same way. Good quality, well-cooked, but missing some oomph. The cookie was just meh. It tasted a little overdone. The bottom had burnt bits and it was cakey and dry on the inside. When I warmed it up at home the next day, it didn't soften like I expected. Also, it tasted like sugary breakfast cereal. For $3, I wanted to foodgasm. I was left hanging in more ways than one.

50.description: Absolutely fantastic tasting tacos and cookies. I got the brisket taco and was blown away by it! It had plenty of brisket, small slices of pineapple, lettuce, sour cream, and a tasty spicy sauce. It was so good and cheap. Their cookies are also so delectable and tasty. DEFINITELY A must go to spot if you are craving cookies and tacos. The server was also really nice and helpful. She gave us her recommendations and was spot on. Even though the place was busy on Friday afternoon, she was quick and patient and very fast. Good service, great food, and REALLY worth the price. They also play awesome old school music! LOVE this place and I will keep coming back when I have the craving for tacos or cookies!

4.description: Highly recommended. Tacos are huge and the cookies are amazing. I came with a friend a couple weeks ago. I believe one of the owners was the gentleman working behind the register. Super cool/very chill atmosphere

6.description: While everything thus far has been above par, I'm such a sucker for their Fat Cap Brisket tacos. Eat it, love it, carry it around your waste line for awhile. My only complaint is I feel that tacos is preventing me from being more adventures with their menu. That taco is so good it's stopping me from eating other food on their menu!*sigh* Life is hard.

22.description: I love that this pace has two things I crave the most, tacos and cookies! And believe me, they disappoint in neither! I have only gotten delivery but it's been quick and delicious!

15.description: I've lived in RoPo for the past four years, and I can't believe this was my first visit to C&C! I met a friend here for dinner, and we both brought our own brews (as it is a BYOB establishment). The owner brought us a bucket with ice to chill our beers, which was great. After setting my things down at a table, I went to the front counter to order. I explained that this was my first visit, and received great recommendations (pork shoulder taco). The owner was super friendly and helpful, and explained the whole menu to me. There was an item I was unfamiliar with, some fried pork skin appetizer, and he insisted I try it, even giving me a free sample--it was excellent! My taco came pretty quickly and was absolutely mouthwatering and huge. My friend ordered the Amish chicken sandwich, which was enough for her dinner that night, and lunch the next day. We both got cookies for dessert, which were moist, flavorful, and satisfied my sweet tooth. Prices were extremely fair, and the atmosphere was casual and laid back. I'll be back!

57.description: this place is so wonderful and i'm not saying that because i own it :-0

20.description: This place is fire! Crazy fresh ingredients awesome tacos and pizza. Staff is funny and friendly. If you like good music, great food, and decent prices you need to try this place.

36.description: This place combines 2 of my favorite things, cookies and mexican food. I fell head over heels when I saw the name on yelp. Thank goodness I was not disappointed. I'm really not a big meat eater, but the carnita torta came highly recommended. It was GREAT. It was filling, flavorful, but not heavy. Perfect. If you go there and don't get the ice cream sandwich you are either ill or don't know how to enjoy yourself; either way, we can't be friends. The owner was there when I went and he was super nice and approachable. I like smaller places where regular people can get good food without the pretentiousness.  I can't wait to go back to try some of the special tacos they post on the chalkboard. This place is definitely in my restaurant rotation.

14.description: So yummy!!  My meat eater boys were in heaven and me, the vegetarian, also found heaven here.   Super vegetarian friendly which one may not think because of their name.  Pickled escabecha was great and spicy.  Crispy portobello tacos were unbelievable.  Kiddos LOVED the pizza and hubby LOVED his two meat tacos.  Taking home the cookies to try later.

12.description: It pains me to leave four stars, because the food and ambiance of Brixton is actually really great. Unfortunately this is the second time my wife and I have been here and both times it's been easier to hail a cab in this neighborhood than the waiter/waitress.With that said, the food is great, the patio is a must and we always enjoy our visit.

7.description: Love the atmosphere, lighting, bartenders, and drinks! I really can't speak to the food since I've never ordered any, but everything else here is spot on. Stopped in for a drink yesterday, and was pleasantly surprised to learn that it was whiskey Wednesday ($5 whiskey cocktails, $3 shots). Loved my Manhattans, and the price was right!

19.description: Terrible service. Our server couldn't have cared less about us or our needs. We felt like we were annoying her to get appetizers. The result: we skipped dinner with them and went to another restaurant who cared what we wanted to eat or drink. There were 2 tables and it took 30 min to get two cold appetizers.

1.description: The good:-Ambience-Music-Beer selection -High top boothsThe bad:-Terrible service, took forever to get our food.  Our waiter actually asked us if we were ready for dessert even though we hadn't gotten our entrees yet! Hah, then when we asked about our food our waiter gave us an exasperated "oh it's coming right now" but it took another 10 minutes.-Fairly expensive food. Not great portions. Burgers do not come with a side.-Burger wasn't very good (3/10)

2.description: I had a great time last night at The Brixton. Our food and service was terrific.Our server had a fun personality. I don't her name but she kinda looks like the brunette in "Two Broke Girls". Even though the place was busy, she told us to take our time with ordering and was very patient with a few high-maintenance questions and requests. The warm kale salad sounds better than the name implies. I'd get it again. The burger was excellent. Everything came out of the kitchen perfectly timed and heated.If you're a larger party, they have several large booths that will probably seat 6 comfortably. The selection of booze at this place is apparently a big draw. I know next to nothing about brown liquor but it seems like they know a hell of a lot.

9.description: Bar service.... WOW! So god damn bad. I mean.... I bartend and I get it if you're super slammed... But there was 6 ppl at the bar. This guy was awful! Drinks empty for 10 minutes. Then when the bill comes there's an open liquor for $22! Ok so... No! Never going there again.

6.description: If it were just me reviewing, I would give this place a 3, but because the boyfriend really enjoyed his meal, I am giving it a 4. Service was great and it was not crowded at all for a Saturday night dinner. He got the Tagliatelle and I got the Mussels. We also got the Broccoli as an appetizer. For both the broccoli and mussels, I just did not like the broth/sauces that they were doused with. It's probably just preference, but I just like my broccoli and mussels plain and steamed. If I were in the area again and somebody wanted to go here, I'll probably give it another shot and be on the safe side and get the burger and fries. :)

18.description: Dear Brixton,I really like you. I really like the bartender Mike. He's attentive, knowledgeable and makes a mean old fashion. I like your food. The fries and some of the best in town. I always have a hard time deciding what to order from the menu because it all sounds delicious, and the only thing that makes my choice easier is that I have never had a bad meal here.I like your ambiance. Upstairs is cozy. The patio is friendly. Downstairs is classy but not pretentious. I want your waitstaff to be better. Drinks went empty. Service times were slow. Check-ins occurred when half the meals were consumed. Check drops were hit and runs, with no notice that it was being dropped or acknowledgement of the customers sitting at the table.I have been back, and will be back to sit at the bar and upstairs, but please, please, do something about the wait staff so I can bring friends to sit at the tables too?

10.description: Every time I come here it is a wonderful experience. The Brixton burger is the best burger in the world. I crave it. I crave the pimento cheese dip. It's....so good. Lighting is perfect and soft, endless supply of Bowie songs, in addition to tv access when the important things are on. They took The Thin White Duke off the drink menu (TRAGEDY) but if you are lucky and get a bartender who knows the recipe it's like getting, and drinking a winning lottery ticket.  Some people mention wait times for a server, we have waited sometimes for a drink, but common sense urges you to read the room and notice you're not the only customer. I've found also that if you are enjoying the company you're with, you can't have a bad experience. Bottom line, if ya got em, get rid of those stale friends and your experience will be fun and fresh.

13.description: I returned after more than a year.     Food was delicious, and I even got salt without a fuss.  Thank you.

16.description: If I could have moved in, I would have.Our waitress was hilarious and put up, nay, appreciated the shenanigans of my friend and I. He was late, and she didn't mind me holding down the table.The vibe is hip, but chill. There was a nice mixture of people in the restaurant. AND, I unknowningly stumbled in during half-priced bottles of wine night (Tuesdays)! BEST. NIGHT. EVER.We started with the pimento cheese as an appetizer (a suggestion from a friend), and it was out of this world. The shiraz was delicious, and our burgers were juicy perfection.When our waitress's shift ended, we agreed to take the check. Before she left, she very sweetly checked on us on her way out the door. And then, the manager came over to refill our water and clear dishes while we sat and finished our second bottle of wine.I was so impressed by every aspect of this establishment, most especially the jovial, personable staff.I can't wait to try the Brixton on a weekend!

17.description: I like this place a lot because they're VERY creative.  Maybe a little too creative?  The design and interior of this place is very cool; they paid a lot of attention to the details of decorating this place.  They have a huge hard liquor selection, but just an OK wine selection.  What they really need is a menu for all the hard liquor on the shelf.  I thought that the food just may be been just a little bit too ambitious.  It all LOOKED amazing... the presentation was 5 star for sure.  The burger was make with the best of ingredients but just a bit too Foofoo for me.  I mean to say, frisee lettuce doesn't really add anything to the burger, and it may even take away some things from a texture perspective.  And with regard to "texture" as far as the meat goes, they obviously used very premium beef but had it ground so fine that it was too mushy.  I order my burgers medium and they cooked it perfectly.  The bun was super premium.  Their fries were great.  We also had the Scallops; they were excellent.  The charcuterie plate is good, as was the bread that came with it.  My wife had the maple chicken & waffles.  She love the chicken but it had a little too much salt for me.  The music is on the louder side but not bad.  Our waiter was very nice, but definitely a bit overworked...  I think that he may have been the only waiter and the place was packed.  The place is not cheap.  This is not a pub.

15.description: I have had two pretty good experiences at the Brixton and I would definitely come back here. I have loved their Mule SKinner Blues cocktail- both in summer and in winter and while I've never actually had dinner here, I have tried several of the bar bites and the small plates. The menu must change periodically, because the offerings were different each time I went. The first time we had the jerky, the popcorn and the grits and the second time we went with the poutine. Now, I hate gravy, but damn, that was pretty good. Service was great- very attentive and friendly bartender and waitress. My only complaint was that it was freezing! I was sitting at the bar and needed to wear my big winter coat to stay warm because the entire lower level got a huge gust of cold air anytime the door opened. Maybe one of those seasonal doors would be possible to help block the wind? Otherwise, great ambiance, great service, great drinks and good food.

0.description: Beautiful, just beautiful as I had a great time here with friends this past Saturday nite.We got here around 9:30-10pm and the place had a great crowd with a very mellow atmosphere...just lovely!All of us had already enjoyed food in other places so this was just a drink outing. awesome whiskey cocktails (Clampdown & Sugar Dumplin') and awesome beer (Cashmere Hammer...phenomenal btw) made for an awesome evening! After doing it up downstairs, we were told there was an swankier upstairs that needed our attention...not to mention a couple of the guys wanted to shoot pool and a table was up there. We went up and went to the far back and grab the last of the seats along with another friendly group.
