We lounged until closing time and our server Gwenyth was awesome...word to our original server downstairs as well (Jillian).You can probably tell that I really like this place! Ambience is killer!

5.description: Great ambiance and good food. They have a shirt and sweet menu. And whatever's on it, is good! Yea, they mean business. I saw down interesting drinks in the menu too but stuck to beer. I tried the risotto and the other two had burgers. We all loved our food. The fries hit the spot too. Overall a good way to spend Friday evening with some good friends.

11.description: I am a big fan of American (New) restaurants and I had been wanting to try The Brixton for a while. New American can be a gamble - usually interesting blends but sometimes the portions are less than American sized, even for someone who doesn't eat too much. The food was delicious and best of all, the portions were the perfect size! Even the pimento cheese app was larger than I anticipated. We were all pleased with our selections - the house made sausage is a must try! Also had good vibes coming from the mussels and the burger. The bun and bread were a bit charred but that just lets you know it's made fresh. ;) Definitely worth a visit if you like some interesting spins on your food.

8.description: Wonderful. Drinks and food are spot on, in a romantic, dimly lit ambiance. Big improvement over In Fine Spirits. The drinks are especially exceptional, and - I understand - always changing.The appetizers - we had jerky - hello, how can you not order that? And the poutine. Also, a charcuterie/cheese plate. Everything was great, and three appetizers are about enough for two for a small dinner.Love this place.

3.description: Great spot with a local feel. The upstairs bar is open on the weekend and feels more secluded. Gwenith is awesome. Jill is cool too. I have yet to eat here, but the menu sounds great.

14.description: While they have been open sometime it just never comes to mind when heading out.  This building has seen some change over the years with some abrupt closures.  Not the Brixtons issue but now that we have been here we will be back.We were able to grab two seats at the bar (our preferred seating area), if you are lucky or insistent you will have Rudy s your bartender.  He is certainly well versed in spirits and offered many suggestions with the food we were going to try.  The bar staff in general and was very attentive.We decided to have the crab dip which was very good, it was big enough to share.  We then chose to split the Brixton Burger which was also very good.  We had an enjoyable evening and we will be back.

4.description: I arranged to meet friends for a drink here and as the first to arrive I settled down at the bar upstairs to order a drink.  I had to ask to see a drinks menu and then had to get the bartender's attention to order (there were 3 other people in the room - who were getting table service).  There was no music in the upstairs bar plus it was freezing - not the best ambiance at all!  I texted my friends and told them to go elsewhere, paid for my drink and left.  I will go back and give the downstairs a chance to redeem this venue - but the staff and setup upstairs needs a serious review.

12.description: If you tried going to Hollywood Pantry a couple months ago you either noticed that the selection was down to one bottle of Absolute vodka and some Charles Shaw merlot or they were just flat out closed. I don't know what happened but they have reopened under new management and the wine selection is back!

7.description: I didn't even know this place was there until they apparently did some major improvements recently.  I love this place.  I can literally get there in under 30 seconds, so I always go there when I need something real quick (like this morning's coffee creamer) or when I used to get home from work at 11 PM and I just wanted an easy dinner. I no longer have to go to Walgreen's or Jewel for quick basics because this place is infinitely closer. not to mention it's got some stuff that neither of those places carry, like my new favorite mint and honey green tea. in fact, Hollywood Pantry is part of the reason I decided to stay in my current apartment! Can't beat that convenience.

3.description: I've lived in Edgewater forever, never been in here.  And I live a block and a half away.  What a delightful surprise the jam packed beer cases were!  Many of my favs and others I'd like to try.  No more trekking to Binny's for me, hooray! Decent liquor selection, glad to know in case of a booze emergency.

1.description: I've started coming here more frequently and have a different opinion of the store. They have a lot of craft beer and any kind of liquor you would need. The guys who work there are nice and we chat about neighborhood news often. The prices are a bit high, but it's a privately owned store so that's understandable.

2.description: PROCEED WITH CAUTION.   this place changes management frequently and the latest group is no good.   i have been overcharged 2 times, in both cases i had to request a receipt, one was not offered to me.   i just challenged the cashier about the discrepancy between the sticker price and what i was charged and i was told that all sales are final.   guess i'll be spending the weekend writing letters.

9.description: This is the friendliest corner store on the planet, and I have been to quite a few corner stores in my day. I feel like I am friends with the family that owns the store, as well as some of the other customers who come here."That's all well and good, Layne, but I've got plenty of friends", you say.That's true, you do have plenty of friends. But do you have plenty of tasty beer, wine, and ice cream?If you don't, then Hollywood Pantry is the place for you. They have an excellent selection of wines, and beer (though sometimes on Fridays, the cooler gets a little picked over). They have weekly wine tastings on Fridays, so you can learn about new bottles you may want to buy. They are also open to suggestions for new beer and wine they can carry (and my SO and I have a lot of suggestions). Hollywood pantry is just a solid store, they have a great selection that is improving with time - and they have amazing owners and customers - it makes me feel like I am more part of my neighborhood when I go here. When was the last time a corner store did that?

10.description: As far as corner stores go, Hollywood Pantry is as good as it gets.  They have a great selection of wine and specialty beer, along with a small but extremely well stocked grocery section.  The place is immaculately clean and the owners are some of the nicest business owners in Edgewater.  Saying it's location is convenient is an understatement.  If you live in the neighborhood and need to pick up something quick you didn't get at Jewel, or if you need a good beer that Jewel wouldn't even carry, stop by Hollywood Pantry.  I love this place!

13.description: i'm being nice for giving this place two stars, and i do it only because i went in there and the dude behind the counter was pretty friendly. this place needs to get it together. prime liquor/beer location and instead they half-stock this tiny store with weird canned goods and display shelves (most of the display shelves proudly showing... nothing). empty wine bins? empty coolers? no thanks. the beer selection is over priced and really random (not in a good way). but if you need some all-night-stamina pills they've got quite the impressive collection.but the WORST? they have hours they conveniently post when they decide to follow by them. want to stop by because you saw they were open until midnight? no, don't do that, because the store hours signs will be "missing" like elizabeth smart. but with more tears on my end, and no made-for-tv movie.

16.description: For a corner store, this place is awesome. I moved away for almost a year and they recognized me the first time I came in again after I moved back. They carry all the things you might go to walgreens for, but it just seems like they really try to cater to the neighborhood.

17.description: I went to Hollywood Pantry today to buy a bottle of wine. What I remember most about my visit is how one of the store employees conspicuously followed me around to make sure I didn't steal anything. That was a turnoff for me - I won't be going back.

15.description: This is my favorite convenience store! Jimmy and his dad make us feel like family. They even collect our packages for us when we are not around. Now that they have started carrying liquor, they have become a favorite stop for the neighborhood. Becoming one of the only liquor stores in Edgewater. Not to mention all the other great things that they always have on hand. This place is fantastic and I always feel welcome shopping there.

0.description: Usually I don't review places that aren't restaurants, but wanted to say they were the real MVP for being open on Christmas... Or maybe not? Although I'm not sure of their employee conditions for being open on a major national holiday, they did come in clutch when my friends and I decided to grab some alcohol for our post-Christmas celebrations.The man at the cashier was very, very nice and joked along with my friend and I as we were checking out! As far as the alcohol selection goes, it's pretty vast and they sell other things like hygiene products, soda, and snacks without having outrageously marked up prices.

5.description: Reopened all shiny and new!! Same corner store feel and same corner store taste. But now with a deli!Apparently the old owner teamed up with a new one and what a difference it has made! Before it looked almost post apocalyptic... barren shelves except for a few scraps and of course condiments, coolers that carried a few bottles of beer (but never a full six pack) and I think some Gatorade (but with no labels so???), and wine racks a few reds and a few whites but all pretty much labeled with "nasty headache in the morning" brands.Now they are fully stocked with all kinds of items, I bet you could even make a full dinner with all that they carry. Plus, the deli counter is full of really nice cheeses and meats. The wine and cooler racks are almost overflowing with a selection to match even Binny's though I wished that they stocked more ciders. Pricing varies but you can always find something with in your budget.    The only thing that hasn't changed is the service; they have ALWAYS been super nice here. Also, they are very good about knowing if you're up for a chat or to leave you alone because you're just popping in and out. Whoever is working the counter is more then happy to hear your opinion on their wine selection.  *** They have wine tastings paired with some cheese and crackers on certain nights. Check them out!

11.description: Ever since the remodel, this has been our "go to" place for beer and sundry items.  They have a decent selection for a store of its size and the owners and staff always share their good humor.

8.description: As someone recently mentioned Cosmo is quite hard to miss if you even walk by this great little corner store. The owner(s), various family members etc. are the kindest people I've met this over my 2 year stint of living around the corner from the place.Oh and wait other reasons they're so awesome: 16 inches of snow? Oh the store owner's dad shoveled my car out for me.Regional beers to remind me of home,also available.Best part,you can take your dog inside, but Cosmo is quite the lady's man...and sadly my little dog is only about 9 lbs...you can only guess how that could turn out if I wasn't so careful w/her when in the store.Aside from just being all around awesome people, it's a good place to stock up on liquor, beer and random things you may want on a weird Saturday morning like blueberry pancake mix.

4.description: I kept forgetting that this place existed until my husband and I went here to get some beer.VERY impressive beer selection for such a small joint! Their Belgians made me swoon. If you like lots of beers (foreign and domestic) this place is pretty great.

14.description: Thank you Yelpers.  Had it not been for you, I'd never know this great little place was within walking distance!So what did I think?1.  I think that one needs to know it can be deadly trying to get here from the north side of Ridge.  My husband and I are traffic dodgers, but even we pros couldn't find a break in the Ridge freeway traffic.  So we had to sort of loop around to get to cross the street.  A minor thing to note, certainly.  But seriously, bring an orange vest if you're coming down through the neighborhood to the north.2.  The space... you'd almost miss it as it doesn't seem to directly flank Ridge.  I'm so glad I had the photo on Yelp to reference!  And then, you go in and it's.... SO empty and barren feeling.  Good thing the wines greet you pretty much right away.3.  The selection of beer and wines?  AWESOME even if not expansive.  I was tempted by much more than we bought.  We got two bottles of wines from a region we're currently exploring; for 10 bucks each it was a good deal.  But it's worth knowing that most wines in the store are more in the 15-30 dollar range.  Which of course is great if you're looking for interesting and good wines.  But you know, FYI.4.  Good selection of chilled whites, which I always appreciate.  And almost all of the beer was sold cold.  A minor but for me a very significant point.5.  The owner was most certainly friendly, but he was so immersed in the TV show he was watching on CW that we didn't get a lot of interaction with him.  That's OK though.  It was kinda cute and he was nothing but warm and friendly when he wasn't enthralled with his show.6.  Peanut butter M&Ms were being sold at the counter.  I'm just sayin'...All in all, the price and location is both a setback... and the very thing that makes it worth the trip.

6.description: Picture it.  December 24, 2008, North Broadway Jewel parking lot. (this should be read in a Sophia Petrillo voice)At the very last minute, I am invited out to have Chinese food with one of Chicago's most respected WFMT radio hosts.  Of course, I am not going to say "no" to this.  I volunteer to bring a few bottles of wine.I walk to the Jewel, only to realize that the store was closed! On December 24th...but why? I glanced at my watch...and couldn't believe it was already closed at 7pm.  Then a homeless person wished me a Merry Christmas.  Oh yeah.  This is a holiday.SO, I walked all the way to the Hollywood Pantry, in hopes that:a)it was owned by a non-Christmas celebratorb)if it was owned by a Christmas celebrator, it would be openc)they would sell good wined)they would accept a debit carde)that I wouldn't be really late for dinnerI scored two bottles of Cab-Sauv, and walked as fast as I could on the icey sidewalks to meet my dinner partner.The store was super clean, and while the selection wasn't "amazing", it was really nice...in fact, it made picking out a few bottles of wine even easier for me.  For the first time visitor, the store is on an angle, and doesn't actually face the street!  Don't miss it!The clerk (who I am going to assume owns it) was pleased to see me, greeted me warmly, and quickly rang me out when I told him I was going to be running late for dinner...and wished me happy holidays.I liked the non-denominational well wish.  This place can expect my patronage again.  Thank you Hollywood Pantry for keeping 2 nice Jewish men in booze on Christmas Eve.p.s. The Chinese food was super yum (Mei Shung), and my dinner conversation was amazing.

12.description: We came as a group of nine hoping for an authentic Vietnamese experience. The atmosphere is pleasant and very casual, a bunch of tables in a space.Some of the dishes were excellent, like the chicken salad made with chicken breast slices and cabbage.Their Pho soup was good, if you are coming for a soup with noodles, this place is for you.Their BBQ meat dish was very flavorful, but far too little meat for the money. Same for the lemongrass chicken. Portion size is my biggest complaint.Brown rice is available for an extra $2.

7.description: Flavors on the pho broth were on point! Order:(Free spring rolls)Combo beef pho***Bahn Mi w. Beef***favWe happened to encounter this place after a 3 mile run. The moment we opened the door, we could smell the pungent flavors flowing from the piping hot pho on the tables. The free spring rolls from the yelp check were just average but the pho and bahn mi took us straight back to Vietnam (where we were just two months ago). The pho was flavorful (with a kick) but light and the noodles were at the perfect chewiness. The bahn mi bread was crispy and the meat was expertly marinated. The only problem was that the service was pretty subpar for such a small restaurant. It took awhile before our waitress paid attention to us each time.

19.description: When you find yourself walking around on a chilly evening, pop into this place and get yourself some delicious pho. I recommend #17 as it is loaded with delicious steak. I'm so glad I came across this hidden gem.

1.description: I got a delivery from this place as I was looking for a joint that I have never tried before and I wanted rice to be involved with my meal. I called and they told me they require a $15 delivery minimum...no problem I guess. I ordered the fried egg rolls, jasmine rice platter with grilled pork chops and fried egg and a thai iced tea. The egg rolls were good as they came with a nice sweet and sour sauce and the rice platter with chops were good as well as the pork chops were very delicious on top of the rice with some vegetables in the mix. I could have left the egg off though as it just didn't fit with the chops and rice marriage. I never got to try the thai iced tea as the driver told me he dropped it on the way bringing it to me. He told me I didn't have to tip him for the debacle...kool! I bet they still charged me for it though as I pre paid.

2.description: Outstanding service. Outstanding Pho. Everything a place should be. There is an integrity to this limited menu that is perfect. Chicken broth with deep, complex flavor. Perfect noodles. Smells good... Fast service. More, please!Returned for a non-pho dish. The squid was terrible. Onions and very little squid. Stick with the pho- you cannot go wrong.

9.description: What is this magic?I have been told several times that vegetarian Pho"really just will never be as good"but dayuuum if this wasn't one of the best I've had. The tofu banh mi was also the tits.So good.So scarf.I scarfed until I couldn't anymore.Your money goes a long way here,and it's right off of the Red Line.I could have fallen off the train and landed in a seat.One of the best banh mis I've ever had.I'M SERIOUS.If you were contemplating,just go.Go now.

6.description: Consistent excellence in the great food, the friendly service, and the clean, spotless facility.

18.description: While the tv playing pop music does not add to the ambiance, the food at this subtle Vietnamese joint is superb. Pho is always a winner but I also recommend the balsamatti.

10.description: Given this is not in the Argyle stretch between Broadway and Sheridan, I was expecting it to be watered down. Much to my surprise, it was NOT.Iced coffee. Egg rolls. Lemongrass chicken. Vietnamese pudding.The iced coffee hit the spot. Not sweet and not bitter, but just right. The egg rolls were not the usually meat stuffed egg rolls that you get at most Asian restaurants. Yes, there was some fine pork and shrimp in it, but the flavour popped. And these lovelies came from the kitchen hot.The lemongrass chicken was touted as being spicy. I had initially thought otherwise until a minute passed and I could feel the heat rising from my scalp and my sinuses were clearing up. Still, the dish had flavour to it, although the spices left a ring of fire around my lips.I am in love with the pudding. It has miniature tapioca pearls and sweet potato in it. The consistency is like that of warm milk with the flavour of lychee. I loved it.I think I will be going back a few more times to try some other items. The two servers who came to my table had told me about several other dishes, so I was sold. Little Vietnam is in my slideshow.

13.description: Boom! Welcome to my neighborhood! Tiny little Vietnamese restaurant, closer even than the wildness of Argyle Street.This little place is firing on all cylinders. First, it's spotlessly clean. Spotless. Uncluttered and fresh looking. The staff is unfailingly friendly, and cute! I know this may be a weird thing, but this place has the BEST WATER EVER. Cucumber water, so fresh!The food is incredible. I got the Pho, which is something I really love. Spot ON! A giant bowl with slippery noodles, and slices of meat. The meat looked better than the sometimes-gristly slabs of meat that appear in other Pho I've had. The broth was perfect - enough for lunch the next day.For appetizers, we got a few rolls. Spring Rolls with Shrimp for $4 are a bargain, so fresh and delicious. Thanks, Yelp - for the check in of 2 free Egg Rolls - these were delicious as well. My charming companion got the beef with asparagus. A stir fry entree with rice - he loved it. The taste was fantastic, and the meat tender and juicy. Vegetables well done, not overcooked.TONS of options for our vegetarian friends. Some really good looking papaya salads and other veg delights.I love this place, so glad they opened up in the neighborhood. And you can't beat the BYOB. Total dinner tab? $26 + tip. Hello, delicious bargain!

16.description: I've been walking past this place since it opened and never went in. went for dinner last night and boy I'm glad we did! the place was pretty packed with only one open table, we were seated right away. got the free egg rolls for checking in on yelp, and they were light and delicious not heavy and greasy like egg rolls can usually be. spring rolls were fresh. pho is tasty and gigantic as pho should be.also, you've GOTTA get the Vietnamese iced coffee. I don't know what they put in there but I could drink like 5 glasses of it.

17.description: Picked up a tofu banh mi sandwich and I wish I could say that it was great. Aside from the cilantro and jalapeños there was nothing banh mi about it. The tofu was soggy and lacked flavor and the vegetables tasted more like a filing for egg rolls than the crisp, fresh taste I normally experience with these sandwiches, which is too bad because they have such great reviews.

15.description: This place has great service, great pho and very good sandwiches. I wish the parking was a bit better, but you can also take the red line to get here.If you don't want to go to argyle, then definitely come here for Vietnamese

0.description: Best Vietnamese restaurant in Chicago in terms of price, food, and service! Price: Prices for pho are more reasonable than Argyle.Food: I've had the pho twice and despite the limited choices, I enjoyed my dish. Friends who have tried the other dishes including the rice and pork chop, rice with braised cartelized catfish, vermicelli bowl, and korean style bbq ribs have also enjoyed their meals.Service: Friendly even when our group stayed over an hour past when we were all done eating on a Friday night. Water was always refilled. No complaints here!

5.description: The wife has been pressuring me to try this restaurant for months. I finally agreed and was glad I did.  I ordered the clay pot catfish and enjoyed it.  The clay pot entrees are spicy, but i like that. If you are from Michigan and never had anything hotter than a pepper corn, be warned.  My catfish had bones and required some work.  We Americans aren't used to that since everything comes in the form of a de-boned fish filet.  The wife ordered the clay pot tofu, which was excellent.  We also had veggie egg rolls that were delicious.  Not greasy.  The restaurant serves cucumber infused water, which is nice because the food is spicy.  Service is fast and friendly.  As a bonus, there is no music.  We ate in peace without a bunch of background noise.

11.description: I'm a huge fan of the Pho. Had a friend recommend me to try this place and let him know what I think. Ordered the pho here with beef ball, raw beef and tendon, basically the way I like my pho. The pho wasn't bad but wasn't great either. The broth is a little on the bland and clean side for me. The waitress was cute tho. And the place has a nice quiet cafe kind of feel.

8.description: Changing my rating way up. Did go back. EXCELLENT, cheap Pho. Other than my pick up mix up, this place is 5 stars

3.description: I LOVE this place! I live nearby and order from here probably about once a week. I bring everyone I know here so they can try the amazing food. Everything I have ordered has been delicious - great pho (super fresh!), vermicelli rice noodle salad, egg rolls, spring rolls, lemongrass chicken (very spicy!) and the banh mi. Prices are reasonable and it's in a great location (right off the Bryn Mawr red line stop). I will continue to come here again and again.

14.description: Outstanding food and good service. Here is my most favorite Vietnam restaurant. Try the crepe! It's so yummy with the sauce and don't forget the rice entree with grilled pork-chop. It's phenomenal!

4.description: I live down the street from this place so super convenient for me when I want something hot to eat on cold days, not to mention the price is right! I always order to go when I eat from this place, but the pho is really good here (love their both) and people that work here are always nice and never stingy with the extra hot and sweet sauce when I ask). They allow BYOB so one day I'll come with friends and eat in.

3.description: I had to give them a star to review? I don't know how the food is because after going out of my way and being stuck on Devon in bad traffic, I came into this place, that I thought was cute and could've been an asset to an up and coming neighborhood, only to be told that the groupon I had (which was to expire in 2 days) was not accepted anymore and that I could get a refund thru them. This is really bad customer service- I grew up with a dad who had a restaurant - this makes me nuts. I told the guy that I just wasted my time and that I would not waste my time again by coming back. Purpose of groupon: to expose your place of business and gain customers. They just lost a customer and in reading other Yelp reviews, it looks like they have various other problems. It's too bad.

1.description: I came here recently to find some particularly horrible service. After waiting several minutes to be acknowledged (only one other customer was there), I was to find out there was no coffee brewed and had to wait an additional amount of time. The space is too tiny, my friend and I felt like a burden to the employees hiding in the back of the shop.

2.description: Okay, so.  I really want to see my neighborhood places succeed, so I hope the Red Rover folks will take these criticisms to heart.  My roomslice and I walked to Vince's for a burger the other day around lunchtime, only to find out that they don't open until 4 pm (WHAT??  But that's a review for another day.)  We wandered into Red Rover more or less by default.  Honestly, the space is unimpressive.  It's very kitsch, very cramped, not super well-lit.  There's only room for about two people near the counter, and nowhere to wait for carry-out.  The gentleman at the counter was very nice, which is good, since he was literally the only employee there and was also the person to make our sandwiches.The sandwiches were fine, honestly; in fact, they were quite tasty.  My issue is that everything about them was store-bought and easily something that could be made at home, for far less than $7.  The turkey was packaged; the ciabatta was not made in-house.  I asked for cucumber on my sandwich, but they were out (then take it off the chalkboard!!)  Each sandwich came with a tiny bunch of tiny grapes, and a pickle.Here is the biggest issue:  The centerpiece of the cafe is a huge bakery case.  We had some time to check out the wares while our sandwiches were being made.  Every item in the case was from a grocery store.  Cupcakes with swirls of buttercream packaged in plastic containers.  Wrapped slices of coffee cake  with actual nutrition label stickers on them.  That bright-pink "strawberry" bundt cake you can buy at Aldi (how much would a slice of that have cost?)  Like, you guys... you are a cafe.  You have sandwiches and baked goods.  It is not good enough to buy all your food at the Jewels, then slap it together and re-sell it.  I don't know, y'all.  There is just nothing really special or interesting going on here.  Without an overhaul, it may not be long for this world.

9.description: A cute little neighborhood café with a good selection of food and drinks, my husband and I left a little too full after a tasty meal of Reuben sandwiches (with pineapple and a pickle on the side), coffee and an Arnold palmer, and slices of pecan pie. The meal was delicious and we will definitely come back to this quiet and charming café :)

10.description: Just made my first visit to this little café to use a Groupon.  Based on other yelp reviews I was not expecting much but can report I had a pleasant experience.  The young man who took and prepared my order was very polite and congenial.  He made a recommendation of The Chatty Kathy (turkey) and it was a very good sandwich... fresh and generous ingredients. The side of pasta salad was also more than adequate (with a little spicy kick) and the carrot cake satisfied my sweet tooth.  It IS VERY SMALL so it was nice that the Groupon did not require that I "dine in".  As a single person I hate that mandate since sometimes I want to try the food but prefer to carry out.  All in all I was very pleased with the process from beginning to end and I will return soon to try the Tim Buck 2...to go!

4.description: Is this place even open???Everytime I call no one answers. Walked over and an employee was sitting right by the door with the door locked and ignored any knocks even though there was a sign right on the door that said opened. I bought a groupon and now I can't even use it?? Whats going on Red Rover? Are you open or not?

6.description: I was excited to try this cute little cafe. Unfortunately, I was disappointed; my cookie was hard and stale (white chocolate macadamia) and the chix noodle soup w/vegetables was really shredded chix w/rice and veggies (mushrooms, spinach). My order took 15-20 minutes, and that was for a to go order.

11.description: The food is reasonably price. Had lunch hours posted as open at 11am waited for 30 minutes for them to open because we had a groupon for them. Someone unlocked the store and offer no apologies. The food was good but not remarkable. A place to go if you want a sand which or something.

5.description: Oh yuck! I got a side of mystery veggies (?) with my sandwich, and a free glass plate to keep. My first visit was months ago just for some coffee. I was tryingt o joke around with the girl behind the counter but Ms. Personality wasnt having it. The coffee is premade and is pumped out of a canister. I made a comment how it was a little warm (as in not hot enough to be served) and she really didnt care nor offer to warm it up. My second visit was yesterday. The dude behind the counter must have been new. He lacked that certain outgoing glad to be here how can I help you!?! personality. I asked him what the soup of the day was and he disappeared into the back for nearly 60 seconds to find out. As I was waiting I saw the sign with the coup of the day. Seems like the chef should start the day by letting the staff know what's going on that day. I ordered the "build your own" sandwich with corned beef and swiss. I dont think I got corned beef. It looked more like ham and tasted faintly like nothing! It came with a side of brown and tan vegetables (?). They may have been veggies, I'm not sure. Something which resembled a green bean in shape was closer to black in color. I also got a pastry which was send home with me on a glass plate wrapped in saran wrap. How much money are they losing doing this?It took about 10 minutes or more to place my order and walk out the door. The kid disappeared many times into the back. Another woman came in after me and she was never acknowleded. We asked if he was the only one on duty and he said yes but a few minutes later he made mention of three people being there. I will never go back. There are too many attitude issues and lack of good customer service. That part of Devon needs good businesses besides crappy corner stores. I dont think they'll last and that's a shame.

7.description: Most likely a front for a drug lab. The staff was rude and in the back area the entire time. I seriously saw my waitress for a total of 30 seconds before she disappeared to the back. Had to knock on the door when I wanted dressing for my salad. Everything on the menu is something you could easily make at home. Horrible kitschy yet stale atmosphere. I won't be coming back.

8.description: My husband and I came here for lunch one afternoon.  I ordered the chicken little sandwich, which is an egg salad sandwich.  I also had an arnold palmer.  The sandwich was messy, but very tasty.  It came with an interesting and good potato side salad.  We were able to sample some homemade raspberry sorbet, and it was delicious.  The man behind the counter who provided us with the sample was very friendly and welcoming.  Next time I want an egg salad sandwich, I am definitely going here.

0.description: I Love finding new places:)Located on Devon Avenue a little East of Clark Street is a trulycharming and quaint little placeWelcome to The Red Rover Cafe', and for the record, this is a very small place, there are about 4 small tables inside so basicallythis is more of a take out operation than a dine in one.Okay, so I will admit that Red is not a favorite color of mine and uponentering this place I saw lots of Red Stuff.. Like Everywhere and Iwas wishing it was all purple instead because purple is my favoritecolor.However, this was not meant to be since this place is called The RedRover Cafe' so I just went with the flow, and actually the restaurant interiorwas quite appealing, A nice red umbrella, some miniature dancing HulaGirls on the table, yadda, yadda...And, can't forget the really pretty red benches outside, I liked these a lotbecause I had been running around all day and boy, was I tired!Okay, so on to the food, Red Rover Cafe' has a bit of an eclectic menu,they have a few sandwich choices, some salads, coffee and tea and evenPB&J for the munchkins...Now, I ordered a corned beef sandwich on a ciabatta roll, and gotta sayit was not one of the best corned beef's that I've had cause they putsome funky mustard on it and killed it!Yes, I asked for mustard, but I just wanted French's, not gray poupon!Boy, did that bum me out!However, if you are a lover of gray poupon make sure and swing by..They've got you covered..So, the sandwich definitely not a favorite but nonetheless, a lively, colorfulplace that will make you smile!Hell, it made me smile and I hate Red...Nuff Said...

29.description: i walked into this cafe/flower shop and fell in love . not only did a laura daluga design a amazing arrangement.in no time at all. (last min. gift for the bosses wife).but while i waited you could see two woman enjoying their soup and sandwich.sitting in this quaint little cafe and flower shop/gift shop.cards for all occasions, great what looked like home made jewlery.little teddy bears. i ordered a pumpkin pie for thanksgiving. cant wait.

42.description: I rarely have use for an upscale florist...I mean, I wish I could justify fresh cut flowers to adorn my cascading home every day, but alas...not in the cards ;) Luckily, I needed some decorative corsages for the Yelp Prom...I checked Yelp, found one fairly close to me and called to order. Service was fantastic. I picked up at noon on the day of the event, and things were ready to go. They have a great little shop, and I was surprised they have lunch specials, fountain and other little gift items. Edgewater Beach is cool, see!Minus a star for the price, as one of the bouttinieres was quite tiny and the corsages were $25 a pop. The corsages however, were beautiful. My date, Jimberly, looked smashing, though I think we both lost our flowers before the end of the night...(get your head out of the gutter, I'm actually talking about misplacing those damn things, they were heavy!)

23.description: Beth did the flowers for our wedding this past weekend and they were outstanding! The flowers at the reception were truly magnificent. Beth was a pleasure to work with, from our first meeting where she sent me home with a free bouquet of flowers and a scoop of ice cream to her dropping the bouquets off at the hotel while I was getting ready she was a joy to be around. We would recommend her to anyone!

47.description: Anna Held is a diamond in the rough.  It is so much fun to stop in for a coffee and a piece of pie while admiring all the shiny doodads and dealybobs throughout the store.  I used to walk by the window front every day when I lived north of Bryn Mawr and I miss seeing the creative and colorful window displays.

8.description: Wks ago we ordered a prom crosage and boutonniere which we picked up yesterday. Based on the reviews I was expecting some sort of artistry creation however I was totally disappointed in the product along with how my Pre-payment transaction was handled. When I called to express my concerns, I was basically told that there was nothing that they could do about this that they were more concerned with the wedding arrangements they were preparing this weekend. I was not looking for a refund of those few dollars. I bypassed a lot of florists in Chgo and suburbs just to do business with Anna Held and did not expect such a cavalier response.They should not have taken my order if they were not going to value it as much as they value other orders.

31.description: My boyfriend and I came here not for flowers but for the soda fountain, which was charming and the perfect mid-day stop (finding parking is a challenge, though; try Bryn Mawr on the west side of Sheridan). They make all sorts of concoctions, including the old-fashioned phosphates, which I had to partake of, as well as shakes, malts, and of course plain-old ice cream. My cherry phosphate was refreshing, fun and not something you get everywhere. I also tried a single scoop of their strawberry cheesecake ice cream, which was tasty, but the drink was definitely the winner. My bf got their mint chocolate ice cream whirled into a shake; it was rather murky in color (well, light green + chocolate), but was deeelicious, so as long as you don't mind a swampy-looking shake I recommend it highly. Service was leisurely (only one lady working the counter), but earnest -- and who's in a hurry? Pull up a seat, watch that industrial milkshake maker get to work, and let Anna Held take you to phosphate paradise.

34.description: My bouquet was stunning. It could not have been any better. Highly recommended!

16.description: I wish this could be a better review. It was my mother-in-law's 90th birthday. Instead of being there to celebrate with her, I found myself out-of-state in the hospital. To make matters worse, her birthday fell on a Sunday and, though i didn't expect to have them delivered on her birthday, i knew that if she got them on saturday, at least she could enjoy them on her birthday and know that i had thought enough of her to have the, delivered on Saturday. After reading several reviews, I called Anna Held As they were just down the street from my mother-in-law's apartment building and I like the idea of supporting a small independent florist instead of one of the national chains. I placed my order being careful to specify the address of the apartment building. I was a bit surprised that I was never asked for my mother-in-law's phone number, but I knew they had  my phone number so if there was a problem I knew that I would hear about it. When I called my mother-in-law on Sunday, from my hospital bed 1000 miles away, I was surprised that she didn't mention the flowers (but, I mean, she's 90) and called my husband to see if she had received them.  He quickly called the doorman who said that no flowers for her had been received all weekend. I called up my AmEx ill online and saw that I had indeed been charged for the flowers. I was furious. I tried calling the flower shop, but they weren't open at all on Sunday and wouldn't open until 10 o'clock Monday. At ten I had some procedures, so I didn't call until 12 noon on Monday.  When I told the person who answered the phone. Had ordered flowers that had not been delivered, she knew immediately who I was. She transferred me to someone who said she had tried to deliver them on Saturday, but there was no doorman at the building. I was struck by how the person immediately became defensive, saying several times that she had been to the building several times that day, but there was no doorman on the weekend, something that I happen to know is not true (they've lived there 12 years).  The address is similar to another building, and I suspect they went to the wrong building. My In-laws have a very common last name and the driver said she called two different people with that last name in the building and got no answer (my inlaws were home all day Saturday) and COMPLAINED that she didn't have the phone number which I was ever asked for. She DID have MY number which she could have called at any time and gotten the situation straightened out. What bothers me most is NOT that they made a mistake with the address and not even that I wasn't called, but the complete lack of humility, the lack of any genuine apology, and the litany of excuses rather than an real customer service.  She said at one point, dismissively,"look, what's done is done" and that they had a big wedding comIng up the next weekend. And then I had to call them at noon on Monday to find out that what I had paid for had not happened two days previously!I was asked, "Do you want the (now two-day old) flowers delivered or not?" When I asked if they were going to be the same two day old flowers, she tried to convince me they "still looked nice" which was not the point.  Fresh flowers have a very limited shelf life and now my mother-in-law was going to have 2 days less to enjoy them before they began to wilt. Not to mention this was a lot of money of m to spend and my mother in law will only turn 90 once and 90 year olds only have. limited number of birthdays left in them (though I suspect my MIL will be around for quite a while.)My husband says the flowers were delivered Monday and that the florist had added flowers, including orchids, to upgrade the arrangement .  He said that the arrangement "looked like something may have fallen on it" though the lack of any crushed flowers made him think that maybe it was just a more modern style of flower arranging. I would not recommend this place to anyone. Their lack of customer service for my taste isn't made up for by having pretty flowers. And if you think I'm someone who is overly critical, I invite you to check ou my other reviews. I think I'm pretty fair.

13.description: We ordered a bouquet for a friend who is retiring from teaching. I spoke with Laura and though we were calling on the late side, for a delivery that would have to be made before school was out, she said they could do it. The roses ended up being delivered during an assembly and everyone in the auditorium was WOWED! I received a wonderful thank you from the recipient. Our friend said the roses were simply fabulous, definitely not grocery store flowers. Thank you to Beth, Laura and everyone at Anna Held for once again bringing beauty & joy to our lives. I noted that Anna Held is pricey but in this case, you get what you pay for: Truly fabulous flowers!

11.description: If I could give more stars I would. I used Anna Held for my wedding this past May and Beth was absolutely amazing. Not only was she relaxed and patient, but she truly understood my aesthetic and was beyond flexible. The flowers were absolutely amazing and totally transformed the space. Even my husband, whose face glazes over when we talk about flowers, called Beth the "MVP" of the wedding vendors. Her prices were completely reasonable and she had no problem reviewing our budget multiple times to get it down to what we wanted. She was excellent at communication and even stored and transported some of items before and after the wedding. I could not recommend Anna Held more highly! It was, by far, the best decision I made vendor-wise for my wedding!

39.description: heard great things about them , but i could have done a better job myself 37.50 for a corsage what a waste

37.description: Beth did our flowers for our wedding at the Drake Hotel in December.  The flowers were amazing and Beth was the most pleasant, honest, kind, down-to-earth person to work with.  It was a pleasure from start to finish.  She was very flexible with our needs to make it a simple, affordable, yet elegant wedding.  I cannot recommend her enough for any event.

0.description: I needed a replacement for my holiday wreath that I put on my front door. I thought a bundle of lavender would do the trick so I contacted several florists in Chicago. Anna Held Floral Studio responded via Facebook but did not have any in stock at the time. They suggested that I come in to look at their selection of eucalyptus and other scented arrangements. I purchased a bundle of spiral eucalyptus. One week later I received a call and an a message through Facebook from this flower shop notifying me that lavender have arrived. I picked them up and they've replaced my eucalyptus. They smell wonderful.The staff is extremely helpful and friendly. When I visited the first time and mentioned "eucalyptus", they immediately knew me and escorted me to them. Same with the lavender. I haven't needed flowers or plants for myself and other occasions but I know where to go. Their store has beautiful blooms and they are happy to order anything for you.

38.description: This place is way too adorable. The flowers are beautiful, hand chosen and put together, they have ribbons of every color, vases vases and more vases, and the staff is so nice! I had a veggie panini with cream cheese and mayo and holy mother of Neil Peart, it was amazing. I think they could save a few bucks as well as make the sandwiches more delicious by buying their bread from a food supply instead of Sara Lee, but no complaints otherwise!Cute as heck!

27.description: We had our flowers done by Beth at Anna Held Flower Shop for our recent wedding. We hadn't put a lot of thought into our flowers or table arrangements so we went into the shop with a blank slate. Beth helped us to create a simple, tasteful decor plan for the day. Based on the service we received at our initial consultation and the cost (which was well below other shops we looked at), we decided to go with Anna Held. Beth was incredibly easy to work with and communicated with us throughout the process. When our wedding day arrived, we were so impressed with how beautiful everything was! All of the flowers were incredible, from the bouquet to the table arrangements to the boutonnieres. Beth and her staff did a wonderful job. Everything with the flowers went seamlessly. We really appreciated their professionalism, hard work, and attention to detail.

32.description: Not just a flower shop! They serve the best apple pie. This apple pie is right up there with Hoosier Mama and Bennison's. Wonderful service - the ladies here couldn't be nicer and this is a great place to stop for coffee or a sandwich. Great prices for the value. It's really adorable inside here, like you stumbled back in time and there are cute tables and a soda fountain counter you can sit at. Tons of plants and flowers fill the shop making it feel really cozy. AND they had a shark hand puppet for sale that I had to buy. Totally awesome.

48.description: Beth and her staff provide amazing arrangements for large-scale special events and just for everyday. The flowers are very fresh and last a long time, and she has very cool stuff! THe staff is very friendly, helpful and creative.

44.description: The cutest lunch place! Delicious food, charming staff and the price is right. This place is good for kids, they have a little table the kids can sit at, draw and amuse themselves. Cool old interior - and flowers too!

24.description: We used Anna Held Flower Shop for our wedding this past weekend and they were fabulous! We worked with Beth who was absolutely wonderful!  Not only was she fun to work with but she really understood what we wanted and the flowers turned out so perfect and beautiful.  The prices were also very reasonable and I would recommend going here for wedding flowers or any other flower needs.  I felt like it was a hidden gem since it's off my beaten path!

7.description: Beth at Anna Held Floral Studio did our flowers for our wedding at the end of August. I had some unique and specific requests as to how I'd like the decor to look (wild and beautiful) as well as a strict budget. She completely understood and totally delivered. We were able to rent items from her to enhance the ceremony set up and the room flip was carefully supervised by her staff. She paid close attention to detail, listened to feedback at my centerpiece trial and made sure all colors were perfect (yellow and green only). She got to know all about me, my family, my aesthetic and took careful thought tailoring our plan to make everyone comfortable. Beth was easy to communicate with via email or over the phone and I loved going into her studio. The centerpieces lasted for over a week after the  wedding, as did my bouquet in water. In truth, now that my wedding is over I miss her and her store but am sure I will find reasons to stop in or send a bouquet from time to time. I will be her lifelong client after the incredible job she did at my wedding.

40.description: Beth did the flowers for my wedding back in September and I cannot say enough about the experience. I had met with a couple of florists before finding Beth and each time I got a proposal it was almost $1000 over my budget, even after having explicitly discussed the budget with the florist. Beth makes you feel comfortable and at ease from the moment you sit down. You can tell she's been doing this forever and she just loves what she does. I showed her what I wanted and she didn't just copy it down - she suggested a couple of things that would make it look even better! Beth stayed well within (even below!) the budget we discussed. She sent me home that first day with a free bouquet! Follow-up meetings were just as great, and the day of the wedding was smooth. She showed up with an assistant, gave everyone bouquets, made sure all of the boutonnieres were on, and made sure that nothing was missing before she left. She made my wedding cake look stunning, and the flowers got compliments all night. Beth was always quick to answer emails or call you back, and the most refreshing thing was that I knew she wasn't just trying to make an extra dollar off of me, as many in the wedding business are. I'll be using Beth for any flowers I need!

30.description: I got my wedding flowers done at Anna Held Flower Shop and must post a rave review!The staff at Anna Held was EXTREMELY helpful to me and made this a wonderful experience. The florists here really know what they are doing and know all about flowers and the best way to take care of them. They gave me excellent tips the day I picked my flowers up (the day before my wedding) on how to make sure they looked freshest on my special day. Everything in my order was on time and looked so completely perfect. I was so incredibly happy with the job these ladies did!Check this place out!

46.description: If I get a choice of where my flowers come from, this is the place!  They have wonderful stock, a great space, fantastic displays, and incredibly helpful staff.  The staff is really the key- let me tell you why..One of my friends got mad at her florist 2 weeks before the wedding and fired her... you can imagine the stress this caused afterward.  I worked at a flower shop in high school- quite a few years ago!- and offered to help my friend-  who was pretty worried about what was going to happen.  I took over the bridal party flowers as well as the bridal bouquet.  I then walked down to Anna Held, and talked with them about the situation.  They helped me pick flowers that would travel well (the wedding was in MI).  They also spoke with me, and designed an absolutely outstanding bridal bouquet for my friend (my new wedding present for her).  The staff worked with me, talked me through to make sure I was confident with how I was going to arrange things, and ordered flowers within my budget.I could not believe it!!  The flowers were wonderful, beautiful, and they earned 3 families as guaranteed customers forever!

1.description: Anna Held did the flowers for our wedding, and we were very satisfied!  We needed a lot of direction, and Beth was a joy to work with and had a lot of really great suggestions.  We had a more narrow palette since we stuck with a natural and green look, and everything was beautiful in the end.  We also wanted her help with our guest favors (small, potted succulents).  She was able to get us pots on the cheap, and recommended we find our own succulents since it would be more affordable than going through her suppliers.  Very professional of her!  We were really happy to hear that she would not only produce all of our floral arrangements, but she also took care of other details such as dropping off our boutonnieres, setting up our card box and gift table, and creating signs for our guest (for directions).Beautiful arrangements, and professional to work with - you can't ask for more.  Highly recommended!

9.description: Beth at Anna Held saved the day when we realized just two weeks before our wedding date that we really needed help with our flowers.  Our original idea of doing our own arrangements failed (with what simply became a lack of time) and, thankfully, Beth was open to helping us out in the nick of time! Beth really got creative with our modest budget and vision for our afternoon fall brunch wedding.  She was spot-on with the selections per our desired colors and overall event aesthetic, per just a couple conversations and email exchanges. It was as if she'd been working with us during the entire wedding-planning process!  I cannot recommend her and the shop enough and can't wait for the opportunity to work with them again.

26.description: Anna Held did all the floral arrangements for our wedding.  They were wonderful to work with (accommodated five or six meetings as I tried to make up my mind and a second sampling of the floral arrangements after I changed my mind about my first vision - without charging extra).  Beth, the owner, is really laidback and down-to-earth.  She was very sensitive to our budget and responded to all questions and concerns with helpful suggestions and great ideas.  She always gave us a fair price and never pulled the nonsense that we got from other florists (instead of telling us how much things cost, the other florists would always ask us, "how much do you want to spend?" With Beth, we ended up slightly UNDER budget!).  It was terrific working with Beth leading up to the wedding, but what was more amazing was the wedding itself.  Anna Held delivered, in a big way.  Everything was exactly as discussed and looked amazing.  The lead floral arrangements, the centerpieces, the bouquets were all absolutely gorgeous - I really think that it came across as if I had spent double or more what I actually spent.  The chuppah and aisle were also just as we discussed and really lovely.  And, at the end of the event, they wrapped up as many flowers as we could carry to take home with us and we enjoyed them for another two weeks after our wedding!  I highly recommend Anna Held for any event.

25.description: I'm truly a fan of Beth and her great staff! I found out about her through another coworker of mine who was getting married a couple of months before me. My Mother and I went to my first consultation and immediately were drawn in by her warm demeanor and regard. I shared my vision with her and she was able to help me tweak some things to get exactly what i wanted. We liked her so much, that at the last minute even decided to use her for my parent's 30th anniversary. She even let us keep one of her vintage candelabra pieces a week and a half more so that we could enjoy the flowers a bit longer. I was equally happy on my wedding day. Beth arrived right on time at the hotel to deliver the bouquets and met me at the church to give the guys their boutonnieres. When i got to the reception, she had all the centerpieces set up and the cake table decorated as well with fresh flowers. The best part about it is i didn't have to worry about anything because she was everywhere she needed to be on time and came to pick up the left over centerpieces (after i took all the flowers off of them). After the wedding, I was able to enjoy my flowers for an additional week. The only very small criticism i have is that my bridesmaids bouquets wilted and bruised rather quickly. They were white roses and a bit more delicate than i thought. Besides that, i would recommend Anna Held Flowers to everyone and will most likely be using them for future events. Sincerely, A very happy bride

12.description: I've been going here to order flowers for the past 6 years. I have nothing but compliments and gratitude to the workers here; they are really helpful, nice, and always make sure to give you the best flowers for you to give to your loved ones! The owner always comes out when she can to serve the people who need help, to me that's actually something a good boss would do. Overall this is place is fantastic! You would not go wrong with getting your flowers for ANY occasion from here.

21.description: Cute yet awkward.  Super quiet, I kinda felt like I had walked into somebody's grandma's house and asked them for ice cream lol.  Nice folks though!  Just weird I seriously felt like I was intruding...

17.description: I ordered flowers for my partner to be delivered this past Thursday. They were beautiful. But, by friday, the main flower in the arrangement was wilting and by saturday it was 100% dead. I took that one out of the arrangement, but by Sunday, the other flowers in the arrangement (tulips and calla lilies) are already past their prime. So, $100 flower arrangement that lasted for one day for the main flowers and three days for the others. I can't believe that they sent flowers out that were so close to the end of their natural life. Note: plenty of water, plenty of light but not too much...this is on you Anna Held. I won't be using again, even though you are my neighborhood florist.

10.description: We worked with Beth (while based in NYC) for our September 1, 2013 wedding at The Drake, and we were THRILLED with the outcome!My husband and I only were able to come to the store once for the mock up session, but regardless of the short visit, Beth understood our vision and nailed it! For example, we wanted low and high centerpieces in collections of flowers, and I wanted succulents in my bouquets, and no flowers but rather herbs for the boutonnieres, and she pulled it off! Everyone complimented us on how unique everything was! Also, with regards to pricing, Anna Held had the best offer. Everything was reasonable, i.e. the chuppah and centerpieces, as opposed to other vendors that we looked into. I highly recommend working with them/Beth!

5.description: Anna Held Floral Studio is amazing.  I found them through my mother and they are local. Their designs are lovely and price points you can't beat. They are friendly and walk-ins are no problem for the last minute need!Thank you guys for always taking good care of me!

3.description: Knowing that there aren't a ton of florists in the Edgewater area, I was really excited to go to Anna Held to pick up three corsages for Mother's Day. When I called, I told the associate that I wanted to stay within $20 for each corsage, and I asked if I could have orchids within that budget. The woman said I definitely could, and that they'd cluster three orchids together for each one. When I went to pick the corsages up, I noticed they looked really small and only had two orchids each.When I asked about it, the woman ringing me out immediately said I had received a deal on my corsages since they should've retailed for $35-40. And if I wanted to add another flower they would have to charge me more. I was really put off by this, because her tone implied that I had nickeled and dimed them. Basically, I was misquoted on the phone and to cover their end, they gave me less than what I was told.It's the business' responsibility to ensure their employees understand proper pricing, and if they don't it's not the customer's fault. The right thing to do would've been to call me when they realized the pricing discrepancy, and explained the situation. Then I would've had the option to decide to pay more, and it wouldn't have been a surprise. Instead, it was as if they were hoping I didn't notice.When I called to speak to the manager afterward, the answer was that because nothing was specified on the invoice that they took down (the same employee who misquoted me, also didn't properly take down my order) they just pulled together the easiest corsage they could, since I was given such a low price to begin with. Had the employee specified what she had told me over the phone on the invoice, they would've honored that. So again, the customer was left at fault because of an untrained employee. The experience just left a bad taste, and sadly I don't think I'll come back.

35.description: Some businesses can not be shackled with a word like "florist."  How about "Anna Held Sandwich Shoppe" or "Anna Held Ice Cream Parlour"?  "Anna Held Gift Shoppe?"Walk into Anna Held (in the Edgewater Beach Apartments, aka 'the pink building') and you walk back in time.  Custom wooden cabinetry across the long wall and a marble lunch counter lines the other long wall.  And everywhere there are flowers.  The cafe has three small round tables, and a short square table for children, filled with story books and art supplies.If you are looking for a nice sandwich, panini, home made soup, or an ice cream dessert, this is a lovely place to escape, or a nice place to have a one-on-one conversation with your grandma, aunty, or your friend whose tastes run towards the "adorable."  On the other hand, this would be a terrible place to type up a legal brief while making deals on your cell phone.The food is literally home made.  The soup is made off-site and warmed up on their little stove.  All of the sandwich ingredients might have come from the same grocery store you shop at.  This place deserves five stars because it excels at what it is:  it's the best darn florist, sandwich, ice cream, gift shop in Chicago.

19.description: It's too bad about this review, because my first impression of this business was a good one.But it was my WEDDING bouquet.  I did not opt, for my wedding, to do floral arrangements, but the one thing I DID want was a bouquet.  That's all I asked her for.  I took her some pictures, we went over what we could put in there for the season, and I left with a receipt and a happy feeling, like she would definitely be able to achieve my vision.Wedding day comes, and my bouquet was supposed to have arrived at 330 so that I would have time to take pictures with it, etc.  345 rolls around, and my coordinator gets on the horn to the flower shop.  Apparently, they delivered my bouquet to the event space the day before.  There happened to be a wedding going on that day, and someone took it from the delivery person.  I guess he/she did not check the NAME, to verify that all was well.   When my coordinator called them, they said they would "rush one out" to me in 30 minutes.  Yes.  That's what I paid for.  A rushed grouping of flowers delivered minutes before I walk down the aisle.  When it arrived, it was clear it had been hastily thrown together.  I will give her credit for getting the right look- despite the clearly thrown together appearance.  I got it 10 minutes before my walk down the aisle.  That part was super sad.  I barely have any formal pictures with it. Luckily, it didn't ruin my day, and I didn't even gripe for any money back- I was really mostly miffed that I did not receive an apology.

28.description: Had heard about this place for years and my wife and I were in the neighborhood and decided to stop by.  It is a very cute spot, and the staff is truly amongst the best I've ever run into.  Friendly, helpful, terrific.We just had ice creams - wife had a couple of scoops of chocolate and I had a milkshake.  Milkshake was very well done - a real throwback to the old days.  Ice cream was quite ordinary, though, which was too bad.  Very good experience and value, all told, though.  I'd definitely go back.

45.description: Beth did the flowers for my August 2007 wedding, and I honestly cannot say enough about her work. She is a talented and creative florist, but more than that, she is a wonderful person. It seemed like everywhere I turned on my wedding day, she was there, making sure everything was perfect. The flowers were even more beautiful than I had anticipated. She captured my vision perfectly. I would HIGHLY recommend her.

33.description: Walking back in time and very charming for a little lunch. Had the BLT and it was just like something my mom would make me- which is something you just need every once in a while. Definitely go when you have time on your hands and are just looking for food from mom's kitchen. It is low key and unpretentious- a breath of fresh air. Old fashioned charm and incredible piece of history. Let's keep this place around! It is going to turn into a once a month stop for me.

43.description: I was really happy with the flowers that provided for my wedding. They were easy to talk with, they captured the look I was going for and the worked within my budget. I had talked to them about floral table centerpieces but when I changed my mind (meaning less money for them) they still were wonderful to work with!

2.description: Beautiful floral designs. Very accommodating staff assisted me with same day request for flowers to be delivered to my mother in law.

18.description: Anna Held did all of the flowers for my husband's and my wedding this past weekend and we could not be happier. The owner, Beth, and all of the other staff are such a pleasure to work with. I needed a lot of help and advice figuring out what I wanted my flowers to look like and Beth helped me until I found something that I was happy with. Beth and her team are extremely experienced and made planning the flowers for my wedding easy and enjoyable. I'm happy that I live down the street from here because I will be returning for all of my floral needs.

41.description: We worked with Beth Tarrant at Anna Held for our July 2008 wedding. We brought her over 100 vases (my husband found them super-cheap at Michael's) and she used them in really unique and interesting ways throughout the venue. My bouquet and my girls' flowers were GORGEOUS, and the flowers for the men were the perfect size and shade. I gave her a very modest budget and she stuck with it. She also delivered the flowers herself, with a big hug and best wishes for me and my husband.

4.description: Using the Studio's website (which I found very user-friendly), I ordered flowers on Sunday for delivery yesterday afternoon (our Daughter's Birthday) within a tight, after-work window. I called the Studio yesterday morning and spoke with Beth to make certain that she had received my order and that my price range was appropriate. She told me it was perfect and that she would put together a nice arrangement. She then called me back to tell me that I hadn't filled out a greeting card (great attention to detail). Our Daughter loved the flowers, which were delivered precisely on time. Our first-time experiences with the Studio and Beth were very positive. We will return.

6.description: the woman here was so sweet and thoughtful.even though they were already closed when i called and i said it was fine for the flowers to go out the next day, the owner took my order and asked one of her employees to stay a bit longer to make the delivery after hearing the flowers were for someone who just lost his partner. major kind and sweet small owned business points here. they were also reasonably priced and charge a fair delivery fee.will definitely come back here again in the future.

22.description: I found Anna Held through yelp as I was looking for a florist in the neighborhood with decent pricing and quality service.  I must say that I got all three and more!I emailed Beth to tell her what type of floral arrangement I wanted, when I needed it by and if they would use my own vases I brought in.  Not knowing much about flowers I also included some pictures of arrangements that I liked and would be happy to see within a certain price range.  Beth was quick to respond to me offering suggestions of what would work and willing to work with my budget.  When I came in I didn't work with Beth as she was assisting a bride (I'm sure a satisfied one!) but Laura, her lead assistant was just as useful and comforting in knowing I would thoroughly  satisfied.  I highly recommend using Beth and her team for any occasion!!

15.description: Cute yet awkward.  Super quiet, I kinda felt like I had walked into somebody's grandma's house and asked them for ice cream lol.  Nice folks though!  Just weird I seriously felt like I was intruding...

20.description: In the recent past, I have ordered flowers to send to funerals online through the Major online florist.  I have not been pleased with what was received and, to make it worse, the prices were exhorbitant.  When my mother-in-law died this week, there was no way I was going to settle for less than perfect.  My husband and I went to Anna Held, a neighborhood business.  We ordered a casket spray, the casket end pieces, a special tropical arrangement because my mother-in-law loved tropical flowers, a wrist corsage and other floral pieces for family members.  Everthing was spectacular and the tropical arrangement was STUNNING!  Everyone commented on the beauty of the flowers and the tropical arrangement stopped people in their tracks!  My mother-in law would have been thrilled with everything.  We were willing to pay whatever we had to pay in order to ensure the beauty and quality of the flowers, but we got quality at a very reasonable price.  What we paid for everything was less that we would have paid for one really nice casket spray as pictured online from the major worldwide floral delivery service.  My husband and I have found our new go-to florist.The staff of the shop were pleasant to deal with under difficult circumstances.Oh, I also thought they served a good cup of coffee for me to drink as I waited.The location, in the arcade of an old Edgewater hotel (?) was like taking a step back in time - LOVED IT!

36.description: Anna Held is a terrific feel-good experience.  Not only is it a wonderful flower shop, but it's also a sweet, very unique cafe with the BEST coffee ever and unique marble top tables and a counter with stools you can sit up to.  Beth, the owner, is one of the finest people you could ever hope to meet.  I first found Beth and this place in 1993, and fell in love with it.  Nothing's changed in all that time.  I've sent dozens of people here and they all rave about it.  A special extra: the unique greeting cards will leave you smiling from ear to ear.  Anna Held Florist Cafe is almost hiding in plain site, like it's a best kept secret you are elated to find.  I promise you that it's a place that will leave you feeling wonderful.

14.description: My boyfriend and I came here not for flowers but for the soda fountain, which was charming and the perfect mid-day stop (finding parking is a challenge, though; try Bryn Mawr on the west side of Sheridan). They make all sorts of concoctions, including the old-fashioned phosphates, which I had to partake of, as well as shakes, malts, and of course plain-old ice cream. My cherry phosphate was refreshing, fun and not something you get everywhere. I also tried a single scoop of their strawberry cheesecake ice cream, which was tasty, but the drink was definitely the winner. My bf got their mint chocolate ice cream whirled into a shake; it was rather murky in color (well, light green + chocolate), but was deeelicious, so as long as you don't mind a swampy-looking shake I recommend it highly. Service was leisurely (only one lady working the counter), but earnest -- and who's in a hurry? Pull up a seat, watch that industrial milkshake maker get to work, and let Anna Held take you to phosphate paradise.

12.description: It's been a long time since I've been to Hot House, but if you're looking for good music, drinks, and a place to just chill with friends -- this is a great spot to go!We went to see some performer (I can't remember who) and we paid cover and had to purchase at least 2 drinks (or how else would Hot House afford to stay open?) Anyway, I had a good time and if I'm back in NYC, I would probably go check it out again.

7.description: This South Loop venue is a cool place to see acts that are not necessarily in the mainstream. It is an intimate stage which presents a diverse variety of programs ranging from jazz to world music to flamenco to lectures. One time I attended a special reception where free food and drink was served to attendees, and the entertainment was complimentary also.

19.description: YOO-HOO!!!Hothouse closed over a year ago!!!It was fantastic, but we must find another place to go.

1.description: What happened to "free tickets for members" events? I bought a membership last year, in hopes of shoring up their international music booking goodness, only to apparently have them STOP doing member events. I haven't been able to use that membership ONCE.Their events at the Viaduct are less then fabulous. Weird layout, and a too large-cavernous room cuts down on the intimate feel they had in their other venue. *sighs*Bad form, HotHouse, bad form. I used to love you.

2.description: A friend of mine invited me to check out her salsa performance here at this venue. She emailed me all the information and a link to the venue's website for directions & location. "hothouse[dot]com"I clicked on it. WHAT HAPPENED AFTER???? Oh Jesus Christ of Laturday Saints, it turned out to be a gay porn site. WTF?!?! I was at work too!!Thanks a lot Favi for sending me a porn link at work. =/All jokes aside (even though this was a true story), the Hot House is a nice venue. Quaint, comfortable and hidden. Other than my friend's performance, I also saw play at this venue that my cousin was in. This establishment proves to be a great spot to hold urban-esque performances. Hot House, I would log onto your website again....UHHHH...WAIT...UH...I mean...no I won't.

9.description: I'm all for Hothouse. Non-profit, great music, good booze. A breeding ground for shared culture. Unassuming to boot. None of that high & mighty stuff. What's there not to like? 2 things:1. if you try to books tickets through the phone, don't bother, I tried at least 15 times- no one picked up. and no one returned my calls.2. an angst-filled security guy who insisted on my ID (so I had to rush home to get it, risking missing a performance) and when he finally saw it, he took an eternity looking at it (and at me, in mock disbelief) I'm a good 6 years older than the minimum legal age by the way.He was just an angry man who didn't like me. I have no idea why.

6.description: Possibly the coolest thing about Hot House is that it's on the second floor - I don't think there are any other loft jazz clubs around here. Very cool decor, with African art, vegetation (albeit fake), lots of red and red walls with a black ceiling, and lit only by wall candelabras. Every seat is close to the stage. Non-smoking! A pretty good selection of beers at regular jazz club prices, but don't be fooled: not everything on the menu is behind the bar. That, along with the fact that it took so long to get a beer I never could get a buzz, were the only things I didn't like about Hot House.For music, I kind of cheated because I went there for Corey Wilkes, whose music I already know I enjoy. The guy sitting at my table almost got into a fight with the Barbies and their Kens next to us because they thought it was an audience storytelling contest instead of a show. It almost came to fisticuffs, but it didn't. Darn.

18.description: OOH OOOH OOH! If only this place weren't so inconvenient to get to! But god, I need to keep their schedule permanently on my screen so  I don't miss the GREAT performers (mostly world music) that they bring!!! Can't stop raving about it. I wish they had monthly passes....Then I could afford to go as much I want to. I need to more compulsive about checking their schedule...But damn, was that Yerba Buena show great!!! This is the kind of venue that Chicago has too few of, or at least the performers I like don't seem to go to....Intimate (very small) and always some interesting and cool people to meet!

10.description: I've booked a few events at the Hothouse, and although they are difficult to communicate with, when it comes down to it the events are always awesome.They bring in great shows, serve great booze, and are always reasonably priced.  Love it.

13.description: One of the greatest venues in the city until they forced out founder Margerite. I'll be sure to pay attention to whatever her next project is. So so many memories. So many art shows, print festivals, activist trainings, fundraisers, and, of course, top-of-the-line music and dancing. Also, a great bar. I also remember fundraising FOR Hot House when the Chicago Police maliciously shut it down. Rest In Peace

16.description: I haven't been here (but Yelp forced me to select stars, so please ignore), but I go by all the time...and isn't it all boarded up now?

17.description: I've never been here and not had a good time.  Hot House has it all!  We even had our law school prom there and it didn't suck.  Hot House can do no wrong.

15.description: I saw Gil Scott-Heron ("The Revolution Will Not Be Televised") here in 2001, one of the high points of my life - great performer in the most warm intimate venue you could imagine.

0.description: If I have my information straight, hopefully I can clear some things up here:The Center for International Performance and Exhibition (C.I.P.E.X.) is a non for profit organization, that up to about a year ago curated music events at the Hot House on Balboa St. Unfortunately, Hot House (the venue) was shut down.
