The amazing multicultural music events continue to be hosted by Hot House/C.I.P.E.X. at various locations in Chicago such as the Brazilian Independence Day Festival hosted at Fizz or now ... the many great upcoming shows at The Morse Theatre.*The link to the Morse Theatre web page with upcoming shows:themorse.com/cms*Here is what Hot House/C.I.P.E.X. has to say about the Morse Theatre:"After a beautifully detailed renovation, the far north side Morse Theatre is one of the most exciting, progressive new venues to hit the Chicago music scene in years. Much of the original 1912 façade and interior details were maintained as the two-tier performance space was refurbished to create a relaxing, intimate cross between theater and club. The renovated building, including planted roof, is LEED certified by Mayor Daley's Green Initiative Program. The complex also offers dining at The Century Public House - a classic Chicago pub, with a nod to the building's history."Hope to see everyone at the Morse! The "Dia de los Muertos" show on October 31st looks pretty good!

5.description: We went to a Hot House event of Swing Gitan at Fizz Bar and Grill last night.The space was really cool -- open and airy, not cramed and claustrophobic (which I hate!). The music was great and our bartender was nice. Pretty straight forward. No complaints.

11.description: A terrific find in the south loop and a great place for the Sunday night antics of the Girlie-Q Burlesque Review. A decent bar and excellent seating make for a better-than-average show experiance. On Sunday nights, the parking is plentiful. The Girlie-Q troup takes their comic kudos from director Bloody Belle, and the whole thing is fun stuff.The HotHouse is an exceptional treasure of a place; god knows how long they'll exist so enjoy it all while they're here.

8.description: I LOVE THE HOT HOUSE!!!Too too too many good times here.  Well worth the trip down to South Loop.  Get yer a's to Hot House for a great time!

3.description: I've been going to HotHouse events for several years now, ever since I moved to Chicago, and I think that this is a GREAT organization to have in the city! If you are into music and learning about different cultures and HAVING FUN, then you should definitely check out a HotHouse event! I do miss the old location on Balbo, since it was such a great venue, and I had such a fun night there, at a African/Caribbean music event. I went to see a Mexican and Spanish guitar show at the Viaduct. While I agree that the location isn't the greatest, the show was really amazing! If you have never seen flamenco in person, you are missing out! Talk about passion! I never made it to the dinner and show package at Las Tablas, but I heard that they were GREAT! I also intend to catch any of the Brasilian shows that come up this year! Samba is so much fun! The crowds at these shows are also a nice eclectic mix of people. If you are sick of the Lincoln Park Trixie/Douchebag scene, go to a HotHouse event, it's guaranteed to be an interesting group of people! If Dorota G is right about the upcoming events being at the Morse Theater, then I am VERY excited!  The renovation looks beautiful! HotHouse is a nonprofit organization, and if you care at all about supporting the arts, I encourage you to check out a HotHouse event.

14.description: Whew! Hothouse is one of the better little venues in the city that nobody knows about. That's probably because HotHouse features a lot of world music and international talent rather than the music that most of us are so familiar with. And it's the performance space I'm in love with. You can sit down and watch a show, and most nights of the week, a good show too. There are a number of booths and tables in addition to the dance floor, and even better is that no seat is further than 50 feet from the stage. The space is intimate and the waitstaff is courteous. I usually go for the monday night jazz sessions, but I've spent may a pleasant hour there. It's trite, but it's true: I just can't get enough of a booth at a venue.

4.description: Best place in Chicago hands down for eclectic, ethnic and electric music!    International musicians who typically sell out around the world tend to stop by here for an intimate setting.  Don't be surprised if everyone abandons their table to hit the vibrant dance floor.The tickets tend to be very affordable (most under $20). The drink menu seems short but carefully chosen.  A frequent favorite of mine is Chicago Samba, a local Brazilian music band that plays infectious dance beats.  Edilson (samba dance teacher) leads the intermission with free dance lessons for all skill levels.  Never a dull night!All in all a great venue for the culturally minded, music-loving types... no matter how great your dance skills are.  Fun location for second or third dates.Some general tips:* There's no assigned seating, so it's wise to go a bit early and get the best seats of the venue, especially for popular artists.* Food is sometimes available with international cuisine; check with HotHouse first if you're relying on them for dinner.* You can take the CTA Red Line to Harrison for a short walk.  There's a homeless shelter nearby, but the streets are mostly harmless.

58.description: A welcome addition to the Chicago coffee house scene. This place has a wide variety of food offerings both savory and sweet. The seating is substantial with large dark wood tables and comfortable chairs. The staff is extremely friendly.

56.description: Chicago Grind is a trendy coffee shop that everyone in the area should visit for their daily fix of coffee or tea!  This place has phenomenal food (i had a cream cheese tomato pepper bagel).  The hot chocolate is rich and thick for all the chocolate lovers out there, I would suggest worth a drive to try it out (if not in the area).  Free wifi along with a friendly staff and the owner Jim who is hands on to serve and make sure all customers leave with a smile.  Great spot!

29.description: Brrrrr! (Sing next phrase to Nelly's "It's Getting Hot in Herre") -- It's getting cold in there, so put on all your clothes. I am getting so cold, I need to put some clothes on... Like previous reviewers said, it's freezing in there! But, in all fairness, it kept me awake.The part that made me leave early though, wasn't the cold; it was the smoke that filled up the space. Here's what happens when you heat up food in a small space with little ventilation: Oh, it fills up with smoke. This means, I am not only breathing smoke, but I also leave smelling like smoke. If only they created a "Smoke Nazi" similar to Seinfeld's "Soup Nazi" and held fast to "No smoke for you", I might just be back...

42.description: The Chicago Grind is a cute little coffee shop in the Uptown / Edgewater part of town and is supposedly extremely new to the neighborhood.  The inside is modern with clean hardwood floors, dark wood counter tops and tables and just feels very fresh.  It's the type of classy coffee shop you expect in 2015 rather than a lot of these older rustic coffee shops that have been around for however many years now.I spent half a day here working last week and although the food and service was pretty good, working here was probably not the best decision I ever made.  It's not that it was uncomfortable or uninviting, but it's more that the noise level was actually pretty high for the morning - afternoon with all of the guests coming and going over the course of the day.  Outlets also weren't very ample, so finding a place to plug my laptop into became a bit of a puzzle too.That said, if you want to go here for a quick bite to eat it's pretty great.  I had the breakfast sandwich with eggs, Canadian ham, and cheese on an everything bagel and it was overwhelming (in the best way possible!) and super delicious.  I could also see the chef in the back using salt and pepper too so that just brought a huge smile to my face.  The only let down that really caught my eye was that the bagel was barely toasted.  Had it had that wonderful caramelized toasty-texture, it would've been the breakfast sandwich of the year for me.  Maybe next time!So here's the long and short of it - don't work here.  It's just too popular and too busy and you're bound to be distracted all day.  If you want some delicious cafe food though this is definitely a homerun in this area of town!

23.description: I really like this place. They have excellent food, coffee, and customer service. I sometimes come here to study because it has a chill vibe, its fairly quiet, and they have plenty of electric outlets! Food recommendation: the chipotle flatbread..its one of the best things Ive ever eaten and its at a coffee shop...who would have thought!

47.description: We love Pizza aroma so when we heard the owner started a new venture, we made sure to give it a try.  This is a new cute little place in the neighborhood for good lunch, snacks or even to hang out.  We love our two flatbreads we had, Thai Pie and Chipotle Chicken.  Apple square dessert is quite good.  I saw a huge collection of good looking desserts, be warned for the new year resolution weight loss people!!  I'll try their coffee soon.The place is nicely decorated, modern looking and clean.  The staff are friendly and look like they are happy to be there.  We will come back for sure.

8.description: Walked in this cozy little spot after spotting it while riding my bike around the city. Saw a sign about Belgian waffles and decided to get just that, a Belgian waffle with strawberries and whip cream. I also grabbed a Nuttella Latte as that caught my interest as well. All in all I gave them both a solid 4 out of 5. The Belgian waffle was good, not the best I've ever had but still pretty darn delicious. It had a nice crunch on the outside with the center being moist and fluffy. The only thing I'm not much of a fan of is the sweet strawberry jam like syrup as I prefer my Belgian waffles with fresh fruit instead but that's just me. They had other varieties which I'll be going back and trying soon though. The Nuttella Latte was pretty spot on in what I was expecting, with delicious flavors of chocolate and hazelnut being very fluent with a robust coffee flavor to accent.

31.description: "I was rooting for you, we are all rooting for you, LEARN SOMETHING FROM THIS!"youtube.com/watch?v=m6Sh…When it comes to this place, Tyra says it better than I ever could. I was elated to hear of the change in ownership and remodeling, but the half-dozen or so visits I've made here since then have grown increasingly disappointing. The coffee is just OK (sometimes it tastes a little off, other times it is fine), the music is awful and distracting ("Sweet Caroline"? What is this, the reception at my Cicero aunt's third wedding?), the pastries are lackluster (your options are cold/refrigerated or microwaved to the point of overheated) and the customer service is awkward and frequently unfriendly (though I can't blame the baristas at all for any snark given the ridic fast food-esque uniforms they have to wear).With some very small tweaks, this place would easily be four stars in my eye. Play less distracting, more "hip" (for lack of a better word) music (or, hell, even instrumental jazz would work). Allow your staff to dress in something that doesn't say "do you want fries with that?" Allow your muffins to be served at room temperature like goddess intended. Get rid of all the giant, tacky signage. Less is more, boo-boo. With these tweaks, you'd bring in not only the current crowd, but also the sort of people in the neighborhood who expect something with more of a city feel, not suburban feel, from their coffee shop. All the pieces are there for this place to be amazing! But meanwhile, there are so many other places in the neighborhood doing it better.

34.description: This place had a recent update inside and looks great. I prefer to visit in the late morning when the couches are more available. The coffee is SO good (though I know that's relative) and the pastries are light, full of flavor, and reasonably priced. The music playing now is Michael Buble. They have daily specials and I'm taking advantage of them all this week to give them my full review. The mocha which was just delivered to me is full of flavor, a good, mild chocolate, blended well with the coffee taste. I hope this Cafe stays in the neighborhood forever!

16.description: Needed a place to grab lunch and work on my laptop for a while, this place fit the bill.  Has free WiFi, sandwich was good,  staff was nice, they even let me swap out my coleslaw for more pickle Spears.... Awesome because I hate coleslaw! This place is classy,  nice jazz music playing,  sophisticated tile backslash behind the counter,  wood floors and do leather covered chairs.

13.description: - Plenty of seating with two-seaters, a couch, two armchairs, a little bar area, and two big tables (seats 10 each) for groups- Limited outlets- Free wifi with strong signal- Lots of really delicious food/drink options, including vegan and gluten-free items. And, daily specials! My buffalo pasta salad and turkey fiesta sandwich were awesome with huge portions for $6.95.- Friendly, helpful staff- Pretty busy, so not a quiet atmosphere - but not too loud- Easily accessible by transit (right off the Berwyn red line stop, along the #36 bus route on Broadway)Spent the day here with a friend getting some work done and it was great.

11.description: I haven't been here since it was Chicago Coffee.  First, it was a nice surprise to see the updated, comfy decor.  Second, the baristas couldn't have been any friendlier, more conversational, or more helpful.  Hats off to them for creating a welcoming vibe.  I ordered a soy chai after I was advised that their chais are on the spicy side.  Yes, it was a touch spicy - just the way I like them.  And the temperature was perfectly hot.  I ordered the vegan wrap.  It was freshly made, and packed with fresh, crunchy vegetables nestled inside a soft spinach wrap.  My friend also dug her sandwich.  All I can tell you is that she said she loved the rye bread, and before you know it, the dang thing was gone.   All in all my experience was tasty food, good chai, friendly folks in a cool environment.  Good neighborhood joint.

39.description: The Good: Nice setup and courteous staff. Free wifi, easy street metered parking. Clean tables! The Bad: I did not like the food. The pastry was WAY too sweet and on the dry side. I had just a couple of bites and ended up leaving 97% of it. The chai latte was surprisingly bland, giving how spicy it was. I had just a couple of sips and left the rest. Maybe the regular coffee or a different drink would be good. This place has potential, if you can find something good to eat or drink.

37.description: Beware if you're Vegan.  I ordered the vegan wrap to bring to work for my lunch, it comes with a pickle and cole slaw and I just happened to ask if the cole slaw was vegan, he says 'oh no, it's not' WTH?  I hope my wrap was really vegan. I doubt if I'll go back there.

0.description: I love coming here. It is a little on the pricey side, but they do have a drink loyalty program and daily food item deals.I've liked everything I've tried so far. The sandwiches and flatbreads are tasty and filling--generous portions and always fresh. I like the fig green tea, coffee, and chai.The owner and staff have always been so nice to me. Thank you.

38.description: Needed a place to grab lunch and work on my laptop for a while, this place fit the bill.  Has free WiFi, sandwich was good,  staff was nice, they even let me swap out my coleslaw for more pickle Spears.... Awesome because I hate coleslaw! This place is classy,  nice jazz music playing,  sophisticated tile backslash behind the counter,  wood floors and do leather covered chairs.

51.description: I would add a star if possible for the fans that sound out the loud groups that come to use the Internet free and don't want order anything!

27.description: I was worried that when an old favorite, Coffee Chicago was bought out, remodeled and re-presented as Chicago Grind, that it would all the good Coffee Chicago had going. Although I miss the people who use to work there, the new staff is just as nice and good at what they do. It's not as swanky and stuffy as Coffee Studio and still feels like a great old neighborhood spot. The coffee is rich and tasty, the asiago bagel was absolutely delicious and the music is not loud.

32.description: Hmmmm. Way, way, way better than its predecessor but I mean, come on, that's not saying much. It looks great. More seating choices. But here are things I have found strange on more than one visit: ceiling fans on too strong; one staff member left over from the previous incarnation who used to be friendly is now the least friendly staff member, and the pastries still suck. Sorry. I'm picky about pastries and I think Chicago is a pastry wasteland except for Bittersweet. Coffee was good. I still prefer La Colombe on Clark but so glad the neighborhood is improving.

54.description: I really want to like this place, and it has lots going for it. Coffee is good, food is good, atmosphere is calm and quiet but with enough energy to keep you awake while studying for hours. I have two major complaints, however, that would keep me from going back there. It is SO cold. For some reason they have the ceiling fans going strong, even though it's about 35 degrees outside. Also, the vents blow strong, cold air. I moved around to a couple different tables, and had the same problem in each place. it's one thing for it be cold, it's another for it to be breezy and cold. My papers were blowing off the table. The second is that the music kept cutting in and out. Not sure if it's a network problem or what, but the staff seems to not notice or be concerned. Super annoying.

48.description: I was in Chicago for a wedding and needed my "Cup of Joe" before the day got crazy! I found this place on yelp and had to give it a go! First things first, when I walked in the door I was greeted by an employee immediately! I took a look around, the place was clean and welcoming. I ordered a chia tea with one shot of espresso... and the chicken salad sandwich to go. The tea was on point and so was the food! I would highly recommend this place for anyone new in the area! 5 stars all the way.

44.description: I LOVE this place and all who work there are GREAT!! I'm a regular and the place is always clean, the staff remembers your order and how you like it, without needing to tell them. I'm able to get a ton of work done here, music is soft and nice and you never feel like they want you out. Thank you All!!

24.description: The atmosphere here is pretty nice.  It's a nice place to grab a cup of coffee while reading or getting some work done.

7.description: Good coffee, great cozy feel inside, good service. A little too many "buy 1 coffee and sit there for 8 hours" people taking up good seats, but if I needed free wi-fi I guess I'd spend time there too.

49.description: Ok,In Chi Town for the weekend and stopped by Pizzeria Aroma for lunch. Had a great meal at a great price. Had the liberty of meeting the owner and chatting for a while.As an owner of 12 retail stores in Florida myself, i was uber impressed with the way Jim, the pizzeria owner, ran his operation. He is a hands on guy who pays attention to detail. He seems to understand his patrons and goes out of his way to provide what they want along with excellent service. He sets his standards high. I like that. So when he told me about a coffee shop he just opened, I said to myself "Let's give it a try"So the next Morning i stopped by to check it out. Great looking place! i was really amazed. I was also shocked to see the varieties of pastries and different foods you could get here. I wasn't expecting a coffee shop you could get REAL food at! The lunch menu looked very interesting and based on the quality experience I had a Pizzeria Aroma, I began wishing i came here for lunch...but I didn't so on with Breakfast.Got myself a Black Coffee and blueberry square. The Coffee was spot on. Hot but not nuclear and the blueberry square was as GOOD as it looked!!! one of the things that always bothered me about Starbucks is that their stuff always looked amazing but tasted BLAH...NOT the case here!I have to say that this is the next level of Coffee Houses. The look, atmosphere and most importantly the service. My Coffee and square were ready in stellar time and served with a smile. What more can you ask for? I even got a "Have a great day" when I was leaving!Definitely will visit here again the next time I am back in town...except this time I am coming for LUNCH!

40.description: I had a veggie wrap there yesterday and it wasnt that good and I thought it was going to be a lot better. The coffee wasn't bad, but I just wasn't impressed. They did have wifi which was very helpful but it just wasn't my favorite coffee shop. The biggest pain was that the door wasn't working properly and whenever someone would walk in it would take a long time for the door to close. People kept putting their coats on and it was cold and uncomfortable.

53.description: Good music, great staff (with one exception, a barista who seems to be very part time, which is fortunate, because she can't make a drink well to save her life), great food.

30.description: My favorite is the egg grinder on whole grain with avocado and chihuahua cheeses. I wash it down with an iced Americans.

46.description: Love the coffee here. They brew Bowtruss coffee, and I'm a huge fan! The atmosphere is great, and it's a great addition to Edgewater. I enjoy sitting on the couch and doing some casual reading here, but I also can get some serious work done here since they have long hours, even on the weekends. I haven't tried their food food yet, but I've had some delicious sweets.They also have a pay phone in the back. Don't know if it actually works, but I think it's a great/interesting addition to the decor.

1.description: So I have to edit/erase my first review and take off stars for this place. Only a couple minutes after enjoying my egg sandwich and leaving a good review for this place- a guy comes into the cafe and calls out to me while I'm in the middle of getting work done, abruptly and aggressively asking me if I ordered anything. When I told him I did he proceeded to ask me what. I told him the egg sandwich and then he just walked away into the kitchen. Turns out it was the owner. His confrontation was so loud, abrupt and rude that other customers around me asked me if I was okay and encouraged me to say something. I spoke to a girl at the counter who was nice and apologized to me on the owner's behalf, but I really would have appreciated a direct apology from him. If the policy is that you have to order something in order to do work in the cafe, there are much more polite ways of enforcing this. Also I was the only person he approached even though there were people around me without food or drink in front of them. In the future I would not feel uncomfortable going to hang out and get work done in this cafe because I'd have to worry about being approached if I didn't leave my dirty dishes sitting in front of me as proof that I had ordered something.Final review: Pro: good egg sandwiches and I've heard the waffles are good. There are some comfty couches/chairs if you can manage to get them. Negatives: no bathrooms, rude owner.

55.description: The Coffee Chicago that was previously at this locale had its highs and lows with discontinued vegan ice cream in, its last weeks, bathroom maintenance issues,  and sometimes random quality of customer service being bad points.  But the good points were far more numerous many food and danish options, pleasant atmosphere and a great location to study or for computer use.  The drinks; shakes, coffee and tea and other options were always delicious and were well prepared. The coffee was well prepared all of the time and the quality was always consistent.Now that Chicago Coffee is at this locale many things have changed the atmosphere has gone up dramatically and it feels more comfy and inviting.  The menu board is changed from Coffee Chicago's chalkboard to digital menus on flat screen televisions which is a nice touch.  I have not had the food yet but I have had coffee on two different occasions the first experience the coffee tasted good and was enjoyable but not stellar.  On the second occasion which happened to be today I ordered a small cafe mocha with almond milk to go.  I received my drink and then proceeded on my way with my day's errands once I was on my way to my next destination I took a sip.  To my dismay the coffee was way too hot and seemed to be over-prepared also the taste was not of mocha but of standard drip coffee that was more than a little burnt tasting.  The texture was also very thin and lacked any distinct mocha flavor.So I give two stars I would give three if it wasn't for the burned flavor of coffee in my mouth that I still have hours later now.  The next time I visit I will have a variety of menu items and update my review.

9.description: I know Chicago Grind has good reviews but the Nutella latte I ordered was not good at all.  There was no trace of nutella or nutella flavoring in the drink and was overall quite bland.  The spot itself has a decent amount of seating for relaxing/studying/hanging out.  The décor on the exterior of the building isn't too welcoming, the awning is a bit cluttered with a lot of words and had it not been for Yelp I probably would have passed by without a second glance.  I wish I could give Chicago Grind a better review, maybe I just ordered the wrong drink.

26.description: I like this coffee shop. Unlimited wifi, tasty iced drinks and out of this world flatbreads!Staff is a mixed bag. Some are super friendly, others took time to warm up. It has a bit of a corporate feel, which is fine if you're there to work, which I usually am. They don't  rush you, they bus the tables and it seems like they appreciate your business.Don't expect anything too hip, but a nice, clean place to grab some coffee, some food and get some writing done.

25.description: I have a new favorite coffee shop in Andersonville / Edgewater.  Great coffee without the snootiness.  The prices are on par with the snooty coffee shop, sigh, but at least the service is met with a smile.

12.description: This is an ideal coffee shop to get work done. They have a cozy reading nook or a good number of tables (communal and solo). The one thing I would change is the level of noise. They often have music playing and it gets annoying - especially when it's clear the majority of people are doing work. Maybe they could turn it down? Food and drinks are superb and love the loyalty card. Be sure and check in with them to get your free cookie!

21.description: Nice, relaxed place.  Good food, good drinks, and comparable  prices.  Air temp much better than the big chain coffee shops.  Only thing preventing 5 stars is, if you stay for a while, there is slight smokiness in the air from cooking that burns the eyes.  May want to run the air more often or open the doors to get the smell/smoke out.  If not that, along with their patio, this would be a 5 star place.

17.description: This place had a recent update inside and looks great. I prefer to visit in the late morning when the couches are more available. The coffee is SO good (though I know that's relative) and the pastries are light, full of flavor, and reasonably priced. The music playing now is Michael Buble. They have daily specials and I'm taking advantage of them all this week to give them my full review. The mocha which was just delivered to me is full of flavor, a good, mild chocolate, blended well with the coffee taste. I hope this Cafe stays in the neighborhood forever!

10.description: Brrrrr! (Sing next phrase to Nelly's "It's Getting Hot in Herre") -- It's getting cold in there, so put on all your clothes. I am getting so cold, I need to put some clothes on... Like previous reviewers said, it's freezing in there! But, in all fairness, it kept me awake.The part that made me leave early though, wasn't the cold; it was the smoke that filled up the space. Here's what happens when you heat up food in a small space with little ventilation: Oh, it fills up with smoke. This means, I am not only breathing smoke, but I also leave smelling like smoke. If only they created a "Smoke Nazi" similar to Seinfeld's "Soup Nazi" and held fast to "No smoke for you", I might just be back...

5.description: Love it...cozy, nice variety of food and coffee/tea selections. Ambiance and decor are just lovely. Friendly staff as well.

3.description: Stumbled upon this place on accident and decided to go in.  Space:  Modern interior, clean, plenty of seats, solid wi fi. They also have an outdoor patio which is bonus.Service:  Very friendly staff.  Seems to know their stuff and were very helpful.Drinks/Food:  I ordered a latte.  The temperature was perfect.  Hot but not scalding.  The quality of the espresso was divine.  They use Bow Truss products.  Anyone who's been to Bow Truss already knows how great it is.   It was relatively perfect as lattes go.  I want to give five stars, but I'll need to pop in a few more times and stay longer to get a feel for the place.  Definitely worth the stop and I'll be back again when I have a bit more time.

35.description: This place received a major overhaul both in decor and in coffee quality, the coffee is pretty darn good. REMEMBER TO CHECK IN AND CLAIM YOUR FREE COOKIE!This place also participate's in Edgewater's free book exchange (bring a book take a book) just don't bring your outdated MSOffice97 books to trade in, put those in the recycle bin and don't be a jerk.   facebook.com/EdgewaterRe…

19.description: Today was my first time trying this place. Thought I'd check it out since it's located conveniently where my train and bus connect. Since I had a 13 minute wait for the bus I stopped in for an Americano. An AMERICANO. Its just espresso and water. No way it should take longer than 13 minutes but it did. No one was in front of me except someone who had ordered before I ever came in. I finally had to tell the guy " I'm about to miss that bus. Please hurry!" Was the coffee worth it? No idea. Didn't have time to doctor it up to my liking. Will I go again? Not unless I have at least 20 minutes and Will not be leaving a tip. Cute place though.

28.description: Stumbled upon this place on accident and decided to go in.  Space:  Modern interior, clean, plenty of seats, solid wi fi. They also have an outdoor patio which is bonus.Service:  Very friendly staff.  Seems to know their stuff and were very helpful.Drinks/Food:  I ordered a latte.  The temperature was perfect.  Hot but not scalding.  The quality of the espresso was divine.  They use Bow Truss products.  Anyone who's been to Bow Truss already knows how great it is.   It was relatively perfect as lattes go.  I want to give five stars, but I'll need to pop in a few more times and stay longer to get a feel for the place.  Definitely worth the stop and I'll be back again when I have a bit more time.

45.description: I would give this place 4 stars based on food and drinks alone, however they have one "barista" there that has such a bad attitude and what seems to be a general disinterest and dislike for all patrons, big or little, white or black, man or woman.  I've never had a pleasant interaction with him and his attitude (and mustache) really piss me off.I went in yesterday to get a bag of Bowtruss coffee.  Saw him at the register and wanted to give the douche one more chance.  I was pleasant and he was still a douche.Case closed.

33.description: I haven't been here since it was Chicago Coffee.  First, it was a nice surprise to see the updated, comfy decor.  Second, the baristas couldn't have been any friendlier, more conversational, or more helpful.  Hats off to them for creating a welcoming vibe.  I ordered a soy chai after I was advised that their chais are on the spicy side.  Yes, it was a touch spicy - just the way I like them.  And the temperature was perfectly hot.  I ordered the vegan wrap.  It was freshly made, and packed with fresh, crunchy vegetables nestled inside a soft spinach wrap.  My friend also dug her sandwich.  All I can tell you is that she said she loved the rye bread, and before you know it, the dang thing was gone.   All in all my experience was tasty food, good chai, friendly folks in a cool environment.  Good neighborhood joint.

43.description: This is by far my favorite coffee shop! It has a European aroma which I miss! I've tried the mocha latte, latte and their black coffee and I loved all of them! Their coffee has always been good each and every time. The collection of tea is absolutely grande! The food, either it is breakfast, lunch, dinner or a small snack, is just delicious and it is the healthiest food i have seen  served in a cafe! I also love the atmosphere there! I can take my laptop and just work or read, or I can take my book or borrow one of theirs and again read. It is never too loud and you can have a conversation with whomever you are there with. The people there are always polite and helpful and the owners know how to run a successful place :) In other words, I just love it and I hope you'll love it too!

2.description: I'm going to agree with another Yelper who recommended Chicago Grind as a study/work spot.  There's only so many places with electrical outlets, but as pointed out, there's a couch area that's usually taken up, and then there's a series of small tables for two along the windows, and these are the spots with the outlets.  The large tables in the center of the room, as far as I know, don't have anywhere to plug in.  While they have music playing, I don't think the volume is so high nor is the music that intrusive or upbeat that it's disruptive - just a personal opinion, but if you are after dead quiet, you might want to explore another option.The staff has always been very courteous to us and their drinks are quite good - their green tea is on the strong and bitter end, though.  We have not tried the food, but the menu seems to have a decent selection that we might try if we stayed long enough into a meal hour!

18.description: I think this place is great for a quick breakfast on the go! This place offers free wifi if you need it, it is a bit of a tight squeeze, but I went on a Sunday, so I'm sure it varies depending on the day. I ordered the breakfast burrito, it was decent, not bad, the eggs are different here though, I'm not sure how they make them but they don't taste like your normal egg. The friends I was with also enjoyed their food! I'd come back.

41.description: - Plenty of seating with two-seaters, a couch, two armchairs, a little bar area, and two big tables (seats 10 each) for groups- Limited outlets- Free wifi with strong signal- Lots of really delicious food/drink options, including vegan and gluten-free items. And, daily specials! My buffalo pasta salad and turkey fiesta sandwich were awesome with huge portions for $6.95.- Friendly, helpful staff- Pretty busy, so not a quiet atmosphere - but not too loud- Easily accessible by transit (right off the Berwyn red line stop, along the #36 bus route on Broadway)Spent the day here with a friend getting some work done and it was great.

52.description: I really like this place.  My husband and I like to to have coffee or tea in the evenings once in a while.  We used to go to dollop on Clarendon, but lately the baristas have been rude and the prices seem a little high.  We found Chicago grind, and love it.  The prices are reasonable.  I have been several times at night, and twice in the morning to get some studying done.  The biggest pro for me is that it is never overcrowded.  I get frustrated when I go to a cafe and there is too much noise because of too many people being jam packed.  That is not the case with Chicago grind.  The service is great as well. So far, so good.  I will be a regular here.

50.description: Worst mocha I've ever had in Chicago. I was in a rush, so when I noticed the barista put in three pumps of chocolate (for the smallest size) and no espresso, I knew it was going to just be a $4 hot chocolate instead. When I finally got to taste it, it was almost cold, a minute after I'd taken it from the shop. Really disappointed in this place. I liked Coffee Chicago well enough, and this place's exterior decor is already an insult to the neighborhood, but I wanted to give the product a shot, since I live so close. Sadly, I won't be going back. Stick to Kitchen Sink, half a block east on Berwyn.

4.description: The Chicago Grind is a cute little coffee shop in the Uptown / Edgewater part of town and is supposedly extremely new to the neighborhood.  The inside is modern with clean hardwood floors, dark wood counter tops and tables and just feels very fresh.  It's the type of classy coffee shop you expect in 2015 rather than a lot of these older rustic coffee shops that have been around for however many years now.I spent half a day here working last week and although the food and service was pretty good, working here was probably not the best decision I ever made.  It's not that it was uncomfortable or uninviting, but it's more that the noise level was actually pretty high for the morning - afternoon with all of the guests coming and going over the course of the day.  Outlets also weren't very ample, so finding a place to plug my laptop into became a bit of a puzzle too.That said, if you want to go here for a quick bite to eat it's pretty great.  I had the breakfast sandwich with eggs, Canadian ham, and cheese on an everything bagel and it was overwhelming (in the best way possible!) and super delicious.  I could also see the chef in the back using salt and pepper too so that just brought a huge smile to my face.  The only let down that really caught my eye was that the bagel was barely toasted.  Had it had that wonderful caramelized toasty-texture, it would've been the breakfast sandwich of the year for me.  Maybe next time!So here's the long and short of it - don't work here.  It's just too popular and too busy and you're bound to be distracted all day.  If you want some delicious cafe food though this is definitely a homerun in this area of town!

6.description: One of the best cafes on the north side. Great coffee and nice, quiet place to get work done or study, especially during the day. The atmosphere is inviting, and feels so home-y compared to the usual Starbucks and other small grab-and-go coffee shops. This place is calling you to stay and hangout for a bit. Fantastic owners and workers as well. In the summer, they have a pretty spacious patio outside as well. Definitely a hidden gem that I hope continues to get more attention.

22.description: Clean and modern coffee shop. Great service and excellent place to meet friends for breakfast and tea. Quiet enough to get work done sure during the week.

15.description: The ambience is wonderful. The coffee is awful. It is so bitter you need to half cream. Let's try the coffee. Noooo good. That's why you go there. For the coffee. The bitterness makes Duncan donuts a diamond. Food is ok. Friends are waiting for their food. A second chance maybe. Always give stuff a second chance.

57.description: Chicago Grind is a remarkable upgrade from Chicago Coffee.  The owner, Jim, also the owner of Pizzeria Aroma, is an ideal business owner - he's very hands on and seems to have a photographic memory of even sometime customers.  He also seems intent on bringing great business to Edgewater.  Chicago Grind is sleek yet welcoming, sharp yet comfortable, and filled with both coffeehouse standards as well as unique food creations.  They use delicious Bowtress Coffee and have all manner of sweets.  I don't really eat sweets, but I have had both breakfast and lunch here and loved both.  I had a yummy egg and cheese grinder with avocado and hot sauce... they also have breakfast flatbreads.  For lunch I had a delicious vegan wrap with a very tasty cole slaw that had apples and raisins in it (so good!). There are salads and pastas galore, reasonably priced.  Chicago Coffee was very average.  Chicago Grind is superb!

20.description: The food is decent, even though the price is $$ and not $.  However, I didn't try the waffles.

36.description: Major step up from the previous incarnation. The new owners classed up the furniture, and when I was in for dinner, there was sweet 90s rock playing in the background. Fast, free wi-fi. Had the Joe Lombardi (best sandwich I've had in a while--they brought over the fresh ingredients and delicious bread from PIzzeria Aroma down the street; same ownership, I believe?) and a mint tea. Ben and the other guy behind the counter were very nice and welcoming. Overall great coffee shop!

14.description: Great assortment of pastries and beverages and sandwiches and salads-you get the point The prices are good and the food is tasty. There's seating, a restroom and the place has a good vibe and great playlist in the background. The staff is pretty friendly as well.

3.description: My daughter and I moved to the neighborhood 3 weeks ago and decided to go out exploring our new stores and so we wandered into our local Payless.  Within 3 minutes, we were approached by  the manager who wasn't wearing a nametag and proceeded to tell us we were in the men's section.  Yes...we know that since we often purchase men's shoes to accommodate our size 13-14 women's feet.  In a span of ten minutes she told us we didn't know what we were talking about when we said we had a hard time finding our size in women's, that we must not have checked recently, that she knows the store on State street has our size because she used to be the manager there, and on and on and on.  Needless to say, we were not soliciting this conversation.  She was so argumentative in her own head, out loud, at us and it was just strange.  I just wondered why she wouldn't leave us alone.  My daughter and I don't engage with negative people and she was just overboard.  The poor sales associate seemed like his hands were literally tied because he didn't step in to make her leave us alone.  My daughter happened to look up and see a box with size 13 women's shoes so she reached up to get it and you'd think we had just held the place up the way she reacted.  Evidently, you are not allowed to touch the boxes on the shelf even when they are at your eye level.  Ok. I understand that we are worried about liability but why be so awful about it?  It was just a strange place and I still don't get it.  When I asked for another box we wanted to look at, she jumped all over me again with verbal attacks saying not to touch the shelf.  I was pointing to the box.  Oh my goodness.  This was seriously a case of someone who did not want us in that Payless location.  My daughter ran out in tears.  I went after her then , after calming her down, I went back in to purchase the 2 pairs of shoes I was allowed to look at in peace.  This manager continued to throw mean words my way and told me I could call 1-800-payless to complain. In all of this, I never lost my composure and I am pleased to say this will not deter me from shopping where I choose.  I will not be bullied because there was something about my daughter and I she didn't like.  I suspect it was because I was biracial and my daughter's skin is white.  Both the manager the sales associated were black.  it's possible she doesn't like race mixing?  I don't know.  I'm just trying to create reason out of crazy.  Too bad to have this person working at that store because it is the only one in the immediate neighborhood.

1.description: UPDATE!!!! For all of you who have complained about the same exact RUDE manager, her name is DOLLY!!!! I  TRIED this place again, since it's the closest location to me. But I have been avoiding it for a very long time & going to a different location. (Btw, the location in Lincoln Square, has nice employees. No one has ever been rude to me there) Anyway, I went back hoping the horribly rude manager no longer worked there & sadly she still does. Which is surprising because I do not understand how someone can be a manager & treat customers with so much disrespect and for so long. My first review was 2 yrs ago & she is obviously still there being mean AND I HAVE complained before. So my guess is Payless just doesn't care. Which is sad! Have you read all of these reviews, about the same issue w/ the same manager???For everyone that is a good person & doesn't deserve to be treated this way, who no longer shops there because of this manager, call: 877-474-6379I just called & spoke w/ a representative. My assumption is that nothing will be changed :( Considering this isn't my first time calling. Hopefully I am wrong & the district manager will no longer allow her or anyone other employees to work there, if they can't be nice to their customers.Yelling, mean, rude, unfriendly, talks down to you, disrespectful. I can go on & on. Just read all of these reviews. How can she still work there & get away w/ this treatment? Let's just hope that my call will actually go through to the district manager, & something will be done.The number I called was: 877-474-6379Hope you guys don't have to be treated this way anymore.

2.description: I wonder if the same manager works here that is mentioned in other reviews. Ughhh... terrible experience. First, I wanted to try shoes on, but there was an employee literally a few feet from me stacking and re-organizing boxes, so I couldn't look around at the shoes in my size. There was a cart on my right too that was making me feel claustrophobic. I was getting stressed out by all of the noise that was being made from the boxes, so I went to the next aisle to try on my shoes. I mean, it was stressful, I didn't like the noise and feeling claustrophobic, but that wasn't the worst part. The girl who I think was the manager was worse. I needed to do a return and wasn't sure if I wanted a few pairs of shoes to exchange them for or not. The manager was going to take them, and I said I wasn't sure if I wanted them yet. She proceeded to take them anyway. I asked for them back, saying I wasn't sure if I wanted them (she didn't think I wanted them), I just wanted to see how much they rang up for first. She looked at me like I was crazy and when I reached for the shoes to take them back she WOULD NOT let go of the box. Ugh. Fine, if you insist on taking them maybe I won't buy them. I can get cheaper prices online anyway.

9.description: I agree with Nannette's review.  This place has an awesome staff and is very clean and well organized.My piece of Flair I'd like to add is that I found the cutest pair of rain boots here.  They are black with different colored polka dots on them and match my umbrella which has the same design but I bought long before I purchased the boots...cheers to payless for having great taste for a lot less then most shoe stores!

10.description: This store has a great selection of shoes at a good price. Yay bogo! The staff always greets you and helps you find sizes. Very organized and clean store. I've also had shoes/purses shipped here (for free!!) and that has been a very easy process. They even let you try them on and return them right away. I'll be back!

4.description: I logged into yelp only to let you kow how mean the manager lady was...she was mean ... ..like all reviewers mentioned the same shit about her..she told she answered my question 10 thousasnd times while i spoke to her for the first time ..mean mean...im looking forward to give a written complain to the payless franchiseabout the shoes quality im not sure as i  have yet to use it...but for the price you pay i guess thats all you can expect ...its really reasonably priced...i would visit the store again but will surely avoid the mean manager lady

6.description: I really love Payless. They have really gotten some great quality shoes, that are surprisingly stylish and affordable, over the years. I remember when all they had was a lot of plastic athletic wear. But things have changed!To my horror, I now wear a sz. 11, so it is hard to find shoes. But this store seems to have a decent selection. I need a 12 in a boot, which they often have, as well. Dolly is, well, a "doll." She's so nice -- and helpful. I always enjoy seeing her when I stop in. They get new shoes in all the time, so it is fun to see what they have in my size. The other day, I bought a short boot on sale. I noticed that the markdown did not occur on the receipt when I got home. Thinking I'd really blown it, leaving the box behind, I called the store to explain what happened. Dolly knew exactly what I was talking about -- saying that the register was not recognizing prices properly. Whew! She then said I could come in and get it adjusted, and get a little bonus for my trouble.I really consider this kind of customer service extraordinary -- given that this is a discount shoe chain. The selection, location and staff at this store make it one of my favorites! I also like that there is a nearby Dollar Tree, Dots, Pay Half, Jewel and a few other nearby stores, in this convenient strip mall. It's right off the 36 Broadway bus at Berwyn - and also a Red Line stop.

11.description: This is a great Payless store and I have had nothing but the BEST experience with the staff, who are friendly and helpful and will give you coupons for your next purchase just for coming in. The store is clean and organized well. 5 stars for the great staff. For real. These people aren't like the typical employees of large chains that just don't give a crap. Every sales person has always been friendly and polite, and you can tell that they actually enjoy their jobs and that they actually "get" what it means to be in customer service. They like people!!!! The shoes that Payless has right now are really cute also. I bought a pair of black pumps for $20 and not only do they look very high end designer-esque, but they are actually comfortable and I wore them at work, running around all night long on both Friday and Saturday night. I also got a ton of compliments on them and I told people that they were from Payless, which they couldn't believe! My only complaint is that they rarely have enough of the really cute "new" shoes in my size. But, a big compliment to Payless in general for carrying shoes in W (wide foot) for those of us that can't fit our peds in slender tiny pointy toe shoes! Also, they have really cute hats and purses that are on sale for $10. I bought two already, and again, have received many compliments on them. You can't beat this store.

5.description: The manager lady is just loud, awful and mean. I will not shop here because of her

7.description: I've been coming here for nearly 15 years - decent - not great - shoes, reasonable prices.  Unfortunately, the latest manager ruins it all by being  - there is no delicate way to put this - an asshole. I tried on a pair of shoes, with my BLACK socks on.  Asked one of the salespeople if they had it in an eight and a half (I had tried on the eight).  She took the one shoe and said she'd go look.  As I waited, I walked around the corner of the aisles up to the display area, with one shoe on, mind you, and just looked at stuff.  The manager came up to ask me not to walk on the stone part of the shoe and started going on about "our sensors will go off" and pointed at some strange stuff on the floor.  When I asked her what they were, her Bond 007 response was, "Well, we're not going to tell you what they are, because that's for us to know.  And you can't walk and certainly not barefoot." And all this with a cluck-cluck head-shake.  When I pointed out that my BLACK-sock-clad foot (in other words, no mistaking that I had a sock on) was hardly barefoot, she just laughed and shook her head with a look that said, "Oh, the things I have to put up with."She was also pretty rude to other customers in the store, constantly yelling at the kids  (whose parents were nearby) to get away.  It's possible she knew them, who knows, but the whole place just stank of unprofessionalism and it's unpleasant to shop while managers yell at other customers (and I'm actually sympathetic to staff who have to deal with kids).I get that retail is really, really tough and that some days you just might want to tear off the heads of customers.  But don't go making up incoherent shit about your bloody sensors that you can't even explain - especially since I've been walking with shoes on your precious floor for over a decade - and don't be a bloody asshole to customers by pretending you work for the CIA. Not returning to this store until there's a new manager - it's one thing to be stressed, it's quite another to be a jerk.  Guess what?  There's a Target store in the neighbourhood now.  Same prices, better selection.As everyone else here has said, their staff's actually really good, in general.  This is the first staff person who's been a jerk.

8.description: I haven't been to a Payless in years and was pleasantly surprised with my experience today upon entering Dominique greeted me with a smile and showed me to the section where my size was I needed some rock inspired boots and Michellee was quick to find the perfect pair .. I can't wait to need a new pair

0.description: How can you be either really excited or really down on Payless. It is exactly what it sounds like. You payless, you get less. Need work shoes? Go here. They are not going to be extremely comfortable. But the staff is nice and the store is clean. They are helpful, organized, and genuine at this store. I really wish they offered a slightly better product.

58.description: I was referred here by my vegetarian friends who believe this to be the  best place to get produce. They had a very diverse collection of fruits and vegetables and they were of good quality. I spent significantly less on produce that I normally do when shopping at a commercial grocery store. I have used most of the produce that I purchased and it was all very fresh and I think in the future I will be getting my produce here where not only is it cheaper but arguably fresher.

56.description: Great small market with great low prices. Much has been said - so I'll just say I really love their store brand mild salsa.

29.description: Our new favorite neighborhood grocery store.We tried out Edgewater Produce shortly after moving to Andersonville a few months ago, and were amazed to learn upon checking out that our weekly groceries totaled just $50. Produce, meat, yogurt, eggs, bulk items like raisins and almonds -- everything we have tried has been high in quality and reasonably priced. Of the basic grocery items we typically buy, the only things that are harder to find at EP are whole coffee beans (I think they only carry one or two local brands and they are pretty pricey) and seafood.

42.description: Great produce, unpretentious and wonderful prices! I wish I had one of these in my town, I would go there all the time.

23.description: YES!  If you don't shop here then you are a sad bird.

47.description: Great produce and meat at reasonable prices. Much better than rip off Jewel across the street.

8.description: The people at Edgewater produce have a really strong sense of our neighborhood and are very aware and attentive to their customers needs. They have great prices and a deceivingly large selection - given how small the store is. Thanks for being in business!

31.description: I love this place! I will continue to return here weekly for fresh and organic meat and produce. I was able to get a lot more for my money.The avocados are HUGE! The limes are amazing. The watermelon is to die for! Also, Patrick, the manager, was very kind. Excellent customer service. I would not hesitate to check this place out. What are you waiting for?!

34.description: Awesome neighborhood grocer! Surprising what they pack into that little space.  Weisswurst and coconut flakes were on my list this week (don't ask) and I figured no chance, but they had both.  And, as others have mentioned, the produce is excellent and their meat selection too.  Especially when you compare it to the truly awful selection across the street.  Love this place.

16.description: I consider this place a hidden gem. It's full of great produce and some other specialty items i didn't think they would have ( black quinoa, chia seeds, spinach pasta, etc) and the prices are AMAZING. 69 cents for a bunch of kale?! I'm in love.

13.description: Great produce market! Better prices! The Andersonville way is to start here, then finish up at Jewel (across the street). The dairy and eggs section here is a little pricey (hence step 2 of the Andersonville way)...lol.

11.description: My daughter just moved to Chicago last week, found this place, and loves it!  She is planning to make it her main grocery store

39.description: This is a great little place to buy your food in Edgewater. Across the street is a Jewel Osco. But if you don't want to give your $$$ to the corporate fat cats - go here.  They have a nice section of fresh fruit /veggies and spices. The size of the store is no bigger than the cake/deli area at Jewel but you get a pretty good bargain. I had about 1/3 of my cart full - cost $30. Since I'm more of a Jewel person - I was taken back by the freshness of the meat - like it was too fresh :( I got the pork and started cooking it - YIKES - it smelled dead. I know you're like - duh...but seriously I buy meat from big corporate supermarkets and they put dyes in it and do something to hide the deadness of the meat  so it doesn't smell bad when you cook it. It probaby give us all cancer ... but maybe I'm just not cut out to get the real deal. Natural slaughted pork- is just gross - give me the fake stuff Good luck!

37.description: The best place to get meat and produce this far north.I used to go out of my way to grocery shop at Stanley's on North/Elston. This place is equally as good. I bike two miles to get here because they have way better produce than a supermarket, and usually for much cheaper.Meat is really inexpensive here, and the deli guys work pretty fast. They also have a great selection of bulk-store nuts, candy, wasabi peas, etc.Watch out for prices on toiletries and other stuff; sometimes they're more expensive than at the supermarket.

0.description: This place rocks.  While they dont have the square footage that their sister store "Harvest Time "has in Lincoln Square, they have an ample selection of items .   Their prices on produce are almost always lower then the Jewel across the street, and the quality is far superior.  The deli has a varied selection of Boar's Head, as well as some bulk smoked items such as bacon and pork chops.  Decent selection of cheeses from the usual suspects to 5-6 varieties of feta.  Small selection of  both domestic and imported grocery items, bulk nuts & fruits, and a packaged meat caseThe best part of Edgewater Produce is the staff.  This is the little neighborhood store where everyone from the management to the shelf stockers and cashiers treat you like you're part of the family . I'm really glad they are in my hood.

38.description: A much better product and price than the Jewel across the street! If you want to help out the local business, your pocket book and still get Terrific produce! This is where to stop.

51.description: I miss good produce. Growing up in California spoiled me rotten (or not rotten as the case may be) in regards to cheap, fresh produce that tastes as if it's just been plucked from the vine/ground/tree/stalk/whatever. So I am inordinately pleased to discover a produce store (within walking distance) that stocks cheap, fresh, tasty produce. And let's not even discuss how much cheaper a good avocado is here than it is anywhere else in the city. My only qualm is that their serrano chiles are severely lacking in spice (when will we ever learn that when it comes to chiles, smaller is almost ALWAYS better) but that's a grievance I hold with nearly every produce store in this city (La Casa del Pueblo in Pilsen being the only exception thus far). And when I stupidly left my wallet at home on a recent excursion, they very nicely held my bag of groceries for me while I ran home to retrieve it.

27.description: I'm a fan, but Edgewater Produce is less of a bargain lately. Everything other than produce seems to be cheaper across the street at Jewel. Jewel's produce has gone into the toilet, though, so this place is even more of a must-go-to. Wish they were open later!

32.description: I used to be a frequent Edgewater Produce shopper, but have since switched to Harvest Time for their location near my work and doctor. I actually think they are owned by the same company because I have seen things with Edgewater Produce stickers on them at Harvest Time.I stopped by last night to pick up a few things for my juice cleanse. Last time I did the cleanse, I got my produce from Harvest Time and it ran me about $55 for 5 days.  This time, the same amount of days ran me a little over $25 at Edgewater Produce. Here's what I got:10 big granny smith apples :: $6.243 loose beets :: $0.42A huge piece of ginger :: $1.522 celery stalks :: $2.384 cucumbers :: $2.64A bunch of mint :: $1.98A bag of carrots :: $0.695 lemons :: $2.005 limes :: $1.004 bunches of spinach :: $3.92A bunch of basil :: $1.99Some of the prices are high for the winter months (i.e limes are usually 10/$1 in the summer) but none of the items I got were on special. I guarantee you I would spend double or triple if I picked up this stuff at Dominick's or Jewel. I do get annoyed at how small EP is and how narrow the registers are. I have gotten meat from here before and it was decent and their spice rack is actually extremely impressive. Downsides: not a huge grocery or dairy section and the cashiers are lazy.

54.description: The produce is amazing, but they also have wonderful roasted chicken, speciality meats, and house-made guacamole.  The lines move quickly.

48.description: Love, love love my weekend routine that involves coming here.I can't get enough fruit; and EP satisfies my need! 8/10 times their fruit is delicious, and when it's less than great, it's still edible.I recommend the apples, mangoes, and all things berry. Their veggies (bag of spinach, celery, peppers, and sweet potatoes) are really well priced and tasty! They carry Boars Head meats, although they're lacking in the organic/humanely raised section. To be fair, they don't claim to be about that, so I stick with amazing produce.Thanks to this place, they are several times when I eat nothing but fruit and skip the unhealthy nighttime snacks!Extra perk: practicing spanish by trying to figure out what the cashiers are saying!A tip: they don't advertise it anymore, but they will give you a quarter back if you pay at the meter and bring in the small perforated side of the paybox ticket.

44.description: Certain neighborhoods on the northside, especially within Lincoln Square and Andersonville, have very few Mexican supermercados.  Edgewater Produce is one of the few that exists and continues to carry great, fresh products at reasonable prices.  Prior to have a taco dinner party at my house, I come here and purchase their aracheras en la maquina (tenderized skirt steaks) and fajita-style chicken with vegetables from the butcher.  It tastes extremely authentic compared to anything I would find at Jewel or Dominicks.  If you need anything found in Mexico or Latin America, you will most likely find it here (Chocolate Caliente, Jarritos, tropical fruits, Mexican Coca Cola [in the glass bottle of course]).  Heck, the tortillas come directly from the factories still piping warm off the press.  If you're looking to purchase produce for your house, or have a fiesta, this is the place.  Keep in mind that common house products like toilet paper and even Suavitel are cheaper elsewhere.

24.description: Produce is freshest in the area. Service is nice and prices are amazing. Check out their website for weekly/biweekly sales. It's worth it.

7.description: My go to store for produce. They carry the best freshest vegetables you can find.  You can find a respectable amount of other grocery needs as well. Puts Jewel and Marianos and even Whole Foods to shame. Too bad they don't carry more organic!

49.description: i bought 2 bags of produce, and paid $56 for it.  most of it went completely bad within 3 days.  not my favorite way to waste money.

40.description: Edgewater Produce is great for so many reasons and I do my shopping here whenever possible.  With Jewel-Osco directly across the street and a Dominick's much closer to where I live, they have won my business despite not being the most convenient option.For starters, it's great that they're locally owned.  As it becomes mega-chain supermarkets increasingly become the norm, it feels wonderful to give some business to mom & pop.  On top of that, you really can't beat the prices.  As the name would suggest, their specialty is produce, and they can provide you with lots of it without breaking the bank.You can also find a number of ethnic (particularly hispanic) specialty items.  A few weeks ago, my girlfriend and I were hosting a dinner party and had a hefty list of ingredients to buy.  Edgewater Produce was my first stop, and I got a huge kick out of the fact that I could buy Epazote (a stick-like spice), but I couldn't find cocoa powder.All raving aside, however, I am disappointed by their lack of effort to include organic products in their selection.  I realize that their store is small and having competitive prices is essential to their business.  Yet the type of people who pass up a chain supermarket to shop local are more than likely also interested in organic and more ethical foods.  That is the only reason that this is not a five-star review.In the end, I am still a huge fan and prefer to do my shopping here.  Unless the Andersonville Farmer's Market is on, there is not better place for fresh produce in the area.

53.description: I absolutely love this grocery store!  The produce is always fresh and very reasonably priced.  Friendly staff.  I never spend more than 15-20 dollars and leave with a week's worth of fruits and vegetables (and I eat a lot of produce!)  Definitely get more bang for your buck and better quality than from the Jewel across the street.

30.description: great prices, great produce. much better than the stuff across the street at jewels. Also makes you feel great to support a unique local market.

46.description: This is the smaller and slightly less awesome cousin of Harvest Time. The produce selection here is way better than the Jewel across the street, and the prices are better too. This place actually seems to take some pride in selling fruits and vegetables that are fit for human consumption, unlike some places ... (can you tell I h8 that Jewel?). You get a lot of food for your $ here if you're buying primarily fruits and veggies. The deli counter has pricey (but quality) Boar's Head cheeses. If it's time for a fancy pants picnic, this is where you should go. The canned and packaged stuff at Edgewater is a bit over-priced and they don't have a great selection. Go here for your fresh fruits and veggies for sure. Consider braving Jewel for a better price on the packaged stuff.

1.description: No problem with the produce, but today they had a sale on pork shoulder.  Stopped in and there was one in the display case.  Unfortunately the wrapping was wrecked.  "Juice" all over the tray, and a huge part of the plastic wrapping was torn away leaving a spot about the size of a baseball open to the air.  This area was clearly dried out and discolored so it wasn't recent.I asked the meat counter attendant if they had other pork shoulders.  He said there was one in the case that was ready to buy.  I told him that there was a torn wrapper and it was exposed to the air.  He took that one out of the case and went to the back to "check for more."  Miraculously they had one.  Freshly wrapped, looking great, that was the exact same weight and price.  It also had a huge discolored spot clearly visible through the plastic that was the exact size AND shape of the spot on the roast I had JUST alerted him to.  Obviously, he lied and pretended to look for a new one and just rewrapped the bad one with no regard for sanitation.Ended up going to another store and paying more for the meat (almost double) but at least I know I'm getting a safe product.  Don't cut costs at the expense of food safety, Edgewater Produce!  You won't see me in there again for a very long time.

55.description: My friends have been telling me to check out Edgewater Produce for months now and I am housesitting two blocks away so I decided to go check it out.  WOW!  The fact that I can get 2 avocados for $1.50 when they are $2 each at Jewel is just amazing!!  The green peppers were twice as big and half the price as the ones at Jewel.  Yes it may be a tad small and there are certain things that you can not get here but I can get all of my basics here.  I loved it and although it is a few extra blocks for me from my place I will definitely be hitting this place up for all of my produce!  It blows my mind that more people do not shop here...

9.description: Lets be clear, I am appreciative of a cheap, local market in Andersonville. I want to support such businesses as much as I can, especially when it's a market that can keep me out of the dreaded Jewel (shudder). Unfortunately Edgewater Produce falls a bit short of expectations after living near Morse Market in Rogers Park for so many years. Morse Market is just better and I am spoiled.Edgewater Produce does have a nice selection of fresh, inexpensive produce but it's slightly lacking and their layout is sort of disorganized. I can get over the layout but what kind of market doesn't have fresh okra?? No honey crisp apples either, for shame. Their prices, while cheap, are noticeably more expensive than Morse Market, I'm specifically thinking of kale, mushrooms, cilantro. Their deli/meat counter I won't even touch. It smells and looks bad. I was digging through chicken once and each package of chicken was just sitting in pools and pools of blood, leaking through the saran wrap. Eek. Again, Morse Market's meat and deli counter is WAY better. For me, it's not even an option to buy meat at Edgewater after some of the stuff I've seen and that makes this market a lot less useful if I'm not even comfortable picking up some chicken breast here. So yes, I will continue to come here for veggies and fruit but always a little reluctantly, knowing there are better, cheaper markets to be had elsewhere.

26.description: Love! Awesome prices and great customer service. The quality of meat and produce at Edgewater is unbeatable. PS try the guacamole they make in house. SO GOOD!

25.description: This is one of my neighborhood grocery stores.  They have the cheapest dozen of eggs around.  Produce is also fresh and fairly priced here.  They take credit cards too which is great for people who don't carry cash.  They are much friendly here than at the asian grocery stores that give you lip about using plastic.

12.description: Great place to shop pick up some groceries, specially fresh vegetables and fruits. I wish there are more stores like this around Chicago. Also very helpful staff.

59.description: Compared with the Dominicks I live very close to, produce and fruit at Edgewater Produce are practically HALF THE PRICE and often better quality! It's well worth the walk to me! Love it!This listing says it's open till 7pm on Sundays but I just called and was told 9pm. Unfortunately, their own website does not list their hours but it will let you know the current specials.

21.description: I absolutely love this place!  It's about 1/8 of the size of large grocery story but you can get almost everything you need here for a fraction of the price!  Staff is friendly.  Produce is awesome!

17.description: This is one of my neighborhood grocery stores.  They have the cheapest dozen of eggs around.  Produce is also fresh and fairly priced here.  They take credit cards too which is great for people who don't carry cash.  They are much friendly here than at the asian grocery stores that give you lip about using plastic.

10.description: Excellent selection and quality of produce. Just as you might expect given their name. Given that produce is in their name, this is their specialty. You won't find much else beyond the basics. There's some specialty food which seems to be mostly Polish and Mexican fare. However the produce I purchased was excellent and will be returning here from now on for all produce needs.

5.description: Hallelujah!No, I'm not kidding.Halle-fucking-lujah!When I moved to Andersonville this month I knew that I would be leaving behind my beloved Cermak Produce in Humboldt Park.  What I didn't know is that I would find Edgewater Produce just a hop-skip from my new pad.I eat a lot of produce.  I work from home and love to cook, so my grocery bills can get extreme.  I need places like Edgewater Produce to give me both excellent fruit and veg, but also keep my bills to a minimum.The lines are long, but it's OK.  Just relax.  Take a deep breath and know those gorgeous, plump red peppers and fragrant onions are going to make a slamming accompaniment to your dinner.They also have a pretty great deli meat counter.  Boarshead has awful radio commercial, but tasty meats.

3.description: Reasonably priced and fresh produce. Meats are ok but way cheaper than the grocery store. Best part of all, found some if my favorite hispanic brands: Bimbo, Goya, etc. I know where I am going to find all the ingredients to make my mothers  beef sancocho!

35.description: THIS PLACE IS AMAZING!So cheap and perfect for living in the neighborhood! Staff isn't overly friendly, but I get over it and it's a tiny store so you won't have to spend much time to get great produce and get out of there :)

19.description: This place is great! Great produce and fresh food selection. Deli is good too. Sometimes their meat isn't the freshest and can turn fairly quickly after purchase.

28.description: Edgewater Produce has never let me down. They only stock the best, freshest produce in town and their prices are rock bottom cheap. Their fruit is always ripe and delicious and their herbs are fresh.They don't stock anything that didn't have a good crop, so if the quality wasn't there you might not find what you need that day. Their mangoes and avocados are the best. Not to mention their meat! Phenomenal prices on fresh meat that's extremely high quality. Don't waste your money at Jewel when you need some chicken - Edgewater is the place to go. Staff is always busy, but they'll take the time to point out what you need when you ask.

45.description: It's a bright spot in the neighborhood, for sure.  A bit pricey for the quality of the food but still generally cheaper than anything else around. Nice selection of produce and Mexican snacks, too.

33.description: This is a great local store that has far better prices for produce than the Jewel across the street.  However, for those of you looking for a northern version of Stanleys (amazing produce prices) this is not it!  There is more here than just produce, and the prices aren't reduced for quick sell the way that are at Stanley's

43.description: Love this grocery store!!  Great produce and an easy to maneuver store that doesn't advertise like crazy. I do 90% of my shopping here. The nuts and dried fruit mixes are a treat!

2.description: One of my favorite things to do is take a long stroll down Clark from my apartment through Andersonville, window shop, people watch, pet puppies, kiss babies, and carry non-disposable tote bags into Edgewater Produce to pick up one large cucumber, 3 lemons, 4 granny apples, a package of cherry tomatoes, and a bag of carrots, walk out roughly $10 lighter and repeat the long window-shopping/people-watching/puppy-petting/baby-kissing stroll back home.This is exactly why I love the 60640.And while I cannot get everything here that I can get at the larger grocers in the area, I can get the healthy things here, and that's all I should really be eating anyway.  Edgewater Produce, I luv you.

18.description: Love this place! The produce is fresh and cheap, and if you are a fan of Boar's Head meat and cheese, they always have an amazing sale on one of their products. This place is only really good for your fresh products, so sadly it's not a one stop shop for all your groceries. But the price beats Jewel hands down, so it is definitely worth making two stops for grocery shopping.

41.description: a bit small and not as clean as its big sister Harvest Time, but excellent competitively priced produce, salsas and fresh tortillas. Also rad  for bulk items like nuts, dried beans, seeds and canned tomatos. Much better prices than the JO and far more efficient way to shop. Not to mention- Edgewater staff  actually WANTS to help you - they are always restocking shelves, unlike Jewel where you get attitude, and backlash for basically being a customer...

52.description: Thank goodness I walk by this place before I head to Jewel as my wallet enjoys the diversion. They might not have everything I need but I sure can find most of what I do for a much much better price.I've been going to their other store, HarvesTime, for a while now but I'm starting to appreciate going to Edgewater since I live much closer to this location. I'm also starting to appreciate the lighter load on my wallet!

50.description: This place is very clean and well organized compared to some other low cost produce places I've been to. They have a good selection for the size of the store (hooray for not just having the bland apple trio of Granny Smiths, Red Delicious, and Golden Delicious!). For me, the thing that won me over was their cheap and very fresh heads of romaine lettuce that didn't force me to remove the first ten layers of wilted leaves. Sure, there's a Jewels across the street, but I doubt the produce would be this inexpensive or fresh.

4.description: Our first of what surely will be weekly visits. It's a great store very good prices and the produce is uber FRESH.  Its impeccable and far less than Whole Foods for better quality. It's a must!

6.description: I love this place, and it's so convenient for me to go here. They have pretty much everything you could need on a daily basis, as well as a selection of more ethnic food items. They also carry some really great baked goods and bagels.

22.description: The BEST produce, deli, and homemade items like salsas, guacamole, hot and spicy vegetable mix!  Very reasonable prices than any chain grocery store.  Cheeses, dairy items like sour cream, etc. just a couple bucks.  Spent $100 and walked out with more food that will feed for weeks!!  A must try for sure!!!

15.description: Salsa Ranchero Tortuga is out of this world!!  I just eat it with a spoon when I get home!Their guacamole is better than any other produce mart I've tried, in the city (I've tried many).  Produce is fresh. Cilantro smells like cilantro should and they have El Milagro flour tortillas!  They're a little higher priced on some things, than Devon Market, but not enough to notice.  GREAT PLACE!

57.description: The cheapest meat and produce around!
