20.description: Extremely inexpensive alternative to Jewels. What can go wrong?

36.description: This little market is just right...70% of it is fresh fruits, veggies, and other great stuff. I came here determined to find the perfect apples for my latest batch of apple crisp, and boy oh boy, did I find em! And nice root veggies for roasting and salads. They also do terrific rotisserie chickens, baked to perfection. I like that this place is small and when you shop here you bring home good stuff and cook it, instead of eating out at some crazy expensive eatery and then reviewing it. What's the point of that, right?

14.description: Edgewater Produce has never let me down. They only stock the best, freshest produce in town and their prices are rock bottom cheap. Their fruit is always ripe and delicious and their herbs are fresh.They don't stock anything that didn't have a good crop, so if the quality wasn't there you might not find what you need that day. Their mangoes and avocados are the best. Not to mention their meat! Phenomenal prices on fresh meat that's extremely high quality. Don't waste your money at Jewel when you need some chicken - Edgewater is the place to go. Staff is always busy, but they'll take the time to point out what you need when you ask.

28.description: I came here on a Thursday night with a girlfriend. I probably should have seen if they were on open table before showing up because when I got there at 7, there was a half hour wait. While waiting, we went next door to the bar where the bartender gave us some great advice about what to order. He said we had to order a bao and a taco. When we came back to the restaurant half an hour later, they still weren't ready to seat us.  The place was packed and it's a very small restaurant. We waited about five minutes and we were sat.  I ordered the green eyes and omg it was the best cocktail I've had in awhile. My friend got their version of the Moscow mule and then switched to the green eyes. You can also order the green eyes up and it's made with egg whites. To eat, we took the bartender's advice and ordered a bao and a taco.  I ordered the shrimp bao and the potato taco and they both were just amazing!  I just loved the bread they used in the bao- it was so fluffy.  We also ordered the brussels sprouts which were full of flavor!Overall, I loved the food and the cocktails.  However, they need a bigger space because they're just so busy!

1.description: Holy crap!  I was not expecting this. Per the reviews I knew it would likely be good, but this was insanely good.Awesome drink list (per my husband). For food, we had:A grilled romaine salad - huge and very fillingGuacamole and chips - chips were yummy by themselves. Guac and salsa were delicious and fresh.Wolf Burger - Husband loved it. Could only fit half in his belly and took the other half home.Side of Mac and Cheese - OMG! OMG! OMG!Fish Bao - OrgasmicElotes - Even more orgasmic and one of the most delicious sides of food I have ever eaten.This is by far the best restaurant in Andersonville and that is saying a lot because there is some heavy competition just up the road.I miss you, LBW!  See you soon!P.S. Pay the guys in the kitchen whatever is necessary to keep them there forever.

39.description: YES. Everything about this is YES.Decor. I love the chill, loungy feel. I love the edison lights, the big bar, and small, cozy atmosphere.Service. The people are awesome here. They aren't afraid to give a beer sample or food suggestion. Just nice, real, down to earth people.Food. The diversity of food here is crazy. My usual rule of "pick one and do it well" does not apply here. They have tacos, burgers, fries, mussels, baos. Yes. All of them. We ordered the mac and cheese, fries, and mussels to share. All of them were SO good. I would eat it all again.Drink. BEER. If you love beer, you will love their menu. So many drafts and bottles to choose from. Not your regular stuff either. You can also order wine and cocktails...but seriously...the beer. I tried a few that I had never heard of before, all very good.So basically you need to come here. And eat. And drink. Because it's good.

9.description: I love you, Little Bad Wolf. You've made the awkward strip of Bryn Mawr so much more delicious. If you were a person, I'd kiss you.Seriously, go to Little Bad Wolf. Their tacos and bao are amazing: I usually get the fish and steak tacos and a cocktail - doesn't get any better than that. And while we're at it - a place in Edgewater that has Pappy Van Winkle? Yes please! I only wish they were bigger so you didn't have to wait so long to get a table.

29.description: I have been meaning to come here for a while, and finally went today. The place was much smaller than I expected it to be, and it was pretty crowded for a Sunday night. The music was also pretty loud, which made it hard to socialize with the people I was with. Luckily, the wait was only ten minutes. The service and food were great. However, I wish the waiter would have told us that the portions are huge. I was with three other people and we had to get to-go boxes for most of the food. The baos and mac and cheese are delicious.

23.description: First, great welcoming staff and bartenders. And, great port taco along with the fries. Will make sure to return, great place to hang out!

5.description: I figured my first review in 2016 should be for this little gem. What a great place! The food, the drinks, the atmosphere and the people. Everything is top notch. Yes, it's a bit tiny, not a lot of seating. But it's really not an issue if you know that ahead of time and plan accordingly. Definitely get one of their cocktails. I don't remember which one I ordered but it was delicious. Also, the bao's and tacos are a must. Shrimp, steak, chicken, all amazing! So that's it! Make this one of your "musts" this year :)

31.description: Little bad wolf has the makings of a 5 star restaurant, besides one thing: the food.  We tried basically every Boa and Taco on their menu along with their Mac and cheese after reading other Yelp reviews, and they were all good, but none left a lasting impression. I felt the tacos/ baos were light on sauce and most were very dry and bland. The one exception to this review is the elotes corn. Go here and order this now! Might be the best I've ever had; creamy, buttery, and it comes with deep fried avocado on top. With that being said I loved the atmosphere, friendly service and extensive beer/ cocktail menu. I would go back for drinks and apps but probably not for their baos/ tacos.

25.description: This was a cool, laid-back kind of place to get some good eats. I enjoyed a grilled romaine salad, but be warned, if you don't like the taste of balsamic, the sauce/vinegar they use to get the char on the romaine is strong in flavor, despite what your server might tell you. My husband got a burger after hearing of the many fantastic reviews, but he/we found it to be just a little drier than we expected. The couple we went with loved their burgers and the choice to get a side salad instead of fries. The fries my husband were disappointing; they were lukewarm at best and very limp. The very best part of Little Bad Wolf is the awesome soundtrack of oldies they play. (Well, at least they were playing the afternoon we had lunch.) I get to eat lunch while enjoying the talents of Diana Ross, Stevie Wonder, and the like? AMAZING.

12.description: The place is pretty dim lit and the music is pretty loud which can be annoying because everyone else dining there ends up speaking louder too so you end up screaming at your friends. They unfortunately don't take reservations so be prepared to wait! On a friday night for 2 people, i ended up waiting about 40ish minutes for a table. Let me start of by saying my friend and I definitely over ordered so definitely do not feel compelled to order as much as we did LOLWe got:Mussels - come in a green curry coconut broth and is served with bread. Probably one of the top 3 mussels i've ever had. The broth was absolutely deliciousssss. I was using my spoon and drinking the remaining broth cause it was that good! Elotes- sooooo goood!! The corn was sweet full of flavor and the beer battered avocado was soo good. The avocado wasnt mushy on the inside as I would have expected. mac & cheese- I had high hopes for this since the reviews raved about it but I wasn't too impressed. Tasted like regular mac and cheese to me. Nothing really stood out.Japanese BBQ Pork Bao- This was good! The pork was tender and had a crispy layer of skin which gave the boa that extra crunch. The bun was so light and fluffy.Steak-Shitake Bao- the meat tasted gooood but im not the biggest steak lover because i like my meat really tender but the flavor was definitely there.Fish taco- definitely my favorite! The fish had a crispy batter that wasn't overfried or soggy. Shrimp Taco- definitely did not skimp out on the shrimp! If you like seafood, you'll definitely like this.  pork al pastor taco- comes with jalapano and pineapple which definitely helped amplify the flavor. This was my second last taco so by then it was kinda cold but the taste wasnt as great as I was expecting but I think that is just because it got cold :( Lastly we got the steak taco- once again, wasn't too crazy about it because it is steak and this was my last taco so the meal was kinda cold and the taco shell had hardened. Overall the meal came out to around $30 per person after tip and tax which isn't too bad considering all the food we got. My biggest recommendation is to definitely get the mussels, fish taco and elotes!

37.description: Mac and cheese is great, as are the mussels. Dishes seem needlessly heavy and greasy, even their white fish. Good ambiance and service. Will probably return.

21.description: LOVED the music:  The Fugees, Alisha Keys, Michael Jackson, Bobby Brown, Bruno Mars.  I was dancing/singing along as I ate!  Two baos and a side was more than enough for dinner.  I had the shrimp and the chicken bao - shrimp was better.  I also had a side of mac & cheese - loved the bacon bits.  For drinks I had the Green Eyes (no longer on the menu but you can ask) and the Duchess - so good.  I had to bring it down a star because they had no dessert!  Great little place with great service.

16.description: Everything about this place makes me happy and want to come back. Their cocktails are on point and their food is incredible. Their burger is literally one of the best burgers in the city, on par with Au Cheval. Seriously It is a MUST! Pair with the mashed potatoes with bacon gravy! The shrimp and steak baos were also great but I dream about this burger!

17.description: Very, VERY crowded on a Saturday night! They don't take reservations, so expect to wait. We got there at about 6:45 and waited maybe 15-20 minutes, which is not that bad considering how tiny and cramped the space is. For food, we got the chicken and shrimp baos, which were pretty delicious. I liked the chicken better, it was a bit spicy and had a Thai-style taste to it. I could barely finish 2 baos, they were pretty filling.The noise level here is out of control. I could barely hear my friend across the table. Don't think I would come back on that basis alone.

10.description: Cool little spot in Andersonville. The heart of the menu and the best things they have are the little tacos and steamed bao bun sandwiches. It's a weird combo, but both were awesome. They also had a nice beer list, this place really surprised me in a good way!Crab cake - BSalad - BPork taco - A-Shrimp taco - AShrimp bao bun - A

11.description: It was my first here and I have mixed feelings. The food was delicious! We had the tacos, elotes, and bao buns. I highly recommend the elotes as an appetizer. It's like the ones you get from the Mexican carts on the streets of Chicago, but a little bit more refined. The tacos were also so amazing. The shrimp was probably the best one out of all of them. The bao buns were not for me, but my boyfriend loved it. The only downside of this place the ambience. It was really really loud. Granted it was partly a bar. But I couldn't even hear my boyfriend speak across the table. And because the tables are so close to each other, I felt like I was listening to the next table's conversation. Because it was so loud, it was super difficult to get the waiter's attention. I even screamed my waiter a few times, but he couldn't hear me. Maybe if they lowered the music volume a few notches would be helpful for a better experience. Other than that, the food was delicious!!

26.description: Do yourself a favor and order the corn! Plus Bao and tacos All. Day. Long. So good! Also, when I was there the Fugees' version of Killing Me Softly started playing and- I'm not kidding-  the whole bar started singing. Not obnoxiously- magically.

27.description: They aren't kidding when they say on here "Not Good for Kids" -- Not realizing this, we came here with our one year old on a Wednesday evening. We were seated at a booth and only realized after some time that they didn't have a booster seat or high chair to offer us. At that point we had ordered drinks & committed to just improvising in holding her and making sure she didn't slip off. Certainly a nice place to meet with friends or have a date night. The food was well worth coming back. Took stars away because we totally felt like we were being rushed & targeted by servers for having a kid and taking up prime corner seating because of her when a larger group was waiting to be seated at our spot.

35.description: I figured my first review in 2016 should be for this little gem. What a great place! The food, the drinks, the atmosphere and the people. Everything is top notch. Yes, it's a bit tiny, not a lot of seating. But it's really not an issue if you know that ahead of time and plan accordingly. Definitely get one of their cocktails. I don't remember which one I ordered but it was delicious. Also, the bao's and tacos are a must. Shrimp, steak, chicken, all amazing! So that's it! Make this one of your "musts" this year :)

8.description: We loved our experience! First and foremost, the server was wonderful! Even though we were at a corner of the bar, he was extremely attentive to our needs and made sure we were taken care of with kindness.Secondly, the food was great! We started out with the chips, Guac and salsa and really enjoyed ourselves. The hot salsa was scrumptious! The mild was too bland.I ate three different baos while my partner had two tacos and a baos. My favorites were the pork and steak baos, but the shrimp baos was wonderful, too! My partner loved his food! And we were stuffed! The menu looked absolutely delicious and we can't wait to go back and try more! Not to mention the extensive drink list! Yes please!And to top it all off, the atmosphere was totally rad. We got there early and had no trouble finding a seat, but people started to have to wait around peak dinner time. This is a must try!

0.description: LBW is sooooo on point every time. From the Mac and cheese, to the baos, and the burgers with onion strings on top. Not to mention the drinks! I love their Moscow mule. It's a small spot so make sure you go early if you don't want to wait too long to get a table. Parking: There's a lot in the back where they have the LBW logo painted on the wall but it's NOT their parking lot. They told us that the employees park there anyways because Jewel has been ok with it so far- so be careful! Parking is pretty easy to find but it also depends on the time. Regardless, I highly recommend trying LBW to everyone

38.description: Super quaint and cool space, excellent service and great food! nuff said.

20.description: What a gem. Great food, servers, and bartenders. The host didn't explain their seating very well but the 10/10 old fashioned made up for it.  If only the price point was a tiny bit less  per item, this would be a 5 star rating.

19.description: Came here with my bf after seeing something on Eater Chicago. I got two tacos (the fish and chicken) and the pork bao. The pork bao was the highlight of the show and something I would definitely come back for. Take a pass on the chicken taco (I didn't find it very flavorful) but the fish taco was great (I couldn't believe how big the piece of fried fish was!) especially with some hot sauce thrown on. Unfortunately, the bartender (who was "taking care" of us) was less than stellar. His whole demeanor made us feel like serving us was an inconvenience. He didnt offer to explain any of the menu, or ask if we had any questions. He didn't ask to refill our water glasses nor ask how my bf wanted his burger cooked or what side he wanted. After getting our food he didn't check in on how we liked our meal. It just seemed like he was entirely absent. It was very disappointing.Would I come back? Yes. Would I sit at the bar? No. I'll opt for a table instead. 4.5 stars for the food, and 2 stars for the service.

33.description: It's noisy.  Some tables are shared which I think is fun- if you don't, you might have to wait.  Staff is fun, drinks are great (cocktails, huge beer list, lots of ciders, great gourmet small-batch booze etc).  The FOOD is fabulous. The bao are a different shape than you're probably used to and are smallish but great. Best is the grilled romaine salad with chicken.  Friends loved Mac and cheese. Everything was great.  Some things are a little spicy so if you don't like that talk to your server (I found everything just great).  And get elote (corn with crumble of cheese) and the green eyes cocktail.

2.description: Really great ambience, service, and best of all, drinks and food!! Definitely give this place a try!My group of 4 came in on a Thursday night around 7:30 and were told that there would be a 25 minute wait. That was no problem at all, because they have a full bar with specialty cocktails, draft beers, wines, it was extensive!We ordered the Black Chocolate Stout, Sofie, and the Hibernation Ale. The Stout paired well with the chocolate notes and made more a more smooth sip. The Hibernation Ale had a lot of delicious and deep hops flavor. The Sofie was a much lighter drink and great for anyone starting out with draft beer.For starters, we ordered a pound of the Fried Jumbo Shrimp, as we were told the 1/2 pound would come with 5-6 pieces of shrimp depending on their size. The Pound of shrimp was a good call as the 4 of us each got a good helping to it and the ketchup and radish sauce that accompanied it-super yummy and fried to perfection! For entrees, we ordered 4 of the Baos: Pork Shoulder, Shrimp, Steak, and Fish! The best was the Pork Shoulder, because of the slightly sweeter BBQ sauce. The Shrimp and Fish Baos were a bit on the dry side. The Steak was good but nothing surprising. We also ordered a side of elotes, and were delightfully surprised by the portion size. The dish was perfectly seasoned with some spice to give it a kick that makes you want more and the cheese mixed and sprinkled on top just makes every bite all the more savory. We will definitely be back to try the burgers!

34.description: The fries are really really good, and are what keep us coming back for more. The service is great - we were told a 20 minute wait which turned into 45, but we received a complimentary appetizer for our troubles, which was delicious. We went back for the bao sandwiches, and the burgers are fantastic.A++

32.description: Amazing bar ! I am a vegetarian and I always struggle for good veg food especially in bars.. LBW have couple of good options for vegetarians. I had Mac and cheese, potato tacos and veg baos.. All the three items I ordered were delicious and filling. I would definitely like to go to this place again.

18.description: Delicious & memorable food & drinks! The space is small & loud.  The hubs asked them to lower the volume and they did immediately!Bao.  There was a theme from our party of 6 that the meat ones were better than the fish/seafood options.  Loved the chicken & pork bao! Found them to be tasty & innovativeTacos.  Everyone loved the fish, steak & potato.  The guac was creamy yumminess. So much that we had to order another order of guac!The mussels in a creamy coconut broth was to die for! One of our friend had never had mussels before and fell in love! The mule drink was well made and served perfectly.  We will be back.   Probably on a weekday when it's not so crowded.  They don't take reservations so be prepared to wait on a weekend as we went at 7pm on a Saturday...prime time wait was 45 min!

13.description: YES. Everything about this is YES.Decor. I love the chill, loungy feel. I love the edison lights, the big bar, and small, cozy atmosphere.Service. The people are awesome here. They aren't afraid to give a beer sample or food suggestion. Just nice, real, down to earth people.Food. The diversity of food here is crazy. My usual rule of "pick one and do it well" does not apply here. They have tacos, burgers, fries, mussels, baos. Yes. All of them. We ordered the mac and cheese, fries, and mussels to share. All of them were SO good. I would eat it all again.Drink. BEER. If you love beer, you will love their menu. So many drafts and bottles to choose from. Not your regular stuff either. You can also order wine and cocktails...but seriously...the beer. I tried a few that I had never heard of before, all very good.So basically you need to come here. And eat. And drink. Because it's good.

4.description: They got Burgers, Tacos, Boas, and a large Craft beer list, this place already won me over. When I went to visit a buddy of mine, and she suggested we come here for lunch I was excited. It was a place that I had bookmarked to try for a while. The place is low key, not that big, infact the seating inside is a little awkward. Wish the place was bigger. We started with elotes which were amazing, some of the best I have ever had. Then we got a variety of boas and tacos. My fav was the pork boa, and steak taco! Heard the Mac n Cheese n Burgers here are great as well, will deff be coming back.

24.description: Mybe more like 3.5 stars.  The baos and burger are good.  With all the burger and bao places in Chicago, nothing to separate themselves from the pack.  A little pricey.  But I think if the food was a buck or two less we would go more often.

6.description: This place is a great combination of style and substance. They have a cool atmosphere/decor, tasty food, and a superb drink list. My first visit was 5 stars, my second visit was 4, mainly due to the service (service was excellent on my first visit). Despite the slower, less friendly service on my second visit, I'm a fan of this place. I've been for dinner and lunch.They have an extensive whiskey and beer list along with some fantastic cocktails. I had their barrel-aged manhattan and my cousin got their sazerac. Both were excellent. We did beer after and enjoyed those as well. For food, you can't go wrong with their sliders, any of the baos (especially the pork one), and their french fries are really good. Their mac n cheese is solid and while their tacos definitely aren't bad, I'd highly suggest their baos over their tacos.I'm glad I've come across this place and that it's walking distance from my brother's apartment. I'll be back for sure on future Chi visits.

22.description: The Bad Burger is just soooo ironically good. That and the chips with salsa + guac were both the best I've had in a long time. Get them. Everything is great here, though the waiter scared the crap out of me by coming up behind and very loudly asking if we were doing OK. Yep, doing great, please don't hurt me. Tip: this place isn't huge so get a reservation if you go on Saturday. Otherwise wait is only 15 min at the bar. They also have games!

15.description: I came here on a Thursday night with a girlfriend. I probably should have seen if they were on open table before showing up because when I got there at 7, there was a half hour wait. While waiting, we went next door to the bar where the bartender gave us some great advice about what to order. He said we had to order a bao and a taco. When we came back to the restaurant half an hour later, they still weren't ready to seat us.  The place was packed and it's a very small restaurant. We waited about five minutes and we were sat.  I ordered the green eyes and omg it was the best cocktail I've had in awhile. My friend got their version of the Moscow mule and then switched to the green eyes. You can also order the green eyes up and it's made with egg whites. To eat, we took the bartender's advice and ordered a bao and a taco.  I ordered the shrimp bao and the potato taco and they both were just amazing!  I just loved the bread they used in the bao- it was so fluffy.  We also ordered the brussels sprouts which were full of flavor!Overall, I loved the food and the cocktails.  However, they need a bigger space because they're just so busy!

7.description: I dined here over the weekend with a group of friends (about 15) and we ordered everything on the menu. Literally.  First - the ambiance is gorgeous.  Great music, great decor, I want to steal their tables.  Basically I'd like to live here.  Second - The food.  AMAZING.  My favorite was the Mac and Cheese.  Possibly the best mac i've ever tasted.  The crab cake was amazing.  Steak Frites were delicious, steak was perfectly cooked. The mussels were perfection.  My least favorite thing on the menu were the baos, but they were still great.  I am definitely coming back asap!

36.description: Food: The food here is amazing, everything was well seasoned and reasonably priced. The boa tacos are delicious, the burgers are mouth watering, mac and cheese is a must if your feeling some comfort food. Establishment & Service: The place is very...very small. So if your looking for private dinning experience, this may not be the best choice.

30.description: I've heard of LBW for the better part of year but haven't had the chance to visit--until today.  What TOOK me so long?First, the atmosphere.  Think of your hipster barista friend who grew up, got a better paying job (and a liquor license) and redecorated.  The place is funky chic. Great music, too. Next, the service. Friendly and knowledgable.  Props to Miranda for awesomeness. Empathy expressed for no iced tea on the menu.  Speaking of...The menu?  Eclectic.  Tacos, baos, salads, burgers, mac + cheese, among many other things.  Still, not a huge menu. We liked that.  That usually translates into fresher ingredients. Which leads me to... The food. I got smacked in the face with happiness just now (yes, I'm still sitting here eating).  The table ordered baos (shrimp and BBQ pork).  Mac + cheese with chicken. Crab cake and chopped salad.  All of it was great.  Wonderful.  Thank you, Little Bad Wolf!  We will return.

3.description: LBW is a pretty big and bad wolf. Thumbing through reviews I see I'm not the only one who made my way to Andersonville because I came across a sponsored IG post of the triple Wolf Burger. I scrolled past it at like 2am and knew I had to have it. One week later I was there.I walked in and was pleasantly surprised to see that LBW gives off an elegant look and feel but not stuffy. I make that remark because originally I thought LBW was just going to be a burger joint. The staff was all pretty cool. Now the space isn't huge with table seating and some bar space. I opted for the bar because there is a majority of table seating with backless stools and I find that to be bullshit choice. But really that's my only gripe. I actually enjoy sitting at the bar.As for the menu my original thought was identity crisis. It's American, Mexican, and Asian. I'm talking burgers, tacos, and baos. But I will say that I'm a fan of a small menu that's done to perfection which is called staying in your lane. Do a few things and do them well. LBW did just that.

14.description: This was a cool, laid-back kind of place to get some good eats. I enjoyed a grilled romaine salad, but be warned, if you don't like the taste of balsamic, the sauce/vinegar they use to get the char on the romaine is strong in flavor, despite what your server might tell you. My husband got a burger after hearing of the many fantastic reviews, but he/we found it to be just a little drier than we expected. The couple we went with loved their burgers and the choice to get a side salad instead of fries. The fries my husband were disappointing; they were lukewarm at best and very limp. The very best part of Little Bad Wolf is the awesome soundtrack of oldies they play. (Well, at least they were playing the afternoon we had lunch.) I get to eat lunch while enjoying the talents of Diana Ross, Stevie Wonder, and the like? AMAZING.

1.description: This place sucks.  I have been to many a Dollar Tree and this is the worst!  Lay out is horrible.  Crap is everywhere.  Nothing is organized well.  They don't have the normal selection of stuff,  either.  Checkers slow! The Ashland location is the better option.

9.description: great product for great price.  They carry big brand  names like hunt's and campbell's and betty crocker in the food section, which is awesome for people on a budget but at the same time dont want to give up quality.  I go here all the time and i love it. who doesn't love saving money, right? ;P  Only reason why I give it a 3 is because the shopping experience really depends on who's working at the time.  Sometimes, employees are obviously on their phones or texting while they ring you up, don't make eye contact or smile, or just ignore you.  today, there were 4 workers by the registers and there was a line of 3 of us waiting to check out.  We spoke up but they took about 4 minutes to get to their registers and get going.  It doesn't seem like  much, but working in customer service, i guess I expect a lot better.  Over all though, it's a good place!

23.description: The Dollar Tree is a mysterious place - an oxymoron of excellent values and worthless junk.Perhaps it works best as an outlet for greeting cards, wrapping paper and miscellaneous party supplies.  You know, those necessary things that eventually end up in the trash?  I love to wrap gifts opulently, but would rather not spend much money to do so.  I also like to send cards for various holidays (Easter, Halloween, etc.).  Dollar Tree allows me to do this without breaking the bank (their greeting cards are 2 for $1 - FABULOUS!!).  I know people love to receive cards, but does anyone actually keep them?  I think most people don't, so I'm pleased that I can send along greeting as economically as possible - all thanks to Dollar Tree.It's also great for cleaning supplies.  I have found that they work just as well as the national brands.  In fact, I am a big fan of their faux Febreze.  And at what cost?  You guessed it - one dollar!Every so often, you will find some great name brand toiletries and hair products.  Most of the others are not a great value though.  Many of the lotions and shower gel products tend to be watered down and not very effective.  A bottle of shower gel that scarcely forms any sort of lather is pretty worthless - even for $1.  They have lots of White Rain products (which I don't think are very good) that you can frequently find on sale for less (if you like that sort of thing).You can also glean some good values in the food aisle.  Pickles, peppers, condiments - all are excellent for a merely a buck.  Again, some great name brand stuff sneaks in from time to time.  Some of these items seem a little sketchy though - maybe not worth a dollar.Once, when it was a few days till payday and I was out of food for my darling kitties, I bought a bag of cat food from Dollar Tree. When I gave it to my babies, they sniffed the bowl and then looked at me as if to say "um......really?".  Once payday arrived, I bought their regular food and mixed the $1 stuff in with it.  My kitties are no dummies - they routinely picked out the good stuff and left the $1 madness behind.  Needless to say, the $1 cat food was NOT a good value.Surprisingly, there are occasionally some good hardcover books for merely one dollar.Dollar Tree used to be my stop for candles.  I'm sorry to say that the selection is now pretty crappy (and not really worth even $1).It's also difficult to count on Dollar Tree.  Sometimes they have what you need, sometimes they don't.  Depending on my mood and the level of necessity, this can be either fun or frustrating.This store is usually pretty messy and disorganized, but I think there is a lot of traffic and only a few employees, so it's understandable.  Check-out lines also tend to be long, but when you're only paying $1 per item, you can't expect much.  The staff is always very friendly, which is a definite plus!All in all, Dollar Tree is a great store.  You can get some great stuff.  Just keep in mind that just because something only costs $1, it is not always a good value.  Still, since it fulfills quite a few needs and I'm a sucker for adventure, I give Dollar Tree four stars!

25.description: By far the best place to get party supplies like table cloths, gift wrap, gift bags, decorations, and even wedding favor components. They sell lots of candy, shower gel, office supplies, kitchen , car, and cleaning supplies too. Don't expect tooooo much but hey, for $1, stuff here is a steal.

12.description: What's not to love about Dollar Tree!! I'm a huge fan of this place. The only thing that irritated me was the line... I hate that they only have one person at the register all the time. But if that's what keeps the prices down, I'm all for it.

21.description: Hand soap, garbage bags, freezer bags,cleaning supplies...$1 each. What's not to love?

16.description: I am a shopper at Dollar Tree. They have some bargains. For me, I buy some low cost food items here. Like tomato sauce, frozen corn, or candy for my hubby. Here, I can get it for cheap vs Jewel across the street. Now, the staff can be so-so at times. Lines are usually under control. Store is usually clean and organized for the most part. I will stay this place is below family dollar and family general, so keep that in mind. Otherwise, it's a cool place for discounts.

17.description: When moving from another city, let alone another country, this is the best place to go first for the home stuff. Everything you would need, you can find here. I also like a great viriety of celebration and birthday party stuff. Prices for their children books cannot be bitten, only $1 each!Bought today a pack of 8 very nice "thank you" cards for $1, isn't that bargain?!

10.description: This store is great. I can get all the stupid stuff for nothing - cleaning supplies, chap-stick, garbage bags, plastic utensils, toothpaste, spices, etc. I even bought 6  pack of Nestle water for $1 - yes... $1. I have to have my handbag and yes I pay for premium gas $5.09/gallon but... the $1 store is where I'm at ... the extra money I save goes into my 401K!!!

5.description: I guess I haven't been in many dollar stores, and I had to check to see, but indeed it's true, everything in here is a dollar or less.  I had to get some gift wrap for a present, found a gift bag (for a dollar) and some little colorful little round things that I packed the gift bag with, less obnoxious than glitter but in that same vein, (for a dollar), and for some reason I also had to get a can of soup (a dollar), and a little notebook (a dollar) which I promptly dropped in a muddy puddle outside (oh well, it was only a dollar).  The long lines were handled with as much efficiency as possible by the two overworked cashiers, and I got to meet a woman talking to herself while in line.  It's funny, I used to to assume people talking to themselves were crazy, now I assume that they are talking on the phone.  She turned out to not be talking on the phone, but she was very polite about talking to both me and herself once we made friends.  That entertainment didn't cost me a dollar, it was free. I guess I have no choice but to choose the one dollar price range below, right?

11.description: The only reason why I go here is for the $1 hand soap. But for the love of Buddha please open more checkout lanes. The wait to checkout is freaking horrendus. If you want the quick in and out this isn't the place.

22.description: My favorite types of trees are those with dollars on it. And this Dollar Tree is the real deal I love this place, no crap here for more than $1.00. I mean, there's not a whole lot you can't get here. And they always have tons of stuff! Favorite purchases include: Pirate play set, bridal shower favors, ribbon, shrink wrapable bags, and even the bubbles and place cards for my wedding. That's right, this Dollar Tree is so awesome it has a bridal section.Technical notes...they do accept debit cards although if you try to buy just one bottle of water they kind of frown on that....

0.description: Nice ppl Clean and  organized store All you need is here and everything is a dollarParty stuffSchool supply Cleaning  supply CookiesCerealsFoodI really like this location

20.description: After living in the Gold Coast with no dollar store (except one on Jackson that I never made it down to) -- I was glad to find this place. Conveniently located near the Berwyn Red Line stop and right off the 36 Broadway bus line. Dollar Tree is my favorite of all the Chicagoland dollar stores. In LA, I shopped at the $.99 cent store religiously, which also had fresh and sometimes organic produce. None of that here, but many other food items.The Dollar Tree is usually my go-to for non-emergency items. I love it for that stuff you need but hate to spend so much money on. Stuff like spray bottles. This store had 3 kinds! Plastic ones of various sizes. The one I got will be used to spray my plants with. Cleaning supplies -- lots of great ones. Today I found a sunglass case and almost got a pair of sunglasses. Betty Crocker brownie mix - full sized! They didn't have lemon juice today. Maybe next time. It's in a neat little strip shopping mall that includes a Jewel, Payless and other stores.  The staff is super friendly here. When I walked in, I was greeted by a lovely lady who handed me a nice shopping list pad! It's not enough that everything costs $1? On my first haul at the Dollar Tree when I moved back here in October, I spent over $100 AND got a $10 discount for a special they were having. Astounding. That day, I found some great dishes, glasswear - and just about everything I needed to set up my new place. DOLLAR TREE ROCKS!

19.description: Curt L's posting in Talk about Dollar Stores prompted me to write a review about this dollar store.  I don't like this store, but at the same time, I don't dislike it either.  The cons are that this store is very disorganized and there are hardly any employees working there who can help you.  This store is so understaffed.  The good thing about this store is that the merchandise is very inexpensive.  It kinda reminds me of a stock-up store.  I have gotten stupid bullshit here, items that you quite frankly don't care about such as plastic garbage bags, plastic measuring cups, and aluminum foil.

2.description: I love shopping for my school supplies, and also hygiene things here. Dollar stores are one of the main things that i missed, while living outside of the mainland. Yes

18.description: My favorite types of trees are those with dollars on it. And this Dollar Tree is the real deal I love this place, no crap here for more than $1.00. I mean, there's not a whole lot you can't get here. And they always have tons of stuff! Favorite purchases include: Pirate play set, bridal shower favors, ribbon, shrink wrapable bags, and even the bubbles and place cards for my wedding. That's right, this Dollar Tree is so awesome it has a bridal section.Technical notes...they do accept debit cards although if you try to buy just one bottle of water they kind of frown on that....

13.description: After living in the Gold Coast with no dollar store (except one on Jackson that I never made it down to) -- I was glad to find this place. Conveniently located near the Berwyn Red Line stop and right off the 36 Broadway bus line. Dollar Tree is my favorite of all the Chicagoland dollar stores. In LA, I shopped at the $.99 cent store religiously, which also had fresh and sometimes organic produce. None of that here, but many other food items.The Dollar Tree is usually my go-to for non-emergency items. I love it for that stuff you need but hate to spend so much money on. Stuff like spray bottles. This store had 3 kinds! Plastic ones of various sizes. The one I got will be used to spray my plants with. Cleaning supplies -- lots of great ones. Today I found a sunglass case and almost got a pair of sunglasses. Betty Crocker brownie mix - full sized! They didn't have lemon juice today. Maybe next time. It's in a neat little strip shopping mall that includes a Jewel, Payless and other stores.  The staff is super friendly here. When I walked in, I was greeted by a lovely lady who handed me a nice shopping list pad! It's not enough that everything costs $1? On my first haul at the Dollar Tree when I moved back here in October, I spent over $100 AND got a $10 discount for a special they were having. Astounding. That day, I found some great dishes, glasswear - and just about everything I needed to set up my new place. DOLLAR TREE ROCKS!

4.description: This is my favourite dollar tree/dollar store to go to. They honestly always have everything I need which is usually coffee filters and school supplies. I usually get some cue cards, or calendars or sticky notes. It is always neat and clean and the supplies are usually neatly stacked. This place is usually always busy which would be a sign of how well stocked they are. Some of the workers there are extremely helpful. I would definitely recommend this dollar tree to everyone for the items that are there and for the prices. Where some dollar stores don't actually have everything for a dollar-this location will definitely not disappoint!

24.description: Dollar stores rock. 'Nuff said.

6.description: Not all dollar stores are created equal: a good one is worth a million & this is one of the better ones. 6 hangers for a dollar. Target sells these for 3$. The Family Dollar charges 2$. This is a fair representation of most prices.And yes, the staff are real friendly.I'd recommend making this the first stop for most of your non-perishable household supplies.

15.description: Great place to stocking stuff. The staff is good, the store is clean, the shelves are well organized. I was happy to grab a couple of things here - all for $1, as it was a very nice shopping experience. Although you are not getting the "highest quality" its good enough for the items they offer and this place is a good as they come when it comes to dollar tree.

7.description: I'm not going to be pretentious and deduct a star because the dollar store doesn't sell balloons like one reviewer did.  Dollar Tree does everything it's supposed to do and more.  I'm always impressed by what you're able to find here, and it's so nice to buy grocery items at Dollar Tree instead of at expensive alternatives.  The Whole Foods crowd might not appreciate what you can get.  Yet, they'll load up on really expensive "organic" junk food that they assume is healthy because it's "organic."  Eating pounds of organic butter and ice cream does not make you healthy.  However, purchasing canned vegetables or peppers at Dollar Tree and making a good meal out of it at home can be healthy and easy on your wallet (or purse.)  This is what makes this store so great.  I wish I had one within walking distance in my area.  Some rich housewives buy expensive items at Crate & Barrel or Williams-Sonoma that they never end up using.  Enjoy your fancy kitchen decorations.  For those who work hard and actually cook, you can get some decent cookware/kitchenware at Dollar Tree.  I cook often and have not had to constantly replace the items.  I prefer this store to a place like Family Dollar, which should be renamed Family Dollars or Five Dollars.  There's not much there that's actually a dollar besides candy bars.  The people who work at Dollar Tree are also a lot more friendly.

8.description: This dollar store actually sells everything inside for just a dollar! The store is very well kept, its clean, and the staff is friendly and helpful. The Dollar Tree has a great selection of household and party items. I love shopping here for brand name home products like dish soap that would cost me much more at the bigger stores.

3.description: My beef ---waiting in line for a half hour for ten dollars of crap.  Change your business model if you don't want to hire people.  Or better yet read your cash register transactions...let me be clear, the constant sales doesn't mean you have a good flow, it means people are waiting to buy the garbage you pimp.  I'd avoid this place like the plague.

14.description: Oh Dollar tree, Oh dollar treeeee! I love theee! So cheap and so convenient. This one lost a star because they no longer sell balloons (they got their helium license taken away). This is my one stop shop for silly party favors or glow sticks. I wouldn't buy anything from their frozen section because I've gotten sick before, but everything else is fair game. There's a Jewel across the street that sell a bunch of the same things, but I bet you could shop at the Dollar Store for a fraction of the cost. They sell 4 packs of ring pops for a buck! That's the best deal ever!

58.description: This place is completely close to my home, maybe couple blocks away. So I decided to visit it around 2 month ago. The view is amazing, Michigan during sunset. Shrimps was good, and the place was really busy.As well as stuff. So nobody really paid attention to our table.And dessert was not really fresh.

56.description: A nice place for a light lunch,as the name indicates right on the waterfront with a nice lil playground next to it.The kids will like it also.

29.description: Great view but was super windy so that made it hard to eat outside.Musician just finished do I asked about music speakers. Was told they had pandora they'd put on but never did. Were out of the white wine and wrap I ordered so had to pick diff wrap and wine. Ordered coleslaw in place of chips but got chips and no coleslaw. Didn't mind since chips were good. Wine was heavy pour for 8$ so that was nice. Beer in can was warm do that stunk.Wait staff was a bit slow and we did have a long wait to get seated on a sun night. Would return.

42.description: The best kept secret in Edgewater.  Perfect view, friendly service, and just a few steps away from home.  Try the fish and chips.  This place has been featured by Time Out Chicago, so you don't need to take my word for it.  The food is not the greatest and a bit overpriced, but the location makes up for it.  It's almost impossible to find a decent waterfront restaurant in Chicago to have a snack and a drink.

23.description: One of the best spots to enjoy drinks and apps on the lake!!   My choices were the caipirinha's and the Mai Tai's both super tasty!  And the we enjoyed the jerk chicken nachos!!  The reviews are spot on!! The service a little slow but still work the trip!!

47.description: The Waterfront Cafe is located in Berger Park and it liesbehind one of the remaining Mansions along Sheridan Road.It was once a Coach House but now has been transformedinto a lovely Cafe with gorgeous lakefront views.I was welcomed by a lovely young woman Hostess person andwas asked my preference in seating, the Cafe has picnic benchesand tables with padded seats available for seating.I chose the padded chairs, because those picnic benches didnot look too comfy, so this was a No Brainer.I had heard that the Waterfront Cafe makes a Watermelon Slusheetype drink so I asked my waiter Justin about that and he asked meif I wanted it with or without Vodka..I chose without vodka because the non alcoholic version was $5.00as opposed to the alcoholic version which was $10.00!And, okay, I was afraid I would like the vodka one too much andI'd want more than one and didn't want to fall into the lake as I was leaving...Menu items at the Cafe include salads, wraps, lobster rolls,fish and chips etc..I myself ordered the fish and chips which I thought were very good,even though the pieces were rather small, more like appetizersize portions.And, honestly, the menu price struck me as too high for what Ireceived.But, I loved this Cafe, I truly did, It was casual and comfortable and can't beat those lakefront views!My server Justin was on top of everything, and for that, wetipped him well.Love the fact that they have live music here too!I would suggest calling ahead to make sure of the dates and timesfor that.So, I am giving The Waterfront Cafe a 4 star rating,and, I am only deducting a star because I felt the menu priceswere a bit high.But, nonetheless, this is definitely a place I intend to return to.Because I love Casual and Comfortable and Watermelon Slushees!But next time I will definitely take it with the Vodka..Sound like a plan to me....

8.description: Beautiful lakeside location. Poor or inexperienced service. (It's always like that at these kind of places isn't it?)Their second week open for the 2015 summer season. I was here for lunchtime on a Thursday. This location is so great. It's hard to find another accessible and beautiful kind of location on the Chicago north shore--the water stretches out blue right in front of you and the skyline is grey in the distance. Atmosphere is a great for an outdoor deck. Some tables in shade, some in sun. Some tasteful decorations and even decent music.The service is pretty rough. It's not offensive, just amateur hour or indifferent. It's just about everything: the slow and awkward greeting by the host (after seating me he stood silently by the table staring a clipboard while forgetting to give me the menu he was holding in his hand). Server took nearly 10 mins (!) to make first contact and ask for a drink order.The food took nearly 30 minutes to arrive after the order was placed. It was a wrap and chips. I ordered the wrap without the aioli sauce--but it arrived soaked in it. I would have said something, but the waiter literally dropped the food basket on my table as he rushed passed and didn't return again for another 15 minutes. Sorta makes you think the place must have been packed, but it was less than half full.I had to ask for a check.I watched others experience much of the same, long times a table before being greeted, basics of serving rhythm sorta not done well.  Denny's has better service.So not awesome, but I'll still come back cause the view is awesome. Which is why these places are always like that.

31.description: Great location with a beautiful view , it looked like a promising summer Erving outdoor and I definitely didn't mind waiting 45 minutes to be seated because the ambience is really nice ! But then another 1hour and 20 minutes for 2 wraps and a lobster roll to come out is inexcusable ! The food was decent but not worth that long of a wait , also the advertising live music performance was a no show so I unfortunately left pretty disappointed as the service and the management didn't do anything about it !

34.description: Awful food. Awful service. What a dump.For $52, we got:- 2 crummy iced teas made of some wonderful mix-"house special" tasteless fish sticks with packets of tartar sauce (hello??? If it's your special, try making tartar sauce rather than giving us packets like McDonalds); - cold "greek fries" (pro tip: greek salad dressing from the 7-11 does not make Greek fries);- a wrap that promptly fell apart- jerk chicken nachos that weren't bad but had nothing to do with Jamaican jerk. It was more like Jewell Chicken salad on chips.Also, wtf with my appetizers coming out after the entrees? Also, wtf with not being able to make the chips on my fish/chips with your "Greek" flavor? You know, the "Greek" flavor we get from dried parsley and crumbled feta on cold fries with 7-11 Greek dressing. Given that the "greek" fries were cold and crappy and prepared by taking last week's fries and adding a few spices, it wouldn't be that hard to do...Also, wtf with the big "no substitutions" sign on the menu? it's all indicative of a management or ownership that really doesn't care about their customers. I'm sure the manager has a sign that says "this job would be easy if it weren't for the customers". He or she should go back to folding clothes at Gap. Folks, I would strongly advise bringing Jimmy John's to the park rather than eating here. This place stinks. Derp. Meh. Ick. Groan....

16.description: The location is fantastic.  I wrestled with the idea of giving this place one star (or less if possible), but the location is really great.  #1 They really have DIRTY tables.  I not just talking about the left-over food crumbs from the previous customers, but the vinyl table covering was very STICKY, basically disgusting.  The vinyl table coverings are textured so they do trap some dirt in general, but you'd think that once in a while they'd consider hosing the things off if they can't even wipe the tables after each customer.  #2 The food quality does not match the price.  The Calamari while fresh (nice) was heavily salted.  That could have been a one-day occurrence.  The plain fries are $5 and remind me of a very generic limp knock-off of McD's without the flavor or texture (just looks).... more like Chuck-E-Cheese kiddie food.  Fries don't cost much to make.  If you're going to charge $5 for them, make them taste good.  In general, the other items were all pretty much sub par.  The wait staff is generally very nice, pleasant, etc...  but, VERY slow.  We spent more time waiting for the server to show up and finally to bring the check than we actually did  eating our meal.  I want this place to succeed.  Please get it together!

13.description: Great view but was super windy so that made it hard to eat outside.Musician just finished do I asked about music speakers. Was told they had pandora they'd put on but never did. Were out of the white wine and wrap I ordered so had to pick diff wrap and wine. Ordered coleslaw in place of chips but got chips and no coleslaw. Didn't mind since chips were good. Wine was heavy pour for 8$ so that was nice. Beer in can was warm do that stunk.Wait staff was a bit slow and we did have a long wait to get seated on a sun night. Would return.

11.description: If this place was anywhere accept the beach front it would never survive Rogers Park/Edgewater.Food is unacceptable, drinks watered down, seating is unclean and uncomfortable and the menu is overpriced. Unfortunately I will not be returning.Forgot to mention your eating with plastic ware and the bird infestation may have you leaving with disgust in your stomach and disgust of the bird droppings on your shirt. I've been more impressed with the restaurants that didn't last on the cursed corner of Morse and Glenwood ...

39.description: i wish i could give this place 0 stars after the sickness i experienced after eating at this place. i have gone here many times, but this is the first time i got sick. i'm kind of disappointed, as this is where my boyfriend and i first met and had our first date. it's now ruined because i got seriously sick after eating here. i should have known after i sent back an expired product.within an hour of eating here, my stomach started hurting. by the next morning i was vomiting and had awful diarrhea. i had to stay home from work. my boyfriend also started to feel the effects and was sick as well.highly disappointed. i'd suggest not eating here. i just saw a similar review for food poisoning on 7/14/15. on top of that, service was incredibly slow. this place isn't even organized properly. none of the serves seem to know what table they're serving. we saw our server three times.

37.description: Nice view. That's worth 2 stars. We have been sitting at our table (after a long wait) for 1:45 and still no food. They ran out of a number of items from the already limited menu. As I type this we just found out they ran out of the food half the table ordered. It is 9:30 on a Tuesday night. Just sayin'.(Steve the manager was really nice- despite the situation he had to deal with)

0.description: 3.5 Stars, rounding up for the great Lake views. Run by the Chicago Parks, the Waterfront Cafe offers waitstaff delivered food, drinks, and musical entertainment in a unique lakeside location.Those who complain about the food- I don't get it- the food was just great!Jerk Chicken Nachos- not exactly "Nachos" (and I know Nachos), but still a fine dish. Tasty and fresh, this seemed way more healthy and less cheesy than actual Nachos. It was kind of spicy, which was nice. 3/5 stars on my Nachos list for being fresh and unique.Apple Walnut Salad with mixed greens, cranberries, blue cheese, vinaigrette. You've had this a million times before if you live in Chicago, and at Waterfront Cafe, it does not disappoint. Service was the right amount of care and hands off, and a jazz band was setting up on the tiny stage with the Selfie Frames. There's live music here 5 nights a week.Did I mention the Lake is spitting distance away? Yes! What beautiful views and atmosphere at the Waterfront Cafe, with twinkling lights, a nice waiting area, and it's pet and family friendly.

38.description: TERRIBLE food that made us sick, watered down drinks, and horrible service. One star is for the beautiful location, other than that- will never eat there again.

51.description: My friends and I tried to go here in Thursday night and were told there was a 35 minute wait because the kitchen was backed up and the servers were overwhelmed. We waited for a half hour and then got sat. We then sat at the table for 15 minutes and no server came by so we just decided to leave. We decided to give it another try for lunch today. We got the jerk chicken nachos for an appetizers and they were pretty good. My sister got the chicken and chips which looked and tasted like they were thrown from the freezer bag into the fryer. Our server was very nice and sweet. Overall a disappointing experience though, aside from the view of course.

27.description: I have been trying to get to this lakeside spot for a while now, so imagine my delight when the stars aligned and I found myself in this neck of the woods on a beautiful summer's evening and with a full moon, to boot!  Score!There was a wait of about 30 minutes for our larger sized group as they don't take reservations.  But no problem as they served us some drinks while we waited and soon our table was ready.There are a mix of picnic tables and café tables.  We got the picnic table right next to the live band closest to the water which was another nice touch.  The view was outstanding as the moon looked like it was coming straight out of Lake Michigan and in the reflection on the water a gaggle of geese swam by  . . . .seriously picture perfect!The menu here is simple.  Expect simple and you won't be disappointed.  Sandwiches, wraps and salads are your best bets.  I had some fried calamari (standard fare) as well as the chicken wrap with coleslaw which was pretty good.There is live entertainment most nights, and on this night it the band played a wide range of music that had us singing along as we sipped our drinks and enjoyed a perfect Chicago night.The whole place closes down around 10 so know it won't be  a late night here.  Also- parking in this area is at a premium so  if you drive, plan to look awhile for a spot.Probably one of the best nights of my summer so far!

32.description: Such a shame!  I wanted to like this place.  The location is fantastic, the views are amazing, it feels like you are on vacation in the city.  Unfortunately the food and drinks were terrible.  I had the watermelon slushie drink, which tasted more like the rind of the watermelon than the actual melon itself.  We tried to start with an appetizer (guacamole) but it came out after my entree.  My entree was the first to arrive at the table which was unfortunate because I was with 2 other people.  5 minutes after my lone entree came out, the appetizer arrived, followed by my friends 2 entrees 5 minutes after that.  I had the jerk chicken nachos which turned out being a mayonnaise based chicken salad on some chips in a bowl topped with lettuce.  It was very bland and not at all what I was expecting of what is traditionally a somewhat spicy dish. My friends had the falafel and turkey wrap and were disappointed too. If you are going to go eat first and just get wine or beer and enjoy the view....

54.description: Waited 15 minutes for a waiter to talk to us. Spoke with the hostess, who acknowledged the problem. Still no waiter. Spoke to the manager after 5 minutes. No apology, he just grunts and disappears. At about 25 minutes someone shows up and stammers through a drink order. Terrible service for the mediocre food.

48.description: So took Dad (and mom) here Fathers Day. Was a little skeptical because of previous reviews but decided the view would make up for it. The service was a bit slow but with a view like that who cares you want to spend time looking out at the lake.  The food was great we had the guacamole and crab cakes for appetizers both were tasty. The fish (4 nice size pieces)and chips, 6 good size shrimp, Jamaican wrap and the lobster roll (me). All were delish. The lobster roll was a bit expensive but it was fresh lobster and big chunks of it so the $14 was worth it. Also being the French fry freak I am I loved the fries.  The only disappointment  was the watermelon/vodka drink (can't remember the name) I ordered. Although it was fresh watermelon juice something was missing maybe a bit more vodka and less juice especially at $10 a pop. All in all whatever caused the prior negative food reviews seems someone wasListening and corrected quite nicely. I'll be back later in evening next time to listen to music they have on different nights. This place is truly a hidden gem in a beautiful setting on the lake.  Next time I'll just be sure to order something else to drink. Shout out to Sam our waiter whovery personable.

44.description: One of the most poorly run restaurants in the area. Waited 20 min for hostess even tho there were empty tables. No red sangria.

24.description: This place has one of the best views in Chicago, and it's not in a skyrise. It sits right against the water, with only a small walking path filled with dogs and birds separating you from Lake Michigan. It's an old coach house that has been converted into a cafe with a unique flavor that relies heavily upon ambience and the aforementioned view. This place feels like a vacation spot. I wouldn't trek to this place if you live really far away, but if you're in the area or it's easily reachable, you should definitely stop in. Drinks are a little expensive, can't get anything alcoholic for less than $6, so plan on this being either your launching point for the night, or one of your final stops, as this isn't the ideal place to rack up a long tab. The food is fine, my girlfriend and I dug the jerk chicken nachos.There's only one bathroom, so make a pit stop before you go.There's a $1 charge for tap water.The hostess was really friendly, sat us immediately, and let us pick our seat based on location and sun vs shade.This is moreso the type of place to check off of a bucket list rather than one to make a staple in your dinging out rotation unless you live in the neighborhood, but absolutely worth checking out.

7.description: I was watching Chicago's best and when I saw this place I wanna to try it out. Don't get me wrong the place is absolutely beautiful but I found it a little bit to pricey for the food they serves and they should actually better do BYOB cause their drink were just ok. Me and my boy got a wrap, crab cakes And fry calamari, All 3 things they were good nothing like wow but good.  Because is summer the noise of the bugs were extremely annoying I thought it was concentrated in that area. This is nothing rest can't do is Mother Nature but wanna to mention this if you looking for something quiet. Overall the place was ok but the lake view it was definitely A+++

49.description: Great food, service, drinks and even better atmosphere. My wife and came here for some drinks and appetizers and were pleasantly surprised at the relaxing environment. We had the red sangria, jerk nachos and Greek island fries. All were so amazing and we will for sure be back!

40.description: Fabulous spot for appetizers/drink, especially pre-theater play in Berger Park. Appetizers acceptable; OK drink list. Nothing special--except the setting next to the lake, which is worth a stop.

53.description: What a gem! This place is beautiful and the food is always fresh and delicious. I went here twice in 2 days. So so good and such a great date spot, hang out or solo lunch date!

30.description: Ok...catch this on a beautiful, breezy day and you will feel like you're on an island vacation,  no joke. And that easy breezy vibe will make it a better experience than it probably should be. I was nervous because so many negative things were said about the service. Our waitress was perfectly nice, but all servers seemed a bit scatter-brained.  My husband and I were in absolutely no rush, but we had to ask for simple things like water or extra napkins multiple times. And they were very vocal about how they felt about their job. Totally unprofessional.  The host kept disappearing so people would seat themselves, which also annoyed the wait staff.  Other more high-maintenance patrons were visibly annoyed with the service. The food was ok. The crab cakes were good but I couldn't taste the coconut. The lobster and shrimp stuffed avocado was bland, but with extra salt and lemon,  it's ok. The portion was very generous! The jerk chicken sandwich was all spice no flavor. Because of this, I think it is a bit overpriced, especially the drinks.  It's a Chicago Park District cafe, not a resort or fancy restaurant. Get over yourself. BUT...that easy breezy vibe gonna make everything all right. Come ready to just chill, not expect a fine dining experience.

46.description: If this place was anywhere accept the beach front it would never survive Rogers Park/Edgewater.Food is unacceptable, drinks watered down, seating is unclean and uncomfortable and the menu is overpriced. Unfortunately I will not be returning.Forgot to mention your eating with plastic ware and the bird infestation may have you leaving with disgust in your stomach and disgust of the bird droppings on your shirt. I've been more impressed with the restaurants that didn't last on the cursed corner of Morse and Glenwood ...

1.description: If you're looking to be amazed in the food department, you're checking out the wrong restaurant. However, if you can get past the resemblance of mediocre bar food, outstanding ambiance with above average service awaits you.Ambiance: The restaurant's outdoor seating area is stunning; greeting you with strung lights and an array of seating including stylish metal cafe tables and picnic tables. The perimeter is made up of adorable wooden fencing, matching the beachy theme throughout the space. Which leads into this spots best attribute - the beach!! This is all located directly next to Lake Michigan. We came right before sunset and the view was priceless (well, until you look at the menu. Then you see it does come with a price). Quality: I'm all about a small menu, but the quality didn't match the price. My blackberry lemonade with Tito's vodka was $10 - and tasted very ok. Could have had more of that sour citrus brightness/bite any good lemonade has. We started the meal with fried calamari. Great crunch, but rubbery in texture and pretty salty. There is a white creamy sauce that comes with it that had a spicy kick. The meal came out literally a minute after the appetizer (which drives me nuts). I ordered chicken strips and fries (my go to when I don't like much on a menu) pros: crispy chicken, actual chicken breast. Con: bad flavor on chicken (reminded me of tyson freezer bag strips) and under seasoned all-around bad fries (a sad version of McDonald's fries). My boyfriend got a salad with falafel that was underwhelming as well.  Customer Service: We had a great server. However, when we tried to warn her about the rat creeping its way into the dinning area, she was a bit dismissive. (Hey, just trying to make sure your guest don't flip out. It was huge!)Accessibility: Pretty limited on parking. I would recommend coming here if within walking distance. Area: Safe, family orientated, right next to the beach and condos.  I don't want to give this place anything less than 3 stars solely for the view. And I heard its even better with live music. Maybe we can call this a solid starter  joint? Nachos or guac, 1 drink, a sunset and then enjoy a night out on the town. Jamie "Jammy" D."I'm not picky, I'm particular."

55.description: Great food and awesome view. However I will say that management needs to step up to the plate. It took at least 1.5 hours to get our food. The manager on duty not once made any rounds to customer service and see if everything was ok. He just stood there and walked from the register to the hostess stand. I will come again but advise management to step up their game.

9.description: Okay loved the location, such a beautiful place located on the water. Amazing views. The service was excellent. Our server was very professional. The  crab cakes amazing although I'm not sure it was real crab. I ordered the jerk chicken OMG OMG OMG it's was awful!!!! The worst chicken in the world it was mushy like tofu! I don't understand why you can't invest in actual chicken. Over all it was amazing!! The falafel sandwich was so so good!!

26.description: Pros: Amazing environment overlooking the lake. Very beautiful. The service was very helpful. Cons: A lot of low quality ingredients. Dressings were made with soy oil. The olive oil I asked them to bring out for my salad was yellow in color and had a strange taste, I almost thought it was not olive oil. The waiter brought out the olive oil to show me (good service) that it was olive oil. However, I saw that "refined olive oil" was the first ingredient and extra virgin was the second, so it was mostly refined, which is low quality olive oil. That explains the color and taste. Refined oils are usually not used for dressing salad, but instead for cooking.I was so disappointed because it's such a beautiful location. I hope they up the quality. I would go back for a watermelon basil drink, but not for food.

25.description: What a great location and  view. You are up north on sheridan road lake front and water side.  Picnic tables and casual atmosphere. Reminded me of dining in hilton head.  But what potential it has for improvement.  Service abysmal (what, customers? ) and food is Diner /street food quality.  No plates no silver ware no servers.   The nice part was some costco size glasses of wine for $8  a glass.  Otherwise, they were out of 3 apps and we were told the kitchen was really backed up so food would be a while. And it was.   We had the hummus olive appetizer platter.  And then the fish and chips. With packaged  tartar sauce from restaurant depot.   So what I am getting at is the property and its location and experience doesnt match the food and service identified as an issue by other yelpers.   So my conclusion is that this place needs an Executive chef/owner/Manager who wants to work 5 months per year.  I think it would be a smash hit.  This way its just kind of an amateur operation that doesnt capitalize on its location.  Not going back.

12.description: First of all I like to start by saying that this place could very much so get a 4.5 to 5 stars from me, view it's spectacular  and I mean that , also  it's very close to my house sangria is okay ambient above average very friendly however the bug situation mosquitoes flies spiders etc .  Is out of control.  This is the only reason I can't give them a perfect rating. If you can figure out the bugs issue I'll deffenatly spend more time and more often here.    I like everything thing else about this place. The amateur band set up stage and the location is very very nice and interesting,  figure out the insect / bugs issue and you'll increase business by a lot. as I live half a block away and always have friends over to hang out in my area " walking distance" .

59.description: If the waterfront cafe was located anywhere else it wouldn't survive. The food is subpar and mostly fryer based. The Jamaican jerk nachos are the only item on the menu worth ordering. The mixed drinks are weak and overpriced. The beer menu is limited. However the atmosphere and space right by the lake is why it's worth it to stop by. Although I've never been by to listen to live music it seems like a great spot to do so. (3.5/5)

21.description: The location is fantastic.  I wrestled with the idea of giving this place one star (or less if possible), but the location is really great.  #1 They really have DIRTY tables.  I not just talking about the left-over food crumbs from the previous customers, but the vinyl table covering was very STICKY, basically disgusting.  The vinyl table coverings are textured so they do trap some dirt in general, but you'd think that once in a while they'd consider hosing the things off if they can't even wipe the tables after each customer.  #2 The food quality does not match the price.  The Calamari while fresh (nice) was heavily salted.  That could have been a one-day occurrence.  The plain fries are $5 and remind me of a very generic limp knock-off of McD's without the flavor or texture (just looks).... more like Chuck-E-Cheese kiddie food.  Fries don't cost much to make.  If you're going to charge $5 for them, make them taste good.  In general, the other items were all pretty much sub par.  The wait staff is generally very nice, pleasant, etc...  but, VERY slow.  We spent more time waiting for the server to show up and finally to bring the check than we actually did  eating our meal.  I want this place to succeed.  Please get it together!

17.description: Great atmosphere!

10.description: Had a great time here. Wonderful views, great drinks (I had a mojito). The lobster roll was unexpectedly good and the three different deserts were all good.

5.description: Awful food. Awful service. What a dump.For $52, we got:- 2 crummy iced teas made of some wonderful mix-"house special" tasteless fish sticks with packets of tartar sauce (hello??? If it's your special, try making tartar sauce rather than giving us packets like McDonalds); - cold "greek fries" (pro tip: greek salad dressing from the 7-11 does not make Greek fries);- a wrap that promptly fell apart- jerk chicken nachos that weren't bad but had nothing to do with Jamaican jerk. It was more like Jewell Chicken salad on chips.Also, wtf with my appetizers coming out after the entrees? Also, wtf with not being able to make the chips on my fish/chips with your "Greek" flavor? You know, the "Greek" flavor we get from dried parsley and crumbled feta on cold fries with 7-11 Greek dressing. Given that the "greek" fries were cold and crappy and prepared by taking last week's fries and adding a few spices, it wouldn't be that hard to do...Also, wtf with the big "no substitutions" sign on the menu? it's all indicative of a management or ownership that really doesn't care about their customers. I'm sure the manager has a sign that says "this job would be easy if it weren't for the customers". He or she should go back to folding clothes at Gap. Folks, I would strongly advise bringing Jimmy John's to the park rather than eating here. This place stinks. Derp. Meh. Ick. Groan....

3.description: The Waterfront Cafe is located in Berger Park and it liesbehind one of the remaining Mansions along Sheridan Road.It was once a Coach House but now has been transformedinto a lovely Cafe with gorgeous lakefront views.I was welcomed by a lovely young woman Hostess person andwas asked my preference in seating, the Cafe has picnic benchesand tables with padded seats available for seating.I chose the padded chairs, because those picnic benches didnot look too comfy, so this was a No Brainer.I had heard that the Waterfront Cafe makes a Watermelon Slusheetype drink so I asked my waiter Justin about that and he asked meif I wanted it with or without Vodka..I chose without vodka because the non alcoholic version was $5.00as opposed to the alcoholic version which was $10.00!And, okay, I was afraid I would like the vodka one too much andI'd want more than one and didn't want to fall into the lake as I was leaving...Menu items at the Cafe include salads, wraps, lobster rolls,fish and chips etc..I myself ordered the fish and chips which I thought were very good,even though the pieces were rather small, more like appetizersize portions.And, honestly, the menu price struck me as too high for what Ireceived.But, I loved this Cafe, I truly did, It was casual and comfortable and can't beat those lakefront views!My server Justin was on top of everything, and for that, wetipped him well.Love the fact that they have live music here too!I would suggest calling ahead to make sure of the dates and timesfor that.So, I am giving The Waterfront Cafe a 4 star rating,and, I am only deducting a star because I felt the menu priceswere a bit high.But, nonetheless, this is definitely a place I intend to return to.Because I love Casual and Comfortable and Watermelon Slushees!But next time I will definitely take it with the Vodka..Sound like a plan to me....

35.description: What started off as a 5 star experience soon degraded to a two star one. First, what a great location! Spectacular view of the late, great ambience with Hawaiian music playing gently in the background. My girlfriend and I came here to have an afternoon snack, do a little work and maybe stay for drinks after working for a few hours.Initially our server was very friendly, if a little too enthusiastic. We ordered 2 of the most expensive non-alcoholic drinks on the menu and one full size entree. After chowing down we pulled out our laptops and went to work. This seemed to bother our server for some reason (btw, Yelp lists this as a "cafe", so go figure). We ordered 2 coffees and spent the next 1.5-2 hours working. At this point our server had changed completely from being cheerful to being passive aggressive. We finally decided to stop working and order alcohol. Our server, clearly upset, hurriedly took our order. My girlfriend ordered a $10 vodka lemonade, but once it was served, we found it basically has zero alcohol in it. Keep in mind, my girlfriend is 90lbs, so she would notice. We told the server to try it, because we were certain there was no alcohol. He tasted it and stated "the ice waters it down, but there is a double shot of vodka in there". I laughed, as that excuse was clearly BS. He rectified this by giving us another shot of vodka, extra attitude included. At this point we were feeling so uncomfortable and disappointed, that we could not enjoy the wonderful atmosphere. We both left upset, with no desire to return.Such a shame that bad service has ruined an otherwise lovely place.

19.description: I came here with my girlfriend one night and it was a pleasant experience.
