Food was alright, the servers were friendly, and the view was stunning.We were initially told that there would be a 35 minute wait. After a couple of no shows, we were seated in 15. Even if the no-shows arrived, I was confident we would have gotten placed well before the 35 minute mark they set. Our server was friendly and attentive. Although I heard grumblings from other tables about food wait times and inattentive servers, that wasn't indicative of my experience (and was not reflected in my score)We got a picnic table along the shore with an amazing view. I was a little distracted by the gnats and flies in the area, but I imagine it'll get better as summer goes along.We both ordered a fish and chips basket. The fish was good, and the fries were kinda "meh". After all I'd heard about the place, I expected different. Prices were in line with what you'd get at any sit down restaurant, so I didn't feel like we got charged for the view (which restaurants do frequently).I'm giving this place three stars because the quality of the view wasn't in line with the quality  of the restaurant. "Something" was missing from this place that I can't put my finger on, and it's making me go crazy because I see a lot of potential in this place. I can't help but feel like this place would make a killing if they were open for brunch. People will wait for mimosas with that view.Anyways, looking forward to coming back and giving this place another try.

28.description: All I can say is that this place now charges a dollar for TAP WATER!! Seriously?? Apparently it's a CPD thing but still. I'm sitting here looking at one of the biggest reserves of fresh water in the world and they want me to pay for it. I about fell out of my chair.

45.description: Came here for lunch today. They weren't serving food because the hostess said the kitchen was backed up due to being so busy. Huh? What a joke.

33.description: The view is unbeatable and the atmosphere is really nice. They had a very good jazz guitarist playing standards on Saturday night. However, the wait was pretty long and we weren't able to order drinks while we waited. We were told "if the bartender gets an opportunity he might come out and take orders, but he's pretty busy." Maybe have more than one bartender for a Saturday night. Once we were seated, the service was even worse. Some of our party got their appetizers after about 15 min., but I think we waited about 45 min for our sandwiches- by which time the fries were really cold. Drink orders were also taken slowly and the check took a while as well. It's a place worth going to because it's unique, but I suppose just go expecting a slow meal and don't show up too hungry because you'll wait a while.

43.description: Great view and nice atmosphere!  Food was good, but service was a bit slow.  Drinks were average.  The watermelon drink sounds appealing but was not what was expected after reading some of the other reviews--tasted a lot like diluted watermelon.

2.description: This place has the look you want:Steps from the lake front pathCute picnic tables as seatingsTrees on the propertyand just general adorablenessBut look and don't touch!We were seated immediately and waited 10 mins for our waitress  Our waitress took 5 minutes to bring waterOur appetizers took 45 mins to come out of the kitchen. This is utter foolishness. 45 minutes for nachos? They put chicken on chips and want you to wait 45 minutes for that? By this point I was too hungry and annoyed to fight, but the craziness hadn't ended. We get the bill and we were charged for tap water!Yes! WATER COST MONEY!When I asked I was told they were wasting to much water. I don't know what this means, but I do know I will never go back!

18.description: My friends and I tried to go here in Thursday night and were told there was a 35 minute wait because the kitchen was backed up and the servers were overwhelmed. We waited for a half hour and then got sat. We then sat at the table for 15 minutes and no server came by so we just decided to leave. We decided to give it another try for lunch today. We got the jerk chicken nachos for an appetizers and they were pretty good. My sister got the chicken and chips which looked and tasted like they were thrown from the freezer bag into the fryer. Our server was very nice and sweet. Overall a disappointing experience though, aside from the view of course.

41.description: My husband and I both had bad diarrhea and vomit after dined there, which was later diagnosed as food poison. The place only has view. The service were slow. It took the server almost half hour to have the food ready. Will never return.

52.description: Beautiful lakeside location. Poor or inexperienced service. (It's always like that at these kind of places isn't it?)Their second week open for the 2015 summer season. I was here for lunchtime on a Thursday. This location is so great. It's hard to find another accessible and beautiful kind of location on the Chicago north shore--the water stretches out blue right in front of you and the skyline is grey in the distance. Atmosphere is a great for an outdoor deck. Some tables in shade, some in sun. Some tasteful decorations and even decent music.The service is pretty rough. It's not offensive, just amateur hour or indifferent. It's just about everything: the slow and awkward greeting by the host (after seating me he stood silently by the table staring a clipboard while forgetting to give me the menu he was holding in his hand). Server took nearly 10 mins (!) to make first contact and ask for a drink order.The food took nearly 30 minutes to arrive after the order was placed. It was a wrap and chips. I ordered the wrap without the aioli sauce--but it arrived soaked in it. I would have said something, but the waiter literally dropped the food basket on my table as he rushed passed and didn't return again for another 15 minutes. Sorta makes you think the place must have been packed, but it was less than half full.I had to ask for a check.I watched others experience much of the same, long times a table before being greeted, basics of serving rhythm sorta not done well.  Denny's has better service.So not awesome, but I'll still come back cause the view is awesome. Which is why these places are always like that.

50.description: I came here with my girlfriend one night and it was a pleasant experience. Food was alright, the servers were friendly, and the view was stunning.We were initially told that there would be a 35 minute wait. After a couple of no shows, we were seated in 15. Even if the no-shows arrived, I was confident we would have gotten placed well before the 35 minute mark they set. Our server was friendly and attentive. Although I heard grumblings from other tables about food wait times and inattentive servers, that wasn't indicative of my experience (and was not reflected in my score)We got a picnic table along the shore with an amazing view. I was a little distracted by the gnats and flies in the area, but I imagine it'll get better as summer goes along.We both ordered a fish and chips basket. The fish was good, and the fries were kinda "meh". After all I'd heard about the place, I expected different. Prices were in line with what you'd get at any sit down restaurant, so I didn't feel like we got charged for the view (which restaurants do frequently).I'm giving this place three stars because the quality of the view wasn't in line with the quality  of the restaurant. "Something" was missing from this place that I can't put my finger on, and it's making me go crazy because I see a lot of potential in this place. I can't help but feel like this place would make a killing if they were open for brunch. People will wait for mimosas with that view.Anyways, looking forward to coming back and giving this place another try.

4.description: I have been trying to get to this lakeside spot for a while now, so imagine my delight when the stars aligned and I found myself in this neck of the woods on a beautiful summer's evening and with a full moon, to boot!  Score!There was a wait of about 30 minutes for our larger sized group as they don't take reservations.  But no problem as they served us some drinks while we waited and soon our table was ready.There are a mix of picnic tables and café tables.  We got the picnic table right next to the live band closest to the water which was another nice touch.  The view was outstanding as the moon looked like it was coming straight out of Lake Michigan and in the reflection on the water a gaggle of geese swam by  . . . .seriously picture perfect!The menu here is simple.  Expect simple and you won't be disappointed.  Sandwiches, wraps and salads are your best bets.  I had some fried calamari (standard fare) as well as the chicken wrap with coleslaw which was pretty good.There is live entertainment most nights, and on this night it the band played a wide range of music that had us singing along as we sipped our drinks and enjoyed a perfect Chicago night.The whole place closes down around 10 so know it won't be  a late night here.  Also- parking in this area is at a premium so  if you drive, plan to look awhile for a spot.Probably one of the best nights of my summer so far!

6.description: This place has one of the best views in Chicago, and it's not in a skyrise. It sits right against the water, with only a small walking path filled with dogs and birds separating you from Lake Michigan. It's an old coach house that has been converted into a cafe with a unique flavor that relies heavily upon ambience and the aforementioned view. This place feels like a vacation spot. I wouldn't trek to this place if you live really far away, but if you're in the area or it's easily reachable, you should definitely stop in. Drinks are a little expensive, can't get anything alcoholic for less than $6, so plan on this being either your launching point for the night, or one of your final stops, as this isn't the ideal place to rack up a long tab. The food is fine, my girlfriend and I dug the jerk chicken nachos.There's only one bathroom, so make a pit stop before you go.There's a $1 charge for tap water.The hostess was really friendly, sat us immediately, and let us pick our seat based on location and sun vs shade.This is moreso the type of place to check off of a bucket list rather than one to make a staple in your dinging out rotation unless you live in the neighborhood, but absolutely worth checking out.

22.description: best undiscovered hide-away in chicago. Great for a mid afternoon drink(Margaritas are great), great for a waterfront dinner with the person you love.

15.description: What started off as a 5 star experience soon degraded to a two star one. First, what a great location! Spectacular view of the late, great ambience with Hawaiian music playing gently in the background. My girlfriend and I came here to have an afternoon snack, do a little work and maybe stay for drinks after working for a few hours.Initially our server was very friendly, if a little too enthusiastic. We ordered 2 of the most expensive non-alcoholic drinks on the menu and one full size entree. After chowing down we pulled out our laptops and went to work. This seemed to bother our server for some reason (btw, Yelp lists this as a "cafe", so go figure). We ordered 2 coffees and spent the next 1.5-2 hours working. At this point our server had changed completely from being cheerful to being passive aggressive. We finally decided to stop working and order alcohol. Our server, clearly upset, hurriedly took our order. My girlfriend ordered a $10 vodka lemonade, but once it was served, we found it basically has zero alcohol in it. Keep in mind, my girlfriend is 90lbs, so she would notice. We told the server to try it, because we were certain there was no alcohol. He tasted it and stated "the ice waters it down, but there is a double shot of vodka in there". I laughed, as that excuse was clearly BS. He rectified this by giving us another shot of vodka, extra attitude included. At this point we were feeling so uncomfortable and disappointed, that we could not enjoy the wonderful atmosphere. We both left upset, with no desire to return.Such a shame that bad service has ruined an otherwise lovely place.

57.description: Great place to sit and relax. However the food is not that great and our arrive was pretty bad.  Also, maybe it's just because of the season but thy closed at 5 today not 10pm as advertised. Very nice place to sit by the water and the drinks seemed pretty good, but I wished they had better food.

20.description: I was watching Chicago's best and when I saw this place I wanna to try it out. Don't get me wrong the place is absolutely beautiful but I found it a little bit to pricey for the food they serves and they should actually better do BYOB cause their drink were just ok. Me and my boy got a wrap, crab cakes And fry calamari, All 3 things they were good nothing like wow but good.  Because is summer the noise of the bugs were extremely annoying I thought it was concentrated in that area. This is nothing rest can't do is Mother Nature but wanna to mention this if you looking for something quiet. Overall the place was ok but the lake view it was definitely A+++

36.description: Good food , very cozy atmosphere , right by the lake . Live music on weekends , great cocktails . Great escape from downtown !

14.description: Great location with a beautiful view , it looked like a promising summer Erving outdoor and I definitely didn't mind waiting 45 minutes to be seated because the ambience is really nice ! But then another 1hour and 20 minutes for 2 wraps and a lobster roll to come out is inexcusable ! The food was decent but not worth that long of a wait , also the advertising live music performance was a no show so I unfortunately left pretty disappointed as the service and the management didn't do anything about it !

29.description: Okay, not sure what's going on with the person that said this is the "biggest" Aldi ever - try the one down on Belmont and Kimball, then see what you think of this one.  This is actually one of the smaller Aldi's, yet they've done a good job of shoehorning the store into an atypical location.  They nicely offer baskets in addition to their carts (have to say that I wasn't surprised that they eventually ended up doing the quarter system here, too) but the baskets make it easier for quick trips on foot.  They're definitely catering to more of an "on-foot" clientele here than some locations.I would like sometime to time-travel to the fearsome Aldi's of the past... when they came to Michigan in the mid-90s, they weren't much different from most of what I see these days, although it's clear that they've been working on remaking that image.  I challenge anyone who's avoided Aldi for the last 10 years to stop in, esp. at a location like this one or the new one in Evanston on Oakton (where we usually go, as hubby doesn't like parking in the garage here, but I hit this one when I'm by myself), or one of the remodeled locations (Pulaski and Foster, soon Clybourn and Fullerton locations).  They're a great place for quality food at low, low prices and they now offer better and more varied produce, dairy and fresh meats than ever.  Often on a weekday morning, I can get in and out in under half an hour and under $30 for TONS of food.

42.description: This particular Aldi is SO not what I remember Aldi being like back in the day... (when I think of Aldi, I remember the dirty, smelly, darkly-lit stores that I used to be dragged to as a kid in po-dunk towns in southern Illinois. Ew.)BUT... this Aldi!? It is clean, nicely laid out, has friendly cashiers, and oh yeah... it's hella cheap! I got some great little frozen flatbreads that were delicious, a bunch of fruit/veggies that are just as tasty as the ones I pick up at Whole Foods, and a few other random items that have yet to fail me. They've got a great frozen section & tons of dairy items. Two ecstatic thumbs up.

23.description: I'm always surprised when I shop here. They now have almond milk and goat cheese pizza (!) at much more competitive prices than the nearby Dominick's. I can always pick up staples on the cheap, but remember to bring a reusable shopping bag!

47.description: When they started building that place at the corner of Broadway and Granville, I head rumors of a Trader Joe's, which was music to my ears. Then I learned that it was, in fact, just a rumor. Sigh. Imagine my joy, though, to see Aldi signage sitting inside the not-yet-open store a few weeks ago.Yes, it is a little small, but it's clean and well-lit, with wide aisles and nice high ceilings. Granted, it did just open, so let's hope the cleanliness sticks around. And while it doesn't have booze (my guess is the Dominick's lobby), it does have a solid selection of Aldi favorites at Aldi prices, as well as the random assortment of name brands (Pringles, M&M's, and Skittles stick out in my mind). And the staff has been super nice, which is always a plus.Very welcome addition to the neighborhood! Now I just need to get one of those old lady folding carts...

8.description: There is a blonde girl that works there who looks to be in her twenties but every time I go to aldi and she is cashiering, I never have to wait more than five minutes in line no matter how long the lines get. She is efficient, more than that she's fast, but still pays attention and gives you a sincere smile and "how are you" every time. She has got to be a manager or promoted because she is very good at her job. Oh and the store is great too.

31.description: I knew there was an Aldi's nearby to where I just moved -- so I was anxious to check it out. I never had access to anything even close in the Gold Coast (not that anyone there needs it anyway; I considered myself lucky to have a Jewel and a Trader Joe's!). I was scouring around for a dollar store to stock up on some "moving in" supplies and was glad to see the Aldi's on the way. So I stop into Micky D's to get me a McCafe before my little trip into Aldi. I wasn't getting much - was mainly just checking it out. It's clean, the staff is very nice and even though they were about to close, they let me get my stuff and were courteous to me. My bill only came to $6.71 and I got half & half, butter, whipped cream and corn chips! Yay! I resisted temptation to buy hoagie buns, knowing that I would prefer the amazing fresh baked bread at Devon Market. They have a very nice selection of just about everything one could need ... it's a no frills store, but I'd rather pay less for some essentials and visit places like Dominick's for stuff like fresh baked bread and home made soups. Butter is butter - etc., and I don't need to pay more for it if I don't have to. So my plan is to hit this store maybe once a month for essentials like that and continue to get the fabulous produce and bread at Devon Market.

34.description: It amuses me so much when people think that putting a quarter in the cart is somehow costing them anything... you get your precious quarter back when you put your cart back where it belongs.Obviously, the issue was not with people STEALING the carts... (the material the cart is made of costs more than a quarter) no, they put the quarter thing on the carts because people never put their carts back where they belong. The quarter system ensures that the store need not keep on an extra staff person to do the drone work of pushing carts because - well - everyone wants their quarter back.  But without that motivation they almost never put their carts back. If you've never been to an Aldi store before, you shouldn't write a review of this one. If this was your first Aldi experience, you were spoiled by this location in the beginning being that it was the ONLY location without the quarter-for-a-cart system (which is really not that complicated).If you want to save money, you'll adjust to these minor hassles which actually make a lot of sense in the end and are a huge reason why Aldi has low prices. A gallon of milk is currently $1.79.

16.description: In general I'm a big aldi lover, especially after they added all the organic options. That said, at least at this location, I would never buy the meat again. Gave it a shot once, and it was disgusting. Super tough and old tasting. That said, this store has good parking, it's bright, and has great selection (at least by aldi standards). It's definitely a good choice for shopping in the neighborhood, especially for prepackaged stuff like cereal and chips.

13.description: I'm slowly beginning to like this store.I was very opposed to paying a quarter to access a cart and a dime for a bag.Last week I received a excellent levelof customer service having to do withmy purchase of an over-ripe melon.The manager (Hada) absolutely surprisedme with her care for me as a customer.I plan to keep shopping here even afterour Whole Foods opens.

11.description: I'd give them 5 stars if they had a liquor license.  OK, that's not their fault.  It is the fault of the goofballs in the neighborhood blocking liquor licenses.  The prices are great and the quality is very good.  Shop here.

39.description: I had never shopped in an Aldi until one opened up right across the street fro me. I was a bit off put because we were supposed to get a Trader Joe's so I wasn't too happy to see the Aldi sign go up. I'll tell you in this economy its great to have a place like this so close by for the staples... with the exception of their "It's just like real butter" instead of "I can't believe it's not butter" butter type nonsense. That stuff is just crap. The prices are great and I like their no frills business plan. I bring my own bags and never have to say to the cashier "oh that's ok my milk doesn't need a bag (who the hell needs a bag for their milk anyway... it comes with a handle, right?) They have a lot of great stuff here for cheap and that is what I am looking for. If I want Godiva brownie mix I'll head down the block to Dominicks thank you.

37.description: This is the cleanest, classiest Aldi I've ever been in. They had an imported German pumpernickle bread (you know, the dark, dark thinly sliced little loaf that's about the size of a small brick?) that was absolutely wonderful. I'm tending towards broke here lately, too, so I plan on making Aldi a regular stop.

0.description: For a long time, I was too big of a snob to go to Aldi, but that just proves that being a snob is stupid. (I also thought that you could only use cash, which kept me away, but you can use debit cards, as well.)I was most impressed with the awesome price I got on the Nature's Path organic cereal -- it was less than $3.00, and is more like $6 or $7 or more at any other place.They mostly do not carry name brands - just their own house brands - but that is fine. I was so happy to find such great prices on canned good staples like beans and soup, and even good stuff like whole wheat pasta.I left the place with more food than I could carry home by walking, all for $50.The only reason I don't give them 5 stars is that more than one item I went to buy had leaky packaging -- so you need to watch out for that sort of thing. Hopefully, that was fluke. But, it won't keep me from going back. In fact, I plan to buy as much stuff as I can from there.I guess the other drawback is that they don't carry a ton of produce, but I feel like that's not their specialty.I'm still going to get most of my produce at health food-type grocers, where I can avoid shrink-wrapped, pre-packaged fruits and veggies and get almost everything organic.

38.description: I was hesitant about going to Aldi but thought I would give it a try.  A very clean, well stocked store.  The European chocolate is over half what you pay at the other chain stores.  Dark chocolate is a weakness.  The produce isn't bad but you do have to check as some items are bruised.  I would love to see more vegetarian options but for now I will be happy with the cheese selection all for around $2.  I can load up for around $30.  Plus there is free parking.

27.description: This is a great Aldi (or "Aldis" as most native Chicagoans call it). :)  The produce is always fresh, with the exception of their avocados which tend to either be rock hard or way too mushy.  I also like to stock up on their frozen seafood, namely their shrimp and salmon (way cheaper than buying them fresh) and their Bleu and Gorganzola cheese can't be beat!  The downside is there terrible selection of frozen veggies.  Well either their selection sucks or I just always come at the wrong time.  Glad this store is so close to my house.

32.description: I'm a private-label-loving cheapskate. How could I fail to love the lovechild of Costco and Trader Joe's. I appreciate the efficiencies: for a 25 cent deposit (not a fee), they save on restacking their carts; I don't need anyone to bag my groceries...Please open an Aldi in Hyde Park (and maybe Menlo Park, while you're at it)!

48.description: Soy milk: $1.35 1 lb pistachios: $4.30Limes: $.15/fruitGrapes and bananas don't look to be in bad shape. Selection of frozen vegetables is decent. Staff is friendly and helpful.A regular stop on the way home, for sure.

44.description: After several weeks of waiting for the crowds to thin and the novelty to wear off somewhat, I decided to check out the new ALDI in Edgewater.  My expectations were exceeded by the brightly - lit and - coloured interior.  Also, you don't have to go fishing for a quarter to use a shopping cart; a sensor and two security guards insure that the carts stay inside the store.  I could not help but laugh at a couple  who,  obviously , had never shopped at an ALDI before.  The pair argued with the cashier over why she would not bag their purchases for them, and then protested when they were charged for a grocery bag.  AH! ALDI VIRGINS!The store employees were courteous and I walked out happy about the total on my receipt, which was smaller than at a traditional supermarket.

24.description: I found chitlings here! Cooked it up and I was in Soul Train heaven!!

7.description: It's a pretty good store overall with good prices & convenient to the redline that has an elevator. The staff are friendly. A very big concern though is that they should put a speed bump at the exit next to McDonalds & a sign saying honk your horn. I was walking north with my baby in her stroller & car was pulling out very fast without even honking their horn & came close to hitting us

49.description: Welcome  Aldi  to your new  north Broadway location ! !   I  just visited  your store tonight  for the first time . And  although  it is smallish  it seemed to have  a great variety  of items and really nice prices too !  i plan to do a lot of shopping there  from now on !

40.description: This is the nicest and biggest Aldi ever. I cannot believe it when I first visited here. It was huge and clean with better selection than most.

30.description: The first thing that struck me upon entering from the upstairs parking lot was "oh, this is pretty small". Which it is. There is no flair and the prices are rock bottom. That being said, the things they do carry are most certainly of questionable intergrity. Not to mention with the boxes and things strewn upon and the link card club milling about I was almost positive I was going to move a box and find a body. Truth be told, if I DID find a body I would have given Aldi 5 stars. I did not, nor did I find this place to the mecca of saving that everyone pointed it out to be. I can go to dollar general and eat cheaper but I promise my GI system wouldnt be happy so I'll stick to Jewel for now.

46.description: All I can say is, finally.  Anyone who knows me knows that I am a tireless Aldi fanatic.  No, it's not the greatest grocery store in the world, but it is top three, and the only one you can get this far west.  This store, however, blows the regular aldis away.  While I'm a little sad they didn't end up getting their liquor license (Although maybe it'll come later), and they don't have the quarter carts, the rest of the store is more than sufficient for 5 stars.I don't know how much of it is that everyone working there was new, but the staff were helpful to those who needed help, and the cashiers were still cheerful, even an hour before closing.The produce section is fairly standard; you won't be finding anything too exotic, but for your standard fruits and veggies, everything's there, and in good quality.   You'll also find the standards for meat, bread, and frozen goods, all priced significantly lower than Dominick's down the street.

1.description: I LOVE Aldi and I love this store.  It save us about 50% of the same amount of food at a regular grocery store and almost all of it is name-brands with different packaging or European imports.  I love how they have everything you might need but then every week they have a new selection of gourmet foods and other goodies.  It's like Christmas every time you go shopping.  I also appreciate that the company treats its employees better than the average supermarket.  The cashiers get to sit and I believe they are payed better too.  This results in a pleasant customer service experience - what do you know?I also love that they have a double refund guarantee - if you don't like something you get another one AND your money back.People who turn their nose up at Aldi are seriously missing out.

9.description: I just left Aldi and I am furious. One of their construction workers or who ever that man was made fun of me and said smart remarks. He tried to block a section by the carts out with a little bucket so I went around it I didn't know he was using it to block an area I could easily go around. He was standing right in front of me and didn't say anything till I had gone around. He then said are you serious? Why would you go around this and was laughing. He continued to laugh telling me how obvious it was that he was blocking it. I told him if he worked directly with Aldi and he didn't say anything. I come here all the time and for someone to laugh at me and say slick funny remarks is unacceptable. It's 11/5 10:54am. You should check who was working in your store and take action. You humiliated me.

26.description: Your not living if you live without Aldi. (I call it Aldis).I have lived on Aldi growing up. As I got older, grown folks think they should go to other places; get name brand things.Not always the case for me; some great things, if not many of them, can come from Aldi. For me, I was so happy to remember that Aldi was walking distance from my house last weekend. You can find most of what you need. The store was clean, well lit, and well stocked. Service was fast by cashiers. Line were a bit long. Note for improvement: maybe there should have two cashiers/lanes at all times on Saturdays...Anyone who shops here does not care about the above. They care about the savings. The week prior, I spend $65 at Jewel. Shopping at Aldi, $36 for the same items! I still will prefer shopping for produce at Jewel, even though a picked up some tomatoes, mushrooms, oranges and bananas this trip.Overall, I will make Aldi a part of my weekend shopping trip. Nice way to save half of my $$$ !

25.description: Really like this store, plus it's very close to my house. Also like that they sell green bags there, that I can reuse hundreds time. But careful: they DON'T accept credit cards.

12.description: Not the worst aldi I've visited, but not the best. I typically end up there when its crowded and wait 15 min in line. I don't pay the quarter for a cart, just grab a basket and build muscle!

21.description: Cheap. Clean. Efficient.Great selection for a discount grocery store.Never had a bad experience in the store or with any of the food items that I've bought here.Always my first go to spot for groceries.

17.description: I was recently laid off from my job, and while I'm not hurting financially (yet, and hopefully won't be), I really love having this Aldi so close to do my grocery shopping. I am all about saving money and this helps me achieve that.I can find pretty much everything I need for my weekly grocery shopping trip, and have yet to try anything that was less tasty than a name brand version of the same product. I even feel like the produce is decent if you compare it to a Jewel or Dominick's. Some people aren't comfortable shopping at Aldi's for whatever reason (lack of name brands, perception that less savory people shop there, etc.), but I think a lot of that is hullabaloo. I have never had an issues at this Aldi. The store is clean. The selection is good and there is this one guy who works checkout who is SUPER nice.No complaints at all.

10.description: Recent (in the last year) aldi convert. Often combine a bike ride w/shopping up north. No aldi near north side (so far....). I get a kick out of people who "dis" aldi but LOVE LOVE LOVE trader joe (look it up lol). Good for staples. Good for gourmet/foodie items if you're paying attention.

5.description: Simple place to pick up simple things. The prices aren't high at all. I'm happy to have a Aldi's in my neighborhood.

3.description: I love the location of this Aldi! It usually has everything I need and the prices are good. I don't go here often but whenever I get the chance I drop by and am never disappointed. I like that it is clean and that they are always stocked well!

35.description: I take it back. I take it all back. My like of this store held for many months. I went to Aldi, I was pretty excited. I could overlook some of the aspects of feeling like I was in a low class store and focus on the low prices ( one dozen eggs for 99 cents, cheap milk 1.50 a gallon, store brand pizza bread that tasted good, was cheap (about 1.79 etc), the cleanliness of the store, and get over it. Not anymore. I went in yesterday. I felt like that by entering the store, I was immediately classified as the type of person who is not to be trusted. Evidence for this is included later in the review.   This is not a feeling I am used to having- EVER. And not one that I ever want to have again. They have taken away all of the good; the pricing on the items that I went into the shop for, helpful employees, etc. First of all- You also now have to put a deposit on a cart. What in the name of all that is good is this about? I am not a criminal, and really, seriously? It is a frickin grocery cart. I need it to store the items I plan on purchasing, as I have short T- Rex arms and cannot carry much. Screw you. It is just a quarter, but, come on. REALLY???? The next issue: 1. Eggs. Eggs were 99cents a dozen. They have raised the prices by 1/2 and as of Sunday, when I shopped, they were 1.49. no thanks. I can get that pricing at Dominick's. Target is cheaper too. And guess what? I can get a cup of coffee at both of these places! HA bonus. I do not have to pay for a cart either! 2. Milk has radically increased in pricing also.    It was 1.50$  Now, it is at least .25-40 cents more- in six months.  Really-- is the economy improving that much?  I do not think so!  Dominicks is lowering prices.  Aldi is raising them! I did not buy any- so I cannot give an exact quote, but good grief, Aldi- get your head out of the dimly lit place it is currently residing. 3. I shopped on  Saturday afternoon. They had 3, tres, three cashiers on duty. Yeah. I waited in line for about 25 minutes. What a pain in an uncomfortable place. 4. The produce sucked, bruised, tattered looking peaches for 59 cents each.  WHAT a bargain!!  Expensive, not worth it. Go to edgewater produce. What a crock of poo.  My opinion? Take your new store concept and throw it in the garbage. It is a big fat pile of fail. Once I got home, I tried to call and talk to the manager. No store numbers are published and you cannot get them through directory assistance. I called the headquarters.  I spoke with someone.  I even spoke with the area manager.  Yeah.  She informed me that they often have specials when new stores open.  She also told me that they had dropped the price of eggs.  Oh wow!  Glad I did their comparison shopping for them!  What a crock! So- I guess the "new store specials" were the milk and eggs.  Now it is buyer beware!I was a fan, supporter, and general endorser of this store. Not anymore.  (I had decided not to write any bad reviews, but this galled me.  I broke that decree.  )

19.description: I guess coming to Aldi is a big no no to certain people.  I really don't mind since they do have a good stock of decent affordable food.  The location is always clean and I like their cashiers, who are incredibly fast.  I will keep shopping here no matter how much people look down on affordable food.

28.description: Ok you don't go to Aldi expecting the quality to be fantastic but this Aldi is dirty!  I cannot bring myself to buy any produce there (and I have bought produce at other Aldi's) because I have seen flies circling the onions.  The selection seems smaller than other stores and this place is always packed and there is always a long wait.  I was excited when this place came to the neighborhood but I'll make the trek over to California for the clean Aldi.

45.description: I love you Aldi!  I'm just sad this hadn't opened when I still lived it Edgewater.  This Aldi is so clean and bright.  The prices are amazing and you don't even have to remember to bring a quarter for the cart thanks to the new fancy magnetic technology or what not that locks the carts.  I had forgotten how cheap Aldi was compared to the South Loop Jewel and Whole Foods.  There's tons of treats for $0.99 and the selection of brand name foods, refrigerated, and frozen foods section blows away all the other Aldis I've been to.  If I had no restraint (or a car to lug it all home) I so would have thrown tons of stuff in my cart like...Crab RangoonPringlesMini Milky Way BarsBuy one get one FREE BreadFrozen Cream Cheese Stuffed WantonsAldi LunchablesCoffee CakeGallons of Milk for $1.49Bouquets of Roses Shredded Mini Wheat BitesAnd so much more.  This is by far, the best Aldi I have ever been in.  They don't take credit cards, debit only, but it's a small price to pay when I'm getting so much food for so little money!  Please stay here forever...and procreate lots of other Aldi stores in the city!

33.description: I love the Granville Aldi.  I have become a total fanatic in this down economy, but am grateful I discovered this place because Jewel is a black pit for money and I feel robbed every time I leave there. Now Aldi is of course the poster place for the low end grocery store, and many  aspiring college educated kiddies in the city skip over this gem for that reason.  First off you have to know that Aldi's is owned by a different branch of the same family that owns Trader Joe's.  Trader Joe's does not disclose who manufactures their preprepared food items- perhaps because the same items are being packaged for Whole Foods, but also I imagine because those same manufacturers want a share of the lower markets too- the Aldi market.  Aldi does not put their food out in displays, instead their dumped out in the boxes they came in.  They don't have a lot of people working there, and you will always wait in a long line.  You will have the mad dash to the counters where you'll bag your own groceries sometimes in the very same boxes that were left out in the store.  And perhaps worst of all you'll never know what foods they'll carry on a certain day.  Once I couldn't find whole cream there, sometimes certain meats aren't out.  However you can stop at Dominicks or Jewel on the way back and pick up the specialty items.  I always expect a second stop when i go to Aldi's.  But believe me knowing I'm cutting my food costs by a third gives me enormous pleasure.  This Granville store is clean and yellow and brightly lit.  Be friendly to the cashiers- they stil have to count their change out by hand, and they're rushing everyone through as fast as they can.  You'll see all sorts of people there, but shouldn't arouse your latent classism too strongly.   Identify what are staples on your grocery list, recognize that brands have infiltrated the entire way you view food, and buy those items at Aldi's.  It's a game to see how far you can shop there. The Coconut popsicles are excellent, the ground turkey a total steal for chili recipes. And I've had my limits-no deal on the spaghetti sauce guys!    But believe me the deal they have on colored peppers always snags my eye.  Rice krispies taste the same in any box they come in, and you can drink your gallon of milk in one setting when you know it didn't cost $3.50.  Breads, nice cuts of meat, esoteric spices-  you'll have to hit the big stores for those.  But the bulk of your items for a DIY cook can be bought here.  I make a game out of how much I saved, adding up the tacked-on dollar here and there that you'll find when you're at Jewel.  And best of all you'll really start feeling like an urbanite who doesn't let the money vacuum of the dictate what you do!

43.description: Ok, so I've been in other Aldis in the city and found them cramped, overcrowded and generally not the most pleasant shopping experience.  I realize you don't go shopping at Aldi for an upscale grocery shopping experience, but the last thing I want to do with my limited free time is to deal with a maddening store while trying to pick up some discount groceries.  However, this brand new Aldi location in the first floor of a condo building might just be the nicest one they have.The location is good, very pedestrian accessible and right around the corner from the Granville Red Line station.  It features very high ceilings, neatly stacked boxes of goods, a well stocked fresh produce area and the staff has been friendly.  It is not a big store nor do they carry everything you need to make a gourmet dinner, however, if you are looking for staples, basic produce or other items that really don't matter what brand it is, this is a great place to shop.  Bag of flour for $1.40 and 10 cent limes...take that Jewel and Dominick's!  The peaches were a bargain and very fresh.  I've added the Edgewater Aldi to my list of stores that help keep my grocery budget in check.  I recommend bringing along your own reusable shopping bags as Aldi charges you for their bags.

2.description: I go here before I go to Whole Foods for my organic foods. It is almost unbelievable how many organic selections they have: coconut oil, seasonings (these are new as of Jan 2016), chopped kale, grass-fed beef, chicken stock. They also have uncured bacon and a line of active foods like multigrain flatbread or turkey sausage. They have pretty much every modern marketing niche (gluten free, organic, world flavor, healthy) effectively served at an unbeatable price. Don't be fooled by the quarter-operated carts, you won't get nickeled and dimed here.

18.description: This is a good place to do some cheap shopping. The quality of most of the stuff they sell is pretty good. However they do not sell fancy stuff like whole foods or trader joe's. They do have some good fruit and meat. A bit of everything. I like this place very much. Lines are long sometimes so thats a bummer. You have to either bring your own bags or you can buy bags there for like cents. Cereals, cookies, milk, cheese, they got everything. Give it a try if you can but do not expect this brand names that you are used to.

41.description: Corn flakes: $0.99.  I'd visit Aldi for that reason alone.  It's also a pretty short walk from my place (5-6 minutes, tops).There are other great cereal prices, too, as well as decent produce.  Oh, and eggs for $0.99.  As someone else noted, it feels like a dollar store.I'm favorably impressed with the whole presentation.  Nice addition to the neighborhood...It doesn't have everything, of course, but that's why we have TJ's, Whole Foods, and (in extreme cases) Fox & Obel.  I really wonder why anyone would bother with the "middle tier" of Jewel and Dominick's.  There's booze, yes, but they don't seem to bring that much else to the table.

4.description: I'm a big fan of the store.  While they don't have a comprehensive selection (though they do have a broad one), what they do have is often fairly priced and definitely cheaper than Mariano's.  In addition, they offer a selection of household items and kids stuff that changes on a weekly basis.I regularly buy only a few items, but this one is conveniently located for me.  It's also helpful that they always have next week's sales flier available at the same time as the current sales flier.  Even better, no damned coupons or hidden sales!  (I'm looking at you, Mariano's, Target, CVS, and Walgreens, who all have coupons available on their website, in their fliers or booklets, through social media that you need to print, etc, etc, rather than just having sales easily accessible to everyone or steady low prices.)Another huge pro is that the sales checkout is often lightning fast, only slowed down by the customers.  The cashiers are really quick and accurate, and I'm glad the store allows them to sit.  Not having aching feet probably helps their speed.The store is always clean, items are in stock the majority of the time, and the staff are very helpful.  They have walkie-talkies, so if they don't know the answer to a question, they're easily able to ask someone else for the answer.Now if only they'd price their 2 liter Pepsi/Coke at the same level as the CVS and Walgreens nearby...  Please Aldi, you'd save me a shopping trip.  :-)

6.description: I'd been told for years "Go, shop at Aldi!" Did I listen? No. I could have been saving money all this time?!First thing that grabs me is the vegetable chips, that usually sell for $3-5 a bag, for . . .  .89. That's 89 CENTS. You can't even get a mini bag of standard potato chips for that. And they are goooooood.I steered clear of the prepared stuff, the mac n' cheese, canned soup, frozen dinners - crap like that. I've just cut it out of my diet. But if you like that sort of thing, it's really cheap.I stuck to the staples. Condiments (their mustard is great!!!), pickles, flour, spices, hot sauce (tastes just like Frank's Red Hot). Almond milk is at least a few dollars less than at most groceries.A few things were cheaper than the other stores, but not cheap enough to go way out of my way. But if I'm there, hell yes, I'll pick these up. Eggs, some cheeses, coffee.Produce: I got some REALLY nice lettuce. I love lettuce, and yeah, it's a weird thing to like, but there you have it. Also their tomatoes looked good. Not a tremendous, exotic selection of produce (Oh, no starfruit. Damn.), but for the standard stuff you can eat every day this is the place to go.I'll go back for the hamburger, canned tomatoes, paper products. Pro tip: real, working chefs shop there. Don't be a snob.

22.description: The first time I went to an Aldi was the one by the Target near the Wilson red line station. That Aldi had really horrible produce so I vowed never to go again. The second time I went to an Aldi was with my friends when they wanted to pick up a few items at the Aldi in Wicker Park or Bucktown. That Aldi was a little bit better than the one near Wilson. This particular Aldi on Broadway happened to be right next to the Granville station near my apartment so I thought I'd stop by to check it out. The produce was so-so, but it was 10 times better than the Aldi near Wilson. This Aldi does not have moldy fruits and vegetables. I still didn't purchase any, but I found that milk and eggs were really cheap. Aldi may even be cheaper than Costco! Did you know that Aldis and Trader Joe's are owned by the same people?? Someone told me this once and I didn't believe them because of my prior visits to Aldi's. I still don't know if I believe it, but Wikipedia confirms it. If this is the case, then ok, I guess I can trust that the milk and eggs I bought would be okay to consume. And I guess I can trust the meat I just bought on a second visit here too. I clearly thought I was too good for Aldi, but it managed to embarrass me when I got to the cash register and the sign clearly said that they only accept cash, debit cards, and link cards. NO CREDIT CARDS. Um, I am not a link card recipient. I had about $4 in cash on me, and I don't make a habit of carrying my debit card around so I ended up having to ask the cashier to take out an item (luckily I only had a few items in my basket) so that my total went from $5.17 to $4.26. Yep, I'll be stopping by for cheaper grocery items when I have cash...

15.description: The first time I went to an Aldi was the one by the Target near the Wilson red line station. That Aldi had really horrible produce so I vowed never to go again. The second time I went to an Aldi was with my friends when they wanted to pick up a few items at the Aldi in Wicker Park or Bucktown. That Aldi was a little bit better than the one near Wilson. This particular Aldi on Broadway happened to be right next to the Granville station near my apartment so I thought I'd stop by to check it out. The produce was so-so, but it was 10 times better than the Aldi near Wilson. This Aldi does not have moldy fruits and vegetables. I still didn't purchase any, but I found that milk and eggs were really cheap. Aldi may even be cheaper than Costco! Did you know that Aldis and Trader Joe's are owned by the same people?? Someone told me this once and I didn't believe them because of my prior visits to Aldi's. I still don't know if I believe it, but Wikipedia confirms it. If this is the case, then ok, I guess I can trust that the milk and eggs I bought would be okay to consume. And I guess I can trust the meat I just bought on a second visit here too. I clearly thought I was too good for Aldi, but it managed to embarrass me when I got to the cash register and the sign clearly said that they only accept cash, debit cards, and link cards. NO CREDIT CARDS. Um, I am not a link card recipient. I had about $4 in cash on me, and I don't make a habit of carrying my debit card around so I ended up having to ask the cashier to take out an item (luckily I only had a few items in my basket) so that my total went from $5.17 to $4.26. Yep, I'll be stopping by for cheaper grocery items when I have cash...

20.description: I thank the grocery gods for Aldi and I'm SO happy to have one so close. They have a huge selection--I can shop here almost exclusively--and the staff is very friendly and SO efficient (take a lesson, Dominicks!). I find their items to be as good or better quality as name brands. The produce at Aldi is way better than Dominicks or Jewel. If you're not satisfied with an item you get a refund AND a new one of that item free. Also great chocolate and coffee. Wow, I almost forgot, try the bacon-wrapped filet mignon: less than $2 each--delish! My only complaint is this location (Broadway at Granville) doesn't sell alcohol (the locations that do have it have some nice wines at great prices...I'm a big fan of their $4.99 Riesling). Aldi, I love you :)

36.description: Okay, so I will admit that I was disgruntled when I found out an Aldi was going in that location rather than a Trader Joes, which is one of the reasons I held out from going for so long.  However, there's not a lot of options in the neighborhood.  I gave in and have had a mixed experience.  The best analogy I can think of for Aldi are those weird Bugs Bunny clones that came out of the radioactive carrots.  They look kind of the same but it's just a bit different.  The packaging is designed to look familiar and everything in the store has that weird imitation quality about it.  It was a little spooky at first-- not that I'm a pretentious name-brand-only kind of person-- my partner calls it the Twilight Zone of grocery stores.Aldi also cuts a lot of corners in order to save money.  They charge you a nominal fee for bags and don't hire people to bag for you.  There is no shelving and everything is just stacked in it's warehouse packaging, which makes everything look like- surprise- a warehouse (a very clean and well-lit warehouse though).  For staples like salt, crackers, cereal and other basic things that likely come from the same factory as the name-brand, Aldi is an amazing resource.  Still, I'm wary of their produce, meats and dairy.  Basically, anything that has an expiration date.  They are, however, really good about giving refunds on products that aren't what they should be and they gladly refunded me for some salsa that gave me food poisoning.  Not that I would ever buy salsa from them again.  I don't entirely distrust their cheap bell peppers or eggs, but for things like that I'd rather spend the extra money and get organic or cage-free.

14.description: so apparently being full of tattoos makes you a criminal or thief i had the security guard follow me through the whole store... every step of the way he was my shadow. i can't even go grocery shopping without being stereotyped or judged...

28.description: I have bought 2 beautiful furniture pieces from Cassona, as well as a statue named Gorda. I love the furniture in this store. They were delivered very fast and on time. However, I tried to purchase an ottoman and placed the order. I put a deposit down and waited the 6-week estimated time. Then, I was told it would be another month. Then, I was told after that, another month. And so on, until 8 months passed and I finally got my money back because I was tired of waiting. The people are nice there, but the store needs to cut off their suppliers who can't produce. The store worked with me to decrease the cost for the delay and offered free delivery, but enough was enough. I'm bummed because I liked the ottoman. Long story short, I think the furniture is top notch. I wouldn't buy anything that wasn't in stock.

1.description: To begin, I do not yet have my couch but I have to compliment Cassona just for the experience of shopping for a couch.  At the beginning of my visits to the store it was just to enjoy the beauty of everything.  All the pieces are amazing!I visited this store many a time with various friends and family members - they agreed with my assessment.  Then there's John and Angel.  No matter the time or day I was there John and Angel were ready to help and just as ready to stay out of the way.  My father brings his own measuring tape holstered to his belt.  Angel remarked "They don't need our help. This man came prepared!"   However, their help and advice is invaluable and they think of every detail of which I had no idea could be involved in a couch. I'm fully confident that I'll love my couch and I'll update when I get it.

9.description: I've had nothing but excellent experiences with Cassona:1)  I purchased a Rowe sofa from Cassona a few years ago that I absolutely LOVE!  However, I've had some issues with the springs.  The parts are under warranty but full warranty service with labor is expired on the sofa.  I reached out to Cassona to ask them if they could assist me with figuring out how to get it repaired, and Alma not only first contacted Rowe and found out all of the details about what was and was not covered, and how to handle things through ROWE, if needed, but she actually spent the next month getting quotes from local repair shops and was able to help me find a very inexpensive, but highly qualified, in-home repair person.2)  I purchased a coffee table that was marked down to sell, first they gave me a huge discount on the delivery, and then, when the delivery person was out sick, Alma showed up with a young man from the shop.  They brought the table to me in her vehicle and assembled it for me instead of making me wait and reschedule with their delivery service.I love their interesting and beautiful furniture, and I can't say enough good things about their service.  This is truly a fantastic place to shop for furniture!

29.description: Lots of the standard, practical furniture pieces most people need at least a few of (yeah, I'd love to fill my place with Eames and Nelson, but I've got two college educations to fund) but lots of unique stuff.If you want something funky and modern but of decent quality, this is a destination store.  I fell in love with the chair/bench made from a gathered bundle of vertical wood.  Now that you know I'm not a furniture or architecture critic, check out the photo I uploaded - yelp.com/biz_photos/O4Xq….  This chair was incredibly comfortable and designed like nothing I've ever seen.Prices are fantastic!

23.description: We've been in Cassona several times since this past summer.  Even though the first few times we were just browsing, we were greeted in an extremely friendly manner and made to feel welcome.  There were some great art prints that I wanted but just couldn't afford this past summer.  Yesterday, I walked in to find the paintings I wanted at a 30-40 percent discount.  I bought three.  The two gentlemen who work in the store are very personable, will chat with you about a multitude of topics, and be genuinely interested in anything you have to say.  I really love shopping and supporting local businesses; I will go back to Cassona and purchase other items as I can afford them ;-)(fyi-their fashionably classic items even non-sale priced are reasonably priced, but I'm on a budget)

5.description: Just moved to the area and walked by the store a couple times. Window had great items so we went in. We really liked a lot of pieces, but I'm so indecisive so we went in another 4 times. Each time the staff was amazing, patient, helpful but not at all pushy. They gave you their honest opinion and let you go from there.  Angel and John are amazing. Finally on the 4th time in, we purchased our sectional sofa. John was so incredibly patient with me as I walked around the store a million times, carrying swatches all around, then he stayed late to make sure our order went in on the same day.  I highly recommend this place and plan to be back to get more items very soon.

31.description: Gorgeous furniture, v. unusual. Well made, sturdy - really unusual, creative pieces here.

25.description: Purchased an ottoman/cocktail table from here and was told 6 weeks for delivery got it in 3! very helpful and friendly sales staff. I will be buying more furniture here in the future.

12.description: This is the first place that I check when I need any new furniture.  I bought my first "grown-up" sofa from John last year and have been a loyal customer ever since.  The reason is because of the staff (John has been my main salesman) and the care that is given to make sure that everything is perfect from the initial order to any issues that might come up once the pieces are in your home.  The prices are fair, the selection is great, and overall it is a fantastic place to find your new furniture.Michael B., Lincoln Park

21.description: Who knew Andersonville had such cute shops?  Not I!  I need to head up this way more often, if only to come to places like Cassona.After brunch Sarah B and I walked around for a bit, and we popped in here to look around.  They have lots of great modern but classic furniture (which is what I like) at really inexpensive prices.  I immediately found many, many things that I loved...  but then my wallet remembered I'm unemployed.  (That's *really* starting to crimp my style, yo.)I actually found some really cool coasters that match some prints I have hanging in my living room so I ended up buying them since they were so inexpensive.The man working here was SO nice, and fun to talk to.  While we browsed and I admired a couch he pointed out some fun features of it (yeah, I'm SO coming back for it when I get a job!), and while he checked me out we talked about traveling.  When I said I was German and Irish, he laughed and said I must know how to party.  Hehe.  He was super fun, and I'll definitely be coming back here when I have paychecks again.

16.description: I love this store. The guys are really helpful. I usually spend a lot of time lurking before I come to a decision about buying a piece of furniture. I made my first "adult purchase" of a sofa from here a little over a year ago. Good, clean lines. I haven't had any problems with mine, but was assured that if there were, I could contact the store immediately for resolution. Today I just received delivery of my new coffee table. Delivery guys 15 minutes early even! They put the table together quickly with no fuss, and I am now typing out my review from the comfort of my awesome lift top coffee table!

17.description: I recently bought a sofa here. Angel was super helpful when picking it out. There are a lot more things to choose when ordering than I had planned for, but they made it easy to do. The sofa is made in 'Merica, which is nice, and was custom made shipped in 6 weeks. The quality seems very good, and the guarantee was also pretty solid. They will replace the foam basically forever if it ever sags. The price was pretty decent too, certainly not IKEA, but quite a bit cheaper than Crate and Barrel and the like, and it looks great.

10.description: I bought my furniture from them and they have such a great staff!

11.description: Visited these guys twice over the past week (2 weekends in a row).  Worked with the manager (Angel).  He was very pleasant to work with, really just a nice experience.  They have a great selection of high quality modern furnishings and accessories.  Very reasonably priced as well.  I wish we had discovered this place earlier on in our shopping process, we likely would have bought a decent amount more furniture from them.

26.description: We bought a large furniture item here, and the price and service were great.  The price was not the cheapest out there, but the people that work here were so nice and helpful that it was worth the extra money.  the cassona in evanston is also good, though I think the selection in andersonville is better.

27.description: I recently purchased a love seat and end table from Cassona. The love seat arrived 2 weeks early and everything looks great in my apartment! Good selection and the guy that helped me was very nice. This seems like a locally owned business so it felt good supporting a neighborhood retailer over a big chain.

0.description: After a nightmarish experience trying to buy a bed at Roy's (seven months after placing my order, we still didn't have anything, and they were dodging calls and emails), I emailed a bunch of other local Chicago furniture stores to see if any of them could special order the same bed.  Within 30 minutes of hitting "send" I received an email back from Alma, the owner of Cassona.  She said she could special order the bed, quoted us a price, and, after telling her about our problems getting the bed at Roy's, she "guaranteed" us that she could deliver the bed within 10-12 weeks and PROMISED that we would be completely satisfied with Cassona's customer service.  Even though the price was more than at Roy's, the reality was that Roy's price was irrelevant:  if they couldn't actually deliver the bed, then the incredibly low price didn't matter.  Despite not having stepped foot in the Cassona store, we took a chance and trusted Alma to make good on her promises.  She clearly wanted our business, seemed very organized and professional, and had the benefit of excellent reviews on Yelp to reinforce what she was promising us.The result:  Cassona has absolutely earned our business from now on.  And I say that despite the fact that we actually had some bumps in the road.  Not only did Alma stick to her delivery promise, but she was actually able to get the bed here earlier than expected.  Unfortunately, when the bed showed up, there was some damage to it (from the factory).  I informed Alma, sent her some quick cell phone pictures, and she promised us she'd get the damaged part replaced.  A few weeks later, a replacement footboard arrived (again...it had to be special ordered, so it wasn't like she could just swap it out from Cassona's own warehouse).  Unfortunately, that one was damaged as well (it was clear that there was a quality control issue at the manufacturer that had nothing to do with Cassona.  Because it was a special order, there was no way to check for damage before it arrived).  Shocked that this could happen twice, Alma kicked it into overdrive and worked with the manufacturer to get a second replacement footboard expedited, and in the end, we ended up with the bed we wanted.  It looks great and we're completely happy.Despite this longer-than-expected process, Alma provided AMAZING customer service.  She regularly emailed us with updates and kept us informed on progress, and even when she went on vacation, her staff picked up right where she left off and continued to stay in touch.  They were completely organized, and there was never a point where we felt like we had been forgotten about.  Each time we had a delivery, Alma was able to get us scheduled very quickly, and her delivery guys did a great job (they showed up on time, and were very efficient). Ordering furniture can be a bit of an adventure, and special ordering makes it even more so.  All you can ask of a retailer is that they keep their promises, do their best, and treat you properly.  Cassona did all of that.  The damage problems weren't their fault:  all they could do is react to those problems as quickly as possible and try to make things right.  And that's EXACTLY what they did.  If not for the manufacturer's quality issues, Cassona would have delivered the bed several weeks earlier than promised, and that's how they should be judged (along with how they worked to resolve the problems).  That's why I wanted to leave such a thorough review:  they deserved to be acknowledged for their excellent efforts.  I would ABSOLUTELY order from Cassona again, and if you're reading this, you should too.  They will do everything possible to make sure you have the best possible experience.

20.description: I really have to give props to this place.  Our sales guy, Angel, was not only patient and not pushy, he was truly helpful in assisting us in choosing some nice pieces, even dissuading us from several things because he didn't think we should spend that much, etc.  The best part?  After having already ordered a bed, sofa, and chair from Pottery Barn, we walked out with the same -- plus a rug and two lamps -- for $800 less than we spent at PB for those three items.  (Needless to say, I cancelled my PB order and went out for a nice dinner!)  Anyway, SUPPORT this local business -- you'll get a better deal, too.

19.description: Stopped in the other day just to take a look around. They have a pretty good selection and some comfortable looking items. Also, the prices seemed reasonable. What I liked best was the staff. The guy was SO amazingly friendly I felt like I was on a hidden video show or something. Maybe it was the Zombie Pub Crawl that put everyone in a great mood. The guy definitely earned Cassona a spot on my "friendliest places" list

2.description: John - you the MAN. This review is dedicated to John at Cassona. And so begins my letter (only slightly dramatized for effect).Dear John,Before I walked into Cassona I had the fear of the sofa gods wedged deep in my soul. Wash codes? Mid-century styling? Rolled arms? What is happening? Please no. You saw me for the deer-in-the-headlights I was and adapted accordingly. You did an outstanding job of giving me your best suggestions based on what I liked. As time went on, and you thought I could handle it, you slowly gave me information about why the couches you had suggested were high quality. All the while being patient with my naivety and indecisiveness. It was perfect.And in the end? I purchased an outstanding sofa. (Mid-century light grey with WS wash codes for those of you playing at home.)Thank you John!All my best,MattMy suggestion to you, reader? I think you know that I'll be back.

18.description: Lots of the standard, practical furniture pieces most people need at least a few of (yeah, I'd love to fill my place with Eames and Nelson, but I've got two college educations to fund) but lots of unique stuff.If you want something funky and modern but of decent quality, this is a destination store.  I fell in love with the chair/bench made from a gathered bundle of vertical wood.  Now that you know I'm not a furniture or architecture critic, check out the photo I uploaded - yelp.com/biz_photos/O4Xq….  This chair was incredibly comfortable and designed like nothing I've ever seen.Prices are fantastic!

13.description: While walking to Starbucks one day I went in here to browse and saw a beautiful painting that I was thinking I had to have. I talked to the staff and they were SO nice it was unbelievable how comfortable he made me feel. I came back with my GF so she could see how beautiful the painting was and he let me put money down and pick it up later. I finally got it home and it looks beautiful in our space. Highly recommend!!!!

4.description: We have had our Rowe sectional from Cassona for almost a month, and are very happy with it.  It seems like the reviewers here, on the whole, have already nailed it: Angel and company are terrific. They're experts, and they really try to make you an expert, so that you can make informed decisions. I walked out of Cassona really feeling like we made a sound, informed decision, and I cannot say that about a lot of places. A truly rare, pleasant and ultimately rewarding experience.

24.description: Got a couch and chair here with the fabric I wanted for about 1/3 the price of Crate and Barrel / Room and Board equivalents.  Delivery was prompt and as promised.A minor complaint - when they delivered the couch it baaaaarrrrely fit through our hall and scratched our wall.  Their initial call was to tell us that "our delivery driver told you it was a tight fit and you said to go ahead so we shouldn't be responsible."  Well, there was a language barrier there, so I'm not sure how that conversation could have occurred.  I just hate when, before getting the whole story,  a store manager sticks up for their employee at the expense of the customer.It took a couple of weeks, but at the end of the day the owner from the Evanston store came by to look at the minor damage and it was fixed appropriately at no cost to us, so was just a small deal in an overall smooth transaction.  If I needed something else to furnish my place I would probably check Cassona first and hope for another good deal.

6.description: I'll preface this review by saying this was among the last stops we went to when looking for a couch.  We tried everything from large chains to other small boutiques and everything in the middle.  John Zotti is by far the most helpful sales associate I have ever met in the history of my furniture buying life.  He went into specifics about the quality of each different manufacturer without being asked and possessed a level of knowledge that others did not come close to as well as informing us of what to look for if we were to buy elsewhere.  The store carries manufacturers that you can find in other local stores (Younger, Rowe, etc.), but the prices are comparable and the customer service is second to none.  If you want to find a great sofa and receive a free education on what to look for - go here and ask for John, you will not be disappointed!

22.description: This is a place that I really really like their style of furniture.  But there were some issues with out couch that caused the drop in price.My fiance and I buy a couch.  We select the style and fabric really really fast.  We already did research online and knew what we wanted.  Then we go and put a down payment.  We are given a 6-8 week window for our couch.  3 weeks pass (we're on vacation in Oklahoma visiting her family), and we get a call saying that the fabric we chose is from a fabric mill that is closed.  So we head back to Cassona right after we get back home.  We are informed that the manufacturer did not even start building the wood skeleton to put the fabric over so once we select the new fabric it will be another 6-8 weeks.  Then comes 4th of July week and the furniture maker is closed that entire week, and apparently that does not count as part of the 6-8 week deliverable window.All in all we get the couch about 12-14 weeks after we ordered it.  I do not think I will purchase from them again, unless there is a dirt cheap price.

15.description: As my sister-in-law (and fellow Yelper, Elizabeth W.) said when she saw my Fiancée's and my condo for the first time, "Ahh, to be gay and fabulous...!"Well, I owe Cassona a thank you for the fabulous part!Having a partner who is a director of interior architecture makes picking out decor or furniture extra difficult.  While I love modernity, I also value comfort.  Decorating our new condo was not going to be an easy task.After chatting my favorite Yelper, Nicole V., we visited Cassona to look at their furniture pieces.We worked with Cassona's awesome duo, Angel and Jon, in selecting, personalizing, and purchasing a sofa.Our gorgeous klein sofa sectional was made of a tough and edgy, yet soft fabric, had an extra wide chaise perfect for naps or cuddling, and a possessed a modern look while still providing back support and having various pillows.  After our couch was delivered, we returned to Cassona to check out a bed frame we had seen.  Sure enough, we fell in love.  Our king sized bed frame was hand-crafted and stained by the talented Canadian manufacturer, Huppe.  We chose the Silk design due to its natural walnut material, and the headboard with five joint sections (or reveals) which peek through to the wall behind.  We felt obligated to also purchase two nightstands ("his" and "hers," if you will) which attach to the bed frame and float above the floor giving the entire piece a 'feng shui' feeling of warmth and relaxation.Cassona kept us up to date with when our furniture would arrive to their store and when it would be delivered to our condo.  The delivery guys were quick in setting up the pieces, cleaning up, and describing any details about the pieces (i.e. how to separate and combine the different sections of the sofa).Best of all, other than what has already been stated, they LOVE Yelpers.  I saved 10% off my entire purchase (trust me, it added up) simply by checking in to the store on the Yelp app.  I'm all about a good deal!  If you're looking for beautifully crafted, creative furniture pieces, be sure to visit Cassona.

7.description: Really like the contemporary yet warm-homey furniture, art and accessories here! I returned twice in two days!

8.description: In pursuit of a couch for our new apartment, boyfriend and I wandered into Cassona yesterday afternoon and did some test sitting in couches. We had previously had a really rotten day of couch shopping at discount stores like Ashley, The Room Place and Value City Furniture, etc. These places did not have fabric options and I found, perhaps surprisingly, not that much cheaper than Cassona .... plus most of the couches were ungoldy uncomfortable and certainly of a lower quality. I wanted a gray couch which is apparently impossible, IMPOSSIBLE I tell you, to get at these aforementioned discount stores. Walking into Cassona I was presented with at least 3 beautiful gray couches plus tons and tons of fabric options. All the couches were very comfortable too, it was quite hard to decide since I was finally faced with beautiful couches in fabrics and colors I loved that had actual lumbar support. We ended up deciding on a 3 person sofa with chaise. The chaise is moveable/removable as it comes with a long cushion and an ottoman underneath that can be moved to the middle or other side of the couch, plus an extra cushion if you want to remove the ottoman entirely. The versatility to change the couch is a great option. The couches all seem to come with 2 accent pillows too and we got to choose through many many more fabrics for those. What I liked most about Cassona, other than the beautiful and not absurdly expensive furniture, was the helpfulness and honesty of the staff. John helped us yesterday and offered lots of helpful tips in choosing a couch and a fabric, explained the different kinds of fabric and how they wear and should be cleaned, explained the warranty and didn't pressure us to purchase. It was nice not feeling uncomfortable about coming back the next day to think it over through the night. We did in fact come back today and the owner helped us place our order and answered more questions. Everything about Cassona is class, from the style of furniture to the care from the staff. Quite a different experience from Ashley Furniture and Value City where I didn't have a singe sales rep offer any information on how the fabric wears or how one should clean it etc. I cannot wait for the couch to arrive! Living around the corner I will definitely be popping in to check out other pieces from time to time.

30.description: Fun furniture, great accessories.  You will not find repeats of items found here- in other stores.  Some very interesting wall hangings hand created by traditional artisans in Mexico.  Fantastic colors in bed linens, custom orders.  My favorites?  Incredible, heavy, but well designed ceramic wall tiles in these funky red/mocha and bit of pumpkin colors with leaf designs. Sounds strange I know, but a fantastic accessory, they had 3 different tiles, at 19.95 each, they were an absolute steal!  I WILL be back!!

3.description: Jessica and I love working with the Cassona team - Alma, Angel, and John. They are very friendly and really know their stuff! We like that they work with domestic manufacturers as opposed to big box stores that source primarily from overseas. Not to mention, you can customize to your liking.We purchased a couch earlier this year and have been very pleased with the quality of the piece as well as the service delivered by the Cassona team. John guided us throughout the entire process from design to caring for the fabric.Currently, we are taking a look at purchasing a leather accent chair. We stopped by the shop last weekend to take a look. Alma and Angel took the time to educate us on the leather varieties and provided us with a couple of great options. We are so excited to purchase within the next few months!!Always a pleasure to stop by, say hello, and see what's new in the store!

14.description: I just received my couches today . The customer service is good in the store not so great by phone . My order took a lot to be delivered . The quality it's average  to be honest I was expecting better quality. I will update my review once I get more use of my couch .

12.description: This store offers lots of entertainment for both a one-year old and a 30-something.  One of us definitely had so much fun because we explored the entire store and in the aftermath, nearly all of the stuffed animals were pulled off the shelf.  Out of sheer embarrassment, I don't think my niece will take me back ever again.  However, when she's not looking, I'll sneak over all by myself.  The toys are that much fun.  Look out stuffed animals!The free gift-wrap with your purchase is a super perk.  It's not cheaply done, either, with nice ribbons and paper.  I despise wrapping, so for that alone, I'll shop here.Go play!  Just promise my niece that you'll pick up after yourself and don't tell her you're going without her.  Oh, and if you think you saw me in there by myself, it never happened (shhhh!).
