1.description: I like Golden Pacific for two reasons:  they always have what I'm looking for, and the staff has always been really friendly and helpful.  The store isn't big, but they manage to fit in a great variety of products.  And not just one of each, they'll have a selection of everything, sauces, noodles, pastes, whatever.The staff has always been eager to please, answer questions, and in general making me feel welcome.  It's nice to have a "one stop shop" when we're making an Asian meal.  Note while there is a parking lot, it's very small.  Street parking (or walking if you're close) might be a better idea when it's busy.

55.description: needed mayonnaise. JAPANESE mayonnaise. so i hiked up here after work last night.cool little store! i got the kewpie mayo and some other fun snacks and the japanese soda with the marble in it...in peach...my favorite.if i would have had more time, and a car, i would have gotten more stuff...some of their frozen stuff looked great!check it out!

9.description: They have a wonderful selection of herbs. They even carry things that I probably wouldn't know what to do with... Essence of durian? What? I was amazed and amused at the same time. They carry several different brands of natto (Japanese fermented soy beans), and I was tempted to buy a box that I remember seeing in my sensei's fridge once (she had a house party and we put stuff into her fridge for later) but perhaps next time when I'm feeling a little more adventurous. The market also have at least two different types of canned guava juice (Philippines is one of the brands). They carry all sorts of canned food items, some of which I've never seen before and my family used to work in the food import/export industry. Wow. With all that said, however, they lack a lot of fruits and vegetables. They have a great selection of frozen food items, but their meat department is a little poor. Also, their noodle section is a bit disorganized. I would still go to Tai Nam (located a little south of Argyle) for fruits, veggies, and meat.

26.description: I don't think fresh produce and meats are their forte. There's some selection of fresh vegetables, some of which are herbs that I don't see in any other stores in Argyle. The fresh meat section is small and quite limited. They do however stock up on many specialty non perishable Asian items that is rare in the Chicago area. I go to Golden Pacific for their taro ice cream, Malaysian shrimp paste from Penang, Indonesian snacks and even belacan, which is a pungent Malaysian style fermented shrimp. They also have the freshest and cheapest selection of shallots in the neighborhood, unlike the refrigerated and damp shallots from other stores in Argyle. Oh, I even found the miracle Kom Kom slicer here, which is the perfect tool for making green papaya salad. They have since replaced it with the imitation kind though. Do come and check it out.

25.description: What a great store!  Friendly and helpful staff, amazing selection, clean, well-stocked...just an all-around great place.   I was looking for something from Indonesia to serve to elementary school students as part of a cultural studies program, and found some yummy "sweet banana roll fried" (the kids loved 'em) and even got some suggestions (and samples) for what to serve when we study Thailand!Oh, and there is a parking lot in back.  No idea if you're actually allowed to park there, but I didn't get towed or ticketed!

12.description: I love this place.  Every once in a while, I get a hankering for noodles, curry, sushi rice and some strong Thai basil.  They have all of that here, in a variety of sizes and for great prices.  Their selection of snacks is also impressive, even if I'm not sure what they all actually are.  The older gentlemen is very helpful, and can answer any specific questions as well as make sure you know what you're buying at the checkout counter.  The parking lot is very small, but it's hardly ever full for long.  Their produce section is small, but has the standard fresh herbs, limes, coconuts, and root veggies.

59.description: I agree with many of the reviewers here that this place is one of the best in terms of selection and cleanliness.  What everyone missed however, is how old the items are or can be(i am talking about non-produce). I did an extensive walk-around in the store, and every piece of merchandise but one (which i bought) had their "best by" date COVERED with an English translation sticker.  That is EXTREMELY sketchy.  That is purely unacceptable.  Most likely (prove me wrong please) the stuff sold there are all expired.  I was inclined to give only one star, but their produce is decent, and that's about the only thing I would buy there.  And believe me, I know my Asian food.

21.description: I went here last night for the first time and was very impressed!  I have a roommate that recently moved to my neighborhood from Chinatown.  We love to cook Asian fare in our household, but needed a new place to pick up the basics.Overall the selection was great!  I have to admit that I didn't even know what a lot of stuff was, so next time I might go in with more of a dish in mind or battle plan.The store was really clean and the staff were very friendly.  I am sure that I will be making regular trips to this store and hopefully as time passes I will be more adventurous when choosing items for dishes!

17.description: I was excited to find soy bean sprout with bean attached came from Phoenix Bean LLC, different kind of Tofu (too bad why I cannot find very soft tofu??),  Daikon radish which is just OK looking but great price!   I have to spend fortune to buy one of these not-so-great looking Daikon at Whole Foods (which is one of my favorite vegetable)!!  Great find not too far from home :-)

10.description: Clean and not as crazy busy as some of the other markets in this area.Excellent selection of Thai products:  Soy sauces, shrimp paste, pickled veg.  Also had Kaffir lime leaves!  Good selection of produce.  Stock up.  Large frozen section is worth a look.The staff was very helpful!If you can't get a spot in the small parking lot, park on the street (metered) just south, next to Jewel.

5.description: Golden Pacific Market is a gem. First off, is clean. Like, really clean. I have never been into a cleaner Asian market. I wanted basmati rice. I was at Jewel, since it was right there after my trip to Pier-1. However, Jewel sucks and was out of basmati. GPM had bags of basmati that weight as much as my bed for $20. They also had good looking whole fish, herbs, produce. Tons of frozen animals. It's a good place. I would recommend it.

3.description: Clean, organized, and nice staff. They probably don't have all the variety of the larger places to the south, but they have the basic ingredients (including vegetables, spices, oils, sauces and starches) that I'm usually looking for without having to navigate a crowd.

35.description: I love this place. They have so many great products for super cheap. There are tons of items that I never knew that existed before. They sell boxes of 100 packets of tea for $3. There are many, many hot sauce options, hard to find cooking oils such as coconut, affordable tofu, Asian produce, and much more. They sell huge bags of rice. Make your dollars stretch further at Golden Pacific Market.

19.description: Love this place! Saves me a long trip to Chinatown, and I can almost always find all the Asian ingredients and produce I need. A lot of southeast Asian ingredients in particular, but also have Chinese, Japanese, and Korean things too.

28.description: I'm always searching out new places to buy my Japanese groceries from in the city, and I've discovered a real pearl. A little off the beaten path is my newest find, Golden Pacific Market. It's just north of the Jewel there, tucked into a narrow lot, and it's one of the best sources in the area I've found so far for Japanese food products. Entering under the dark green awning, walking up and down the aisles, I was surprised over and over at the number and variety of Japanese items, like furikake; there must have had over half a dozen varieties of these seasoning mixes that we use to top rice with. Score!What else caught my eye? Japanese style fresh and pickled daikon, renkon, and takenoko (radish, lotus root, and bamboo shoots)! Several types of nori, and my favorite brand of katsuobushi (dried shaved bonito). Plus, they have loads of other Japanese ingredients,  beverages, and snacks. Oh, so many snacks! I found my favorite "maruboro" cookies, little round crunchy / melt-in-your-mouth treats! I had to tell myself to stop before I bought one (or three) of everything.The store is well-organized and clean. Also importantly, there are NO funky smells, which is a huge plus for me. Their prices are fairly low, especially compared to my gold standard of Mitsuwa. I will return many times, to be sure, and will start recommending Golden Pacific as a good source of Japanese groceries in the city. Lest I forget in my excitement, there are many other types of groceries from all over Asia here, too. Fantastic variety!Parking seems to suck, with only a few spaces in front, but I have to admit that I haven't asked the owner if there is more parking in back. It's just up the street from the Berwyn red line stop, though, if you public trans-it.Now, pardon me please while I go eat my beloved maruboro cookies, and leave you with this question from the package: "Dafune Rabbit - How Rabbit Feels?" I dunno. You tell me *munch munch*

45.description: The worst Asian grocery store in Chicagoland.Store is very organized and clean , however, all products are very OLD.Frozen foods are 2 or 3 years in the freezer.You must check the expire date before you buy.

33.description: Nothing compares to getting authentic Asian ingredients without going to Chinatown. This store is right around the corner from where I live. I accidentally went in there once day and was really delighted to find a bright, airy store with clean, wide aisles. Most Asian grocery stores pile up so much stuff on the shelves and in the aisles that it is really difficult to move around. I also happened to find Indonasian peanut satay and salad dressing which I haven't seen at other stores. Couldn't have been happier. When I was young, my Dad, who was born and raised in Indonasia made chicken satay, yellow rice and some other traditional cuisine for me. Now I live thousands of miles away from him. Finding these sauces brought back many sweet memories. I also found some of my favorite childhood snacks like sun dried plums, saseme rice balls. I brought some dried plums to work and "bribed" a coworker who's working with me on a project. He ate the entire bag!Last but not the least, what separate a great grocery store from the rest is the produce section. They only offer a selected list of produce, mostly Asian vegetables. Although the selection is limited compared to Jewel or other western grocery stores, the price and quality for those they do offer are unbeatable. All in all, a very well managed Asian grocery store with characteristics usually associated with other western counterparts (wide, clean aisles, bright, airy).

43.description: I like this store for the most part, but it does suffer a little from the same problem a lot of small grocery stores do - turnover.  Shopping here is pleasant, they keep good lighting and it doesn't smell bad.  But as others have pointed out, sometimes things are older than they should be so watch the expiry dates. If it wasn't for the expired-by dates problem, this place would be five-star.  And, if I lived closer, I'd still probably shop here a lot.

2.description: Awesome little Asian grocery store. Great finds for Thai spices. We also find Thai spicy holy basil which is so hard to find, it made my wife's day :) They have a little parking area too!We found some Thai red rice which we love.Good selection of snacks too as well!Very helpful and friendly staff.

18.description: I went here last night for the first time and was very impressed!  I have a roommate that recently moved to my neighborhood from Chinatown.  We love to cook Asian fare in our household, but needed a new place to pick up the basics.Overall the selection was great!  I have to admit that I didn't even know what a lot of stuff was, so next time I might go in with more of a dish in mind or battle plan.The store was really clean and the staff were very friendly.  I am sure that I will be making regular trips to this store and hopefully as time passes I will be more adventurous when choosing items for dishes!

41.description: I used to like Golden Pacific Market but there have been a series of snafus that make me question shopping there.As many have pointed out, it is a much cleaner and nicer (just not stinky) smelling Chinese market compared to the other markets on Argyle. But it also has marked up prices and I have learned after two times to never buy ground pork there because it turns smelly by the second day in the fridge. A lot of its vegetables are bruised but you can't tell because they line nicer ones toward the outside of the bags. And I wonder where they purchase the vegetables because of the amount of dirt on them.I am now afraid of the frozen isle because I saw the owner place all the frozen dumplings into open air freezers when the shelf freezers experienced a power outage. When I poked at the dumplings, many of them have already half defrosted and I knew he was going to refreeze and sell them again. Whoever bought those would have had dealt with a plate of dumplies that were all stuck together, not to mention possibly spoiled. I now try to shop at the Tai Nam market off of the Argyle stop on Broadway. But they don't scale their fish... :(

52.description: This is your one stop Asian supermarket stop. They carry vegetarian jerky , which is under $2 a bag. They also have a huge selection of seafood both fresh and frozen. Good selection of fresh meat too. Sauces and snacks galore. I am used to going to small storefront Asian supermarkets so this really blew me away.

50.description: A large, nicely organized, clean asian market. The employees are friendly and helpful. Their selection of japanese food is higher than most markets in the argyle area, which is a big plus for me, personally.

4.description: Hey!  What's that hiding behind Jewel?  Oh cool, it's another Asian grocery store!Set a few blocks north of the Argyle Chinatown, Golden Pacific Market always seems to me somewhat removed from the action, and so the place almost has a hidden gem kind of feel to it.  While the mobs are ringing up hundreds of dollars in supplies over at Tai Nam, shop in peace and relative safety over at Golden Pacific.The prices do seem slightly higher than even the nearby competition, but as another Yelper pointed out, they carry more southeast asian (Filipino, Indonesian?) stuff, making a trip over here pretty interesting if you're looking to try a new kind of instant noodle, candy, or snack.  For most Chinese grocery items they're pretty likely to have you covered...unless you're looking for fresh soymilk!

6.description: Good produce selection, for Southeast and Far East Asian cuisines.  Nice selection of frozen seafood.  The aisles are sorted (somewhat) by region and culture.  I found a choice (not one, but a selection) of Filipino soy sauces.  Good assortment of Eastern canned fruits, canned fish, sauces and soup bases, noodles, and pickles.  Only a good variety of spice and a fair selection of rice.  Some rice steamers for everyday use.  There's a pretty wide variety of Asian stuff, but the concentration is Sino-Southeast Asian ingredients and condiments.  Very clean and neat. Limited parking in front (7 medium to small cars, or two SUVs dependent on driver skill), weekdays there's some street parking very nearby.

22.description: i make a trip here every in the beginning of the cold season to stock up on supplies for different variations of tom yum soup.  i always end up spending, like, $50 on things in addiction to the things i really need.  a searched far and wide for fresh kaffir lime leaves.  i even went to china town.  in all, i went to about 17 stores.  and here, like a light from heaven, i found them here!  and boy were they worth it! tip: if a recipe calls for them, DO NOT think you can omit them...

15.description: I'm always searching out new places to buy my Japanese groceries from in the city, and I've discovered a real pearl. A little off the beaten path is my newest find, Golden Pacific Market. It's just north of the Jewel there, tucked into a narrow lot, and it's one of the best sources in the area I've found so far for Japanese food products. Entering under the dark green awning, walking up and down the aisles, I was surprised over and over at the number and variety of Japanese items, like furikake; there must have had over half a dozen varieties of these seasoning mixes that we use to top rice with. Score!What else caught my eye? Japanese style fresh and pickled daikon, renkon, and takenoko (radish, lotus root, and bamboo shoots)! Several types of nori, and my favorite brand of katsuobushi (dried shaved bonito). Plus, they have loads of other Japanese ingredients,  beverages, and snacks. Oh, so many snacks! I found my favorite "maruboro" cookies, little round crunchy / melt-in-your-mouth treats! I had to tell myself to stop before I bought one (or three) of everything.The store is well-organized and clean. Also importantly, there are NO funky smells, which is a huge plus for me. Their prices are fairly low, especially compared to my gold standard of Mitsuwa. I will return many times, to be sure, and will start recommending Golden Pacific as a good source of Japanese groceries in the city. Lest I forget in my excitement, there are many other types of groceries from all over Asia here, too. Fantastic variety!Parking seems to suck, with only a few spaces in front, but I have to admit that I haven't asked the owner if there is more parking in back. It's just up the street from the Berwyn red line stop, though, if you public trans-it.Now, pardon me please while I go eat my beloved maruboro cookies, and leave you with this question from the package: "Dafune Rabbit - How Rabbit Feels?" I dunno. You tell me *munch munch*

57.description: This is by far the cleanest and most well-stocked of the Argyle-area Asian  markets; well-lit and with a friendly staff.  Still, though, the meat and especially the fish is a little.. daunting, both by smell and appearance.   And yes, the items are a bit old:  the curry paste I bought just three days ago had a sell-by date of 2005, and the fish sauce's time ran up a month ago.  Not that these are things that actually, you know, spoil... but it's still a little disconcerting to buy something that's two years in the red, even if it's nothing but spices and salt.

20.description: I wanted to like this place. Coming from Toronto, I was eager to find an Asian supermarket near where I now live in Edgewater.  I needed some red curry paste so I walked over this evening only to find the doors closed for Chinese New Year.  I stepped up to the door to take note of their opening times and noticed some movement in the store.  A dark shape, like a pocket dog, running across the aisles in the darkness. I only saw one rat, about a foot long. I will not be back.

36.description: I buy Asian grocery all the time. Though I can't complain about lack of hygiene sometimes when the prices are that cheap, I have to say I cannot shop at this store anymore. I bought a pack of boneless chicken and it was absolutely rotten when I opened it at home. The management needs to pay attention to produce because I guess quite a few people like this store and it would be sad to see it lose business due to staff's negligence.

14.description: Golden Pacific, you make me think about cheating on my usual place on Argyle!  You mix it up, you aren't dirty, AND you are fresh.  When I don't want to trek it all the way down Broadway, this little place is my spot.  There are only about 6 parking spots, but since the traffic is less crazy than Argyle, I haven't had a problem yet.  The frozen section and spice mixes have everything from Indonesian to Thai.  The candy section isn't bad either!

58.description: I came here at about 10 a.m. on a Saturday and ordered a mocha and funfetti cupcake. Funfetti Cupcake: Frosting is perfect, light and buttery but not overly sweet. Cake was moist and delicious.Mocha: Made with Intelligentsia Coffee and really just hit the spot.Atmosphere: There are sturdy window tables and a large open front window. I was able to grab a table right next to the window. Awesome.Really a good experience here.

56.description: Earl gray raisin scone is amazing!

29.description: I am big big fan of Lovely, Too from the latte, to the pastries, to the sandwiches to the BACON POTATO SALAD.  Not to mention I can sit her pretty much all day working and never feel rushed or distracted.  All the employees seem very nice and helpful. For a bakery/deli/coffee shop, I am pleased on all levels.  Thanks Lovely, Too for being so awesome.

42.description: This place has great sandwiches, drinks, and pastries.  Sometimes the pastries are a bit dry, like they were from the day before, but overall it does the trick.  Lots of tables to sit at and free wi-fi, but the downside is that some of the staff are just straight up awful.  Usually on weekends there are some younger men working who are chatty and super helpful, but now and then I get the female workers who are just ridiculously rude, almost like they are going out of their way to be rude rather than that's just their normal state.  If I were the owner, I'd get rid of these ladies and find some who enjoy their job and helping others.  This is the closest shop to my house, so I often come here, but I do most definitely avoid it if I don't see some of the nice staff members working.

23.description: We moved to the area 4 months ago and we love Lovely!  They have good pastries (cinnamon roll, peanut butter cookie, monkey bread!!) and it's just a nice place to sit and have a hot drink during the winter (which is the current season!). The staff are quiet and easy going.  The place is always clean and quite. Our only grief is that they don't open as early as Starbucks so sometimes we have to go there instead of supporting local. Either way, this is a nice place for a cup of coffee, a pastry and some relaxing or studying.

47.description: i love this place but i can't FREAKING STAND THEIR LIDS!!! my coffee spills on my shirt everyday at work. seriously what am i supposed to do buy coffee from this place and then pour it in a cup from dunkin donuts across the street?lovely - you make great baked goods and coffee for a really reasonable price. i and your customers would be willing to pay more if it meant not spilling your product all over our clothes. please buy new lids.

8.description: A full array of freshly prepared pastries. I have tried several. The muffins are dense but moist and the fruit filled varieties burst with flavor. There are four or more croissants to choose from, both sweet and savory. Bite into their crispy layers and savor the buttery moist insides. There are many more pastries as well as sandwiches and quiches. Great place to meet up with a friend after a walk on the lakefront.

31.description: I love their quiches and coffee and everything here! Nice atmosphere with a lovely view of the street. The sunshines through the windows in the afternoon and gives it a warm and homey feel. The music in the background is spot on. Im sure you'd love this place once you walk in

34.description: I am a sweet freak! Cookies, donuts, cupcakes-oh, the choices!!A friend and I stopped into Lovely after a heavy brunch.  After all, our delicious meal did not include sweets.I purchased a variety of cookies and a blondie bar.  My visiting family has declared the cookies to be delicious!  I have enjoyed 1/2 of the gargantuan blondie bar and it's only been a hour since purchase!So thrilled to FINALLY duck in and try them out!

16.description: I'm not sure about this place. Perhaps the configuration of the seats or the ordering process or the location of the napkins and silverware, or the weird taste to the water that is available. The turkey sandwich I ordered was decent. The mixed greens side felt a little "out of the bag." It took a long time to get both. And only after an inquiry. And I was pretty hungry.Here's what gets me about this place. I am a non-coffee drinker and wanted a diet coke. I saw regular Coke. I inquired, do you have Diet Coke? "Nope, just regular." "Well," I said, "Are you trying to say that High Fructose Corn Syrup is somehow a preferable obesity causing toxin to aspartame as a neuroexciter?" Flew over the heads of the absent hipsters attending to my order. It took two of them to figure out how to swipe my credit card. Really? I mean if you are going to make a holier-than-thou decision on behalf of your customers like that, at least don't be a hypocrite about it. Those muffins aren't that great for your health either.I got water instead. Lemony weird water. Regular water not available. Only apparently forcefully flavored water. The place was overrun by table hoarding laptoppers not really ordering anything. That's an annoyance of mine, particularly for a place with minimal seating. I'll pass next time.

13.description: I am a sweet freak! Cookies, donuts, cupcakes-oh, the choices!!A friend and I stopped into Lovely after a heavy brunch.  After all, our delicious meal did not include sweets.I purchased a variety of cookies and a blondie bar.  My visiting family has declared the cookies to be delicious!  I have enjoyed 1/2 of the gargantuan blondie bar and it's only been a hour since purchase!So thrilled to FINALLY duck in and try them out!

11.description: We decided to get our wedding cake from Lovely Too because we live in the area and we could not be more pleased with the entire process! Trisha, the Kitchen Manager and Custom Cake Specialist was so kind, friendly, and accommodating! We decided to get a pumpkin cake with "nearly naked" frosting and cream cheese frosting layers and it was SO GOOD. The delivery to the venue was on time and delivered by Trisha herself. We had a tasting with Trisha a month or two before and communicating with her was great through the entire process. It was nice to work with a smaller bakery because we felt like they knew us personally and that we were a priority. All of our guests loved the look and taste of the cake! Thanks Trisha and Lovely Too!!

39.description: This cute little bakeshop is just lovely. Oh wait, that's their name. Well honestly, they live up to it! The decor is trendy, but not too loud. Plus there is plenty of seating. I stopped in with a couple friends on a morning after some crazy drinking so I was definitely struggling. However, after a delicious donut and a chocolaty Mocha, I was ready for the rest of the day.

37.description: I recently won a box of yummy baked goods from this shop in a silent auction.  So YUMMY! and not only were their treats yummy, I totally love that they donated their items to a local arts festival.  I will be back to get more!

0.description: I got a mix of cupcakes, brownies/bars and cookies for a party I threw for some friend's and asked the the bakery to decorate them. OMG they were AMAZING!! The decorations were beyond cute (it was an "Independent woman/Divorce" theme) and they were so creative, artistic, and I really couldn't of asked for anything more! Plus all the treats were super duper delicious! Highly recommend!!

38.description: A quick walk from the lakeshore this little gem is a welcome respite from the transitional neighborhood. Slip in here for a perfectly executed cappuccino and any number of delicious baked goods. The place is cute, clean and quiet and decidedly modern. I had the blueberry muffin and it was perfecly moist with just the right sweetness. The coffee was so well made I was pleasantly surprised (I'm ridiculously picky about my coffee). Most customers were working or visiting with a friend. Lots of tables and a good ability to combine smart tables into a larger one. Seems like the perfect spot for a work meeting. That said it Sunday so check it out on a weekday before taking my word for it.

51.description: Lovely, Too is awesome! The employees always serve their customers the freshest cupcakes available, and that one hipster dude is really hott ;). THUMBS UP.

27.description: Rarely am I sold on a place after simply walking in.  The coffee and the pastry were excellent.  The counter service was personable.  Apparently they bake their own bread and make fresh butter?  How nice is that?  Important to me, it has that we care feel.

32.description: I love their muffins that look like mini upside down Bundt cakes. The pumpkin spice muffin, which isn't too spicy (that's a good thing in my book), is particularly moist and indulgent with a sweet cinnamon glaze! Part of me wishes they would drizzle a glaze on the blueberry muffins. I'm thinking: a slightly lemony glaze. But then again, I'm glad they don't, because that would be trouble for me!

54.description: Solid little bakery replaced Flourish. I popped in for a Red Velvet Whoopie Pie and coffee and it was tasty enough. Free Wifi. Pleasant, relaxed atmosphere. Lots of tables, and good light.Though, I have to say, I still like - and this is MY opinion - the coffee better at Zanzibar down the street. The decaf was a little metallic. I'd recommend this place, though, if you are in the area and are jonesin' for a little sweet somethin'-somethin' as I was. Glad they are here, and I'll be back.

48.description: Adorable shop with plenty of seating on a weekday afternoon, pleasant atmosphere, and much better than average chai.  But we're not here to talk about that.After living in England for a year, my standards for scones are fairly high - most places in the U.S. (and, let's face it, London) don't put a lot of care and attention into scones, and they end up in a weird netherworld of too sweet and yet too savory or too dry and yet too dense.  So the earl grey raisin scone was a gamble for me, especially since I generally think raisins are just ok.But I think this scone has changed my life a little bit.  It's soft and moist but still a little flaky, the golden raisins are still soft, and the glaze isn't terribly sweet.  And tastes like earl grey tea.  And is huge.  This scone has made my day (which might tell you more about my day so far then about the scone, but so be it . . . )That last star will have to wait until I've had a chance to sit down and do some work there, but it's looking very promising.

44.description: Just stopped in for some treats. Did not see one smile from the people behind the counter. They are quite expensive and the $2 donuts I bought literally fell to pieces when I took a bite because they were so dry. Just horrible. The chocolate chip pb cookie was great though. All and all not worth the drive and parking situation.

24.description: I stopped at Lovely, too today. I ordered an old fashioned donut. Well, it was a really nice texture, it was very soft. It was maybe a little too soft. Now, I think baked goods need salt. This donut really didn't have any salt, or much salt. I don't make the donuts, so I'm not sure. I think these donuts could be great. The vanilla bean was nice. I also ordered an Americano. It was fine. I asked if they made pour-over or how they made their coffee. The barista looked at me like I was a complete dick and became rather rude after I asked. No thank you or anything after I tipped and signed my check. Also, during this whole exchange with the barista, another guy came over that worked there and asked him if he was ready for his cigarette. He said, "I would love a cigarette." Then I saw him walk out the front door and smoke his cig. Boo, Lovely, too. You have such a cute shop. It's a good location. Your employees are not friendly and the food and beverage were just ok. I would go back and try it again as long as I didn't have to deal with this rude guy.

7.description: The cupcakes are refrigerated and therefore dry and tasteless, the coffee is meh, and the food is hit or miss. The service could be a lot better. Last time I was served really cold tomato bacon soup, the time before They didn't ring up my muffin and they were super busy so I let it go and didn't get to eat breakfast, and the time before that we waited 20 minutes for coffee because they forgot about us. The "veggie melt", and "the lovely" are really great sandwiches. I also really like the toast and jam flight that they have...that's pretty cool and very affordable. I keep supporting Lovely because I like my money to go into local businesses and they have some really great food options, but they need to get it together. 9 times out of 10, I go in there and their employees looked bored or pissed off that they're being inconvenienced by helping me. It's just not a pleasant experience.

49.description: When looking for a little coffee shop with pastries this past weekend, I wanted to go to Lovely, Too just because of the cute name. I'm a sucker for a cutesey name! The shop is quite adorable, just the right size with very friendly workers and a lot of options in terms of baked goodies. I decided to get a bunch of things because...I like sugar. Nomnomnomz.Their Brownie ($2.75) was quite big and a bit cakey. I wish it were more ooey gooey and yummy nummy in my tummy.I got an Old fashioned chocolate donut that I had for breakfast the next morning. I paid $2.50 for this donut but looking at my receipt vs. the menu it looks like I was incorrectly charged for a scone and normally their donuts are $2. It was a bit dry and I wasn't a big fan of the flavor on it. The frosting thinly circled on top was a bit gooey yet dry instead of soft and creamy. Not a fan.Their cupcakes are small, boohoo. The prices ranged from $1.75-$2.50 which isn't bad at all!The Chocolate Peanut Butter cupcake had smooth airy frosting with not much flavor, the cake was awfully dry and not super filled with flavor -  but the peanut butter dollop in the middle of the cake added a bit to it.Pumpkin spice - Best item of the bunch that I got. Had a yummy, very light & airy frosting on top of a very well spiced cake with no dryness at all.The Double chocolate cupcake was also not as dry as the first one I tried and yummy but I can't say they knocked it out of the park for me.I'd definitely go back to Lovely, Too for the atmosphere & some warm beverage but I think I'd try some new & different items.

40.description: Anyone who knows me knows that trying to make sense of my eating habits is impossible. They are weird and contradictory at best. For example, I like cobbler, but don't care for pie. Confused? Yeah, me too.My partner-in-crime, one the other hand, adores pie. Instead of a birthday cake, I decided to surprise him with pie. I ended up going with Lovely for a three reasons: (1) he likes berry pies (out of season), (2) they offer mini pies and (3) they were open on Mondays. Lovely was perfect, many of the other places I checked out required I special order a full-size pie.The only knock I would say about the whole process was getting in touch with the right person. I called the original location only to be directed here. When I called Lovely Too, I was told to email, which bounced around once more. I ended up dealing with Trisha, and once I got to her, everything was easy as pie (pun intended).On his birthday, I picked up two of the most adorable mini blueberry pies. Even though pies aren't really my thing, I was talked into a few bites and they were delicious. I tend to find pie crust dry and bland, but this was quite good; it wouldn't turn me into fan, but I could be persuaded to enjoy a slice now and again.Had we not planned a day of gluttony, I easily would've walked out of there with some of their other baked goods. If they taste as good as the pie I tried, I won't be disappointed.

53.description: Excellent coffee and pastries. I usually stop by on weekends to grab a cappuccino or two and get some work done. The baristas are very nice and friendly. And they do cheap refills if you're sitting in the cafe. Inside is lots of wood (really cool exposed roof beams and high ceiling) and hard surfaces, so it can get pretty loud and reverby even if there aren't a lot of people in there, which can be an issue if you're trying to chat.Otherwise very solid overall. Consider me a regular visitor.

30.description: This place is at best mediocre. Tasted two different pies, both  were okay, but the  crust was a little tough even after it was heated up. the coffee beverages are just average. if you're  the neighborhood the place is fine otherwise there is better available.

46.description: This is a great little spot for coffee, tea, food, sweets, and studying!  There is always a mix of people here on Saturday who are chatting or working silently and it really works.  They play the music loud enough to even it out so that if you are studying you aren't caught up on someone's conversation next to you. I can't really comment on coffee, I mean I know good coffee and bad coffee and this is the GOOD stuff!  I usually get a soy latte and love it.  Recently I've tried the bottomless cup of coffee, which is nice for an all day study session. What really pushes this to 5 stars for me is 1. service.  Everyone who works here is so nice and respectful and just generous.  I really enjoy coming here. and 2. the sweets. OMG - if there is monkey break, GET IT.  Also, their croissants are just heavely.

1.description: As much as I miss the scones and breads at Flourish(their predecessor here), I initially wasn't impressed with this place. On my last few visits, I think this place has been delivering for me more, as far as pastries and desserts go. I'll have to try their food on a future visit.Anyway, the things I have tried such as brownies, linzer(I think that's what the German pastry I tried was called), and I think jalapeno corn bread or something along those lines was decent. I wish their closing time was slightly later just like the closing times were for Flourish, but I won't deduct them a star over that.I'll reserve the 4th star, once I see how their regular breakfast and lunch sandwiches, soups, and melts stack up. If it's as good, I'll up my rating of this place. So far so good, and it's at 3.5 for now.

55.description: Let me tell you this: If you think Lovely's pastry case is epic, wait until you let them make you a custom wedding cake. So here's the deal: My partner and I didn't want the cliche kind of roses/tiers cake for our big day, so we went to Lovely for something epic and they DID NOT disappoint.I'm telling you right now,  EVERY SINGLE one of my guests asked me how a peanut butter and jelly cake could be so dang good and not taste like a kid's lunch. Seriously, the cake tasted like the most delicious 5-star gourmet treat I've ever had. The peanut butter ganache was on point and the jam was just as wonderful. OH, and let's not forget the decoration. Our theme was travel and they BROUGHT IT -- one with a globe cake that would blow Martha Stewart's mind and another that was a suitcase cake that literally looked like a real life leather suitcase. Basically, what I'm saying is these guys are the cake whisperers. They made my wedding cake dream a reality. Actually, they really made the wedding such a success with their hard work and devotion to making my cake order the best. (But, seriously, THE PEANUT BUTTER AND JELLY CAKE -- You will not be disappointed with it!)

9.description: The coffee is delicious as well as their scones and croissants. High in price though which is a down side

26.description: I go there before church on Sunday's. What a gem! I'm a huge coffee snob and I was delighted to find not only do they brew ipsento, but the brew it excellently. O don't live close but am putting this on my list of go to coffee shops for an afternoon of calm reading or meeting up to chat with a friend. I hate when coffee shops are packed full or don't allow adequate seating. Lovely, too truly offers what every bakery and coffee shop should: a refuge of caffeine with friendly staff and mismatched furniture

25.description: I'm not sure about this place. Perhaps the configuration of the seats or the ordering process or the location of the napkins and silverware, or the weird taste to the water that is available. The turkey sandwich I ordered was decent. The mixed greens side felt a little "out of the bag." It took a long time to get both. And only after an inquiry. And I was pretty hungry.Here's what gets me about this place. I am a non-coffee drinker and wanted a diet coke. I saw regular Coke. I inquired, do you have Diet Coke? "Nope, just regular." "Well," I said, "Are you trying to say that High Fructose Corn Syrup is somehow a preferable obesity causing toxin to aspartame as a neuroexciter?" Flew over the heads of the absent hipsters attending to my order. It took two of them to figure out how to swipe my credit card. Really? I mean if you are going to make a holier-than-thou decision on behalf of your customers like that, at least don't be a hypocrite about it. Those muffins aren't that great for your health either.I got water instead. Lemony weird water. Regular water not available. Only apparently forcefully flavored water. The place was overrun by table hoarding laptoppers not really ordering anything. That's an annoyance of mine, particularly for a place with minimal seating. I'll pass next time.

12.description: I ordered a cake from here for my boyfriend's birthday and I have nothing but good things to say about this place they packaged it in a way that it wouldn't get damaged, the design came out just great my boyfriend loved it needless to say Lovely Too helped me make my boyfriend feel all the more special on his birthday they have great service and with their creativity they understood just how to make the cake come out perfect.

59.description: My first time going here and they forget to make my order. I waited 40 min. for a mediocre sandwich and potato salad that was $7. All I got was a I'm sorry the cook left without making it. I will never go back here again.

21.description: This whole shop is airy and designed beautifully. There are so many great places to get coffee in the city, but I personally highly recommend this place. I'm also trying to find a great coffee shop when I'm downtown staying with my sister for a stay-cation.. a.k.a 'getting away from the suburbs weekend'. I do not want Starbucks, it's played out! There is literally one right next to her condo but I rather a small non-chain boutique coffee place.Their coffee is great and is not extremely strong. They have many different choices. There's only so much you can say about coffee. The space is very open and has nice large tables to sit and chat or study or evening have a meeting if you wanted to. The decor is beautiful and not all dark and boring and green like Starbucks. The overall environment is excellent! They have many baked goodies to choose from also, which is also a plus. Enjoy ;)

17.description: Great place to get a coffee, something sweet, a substantial lunch, and some quality work done.  Free WiFi.  Great staff.  Clean bathrooms.  Nothing to complain about it.  The Lovely Turkey Sandwich with pesto is really amazing.  I get it with the mixed greens and am always quite full.  When I have no fear of my caloric intake for the day, I get it with the potato salad with bacon, which is really quite good.  I keep meaning to explore more of the menu, but that turkey sandwich keeps calling me back.  Great, quiet spot on busy Byrn Mawr.

10.description: We love Lovely as a bakery and coffee shop anyway, but wanted to make a more distinct point about another positive: its wedding cakes!Ordering a wedding cake from Lovely was a breeze.  As fans of their Milwaukee Ave location, we'd done lunch, coffee, baked goods, breakfast all before, but we still marveled at our cake. Trisha and the cake team at Lovely worked with my wife and I to create the perfect, spare, beautiful cake.  Most importantly, all 3 flavors (that's lavender-vanilla, chocolate raspberry, and carrot - we just couldn't decide between the 3).  Our cake tasting was maybe the most fun thing we did in all of wedding planning - such a calm, easy, fun experience in the Lovely Too shopThe cake was delivered in perfect condition, on time and in great shape.  Our only complaint is that we've eaten it all!

5.description: I really want to love this place and wanted to give 5 stars. Certainly they deserve top marks for service, based on my experience. Everyone behind the counter was friendly, helpful, and made me feel welcome. I did like the turkey pesto sandwich I ordered, although I felt the red onions were overpowering. The size of the sandwich was generous and it was toasty and fresh. My red velvet cupcake however, was incredibly disappointing and I really wanted to like it. The cake was tough and dry, the frosting gummy and flavorless. So sad. I was looking forward to it. Fix the cupcake and I'm sold, though. Love the friendly atmosphere and the neighborhood feel.

3.description: This whole shop is airy and designed beautifully. There are so many great places to get coffee in the city, but I personally highly recommend this place. I'm also trying to find a great coffee shop when I'm downtown staying with my sister for a stay-cation.. a.k.a 'getting away from the suburbs weekend'. I do not want Starbucks, it's played out! There is literally one right next to her condo but I rather a small non-chain boutique coffee place.Their coffee is great and is not extremely strong. They have many different choices. There's only so much you can say about coffee. The space is very open and has nice large tables to sit and chat or study or evening have a meeting if you wanted to. The decor is beautiful and not all dark and boring and green like Starbucks. The overall environment is excellent! They have many baked goodies to choose from also, which is also a plus. Enjoy ;)

35.description: Favorite place in this area. Great place to relax and get work done. I loved their chicken salad sandwich- one of the best I have had. Service is great also!

19.description: Anyone who knows me knows that trying to make sense of my eating habits is impossible. They are weird and contradictory at best. For example, I like cobbler, but don't care for pie. Confused? Yeah, me too.My partner-in-crime, one the other hand, adores pie. Instead of a birthday cake, I decided to surprise him with pie. I ended up going with Lovely for a three reasons: (1) he likes berry pies (out of season), (2) they offer mini pies and (3) they were open on Mondays. Lovely was perfect, many of the other places I checked out required I special order a full-size pie.The only knock I would say about the whole process was getting in touch with the right person. I called the original location only to be directed here. When I called Lovely Too, I was told to email, which bounced around once more. I ended up dealing with Trisha, and once I got to her, everything was easy as pie (pun intended).On his birthday, I picked up two of the most adorable mini blueberry pies. Even though pies aren't really my thing, I was talked into a few bites and they were delicious. I tend to find pie crust dry and bland, but this was quite good; it wouldn't turn me into fan, but I could be persuaded to enjoy a slice now and again.Had we not planned a day of gluttony, I easily would've walked out of there with some of their other baked goods. If they taste as good as the pie I tried, I won't be disappointed.

28.description: Cute little cafe. They have enormous brownies & pastries. Gotta love the bottomless cup of great coffee! They make a full array of drinks as well. Staff was friendly.Nice place to come & get some work done on laptop or enjoy a relaxing afternoon treat. Will definitely be back to try their lunch menu.Location is not bad either. Literally half a block west from Bryn Mawr red line stop in Edgewater neighborhood.Within a half a block around the redline stop are at least 2 chain coffee shops. Bypass them & come here.... You won't regret it.

45.description: I love this place! My husband and I come here on Sunday mornings. The pastries are the best. The coffee drinks too. The people that work here are so nice.  I love to sit in the sunny front window and savor everything--the food, the people, the atmosphere. So glad we found this place.

33.description: This is one of my personal favorite coffee shops in Chicago. It's a quiet little coffee and bake shop right off the Bryn Mawr (red line) stop. They have a great assortment of baked goods and there's usually free samples. Their coffee is great too! I usually get a mocha (iced or hot, depending on the weather or my mood).Their staff is just as sweet as their baked treats! They have free wifi, and it's pretty quick. I love going here to have a snack and drink some coffee and read. If you're ever in the area you should hit this spot up!

43.description: The absolute best red velvet cupcakes and carrot cupcakes! Lovely, Too designed the most beautiful and delicious wedding cake of our dreams: 5-tiers and 2 layers of our favorite combination of red velvet and carrot cake with their out-of-this-world cream cheese frosting. My husband and I broke the tradition of freezing the top tier for our one-year anniversary, and instead savored every last bite the day after the wedding!       Their customer service is outstanding.  The owners and employees are some of the most hospitable, professional, passionate, and talented people you will ever meet in the industry. Not one detail was overlooked during our wedding. Thank you, Lovely, Too!

2.description: This review is for a donut and whoopie pie.  4 stars for your donut, -25 for your "whoopie" pie.  What do you call that rubbery patty in the middle of the wheat bread slabs?  This was inedible.  Please refrain from selling this, but if you insist on selling this please label it stale bread with rubber marshmallow slab.

18.description: I go there before church on Sunday's. What a gem! I'm a huge coffee snob and I was delighted to find not only do they brew ipsento, but the brew it excellently. O don't live close but am putting this on my list of go to coffee shops for an afternoon of calm reading or meeting up to chat with a friend. I hate when coffee shops are packed full or don't allow adequate seating. Lovely, too truly offers what every bakery and coffee shop should: a refuge of caffeine with friendly staff and mismatched furniture

41.description: I recently discovered this place about two weeks ago. I love going there for their cupcakes. Omg ! There buttercream frosting is so delicious! Also, service is great and super friendly! I also ordered a birthday cake it's so moist and good! I got the carrot cake with cheese cake frosting mmmm! Love it! The cake is moist and the frosting again is dying for it's not too sweet. I recommend this place.

52.description: A dry and flavorless cupcake that tasted way too wheat-y to me. Their chocolate frosting is ganache, which is too rich for a cupcake. I ordered and right in front of me the guy behind the counter said to the other "give her that one" and pointed to a plate of what was obviously yesterday's leftovers as there was one or two of each flavor. Ok, I'm right in front of you hipster dude. I don't want yesterday's old, even drier cupcakes. They look pretty but that's about it. I would skip it and save your calories for a better place.

50.description: This place is very cute, makes great coffee drinks, and always has a table open to get work done. If they had more dairy-free items or slightly healthier choices, it would be perfect.

4.description: Stepping inside this little coffee shop, you almost instantly forget the hustle and bustle going on outside on Bryn Mawr Avenue. Looking for a quiet to study on a Thursday afternoon, this place hit the spot.There are plenty of outlets and a variety of different sized tables to choose from, making this place feel appropriate for cranking out some solo studying or coming with a slightly larger party. I stayed for three hours and never felt rushed to leave which was really nice. The staff was friendly and accommodating, providing suggestions on their favorite drinks. I stuck with an iced coffee, but I appreciated the input! They have a wide variety of menu options, ranging from sandwiches to baked goods and all in a very affordable price range.  They also offer freshly baked bread which I observed a few people come in and ask for & which smelled delicious!Having spent some time in Andersonville over the past few weeks, this is the kind of place I'd like to frequent often. I will be stopping by Lovely, Too again sometime soon and next time with a friend or two!

6.description: A cute place if you're in the neighborhood, but not worth a substantial trip. They offer a variety of drinks, sandwiches, and baked goods. The serving of tea was nice and substantial and served in it's own teapot.The best baked good we tried was the turtle macaroon. It was absolutely delicious - a perfect exterior with a gooey middle. Unfortunately, the maple bacon donut was a little bit of a letdown - the bacon was great and the donut was pretty good, but the hard maple glaze made it hard to eat and a little overly sweet.In all honesty, this place also got knocked down one star for service. While I was there I saw customers being repeatedly told to wait before placing their orders, even though the barista had previously been doing nothing, while other times customers had to call out to staff because no one was behind the counter/register.

22.description: One of my favorite neighborhood haunts for coffee and treats. Amazing bacon/egg/cheese croissant sandwich, but prepare to wait and enjoy your coffee while they grow the bacon from scratch. Occasional coffee specials can range from amazingly good to amazingly different. The most recent one I  had  was an oatmeal latte that came as advertised: an oatmeal-tasting coffee beverage that was different than anything else I'd  ever tasted. Get the blondie brownies!

15.description: Very cute bake shop! I had their earl grey raisin scone and it was so delicious - I would highly recommend it. They also have a wide assortment of baked goods, from Rice Krispie treats to 4" cakes to macarons. I can't wait to come back to try the rest of their baked goods!

57.description: Potato salad is on point

20.description: Lovely Too is a great place to go to get work done. It also has amazing pastries and drinks. The almond croissants are out of this world, and I actually had a dream about the peanut butter chocolate chip cookies.

36.description: Love their take on donuts and the monkey bread is heavenly. Their pastries are all exceptional, but the cupcakes haven't been too exciting. I prefer them room temperature and these seem to be refrigerated, I guess to keep them fresh.The staff is always friendly and courteous. They all have a cool vibe about them.Really happy that we have this gem in our neighborhood.

14.description: I stopped at Lovely, too today. I ordered an old fashioned donut. Well, it was a really nice texture, it was very soft. It was maybe a little too soft. Now, I think baked goods need salt. This donut really didn't have any salt, or much salt. I don't make the donuts, so I'm not sure. I think these donuts could be great. The vanilla bean was nice. I also ordered an Americano. It was fine. I asked if they made pour-over or how they made their coffee. The barista looked at me like I was a complete dick and became rather rude after I asked. No thank you or anything after I tipped and signed my check. Also, during this whole exchange with the barista, another guy came over that worked there and asked him if he was ready for his cigarette. He said, "I would love a cigarette." Then I saw him walk out the front door and smoke his cig. Boo, Lovely, too. You have such a cute shop. It's a good location. Your employees are not friendly and the food and beverage were just ok. I would go back and try it again as long as I didn't have to deal with this rude guy.

58.description: The sauce is delicious,  don't forget to  bring  money for  sauce.

56.description: Cute, small, and without affect. Chef-owners Mike & Anne are very friendly and very talented. Service is genuine, and the food is tasty, homegrown, and adventurous without being too left-field. David's review of 3/23/13 captures my sentiments, but I can't figure out what would have earned them an extra star from him. I say five.

29.description: Loved this cute little breakfast spot! It's counter service and has a limited menu, but would love to come in for one of their special dinners some time. Lots of fun specialty local foods to pick up and bring home too which is great.

42.description: So Very Happy to have this place in the neighborhood! Sandwiches are delicious, though as on commenter mentioned, they are a bit on the small side. They should offer some side salads, etc to round out the lunch/brunch experience.

23.description: I love this place! Such a special gem in the neighborhood.The food is so good. I crave their grilled cheese with pimento spread on fresh bread all the time. I was there once when they had a special with kimchi, and the person taking my order made a suggestion I get it on my grilled cheese. LIFE CHANGING. The food is only enhanced by the variety of hot sauces in the caddies on each table. Everyone that works there is friendly and knowledgeable about the food and products they sell. They all seem to love the food as much as the patrons that frequent the establishment. It's a great restaurant.

47.description: This place is a gem. Even better that they don't have public wifi. The sandwiches feel expensive, but when you eat one you really understand why. It is really like fancy brunch food. Coffee is alright.If you want to save some money and are the kind of person who is half coming to drink half of the dozen or so bottles of coop sauce at every table, buy a delicious baguette thing and just pour it on. I don't think this should feel bad given the name of the place.It goes without saying that coop sauce does amazing work (like, as a coop that incorporates youth leadership development, etc, plus good hot sauce) and is a real treasure for chicago. Oh, they have a bunch of other great stuff there too. Did you know coop makes pimento cheese?

8.description: SBK is actually homebase to at least three excellent ventures. The shop itself makes strangely creative sammies and other breakfast and brunch plates; the sauce shelf throws out strangely addictive hot sauces and salsas; and the granola factory churns out granola so dewy sweet you want to smear it on your face if it didn't hurt.

31.description: I love this place and come here often.  I love the maple sausage breakfast sandwich.  The Sauce coffee is delicious.  The baked goods never disappoint.  The hot sauces are also very tasty.  I would give this place 10 stars if I could and it single-handledly affirmed my decision to move to Rogers Park.

34.description: Love this place! The troutmaster and the foghorn sandwiches were both delicious, and the oatmeal cream pie was amazing! We will be back soon!

16.description: This review is for their AMAZING granola/snack bars. Their Cherry ones are dairy free (contain honey) and they are SO SO SO good. tons of local ingredients and they are such a treat. I get them at Dark Matter on Western, or have also seen them at Green Grocer & Real Good Juice Co. BEST!

13.description: I get it.  I really do. They want to promote their sauces. But the way the kitchen is set up cannot handle more than 2-3 people at a time. You will be waiting for a significant amount of time. Portions and price, not in the correct ratio. Good flavor, but only for the 2-3 bites. Not enough for an actual meal.

11.description: Great homemade breads! Had the grilled Pimento Cheese spread! And a sliver of Honey pie!!!! Great staff, hipsters and grannies!

39.description: This is a slight walk from my place, but it is a nice establishment in the area.  It seems little by little, wonderful locally grown businesses are popping up in Edgewater/Rogers Park.  And my philosophy has always been to support local businesses that make a neighborhood unique and diverse.So let my start by saying the food here is good; it is the sauces and condiments that make the food even better.  I added the Green Mash-ine and Chi-racha to my maple sausage breakfast sandwich -- taste explosion!  Besides the sauces,  the coffee is worth raving about.  They use both Stumptown and Dark Matter.  I was particularly in love with the Stumptown brew -- smooth and had a nice after taste.  The service here is friendly and the staff seemed very intent on being helpful when I arrived. If there was one complaint, I was not overly fond of the plastic chairs they used for seating.  My back was aching a bit after sitting for 10 minutes.  But is only a minor problem; the ambience is nice and it is a very well-light place with lots of sunlight (don't like those poorly lit, drab cafés).With summer approaching, I look forward to another leisurely walk to Sauce and Bread Kitchen.

37.description: Went to the April Fools supper club collaboration dinner (5 courses for $50) and it was incredible!! Food was inventive and amazing! We even got some beer samples. I can't wait for more of these events!Family style seating was nice; my friend and I sat with the sister (and her boyfriend) of one of the owners. It was cool to learn more about the business and its history. Try the sauces that are on the tables! BYOB for the supper club. Order tickets early; they sell out quickly because the space is small and they have a good following. I went one other time and had a sandwich... the bread was the star, along with the cheese spread. Buy some.

0.description: Visited Sauce and Bread Kitchen after seeing it on Check, Please! and we were so glad we did!This is such a cute little spot.  We weren't sure exactly where it was as the sign isn't that readable driving by, but we did see the small sign on the sidewalk, so figured we were in the right spot.  The staff was so friendly!  They helped explain the menu and give recommendations and didn't rush us though there were a few people waiting behind us.  We ordered (smoked trout, waffles) and sat to wait while drinking their delicious coffee (I forgot which coffee they serve, but it was tasty!).  It took a few minutes to get the food, but once it did, I have to say, it was plated beautifully.  They took care with how the plate looked (and tasted)!.  The trout was delicious and had some interesting flavors (horseradish cream cheese, some pickled onions, etc).  It was a nicely sized portion, filling but not huge.  The atmosphere was very cozy with the right amount of kitsch and comfort.  I can't wait to return - definitely worth a visit.Food - 5Service - 5Value - 5Bathrooms - 4Atmosphere - 5

38.description: I adore SBK, and will miss it a great deal once my boyfriend no longer lives in Rogers Park. In a neighborhood like the Ukrainian Village, it would be easy to overlook this gem amid the sea of coffee shops and adorable brunch spots - but in Rogers Park, it stands out from the myriad delicious ethnic restaurants as the best spot for brunch or a late lunch on the weekends.I have yet to be disappointed by their sandwiches, most of which come with a wee salad, or their soup of the day, which generally comes with a few generous slices of their house-made Crumb bread. I'm not a hot sauce kind of girl, but if you're into that, you have at least half a dozen Co-op options on hand. Get anything with their pimento cheese, and thank me later.The menu is short and doesn't seem to change all that often, but that's fine when the  standards are solid and the daily specials interesting. I like that they have a prominent map showing where most of their ingredients are sourced. My impression is that the two staff members I've seen on the weekends are also the owners, and they're consistently friendly. Their prices are competitive with Heartland Cafe, but the quality is much higher and more consistent, even if their portion sizes are smaller. I've never left hungry or unhappy.With free street parking on Sunday and some of the best bread I've had in the city, you really can't go wrong.

51.description: I'm going to claim Crumb Sauce for Rogers Park because we need a place like this in Rogers Park!Adorable place staffed by really cool, nice folks. I had the apricot and ricotta toaster pastry. Ask them to warm it up for you. Delish. Also, amazing coffee that's all-you-can-drink. Ask them for decaf, and you'll get a fresh-made French press. Lots of tasty-looking local products for sale. More of a casual stop-in or take-out place than a brunch spot.  Astoundingly delicious bread you can take home. Love this place!

27.description: Portlandia in Chicago.  Outstandingly flavored breakfast sandwich on a tender crumpet with feta schmear and seemingly-handcrafted sausage.  Everything is delicious, handcrafted and not overly precious.   The baked items are extraordinary.   Small menu, order at the counter.  It's a tidbit pricey for the midwest, being equal to West Coast prices for comparable deliciousness.  Granola is strangely fantastic, with a hipster kick of pepper or something equally as quirky.

32.description: I love this place. Since they've been open I've come to know Mike and Ann a bit and they seems like nice people but this review is all about the food.The sandwiches are well thought out and quite tasty. They are also great vessels to sample the many Co-Op hot sauces that are available. There are 5 - 10 normal hot sauces available along with special ones based on some event or pepper or collaboration (I have about a dozen of them at home at the moment. I try to buy one a week but have been put on a limit so they don't take up any more space on the counter.) BYOV (vodka) and get the bloody mary setups.There are special dinners every month or so. I've been to two of these and they were both amazing. Much different than the sandwich/brunch fare but equally well thought out and tasty. They are an intense evening of food and great fun.There are also a variety of cheeses, salamis, and other tasty things for sale. I'm partial to the pimento cheese which is also available from the menu. The breads used are all baked there and many are available to take home as well. Overall it's a great place and spending time chatting with Mike as you enjoy one of his creations is as good of a restaurant experience as you could hope for.

54.description: Great sandwiches!!  Amazing flavors and great combinations of flavors!But  . . . the portions are SMALL!!  This is a good place for a snack, but it is not a full lunch or even breakfast.  The small sandwich comes with a tiny pile of lettuce, but it is not enough!  If they served some potatoes or hash browns w/the sandwich, it might do the trick.  $10 for a sandwich that will not satisfy my smallish stomach (don't even ask about my boyfriends' stoamch)?  Sorry, but I can't afford to come here and buy two!

48.description: This place is a lovely surprise and I can't believe it took me so long to find it. The food is amazing, my favorite so far is the five cheese grilled cheese sandwich with pesto. A lot of their food comes from local farms, yet it's not expensive! I got a little tired of one particular neighborhood restaurant that charges an arm and a leg for mediocre to bad local food, so this place is my new alternative :) also the people who work there are super friendly and will sometimes give you some free bread to try.

44.description: Came here this afternoon for a quick and easy brunch after reading a good review in the New York Times and was not disappointed. We were told right away that while they were currently out of sausage, we could substitute bacon, which was fine with us. I had a special called "not the queens crumpet" and the boyfriend had a breakfast sandwich. The special was absolutely delicious! The boyfriend liked his sandwich but was eating off my plate. We were also given samples of another menu item of smoked turkey with chow chow while we dined to "make up for being out of sausage", not that we had minded. Great little place to grab breakfast or lunch, and convenient for buying co-op hot sauces to take home!

24.description: Sauce and Bread Kitchen (SBK) has impressed me many o' times since I moved into the neighborhood.  Their sandwiches are enlivened by delicious pimento or feta spreads and their daily specials are worth checking out.  The baked goods (particularly the sweets and the crumpet they serve the breakfast sandwiches on) are often above-average-tasty.  I think the texture/crumb of their pastries is noticeably more sophisticated than other bakeries; with the latter you can often taste the effects of industrial equipment on delicate doughs--none of that at SBK!  Essentially the only issue I have with SBK would be their hours, which are wildly inconvenient for those of us who like to go out for breakfast.  I wish--really, with all my heart--that they would open earlier and close later.  I pass on SBK on a regular basis because I'm not willing to wait around until 10:00 to eat my morning meal.As far as atmosphere, SBK is often very quiet, and while it doesn't have wifi I do see people with laptops or papers.  I read for class here on occasion.  On the weekends it is often more lively, with couples and their young children and babies.  I recommend this hybrid cafe/brunchy-lunchy/mini-hot sauce shop to people all the time.

7.description: You are missing out if you don't get over to Sauce and Bread!  Great food and the nicest people in the world!

49.description: Back for more of Chef Mike & Pastry Chef Ann's creations! Today I'm indulging in a beautifully prepared "Troutmaster Tartine," a new "special" sandwich. Mike layered salivary-gland-inspired horseradish cream cheese, chunks of smoked trout, pickled pears & peppercorns on one of Ann's classic, fresh baguettes - crunchy on the outside, chewy goodness on the inside. And my guy ordered the "chili tamarind smoked turkey" sandwich with housemade bacon (incredible), feta cheese & the inimitable "chow chow" relish. When we leave, we're buying that "chow chow" relish - good on everything from scrambled eggs, lox/ccheese bagel sandwiches & everything in between. From their larder, I always pick up a few Co-op Hot Sauces, ramp onion sauce, The Co-op Bloody Mary Mix, and Ann's pastries, whatever might be left when we leave. (I usually ask Casey, at the front bar, to set aside stuff for me, in advance.) It's hard for me to pass anywhere in the vicinity without stopping by for something, anything, out of this inspired duo's kitchen cooktop or ovens!  COME AND GET IT!!

40.description: Good local clean high quality awesomeness! A must try spot! They have the best veggie egg sandwich on this earth!

53.description: So good. Just go.

30.description: This place is adorable, tasty, and a great local business.Service:Its a little slow sometimes, because there is usually only one person cooking and one person at the register who is also serving.  They are all sweet, knowledgeable and consistent with their service.Ambiance:Feels like a coffee shop in Wicker Park or Logan Square.  Come as you are.  Super cute, a bit of a hipster vibe, farm house look with lots wood and shared tables.  Its very relaxing once you step in.  When its warm they open the large windows.Food:Everything is fresh and delicious. Its truly farm to plate with only the best ingredients.  Ive had the french toast, their regular toast with schmear, chocolate chip cookies, and their sausage.  Everything is delicious, unique and worth it.  They have a different take on each traditional breakfast item or dessert.Drinks:Ive only had water.  But they offer all sorts of teas, coffees, and sodas/juices if you want them straight from the bottlePrice:Cheap.  You will probably spend $10/person.  That is without a drink.Go support this awesome local business.  Its definitely adding to Edgewater, and I hope here to stay.

46.description: Yummy! I did the Maple Sausage sandwich with no egg (for brunch,) and they gave me an extra sausage which made my day. The crumpet was delicious. The feta cheese spread was good too, perhaps a little too salty for me, but I solved that with hot sauce! So many hot sauces! So many hot sauces! I am not kidding.. Fresh, natural ingredients! And the staff is wonderful too. The atmosphere is really laid back and relaxing; it's BYOB too. Definitely worth a visit if you are anywhere nearby. I'm surprised more people aren't there for the quality/price.

1.description: Brunch to bedtime this is a diamond on clark and devon. Their breads are all amazing, along with the sauce as the name implies, but really all of their ingredients are on point. Not to mention they are all organic and locally sourced, yet still affordable (looking at you Uncommon Ground). Toss it some special local coffee roasts available round the clock (try the Dark Matter blend!) and the fact that they are connected to the bar, Norse, and this makes for an all around phenomenal spot. My menu favorites are the breakfast sandwich which has a creative take on a classic wherein the normal biscut bread is indescribably amplified. Then you also have the Troutmaster. Think of a Lox bagel, but somehow better. Cannot recommend this place enough!

55.description: What a wonderful little place opened up here on North Clark. Wonderful lunch selections.. Wonderfully rich and bold coffee. Locally sustainable foods. Wonderful honest service. Only thing I wish that they would expand hours of operation past 3pm.

9.description: Got the veggie breakfast sandwich and that fresh crumpet is soooo delicious. The egg with spinach was perfectly seasoned and fluffy. A perfect little breakfast snack.

26.description: This place is great.Tasty food, friendly staff and generally a cool space.I can't wait to go back.

25.description: I love the sauce, so I thought I'd try the food. Delicious sandwiches, great hot sauce.  You should go, really.

12.description: Great sandwiches. The smoked Turkey was on point and the ratatouille was great. The side salad was refreshing. Would go back to try more things on the menu.

59.description: Great tasty sandwiches, delicious desserts and smears.True Edgewater gem!

21.description: Though SBK is right in my neighborhood, I didn't realize it was there until reading about it in the NY Times "36 Hours in Chicago" piece. I was shocked that they would include a recommendation this far north, so I had to try it. The food is really delicious, and affordable, too. Though their regular menu items are solid, I usually find that their daily specials are a big winner. I also like the foodstuffs for sale there. I've tried the heirloom hot sauce, salsa verde and blueberry pomegranate preserves -- all were great. Their Bloody Mary Mix, however, is outstanding (maybe the Best Bloody Mary Mix ever). The place is BYOB, so you can bring provisions and have yourself a proper Bloody Mary along with your breakfast.

17.description: Went to the April Fools supper club collaboration dinner (5 courses for $50) and it was incredible!! Food was inventive and amazing! We even got some beer samples. I can't wait for more of these events!Family style seating was nice; my friend and I sat with the sister (and her boyfriend) of one of the owners. It was cool to learn more about the business and its history. Try the sauces that are on the tables! BYOB for the supper club. Order tickets early; they sell out quickly because the space is small and they have a good following. I went one other time and had a sandwich... the bread was the star, along with the cheese spread. Buy some.

10.description: I can't believe we haven't been here sooner. It's in an awkward location on Clark, but has street parking in front. Decorated in my favorite kind of hip twee fashion for a small breakfast place. The menu is small (7-8 sandwich options, and a granola) but everything is priced well with nothing more than $10. Small grocery items for sale, with a few pickled and smoked items along with hot sauces, olives, and cheese spreads. I would definitely stop by here for party appetizers and spreads. Their house coffee is roasted by Dark Matter (!!!) and you will find at least 7 unique hot sauces on your table. Boyfriend got the sausage sandwich and really enjoyed it. I got the granola and - it's like the server read my mind (or maybe my face) and returned with extra cherry/raspberry preserve chunks for me. This place reminds me a LOT of some of my favorite places in Minneapolis. We will be back!

5.description: Neighbors - Sauce and Bread Kitchen is amazing. As a small business owner, the immediate space is warm, welcoming and just aesthetically pleasing. Right away, you understand their focus on LOCAL partnerships. Their willingness to simply smile shines through.Ok, for the food. FRESH. FRESH BAKED. FRESH. Isn't that enough? Nothing beats their breads and amazing little pastries....DAILY.We recently had them cater an event we had and the food from savory to sweet was a huge it! Thank you!Go in...support them...then return, return, return.

3.description: This place puts out some good stuff.  Great sandwiches & coffees, cafe goods (baked goods) as well as in-house made hot sauces, jams, salsas and at the moment they've captured my interest with a rockin' breakfast crumpet with sausage (made-in-house) served with some house greens.  The sides may change and it's usually to something else that's tasty.  If you've got a free Sunday, for brunch and nowhere to go, you could head here for an unpretentious meal.  Often, there isn't any wait.  So knock yourself out with a few baked goods and coffee while waiting on your meal.If having an interest look onto their website for more details as their menu changes seasonally.  Also, if interested in a personable prix-fixe menu this is a special offered from time to time and available outside of their normal everyday offerings.The stuff is made by hand with ingredients sourced locally and is a sister business to their co-op of a similar name.  The information of farms they use for sourcing, is freely given via a map drawn on a main wall within the cafe.  The local popular sauce known as "Co-op hot sauce," is available in the neighborhood at grocers like Mariano's or Whole Foods and cafes / bars like Uncommon Ground.  Pretty good stuff and alike the tastier hot sauces I've tried and purchased at farmers markets in Sonoma County on the West coast.  I love that these bottles are on hand for usage during meals and sit atop tables for easy use.  I will often mix the Smokey Mole and habanero or Oaxaca chilhuacle (that's a mouthful) and drag my crumpet sandwich through it.  LOVE IT, so hot it causes a nice sweat but a fun sweat.  I'll grab a couple more bottles for my pantry to be used for eggs or pot pies.One common phenomenon on Yelp is to find low rated reviews from folks that hate a business' hours of operation or inability to maintain their posted hours.  I won't do that but I will mention it here.  I've tried coming in for morning coffee and a
