And they said they we're a bunch of liberals.Shouldn't be sticking their nose where doesn't belong. Needless to say I won't be honoring their business. Pretentious phonies

32.description: Wow, I've never walked into such a chaotic Mariano's before. I guess I just assumed they would all be the same. Within the first 5 minutes of entering this Mariano's, there were crying babies everywhere, parents yelling profanities, customers screaming racist comments at each other and causing scenes, wifi not working, overcrowded cafe/seating area, and I actually had to approach a different cashier to ring me up so I wouldn't be considered stealing because my first cashier wouldn't ring up my non-deli items and bagged my groceries including the items I had not paid for. I tried to sit down and get work done at the cafe, but all I did was write this review on my phone and leave because the wifi wasn't working. Other than the 2 cashiers who did end up ringing me up, no one was helpful. The environment is SUPER chaotic. This location has poor customer service and is poorly managed.

54.description: This place should be called Mariano's NOT-so-Fresh Market. I was so excited that this much raved about market was coming to the neighborhood but, sadly, have been very disappointed. On the whole they have a very small organic produce selection, and most of the time what is there is extremely poor quality- I challenge you to find more than a few organic tomatoes that aren't nearly rotten and bruised. The organic bananas are always so green that they are inedible for days. And, for whatever reason, they can't seem to keep my favorite fat free Greek yogurt in stock. If you know it goes out of stock, order more. It's not rocket science. On top of all that, the store isn't kept particularly clean and the staff isn't very helpful or polite. One time I went to the cheese section and asked the employee standing there, presumably to answer questions about the cheese selection, for a recommendation on a hard cow's milk cheese with a bit of a nutty flavor. He said: "I'm sorry. I really don't know anything about cheese." Wow. Seriously, I can't wait until the Whole Foods on Broadway opens so I can put this Mariano's behind me. By the way, I have been to other Mariano's that are much fancier, cleaner and better stocked. Did Mariano's think folks in Edgewater/Uptown would settle for less?

48.description: When it comes to food, Mariano's is a bit more expensive then the Dominick's that used to be here. But I will not complain about that because after all it is a Mariano's. However, if you are looking for fresh flowers, well save your time and go to the Mariano's on Lawrence in Lincoln Square.I came to this Mariano's twice to pick up flowers for my wife. Both time (once on a national holiday, and once on a non-holiday) the flowers looked horrible. They were probably where for a long time and were half dead. I just walked out and went to the Mariano's in Lincoln Square where the flowers where fresh and the employees friendly.So in for now, this will not be my first stop for flowers anymore even thought it is just 2 blocks from where I live. They really need to work on that department and make sure that they have fresh beautiful flowers all the time or take the department away. At the moment the flower department is a joke.

44.description: Picked up bagged zucchini squash & a bag of potatoes you just put in the microwave. Used 2 days later & BOTH were covered in mold!  If I hadn't opened the bag to cut them & just threw them in the microwave, I probably would not have noticed & would have gotten sick for eating moldy potatoes! Both bags were moist inside!  Totally UNACCEPTABLE & far below any grocery store standard. Get it together Mariano's.  Very disappointed & totally grossed out!

24.description: Most horrible experience's i've ever had. I visited This store on 7/9/2015 around 4:30pm. Me and my girlfriend were shopping from just some snacks. We were going over to the gelato area and the african american young girl 1st did not great us, then almost half of the signs did not match the gelato flavors. I chose not to have any but my girlfriend wanted to try anyways. So she asked to try 2 flavors one being a peanut butter caramel. The young lady was having a difficult time scooping the gelato and then i notice that she was not wearing gloves or did not wash her hands before servicing us. I found that a violation of a heath code being that i am safe serv certified for Illinois. You must wear gloves and wash your hands before servicing customers for ready to eat foods. She completely ignored rules and heath code  regulations. Customer service was very low. this would be the last time i ever go to that department. I believe she completely ignored her training or was not train very well.The following day 7/10/2015 4:30pm Me and my girlfriend once again went to check out lane 8 ready to check out for our dinner. Once we get into the lane there was a young african american girl that checked us out. we had a few large items like, case of water, water melon, and 1 gallon of juice. Now i can understand a case of water but she refused to pick up the gallon of juice from and the water melon. I even handed it to her and she almost dropped it. she claimed to need to go to the gym. I found that very ridiculous because my girlfriend is much smaller and she can lift as much as i can. I believe in 1 the job description for a retail job is, Are you able to life up to 50lbs? Apparently mariano's just hires anyone. To top that off she total it to $64.07. My girlfriend use her card 1st which she paid $57 and some change then i paid off the remaining. Now the recipe doesn't come out unless it went through so when her portion of the receipt came out i was instructed to swipe my card for the remaining balance. After doing so the rest of the receipt came out and we again poor customer service and all just left. me being annoyed i did not bother to check my receipt.The next morning i see the full amount charged to my card only. I call my girlfriend while shes out of  state to ask if she was charge to. She says yes cause she saw her balance what was left over on the receipt. I called the store to explain what happened. they looked into it and called me back 2 hours later. first a lady tells me once the receipt they have i was only charged there's no record of her being charge, i respond with well why did  do we have a copy that says it was charge. she says bring in the receipt. I said i will once my girlfriend gets back but why don't you guys have a copy of that. It doesn't make since that whats on my recipe is completely different from whats on theres. Like you completely over charged me because you have a cashier that does not know what she is doing. I decide to talk with the store manager and he gave me the same response not helping at all. so. So you juts took extra from me and you have no idea why. This store really sucks. Dominick's that use to be there is ten times better. So now i will dispute this with them because i'm over dealing with this store. Jewel will be my new neighborhood store.Worst store in Edgewater. Will never shop there again.

7.description: Mariano's Fresh Market is one of my favorite grocery stores. I always think of it in between a Jewel and a Whole Foods. Similar to jewel in that you can purchase popular brand name items like Hidden Valley  Ranch and Frank's Red Hot. Similar to whole foods in that the store seems to filter out items that are unnecessarily unhealthy and also provides specialty foods and rare finds.This location had a full Pharmacy and also a Fresh Meat counter that has a diverse range of meats (fresh burgers, sausages, steaks, fish, octopus, you name it) we purchased jalapeño cheddar burgers and Parmesan crusted chicken to cook. We also purchased live herbs in pots to grow in our apartmentThe supply is very large, they have a parking deck on the roof, and the staff is friendly.

49.description: This is the most convenient market for me to get to from home, so I've gone here for a lot of my shopping when I don't venture down to Chinatown or over to Jewel.I have two main gripes with this place.  I'm not impressed by the quality of the produce, for one.  The other gripe has to do with the people that work there.  The checkout people are usually pretty slow, but they have also made some pretty ridiculous mistakes while checking my groceries - on one occasion, ringing up $200 on baked goods somehow when I had one piece of bread in my basket.  Another time they charged $3 for a half cantaloupe when the printed price on the sticker was $1.20.  Since we had already paid, we went to the customer service counter to get refunded.  While we were being helped, an idle worker in a Mariano's uniform made ridiculous comments like "all that for a dollar?"   Yep.  Yes.  All that for almost two dollars, which we should not have been charged in the first place.  Ugh.Yet another time, I came in at around six or seven in the evening and Mariano's lady was giving out free samples.  As I walked up to her she said "Good thing you came over here, I was about to throw this sh*t away and go home" and took multiple opportunities to reiterate that she was going home soon.  Let's say that I hope she is home and is not working at Mariano's anymore, because that attitude sucks.However nice the other staff may be, these bad experiences were enough to make me avoid Mariano's and walk to Jewel or the cluster of Chinatown grocery stores nearby because they are more deserving of my business.  I can even talk myself out of the overrated gelato at Mariano's, that's how pissed I get.

40.description: Great store and employees!BTW- it's a REAL piano and real pianists play for customers here. Thank you, Mariano's!

53.description: Lack of stocked items, and really unpleasant and rude customer service (Catt) at customer service desk. I had asked for an item and she mentioned they might be out of it and it won't come in until 2am, and acted as I inconvenienced her when I asked her to verify they were out of the item. Rolling her eyes, she expressed even more inconvenience when I asked her to check for product availability (packaged cheese, nothing exotic or rare) at another close location (Lawrence). She was on the phone with them for approximately 7-10 minutes trying to figure it out  and I left for Jewel. She even admitted her unpleasantness and apologized but still doesn't make one feel welcome. I am done with Mariano' because of this experience -  especially when I can get the item, and others, anywhere else. You may have nice grand openings Mariano's but your Edgewater location gives you a bad name. Bye bye Mariano's. Your customer service puts the NO in MariaNO's

30.description: Dirty and so slow. Tried this place again and was no better then months ago. The deli was packed on a Saturday and only 2 working on staff. It wasn't their fault but way under staffed. I felt back for the 2 working - no one one to call to help. Watches the kitsch area that had lots of help but don't cross the line to the deli. The kitchen area was so filled with garbage - the work are was dripping with grease off the sides. A female working was filling the mixed vegetables - dropped some on the dirty table and used her BARE Hands to pick it up and place it in to the pans for the self service Hot food. NEVER will buy the hot food again at this location. Too much out of stock - product is not priced correctly and nothing is done about it. Live close but will now go elsewhere.

46.description: The experience and customer service at this particular Mariano is unfortunately very disappointing. Unlike their 'flagship' store on Lawrence, this store does not offer that same welcoming vibe. The Customer Service (management team) evening shift displays themselves in a very unmotivated manner when requested for assistance by a fellow employee. More time is definitely needed to be invested in personnel training. This particular stores still present themselves with the same vibe as the previous Safeway Dominick's. Hopefully, the culture of this store will change.

1.description: Overall since this location opened, I give it 3.5 stars. I wish in some ways, this store had a little extra ooompth, like the location on Lawrence. I don't fault this store totally, since I know it has less square feet vs. Lawrence to work with. And I'll still go here b/c of convenience issues, and since it's slightly closer vs. Lawrence. Still those issues that it could improve on are there, and that's the reason I round down instead of rounding up on the stars.Like others said, I sometimes have noticed the occasional employee that's a little rude, unlike at other locations where they seem to try a little more(i.e. Lawrence, Elston). Also, I kinda wish like another Yelper said that they could do something with the greeting card space near the piano player that seems wasted. I wish this store could have an in-store bar added somewhere within the store like Lawrence does, but that's just me.I am happy though that it is an improvement over the Dominick's that was once here, though(both the dingy one pre-2010(?) that had the parking in front of the store, and the replacement Dominick's that was built on this site). The lone thing I miss about the Dominick's days is that I loved the convenience of the US Bank branch within this Dominick's(after the newer one was built), but I won't hold that against Mariano's. I just hope the management of this one could be slightly better and that it doesn't often seem like it's ignored for how well it's ran vs. Lawrence, but I guess we'll see over time if it improves.

55.description: I shopped at this store in it's former life as Dominick's grocery store for 4 years, it had a great selection, I knew all of the employees, and they always went out of their way to accommodate customers requests, especially when you were there at least 4 or 5 times a week. I live down the street, and it was convenient to walk to and leave the truck in the garage.Little changed as it made its transformation to Mariano's, just new employees, a way over-priced juice bar, and they no longer have a Starbucks, whose employees were so nice. They have their Verano brand coffee at a coffee bar, and it pales in comparison to the former.To be perfectly honest, I now drive to the Mariano's on W Lawrence, and that is a whole different experience, and another review. I am writing this review in regard to an incident that took place this evening. I arrived home Sunday evening for my place in Michigan, and found that I had left my wallet, debit card and credit cards there, not a big deal, but an inconvenience, and a 45 minute drive tomorrow to retrieve them, they were in a over-night bag that I forgot to put in the jeep. I was having a few friends stop by and needed some quick nibbles and wine. I called the Edgewater Mariano's and asked if they accepted personal checks, I only write one check month, or I wouldn't  even keep a check book. The person who answered the call was very professional, and friendly, and stated, it was absolutely not a problem with personal identification, so no problem. I shopped, and was checking out with just a few purchases, $90 worth of snacks and wine. The clerk, although friendly, has never accepted a check, and fumbled for 10 minutes or so as other frustrated patrons were waiting to check out, after several attempts to enter the check, it was accepted but asked for a state code, she was clueless, so i offered that it was probably my Drivers's license code, it was, entered again, and said it was declined. As it happened, Candace the person who had taken my call earlier was called over to assist, and could not get the check to be accepted either. Gratefully she asked me to just come over to the customer service station and she would take care of it. She put the check through and received a c-6 whatever that is, and said that I would need to call a certain number tomorrow to find out why. I remained calm and friendly, and stated that I didn't need these items tomorrow, tomorrow I can go to my bank branch and withdraw the cash I need. She called the store manager Owen over, and explained the problem to him.....same bullshit line, yet he was friendly. I explained to him that between his Mariano's and the Mariano's on Lawrence I spent a significant amount of money, and am in Mariano's 4 -5 times weekly. And I do mean s significant amount of money, ridiculously around $700 - 800 a month. I explained to him although I appreciate their customer service thus far, I find it ridiculous that you would not accept a local check from a regular shopper and simply deposit the next day. Mind you I had $90 worth of "wine and snacks" a normal order would have been closer to $150 and that is at least twice a week. I prepare gourmet food for my self and friends, and use the best ingredients, and I and  they enjoy fine wine and top shelf liquor.I was very kind, and friendly, but I let Owen and Candace know, that under no circumstances would I ever patronize their Mariano's again. And indeed I will never darken its doors or purchase an item there, even if I have to drive across town to do so. I intend to visit the Mariano's on Lawrence tomorrow as, I really like their selection of hard to find items, and incredible wine section. I will talk to the manager there, and see what he has to say, he may salvage my patronage and loyalty, as he is an incredible individual. I also intend to find out whom to contact corporately to file this complaint with. The real clincher is that as this all was going down I was looking at my checking account, with lets just say a significant balance to cover my purchase 100 times over. Inexcusable customer service. I will encourage any person who asks me to never shop at this Mariano's, and I will never spend another dime in that store. More to come on my investigation into a corporate complaint, and as to the other Mariano's take on this stores idiotic handling of this situation. Post script, I had written a check at this store when it was a Dominick's, it was similar circumstances, lost debit card, cancelled...so I wrote a check with no problem.

9.description: Dirty and so slow. Tried this place again and was no better then months ago. The deli was packed on a Saturday and only 2 working on staff. It wasn't their fault but way under staffed. I felt back for the 2 working - no one one to call to help. Watches the kitsch area that had lots of help but don't cross the line to the deli. The kitchen area was so filled with garbage - the work are was dripping with grease off the sides. A female working was filling the mixed vegetables - dropped some on the dirty table and used her BARE Hands to pick it up and place it in to the pans for the self service Hot food. NEVER will buy the hot food again at this location. Too much out of stock - product is not priced correctly and nothing is done about it. Live close but will now go elsewhere.

26.description: I shop at this Marianos location frequently and I always end up buying something extra! I love that this location is always clean and that they always have everything stocked. They always have samples no matter when I go- for instance today they had a sample of elis cheesecake and a pizza which I walked by. Today they also had a piano player playing different kinds of music like beethovens fur elise and more current songs like sam smith. Ilove the way they have the layout of the wines and cakes at the back-my favorite place to go! Overall, I love grocery shopping here, the only reason I would give it 4 stars and not 5 is that some of the things are a little overpriced but for the most part, the shopping experience is always great  and I would highly recommend it!

25.description: I love coming here I live close by and go here a few times a week they are really friendly and always packed but try and help you as fast as they can. The bake goods are always fresh and taste so good I go here and get donuts a few times a week. The hot bar is good. I love their 6 dollars meals I get them a few times a week. I will keep going here the staff and management are great.

12.description: This Mariano's has gotten worse with their pricing in many ways.  I've repeatedly asked customer service about this, and offered to file a written complaint, but they say the pricing is set by Mr. Mariano, or corporate, or whatever.  I just want the pricing and sales to make sense.  For months now, I just avoid the store, unless I have to refill my meds.  At least their pharmacy is consistent.Examples of irregular pricing:- White button mushrooms, a staple good for me.  They keep going up in price, even by leaps of an entire dollar.  The quality is often bad, with the mushrooms being greyed (meaning they are going bad).  My advice is to wait for them to go on sale at Aldis, then stock up.- 2 liter pepsi/coke, another staple good.  The prices increased over time (they did on the cans as well), then suddenly, the 2 liter prices were comparable to Walgreens and CVS have a sale.  The sticker made it look like they were always that price, that it wasn't a time-limited sale, then the prices jumped again.  I talked to customer service, and they said that those stickers are time-limited, but never have a date, and they're not sure why.  Ok, back to loading up on soda at CVS, yet another reason to skip Mariano's.Another woman I spoke to said she had a similar problem with ground turkey, so she goes to Jewel.  Many of their fruit prices are high, even though they're not organic.  Aldis is cheaper and farmer's market organic stone fruit is about the same price as the non-organic fruit at Mariano's.The store is generally nice-looking, (except for the potted herbs, which are always sickly-looking,) but I prefer Aldi.

59.description: I go to this Mariano's a lot because I own a restaurant and produce there are fresh and pricing are responsible. I was unhappy with the lady that work at the register she was rude and disrespecting. I bought about 10 lettuces and she over charge me. The lettuce was 99 cent a lb. but she charged me 1.39 a lb. I told her she over charge me ... This is how she reply back "so, it's only a few cents more" I was shocked by the respond she gave me. Not only that she gave me attitude as well asking if I know what kind of lettuce this is I told her no I'm not sure but can you check ... Instead she made me go check. " if you don't know what this is can you go back and check the price and let me know" how rude was that?! Very very disappointed. Another down part is they charge for dressing when you buy salad ! How ridiculous is that ? I never got charge for dressing before but they actually charge me for dressing and weigh by pound. This Mariano disappoint me. Wish the old Dominick's was still here.

21.description: I love this store especially early in the morning when the aisles aren't as crowded. Great staff nice selection easy to park

17.description: Overall, I give this Mariano's 4 stars. Honestly, for me this is mainly due to convenience. I live about 1 block away and the hours are relatively great for a morning or evening last minute snack. I generally get most of my groceries from here except meat which I find pretty pricey. I do appreciate the really amazing diversity here which is something you don't see in all of the Mariano's around the city. You will be surrounded by so many different types of people from all kinds of walks of life which I genuinely find as a breath of fresh air in the city.

10.description: This place is a joke. Great, you have a piano player, but otherwise you are understocked and understaffed.  I literally just stood at the unstaffed cheese counter for 10 minutes, asked a passerby employee  for help, they said they would go ask customer service, no one came, then I called the main line at the store, asked if anyone could come to the cheese counter, the person who answered the store's main line say 'I don't know' (!?), then I asked if they had Gruyere anywhere, same answer (!?), then I said 'awesome visit', zero effort to assist, then I hung up.  Then I went to their dairy section where it was poorly stocked and did not have what I was looking for.  The thing is, this is like the fourth time poor stocking has been an issue in recent visits.  Boo.  Jewel is actually way better.

5.description: Mariano's was definitely the best supermarket I frequented while in Chicago.  Despite a ridiculously large abundance of mom-and-pop shops, pretentious big named hipster markets, and your classic everyday North American supermarket chains scattered throughout the city, Mariano's really managed to hit that sweet spot you want from a local grocer.On each and every visit, there was always a large frequency of staff that were smiling and willing to help, prices and sales were consistently reasonable especially for a big city (some even cheaper than in upstate New York!), and the products I spotted were always fresh and diverse.  Not only that, there were always a ton of different "sections" to shop at as well!  Besides your standard aisles of home food necessities, meats, and produce, they also had a bakery where fresh cakes, donuts, and breads were regularly being made, a bunch of unique prepared food counters (yay to $6 and $10 meals!), an actual hot food buffet, an excellent cheese fromagerie (always with free samples), and a bunch more that I'm probably forgetting.I don't really know what quite did it for me specifically, but I think the combination of all the kind staff and the wide variety of options made me feel comfortable and at home.  I didn't feel oppressed by the environment and was always able to conduct my shopping with ease.  Even though they may not have had every option of every type of product available, they definitely took into consideration everyone's food needs, and had several options for everyone to choose from.  Literally perfect for any standard shopper, regardless of any food restrictions.Mariano's has definitely got that sparkle.  I would recommend it to anyone in Chicago over any other option available.

3.description: Having a Mariano's in this location is a great addition to the neighborhood. I really enjoyed shopping here when I lived nearby, and always found what I needed. The prices aren't that bad, and they sell a lot of things I couldn't find anywhere else. Not to mention their alcohol selection and deli, cheese, bakery counter options were fantastic. Downside is the location. While it's good for the location and the area, the kind of people the store attracts isn't always the best. The cafe is right by the entrance, so most people come in, and just plop in the free cafe seating and never leave. I hate to say it, but it really is bum central. Maybe if they had put the cafe in a different area of the store, this would be a completely different story. In fact, this free seating isn't even near the actual cafe/coffee shop. It's stuck over by the gelato like a little cafeteria. It feels like an insane asylum. Other Marianos have their coffee shop, gelato, and bar all together in one area with seating, but Edgewater just sticks it by the door, so anyone can come in and sit down and never leave. It's truly bizarre and turns most people off upon walking in.Staff here aren't the most professional as well. The Ravenswood location has much more organized and professional staff members. A lot of the cashiers are rude and downright confused most of the time. It seems like there's always a huge fuss when buying alcohol since only one or two  staff at a given time are able to sell it, so there's always announcements and yelling going back and forth to request backup to see someone's ID. Plus some of the staff are kind of creepy. Lots of them just stare at you when you walk in and don't even say hi. It made me really uncomfortable and I started going in the other entrance because of it.Ugh, ok I've said enough. Still a nice store, but lots of annoyances that aren't present at the other Marianos I've been to.

35.description: I'm going to call this location the "Homeless Mariano's" because simply put, I've never seen another MO's with so many vagrants and nursing home residents using the cafe seating as their own personal day room. After many successful shopping trips here without lingering, I decided to make this a destination to sit and eat a bite from the hot bar. Unfortunately, the seating areas seem to have been occupied by All Creatures Great and Small; from people screaming at each other and starting fist fights (where is security?) to men and women camped out with their every possession laid over every possible piece of real estate.In summary, awful experience if you're not getting in getting out.

19.description: Lord knows this neighborhood needs a good grocery store, and we were SO excited for this Mariano's to open, especially in the absence of Dominick's.However, I made the mistake of holding this Mariano's to the same standard of others I've shopped, and now I've just very, very disappointed.Let me say this: I've given this location multiple tries. This has been, for the past couple of months, mo go-to grocery store. Each time, though, I've had an experience that has left me wondering whether or not I should go back.There are many problems here (messy store, disinterested employees, lack of organic proteins, etc.), but the most egregious problem, in my mind, is the quality of the products they sell.Let's start with the produce: the produce is almost ALWAYS bad. I'm talking as bad as Jewel--and that's really saying something.I've tried to get fresh greens, boxed greens, and herbs on multiple occasions, only to find that they were brown, soggy, and spoiled. One time, after finding a whole row of mushy, brown boxed chives, I asked an associate to get me another box from the back. He came back with a whole box of "fresh' chives, and they were also mushy and brown.The same goes for the (expensive, high-end) boxed greens--like arugula and kale. If you plan on buying any of those things, make sure you turn the box over and check for freshness. The produce, though, isn't the only problem.Last week alone, I had to return a $9 container of "freshly grated" Parmesan, a container of organic cottage cheese (with an expiration dated a month from now), and a box of arugula. All were completely sour and rotten. The cottage cheese had liquified and smelled like spoiled milk. The Parmesan tasted like funky blue cheese. (Just smelling it made it obvious that something was badly wrong.)I returned these items without hassle, and I asked to speak to a manager. I spoke to Nunzio, and he was very willing to listen to my complaints. I expressed concern over the quality of the fresh products, specifically, and the overall quality of the store, generally. He listened carefully, noted my concerns, but I haven't seen many changes in the week since. I went today--likely for the last time--and saw several boxes of rotten lettuce.The Edgewater/Andersonville citizen in me--and the cynic--has to wonder why THIS Mariano's location seems to be so lacking, while other locations, in "better" neighborhoods, are so wonderful. I'd hope that wasn't intentional, but what other conclusions can I draw?For now, I'll be driving to Trader Joe's or Whole Foods, unfortunately. This store has had way more than 3 strikes, and I don't intend to give them anymore of my time or money.

28.description: So tired of going to this store and they never have anything stocked or the hot foods bar food is just gross. Have tried theyre hot foods bar several times while on lunch for work and its always gross. Its clearly been over cooked, sitting out way to long and just lacking in taste. They never seem to carry every day items in stock. I'm tired of going to more than one store for my shopping. Save yourself the trouble and just go to the Ravenswood store.  Its not even a 5 min drive from this crappy store. Better food and selections.

45.description: I love the faux grand piano and the $6 (sometimes $10) meals. I just wish they had a "last call" section like the Dominick's, which was a great way to try out new brands on the cheap.Also they could use a self-check out. I don't want anyone else fondling my grapes.Also I'm not sure why they killed the wine/beer bar idea. It would have been a good space for it. But the meat section is amazing. I'm so glad this ex-Dominicks didn't become a Trader Joe's (too little selection) or a Whole Foods (Whole Wallet). They could use more volume sizes in staples like applesauce and cottage cheese, boxes of power bars and the like. But their amazing produce section makes up for it.In all a great addition to the area.

33.description: Mariano's was definitely the best supermarket I frequented while in Chicago.  Despite a ridiculously large abundance of mom-and-pop shops, pretentious big named hipster markets, and your classic everyday North American supermarket chains scattered throughout the city, Mariano's really managed to hit that sweet spot you want from a local grocer.On each and every visit, there was always a large frequency of staff that were smiling and willing to help, prices and sales were consistently reasonable especially for a big city (some even cheaper than in upstate New York!), and the products I spotted were always fresh and diverse.  Not only that, there were always a ton of different "sections" to shop at as well!  Besides your standard aisles of home food necessities, meats, and produce, they also had a bakery where fresh cakes, donuts, and breads were regularly being made, a bunch of unique prepared food counters (yay to $6 and $10 meals!), an actual hot food buffet, an excellent cheese fromagerie (always with free samples), and a bunch more that I'm probably forgetting.I don't really know what quite did it for me specifically, but I think the combination of all the kind staff and the wide variety of options made me feel comfortable and at home.  I didn't feel oppressed by the environment and was always able to conduct my shopping with ease.  Even though they may not have had every option of every type of product available, they definitely took into consideration everyone's food needs, and had several options for everyone to choose from.  Literally perfect for any standard shopper, regardless of any food restrictions.Mariano's has definitely got that sparkle.  I would recommend it to anyone in Chicago over any other option available.

43.description: The flowers we received for our Labor Day weekend wedding from Mariano's were wayyyyy beyond our expectations.  They were stunning!!Lisa in the floral department is patient, considerate, and willing to work within your budget.  We researched floral for a long LONG time and this by far was the option that gave us the best value and the most beautiful floral pieces.  The bouquets, boutonnieres, wrist corsages, and centerpieces were all done by Lisa and her team. I highly recommend any bride to consider this option!

2.description: Having a grocery store 90 seconds from your doorstep is a luxury - and one that I hope not to take for granted. That said, this Mariano's is a borderline train-wreck. Gripes:- The fresh produce section along the wall is so over-watered that much of the fresh herbs and lettuces are waterlogged to an inedible state. It's disgusting.- The management of the store is extremely surly - I've seen them dress-down staff in front of customers 2-3 times. Totally unprofessional.- The layout is frustrating, but they were probably at the mercy of the previous grocer who occupied the space.There are some pros!- The pizza in the prepared food section (by the slice, kinda-sorta Sicilian style) is shockingly tasty! - Ditto for the rotisserie chicken- Good selection of beer- The staff (at the non-management level) is often friendly to customers but seem to be carrying the burden of working in a not-super-fun storeOverall, very happy to have a grocery store so close to home - really a blessing. And when my wife and I first moved here, we were excited about having a Mariano's (and not a Jewel) so close - but the quality has slipped enough that our excitement is waning. Still better than Jewel (duh), but not what it once was.

18.description: I'm going to call this location the "Homeless Mariano's" because simply put, I've never seen another MO's with so many vagrants and nursing home residents using the cafe seating as their own personal day room. After many successful shopping trips here without lingering, I decided to make this a destination to sit and eat a bite from the hot bar. Unfortunately, the seating areas seem to have been occupied by All Creatures Great and Small; from people screaming at each other and starting fist fights (where is security?) to men and women camped out with their every possession laid over every possible piece of real estate.In summary, awful experience if you're not getting in getting out.

41.description: Such a sad and depressing shopping experience. Most of the produce tastes like cardboard, unless you buy organic (which is actually more expensive than Whole Foods). The hot bar and $6 and $10 meals are greatly over-salted. I shopped there at 9:00 the other night, and they had removed all of the perishable foods off the shelves by that time. I could not even find a carton of milk (thankfully Walgreens was still open). While I was roaming the aisles in search of something, anything to eat, I left my cart unattended, and by the time I returned 3 minutes later, one of their stock-workers had emptied and removed my cart. The vacant piano at least lends the shopping experience a hint of the absurd, which is unfortunately the only thing that makes shopping there worthwhile.  Edgewater and Uptown deserve far better than this.

52.description: I love Mariano's. I thought that the prices here were gonna be too high just judging by the design of the store but everything is pretty affordable and right in line with what I would pay at Jewel Osco. Staff is always really polite and fun. I'm still getting used to how the store is layed out and some of their merchandising decisions don't exactly make sense.The hot food bar is great! The $6 meals are great! The Gelato is addicting, I think we go between 4-7 times a week.I made a return here as well and that went really smoothly.

50.description: Glorified Dominicks with staff like an aldiDon't waste your time here, go to the one on Lawrence, that location is truly a 5 star location.

4.description: Keep the bum's and crackheads out of the store. The cafeteria area looks like a halfway house. It's disgusting to try to eat your lunch. The Deli counter is so slow and they try to ignore you hoping you go away. I had to stand there and literally send smoke signals to get their attention. You can't beat the deli prices to I take the bad service. The Deli girl is lazy she can't even slice the last of the ham to the specific thinness.  Prices are really good but the store is disgusting.

6.description: I got a shot of espresso at Mariano's.  At their crappy coffee shop.  Which totally sucks ass.

22.description: This Mariano's has gotten worse with their pricing in many ways.  I've repeatedly asked customer service about this, and offered to file a written complaint, but they say the pricing is set by Mr. Mariano, or corporate, or whatever.  I just want the pricing and sales to make sense.  For months now, I just avoid the store, unless I have to refill my meds.  At least their pharmacy is consistent.Examples of irregular pricing:- White button mushrooms, a staple good for me.  They keep going up in price, even by leaps of an entire dollar.  The quality is often bad, with the mushrooms being greyed (meaning they are going bad).  My advice is to wait for them to go on sale at Aldis, then stock up.- 2 liter pepsi/coke, another staple good.  The prices increased over time (they did on the cans as well), then suddenly, the 2 liter prices were comparable to Walgreens and CVS have a sale.  The sticker made it look like they were always that price, that it wasn't a time-limited sale, then the prices jumped again.  I talked to customer service, and they said that those stickers are time-limited, but never have a date, and they're not sure why.  Ok, back to loading up on soda at CVS, yet another reason to skip Mariano's.Another woman I spoke to said she had a similar problem with ground turkey, so she goes to Jewel.  Many of their fruit prices are high, even though they're not organic.  Aldis is cheaper and farmer's market organic stone fruit is about the same price as the non-organic fruit at Mariano's.The store is generally nice-looking, (except for the potted herbs, which are always sickly-looking,) but I prefer Aldi.

15.description: This is the most convenient market for me to get to from home, so I've gone here for a lot of my shopping when I don't venture down to Chinatown or over to Jewel.I have two main gripes with this place.  I'm not impressed by the quality of the produce, for one.  The other gripe has to do with the people that work there.  The checkout people are usually pretty slow, but they have also made some pretty ridiculous mistakes while checking my groceries - on one occasion, ringing up $200 on baked goods somehow when I had one piece of bread in my basket.  Another time they charged $3 for a half cantaloupe when the printed price on the sticker was $1.20.  Since we had already paid, we went to the customer service counter to get refunded.  While we were being helped, an idle worker in a Mariano's uniform made ridiculous comments like "all that for a dollar?"   Yep.  Yes.  All that for almost two dollars, which we should not have been charged in the first place.  Ugh.Yet another time, I came in at around six or seven in the evening and Mariano's lady was giving out free samples.  As I walked up to her she said "Good thing you came over here, I was about to throw this sh*t away and go home" and took multiple opportunities to reiterate that she was going home soon.  Let's say that I hope she is home and is not working at Mariano's anymore, because that attitude sucks.However nice the other staff may be, these bad experiences were enough to make me avoid Mariano's and walk to Jewel or the cluster of Chinatown grocery stores nearby because they are more deserving of my business.  I can even talk myself out of the overrated gelato at Mariano's, that's how pissed I get.

57.description: Clean, just the right size, produce section is always well stocked.I like this Mariano's better than the one up the road on Lawrence for its smaller size and straight forward floor plan. (The layout of the store on Lawrence is a bit of an IKEA-esque maze.) The quaintness of this Sheridan location just feels friendlier. The sushi to-go is tasty for being pre-made. The pre-made deli sandwiches, on the other hand, which are topped with cheese shaved down to like 1/10 of a millimeter thick, are not so fantastic. I like the pretzel bun and croissant options, but the cheese portions are so half-assed, it's just irritating.Speaking of cheese, this store follows suit with other Mariano's locations in offering a great selection of gourmet cheeses at reasonable prices. And I must add, the cheese counter is nicely complimented by well-stocked liquor department, with a special focus on wine and beer.

20.description: Mariano's Fresh Market is one of my favorite grocery stores. I always think of it in between a Jewel and a Whole Foods. Similar to jewel in that you can purchase popular brand name items like Hidden Valley  Ranch and Frank's Red Hot. Similar to whole foods in that the store seems to filter out items that are unnecessarily unhealthy and also provides specialty foods and rare finds.This location had a full Pharmacy and also a Fresh Meat counter that has a diverse range of meats (fresh burgers, sausages, steaks, fish, octopus, you name it) we purchased jalapeño cheddar burgers and Parmesan crusted chicken to cook. We also purchased live herbs in pots to grow in our apartmentThe supply is very large, they have a parking deck on the roof, and the staff is friendly.

36.description: This location doesn't really compare to other Mariano's locations. In my opinion, it's average. It's close to home so the location is very convenient for me. The bakery is basic and minimal in comparison to other Mariano's. The staff here are helpful and the store is usually kept clean and stocked. The grill is my favorite amenity here.

14.description: This is a very nice Mariano's.Everything that I saw there today was Impressive and knowingthat they are in the midst of a Grand Opening at this location really says a lot..The store is well stocked and is looking good, they have many preparedfoods/food stations including a sushi bar for those of you that havetaken a liking to raw fish.. I haven't but I was happy to see a really greatsalad bar with more than your average type of choices..Hot Soups, Hot Prepared Foods and a Pizza StationAnd, a Booze/liquor Selection that was quite incredible, so much moreavailability on brands here folks...Lots of Craft Beers for those of you who like that.. I don't just toss me a sixerof Miller Lite and I'm happy..:)And, there are tremendous sales going on, I was loving that, but then I also noticed some items which were priced higher here than at Jewel's...But, the selection is here, A popcorn stand is available where they are popping up bags of Chicago Mix and they have these Gourmet Taffy Applesthat were huge in size...Giving out lots of free samples today too..And, there were many check-out lanes open, and if there were crowds Inever saw them..So, if you haven't been to this Mariano's yet come see for yourself..Such a great, new addition to the Edgewater Neighborhood!And, gotta say, the older guy playing Johnny Mathis's Misty on the pianomade me smile..Looking good Mariano's..
